text_original: Mr. President, Mr. Speaker, Members of the Congress of the United States: It looks like a good many of you have moved over to the left since I was here last.
text_following: I come before you today to report on the State of the Union and, in the words of the Constitution, to recommend such measures as I judge necessary and expedient.

text_original: I come before you today to report on the State of the Union and, in the words of the Constitution, to recommend such measures as I judge necessary and expedient.
text_preceding: Mr. President, Mr. Speaker, Members of the Congress of the United States: It looks like a good many of you have moved over to the left since I was here last.
text_following: I come also to welcome you as you take up your duties and to discuss with you the manner in which you and I should fulfill our obligations to the American people during the next 2 years.

text_original: I come also to welcome you as you take up your duties and to discuss with you the manner in which you and I should fulfill our obligations to the American people during the next 2 years.
text_preceding: I come before you today to report on the State of the Union and, in the words of the Constitution, to recommend such measures as I judge necessary and expedient.
text_following: The power to mold the future of this Nation lies in our hands-yours and mine, and they are joined together by the Constitution.

text_original: The power to mold the future of this Nation lies in our hands-yours and mine, and they are joined together by the Constitution.
text_preceding: I come also to welcome you as you take up your duties and to discuss with you the manner in which you and I should fulfill our obligations to the American people during the next 2 years.
text_following: If in this year, and in the next, we can find the right course to take as each issue arises, and if, in spite of all difficulties, we have the courage and the resolution to take that course, then we shall achieve a state of well-being for our people without precedent in history.

text_original: If in this year, and in the next, we can find the right course to take as each issue arises, and if, in spite of all difficulties, we have the courage and the resolution to take that course, then we shall achieve a state of well-being for our people without precedent in history.
text_preceding: The power to mold the future of this Nation lies in our hands-yours and mine, and they are joined together by the Constitution.
text_following: And if we continue to work with the other nations of the world earnestly, patiently, and wisely, we can-granting a will for peace on the part of our neighbors make a lasting peace for the world.

text_original: And if we continue to work with the other nations of the world earnestly, patiently, and wisely, we can-granting a will for peace on the part of our neighbors make a lasting peace for the world.
text_preceding: If in this year, and in the next, we can find the right course to take as each issue arises, and if, in spite of all difficulties, we have the courage and the resolution to take that course, then we shall achieve a state of well-being for our people without precedent in history.
text_following: But, if we are to realize these ends, the Congress and the President, during the next 2 years, must work together.

text_original: But, if we are to realize these ends, the Congress and the President, during the next 2 years, must work together.
text_preceding: And if we continue to work with the other nations of the world earnestly, patiently, and wisely, we can-granting a will for peace on the part of our neighbors make a lasting peace for the world.
text_following: It is not unusual in our history that the majority of the Congress represents a party in opposition to the President's party.

text_original: It is not unusual in our history that the majority of the Congress represents a party in opposition to the President's party.
text_preceding: But, if we are to realize these ends, the Congress and the President, during the next 2 years, must work together.
text_following: I am the twentieth President of the United States who, at some time during his term of office, has found his own party to be in the minority in one or both Houses of Congress.

text_original: I am the twentieth President of the United States who, at some time during his term of office, has found his own party to be in the minority in one or both Houses of Congress.
text_preceding: It is not unusual in our history that the majority of the Congress represents a party in opposition to the President's party.
text_following: The first one was George Washington.

text_original: The first one was George Washington.
text_preceding: I am the twentieth President of the United States who, at some time during his term of office, has found his own party to be in the minority in one or both Houses of Congress.
text_following: Wilson was number eighteen, and Hoover was number nineteen.

text_original: Wilson was number eighteen, and Hoover was number nineteen.
text_preceding: The first one was George Washington.
text_following: I realize that on some matters the Congress and the President may have honest differences of opinion.

text_original: I realize that on some matters the Congress and the President may have honest differences of opinion.
text_preceding: Wilson was number eighteen, and Hoover was number nineteen.
text_following: Partisan differences, however, did not cause material disagreements as to the conduct of the war.

text_original: Partisan differences, however, did not cause material disagreements as to the conduct of the war.
text_preceding: I realize that on some matters the Congress and the President may have honest differences of opinion.
text_following: Nor, in the conduct of our international relations, during and since the war, have such partisan differences been material.

text_original: Nor, in the conduct of our international relations, during and since the war, have such partisan differences been material.
text_preceding: Partisan differences, however, did not cause material disagreements as to the conduct of the war.
text_following: On some domestic issues we may, and probably shall, disagree.

text_original: On some domestic issues we may, and probably shall, disagree.
text_preceding: Nor, in the conduct of our international relations, during and since the war, have such partisan differences been material.
text_following: That in itself is not to be feared.

text_original: That in itself is not to be feared.
text_preceding: On some domestic issues we may, and probably shall, disagree.
text_following: It is inherent in our form of Government.

text_original: It is inherent in our form of Government.
text_preceding: That in itself is not to be feared.
text_following: But there are ways of disagreeing;

text_original: But there are ways of disagreeing;
text_preceding: It is inherent in our form of Government.
text_following: men who differ can still work together sincerely for the common good.

text_original: men who differ can still work together sincerely for the common good.
text_preceding: But there are ways of disagreeing;
text_following: We shall be risking the Nation's safety and destroying our opportunities for progress if we do not settle any disagreements in this spirit, without thought of partisan advantage.

text_original: We shall be risking the Nation's safety and destroying our opportunities for progress if we do not settle any disagreements in this spirit, without thought of partisan advantage.
text_preceding: men who differ can still work together sincerely for the common good.
text_following: As the year 1947 begins, the state of our national economy presents great opportunities for all.

text_original: As the year 1947 begins, the state of our national economy presents great opportunities for all.
text_preceding: We shall be risking the Nation's safety and destroying our opportunities for progress if we do not settle any disagreements in this spirit, without thought of partisan advantage.
text_following: We have virtually full employment, our national production of goods and services is 50 percent higher than in any year prior to the war emergency.

text_original: We have virtually full employment, our national production of goods and services is 50 percent higher than in any year prior to the war emergency.
text_preceding: As the year 1947 begins, the state of our national economy presents great opportunities for all.
text_following: The national income in 1946 was higher than in any peace-time year.

text_original: The national income in 1946 was higher than in any peace-time year.
text_preceding: We have virtually full employment, our national production of goods and services is 50 percent higher than in any year prior to the war emergency.
text_following: Our food production is greater than it has ever been.

text_original: Our food production is greater than it has ever been.
text_preceding: The national income in 1946 was higher than in any peace-time year.
text_following: During the last 5 years our productive facilities have been expanded in almost every field.

text_original: During the last 5 years our productive facilities have been expanded in almost every field.
text_preceding: Our food production is greater than it has ever been.
text_following: The American standard of living is higher now than ever before, and when the housing shortage can be overcome it will be even higher.

text_original: The American standard of living is higher now than ever before, and when the housing shortage can be overcome it will be even higher.
text_preceding: During the last 5 years our productive facilities have been expanded in almost every field.
text_following: During the past few months we have removed at a rapid rate the emergency controls that the Federal Government had to exercise during the war.

text_original: During the past few months we have removed at a rapid rate the emergency controls that the Federal Government had to exercise during the war.
text_preceding: The American standard of living is higher now than ever before, and when the housing shortage can be overcome it will be even higher.
text_following: The remaining controls will be retained only as long as they are needed to protect the public.

text_original: The remaining controls will be retained only as long as they are needed to protect the public.
text_preceding: During the past few months we have removed at a rapid rate the emergency controls that the Federal Government had to exercise during the war.
text_following: Private enterprise must be given the greatest possible freedom to continue the expansion of our economy.

text_original: Private enterprise must be given the greatest possible freedom to continue the expansion of our economy.
text_preceding: The remaining controls will be retained only as long as they are needed to protect the public.
text_following: In my proclamation of December 31, 1946, I announced the termination of hostilities.

text_original: In my proclamation of December 31, 1946, I announced the termination of hostilities.
text_preceding: Private enterprise must be given the greatest possible freedom to continue the expansion of our economy.
text_following: This automatically ended certain temporary legislation and certain executive powers.

text_original: This automatically ended certain temporary legislation and certain executive powers.
text_preceding: In my proclamation of December 31, 1946, I announced the termination of hostilities.
text_following: I shall submit to the Congress recommendations for the repeal of certain of the statutes which by their terms continue for the duration of the emergency.

text_original: I shall submit to the Congress recommendations for the repeal of certain of the statutes which by their terms continue for the duration of the emergency.
text_preceding: This automatically ended certain temporary legislation and certain executive powers.
text_following: I shall at the same time recommend that others within this classification be extended until the state of war has been ended by treaty or by legislative action.

text_original: I shall at the same time recommend that others within this classification be extended until the state of war has been ended by treaty or by legislative action.
text_preceding: I shall submit to the Congress recommendations for the repeal of certain of the statutes which by their terms continue for the duration of the emergency.
text_following: As to those statutes which continue until the State of war has been terminated, I urge that the Congress promptly consider each statute individually, and repeal such emergency legislation where it is advisable.

text_original: As to those statutes which continue until the State of war has been terminated, I urge that the Congress promptly consider each statute individually, and repeal such emergency legislation where it is advisable.
text_preceding: I shall at the same time recommend that others within this classification be extended until the state of war has been ended by treaty or by legislative action.
text_following: Now that nearly all wartime controls have been removed, the operation of our industrial system depends to a greater extent on the decisions of businessmen, farmers, and workers.

text_original: Now that nearly all wartime controls have been removed, the operation of our industrial system depends to a greater extent on the decisions of businessmen, farmers, and workers.
text_preceding: As to those statutes which continue until the State of war has been terminated, I urge that the Congress promptly consider each statute individually, and repeal such emergency legislation where it is advisable.
text_following: These decisions must be wisely made with genuine concern for public welfare.

text_original: These decisions must be wisely made with genuine concern for public welfare.
text_preceding: Now that nearly all wartime controls have been removed, the operation of our industrial system depends to a greater extent on the decisions of businessmen, farmers, and workers.
text_following: The welfare of businessmen, farmers, and workers depends upon the economic well-being of those who buy their products.

text_original: The welfare of businessmen, farmers, and workers depends upon the economic well-being of those who buy their products.
text_preceding: These decisions must be wisely made with genuine concern for public welfare.
text_following: An important present source of danger to our economy is the possibility that prices might be raised to such an extent that the consuming public could not purchase the tremendous volume of goods and services which will be produced during 1947.

text_original: An important present source of danger to our economy is the possibility that prices might be raised to such an extent that the consuming public could not purchase the tremendous volume of goods and services which will be produced during 1947.
text_preceding: The welfare of businessmen, farmers, and workers depends upon the economic well-being of those who buy their products.
text_following: We all know that recent price increases have denied to many of our workers much of the value of recent wage increases.

text_original: We all know that recent price increases have denied to many of our workers much of the value of recent wage increases.
text_preceding: An important present source of danger to our economy is the possibility that prices might be raised to such an extent that the consuming public could not purchase the tremendous volume of goods and services which will be produced during 1947.
text_following: Farmers have found that a large part of their increased income has been absorbed by increased prices.

text_original: Farmers have found that a large part of their increased income has been absorbed by increased prices.
text_preceding: We all know that recent price increases have denied to many of our workers much of the value of recent wage increases.
text_following: While some of our people have received raises in income which exceed price increases, the great majority have not.

text_original: While some of our people have received raises in income which exceed price increases, the great majority have not.
text_preceding: Farmers have found that a large part of their increased income has been absorbed by increased prices.
text_following: Those persons who live on modest fixed incomes-retired persons living on pensions, for example-and workers whose incomes are relatively inflexible, such as teachers and other civil servants-have suffered hardship.

text_original: Those persons who live on modest fixed incomes-retired persons living on pensions, for example-and workers whose incomes are relatively inflexible, such as teachers and other civil servants-have suffered hardship.
text_preceding: While some of our people have received raises in income which exceed price increases, the great majority have not.
text_following: In the effort to bring about a sound and equitable price structure, each group of our population has its own responsibilities.

text_original: In the effort to bring about a sound and equitable price structure, each group of our population has its own responsibilities.
text_preceding: Those persons who live on modest fixed incomes-retired persons living on pensions, for example-and workers whose incomes are relatively inflexible, such as teachers and other civil servants-have suffered hardship.
text_following: It is up to industry not only to hold the line on existing prices, but to make reductions whenever profits justify such action.

text_original: It is up to industry not only to hold the line on existing prices, but to make reductions whenever profits justify such action.
text_preceding: In the effort to bring about a sound and equitable price structure, each group of our population has its own responsibilities.
text_following: It is up to labor to refrain from pressing for unjustified wage increases that will force increases in the price level.

text_original: It is up to labor to refrain from pressing for unjustified wage increases that will force increases in the price level.
text_preceding: It is up to industry not only to hold the line on existing prices, but to make reductions whenever profits justify such action.
text_following: And it is up to Government to do everything in its power to encourage high- volume production, for that is what makes possible good wages, low prices, and reasonable profits.

text_original: And it is up to Government to do everything in its power to encourage high- volume production, for that is what makes possible good wages, low prices, and reasonable profits.
text_preceding: It is up to labor to refrain from pressing for unjustified wage increases that will force increases in the price level.
text_following: In a few days there will be submitted to the Congress the Economic Report of the President, and also the Budget Message.

text_original: In a few days there will be submitted to the Congress the Economic Report of the President, and also the Budget Message.
text_preceding: And it is up to Government to do everything in its power to encourage high- volume production, for that is what makes possible good wages, low prices, and reasonable profits.
text_following: Those messages will contain many recommendations.

text_original: Those messages will contain many recommendations.
text_preceding: In a few days there will be submitted to the Congress the Economic Report of the President, and also the Budget Message.
text_following: Today I shall outline five major economic policies which I believe the Government should pursue during 1947.

text_original: Today I shall outline five major economic policies which I believe the Government should pursue during 1947.
text_preceding: Those messages will contain many recommendations.
text_following: These policies are designed to meet our immediate needs and, at the same time, to provide for the long-range welfare of our free enterprise system: First, the promotion of greater harmony between labor and management.

text_original: These policies are designed to meet our immediate needs and, at the same time, to provide for the long-range welfare of our free enterprise system: First, the promotion of greater harmony between labor and management.
text_preceding: Today I shall outline five major economic policies which I believe the Government should pursue during 1947.
text_following: Second, restriction of monopoly and unfair business practices;

text_original: Second, restriction of monopoly and unfair business practices;
text_preceding: These policies are designed to meet our immediate needs and, at the same time, to provide for the long-range welfare of our free enterprise system: First, the promotion of greater harmony between labor and management.
text_following: assistance to small business;

text_original: assistance to small business;
text_preceding: Second, restriction of monopoly and unfair business practices;
text_following: and the promotion of the free competitive system of private enterprise.

text_original: and the promotion of the free competitive system of private enterprise.
text_preceding: assistance to small business;
text_following: Third, continuation of an aggressive program of home construction.

text_original: Third, continuation of an aggressive program of home construction.
text_preceding: and the promotion of the free competitive system of private enterprise.
text_following: Fourth, the balancing of the budget in the next fiscal year and the achieving of a substantial surplus to be applied to the reduction of the public debt.

text_original: Fourth, the balancing of the budget in the next fiscal year and the achieving of a substantial surplus to be applied to the reduction of the public debt.
text_preceding: Third, continuation of an aggressive program of home construction.
text_following: Fifth, protection of a fair level of return to farmers in post-war agriculture.

text_original: Fifth, protection of a fair level of return to farmers in post-war agriculture.
text_preceding: Fourth, the balancing of the budget in the next fiscal year and the achieving of a substantial surplus to be applied to the reduction of the public debt.
text_following: LABOR AND MANAGEMENT: The year just past-like the year after the First World War-was marred by labor management strife.

text_original: LABOR AND MANAGEMENT: The year just past-like the year after the First World War-was marred by labor management strife.
text_preceding: Fifth, protection of a fair level of return to farmers in post-war agriculture.
text_following: Despite this outbreak of economic warfare in 1946, we are today producing goods and services in record volume.

text_original: Despite this outbreak of economic warfare in 1946, we are today producing goods and services in record volume.
text_preceding: LABOR AND MANAGEMENT: The year just past-like the year after the First World War-was marred by labor management strife.
text_following: Nevertheless, it is essential to improve the methods for reaching agreement between labor and management and to reduce the number of strikes and lockouts.

text_original: Nevertheless, it is essential to improve the methods for reaching agreement between labor and management and to reduce the number of strikes and lockouts.
text_preceding: Despite this outbreak of economic warfare in 1946, we are today producing goods and services in record volume.
text_following: We must not, however, adopt punitive legislation.

text_original: We must not, however, adopt punitive legislation.
text_preceding: Nevertheless, it is essential to improve the methods for reaching agreement between labor and management and to reduce the number of strikes and lockouts.
text_following: We must not, in order to punish a few labor leaders, pass vindictive laws which will restrict the proper rights of the rank and file of labor.

text_original: We must not, in order to punish a few labor leaders, pass vindictive laws which will restrict the proper rights of the rank and file of labor.
text_preceding: We must not, however, adopt punitive legislation.
text_following: We must not, under the stress of emotion, endanger our American freedoms by taking ill-considered action which will lead to results not anticipated or desired.

text_original: We must not, under the stress of emotion, endanger our American freedoms by taking ill-considered action which will lead to results not anticipated or desired.
text_preceding: We must not, in order to punish a few labor leaders, pass vindictive laws which will restrict the proper rights of the rank and file of labor.
text_following: We must remember, in reviewing the record of disputes in 1946, that management shares with labor the responsibility for failure to reach agreements which would have averted strikes.

text_original: We must remember, in reviewing the record of disputes in 1946, that management shares with labor the responsibility for failure to reach agreements which would have averted strikes.
text_preceding: We must not, under the stress of emotion, endanger our American freedoms by taking ill-considered action which will lead to results not anticipated or desired.
text_following: For that reason, we must realize that industrial peace cannot be achieved merely by laws directed against labor unions.

text_original: For that reason, we must realize that industrial peace cannot be achieved merely by laws directed against labor unions.
text_preceding: We must remember, in reviewing the record of disputes in 1946, that management shares with labor the responsibility for failure to reach agreements which would have averted strikes.
text_following: During the last decade and a half, we have established a national labor policy in this country based upon free collective bargaining as the process for determining wages and working conditions.

text_original: During the last decade and a half, we have established a national labor policy in this country based upon free collective bargaining as the process for determining wages and working conditions.
text_preceding: For that reason, we must realize that industrial peace cannot be achieved merely by laws directed against labor unions.
text_following: That is still the national policy.

text_original: That is still the national policy.
text_preceding: During the last decade and a half, we have established a national labor policy in this country based upon free collective bargaining as the process for determining wages and working conditions.
text_following: And it should continue to be the national policy.

text_original: And it should continue to be the national policy.
text_preceding: That is still the national policy.
text_following: But as yet, not all of us have learned what it means to bargain freely and fairly.

text_original: But as yet, not all of us have learned what it means to bargain freely and fairly.
text_preceding: And it should continue to be the national policy.
text_following: Nor have all of us learned to carry the mutual responsibilities that accompany the right to bargain.

text_original: Nor have all of us learned to carry the mutual responsibilities that accompany the right to bargain.
text_preceding: But as yet, not all of us have learned what it means to bargain freely and fairly.
text_following: There have been abuses and harmful practices which limit the effectiveness of our system of collective bargaining.

text_original: There have been abuses and harmful practices which limit the effectiveness of our system of collective bargaining.
text_preceding: Nor have all of us learned to carry the mutual responsibilities that accompany the right to bargain.
text_following: Furthermore, we have lacked sufficient governmental machinery to aid labor and management in resolving their differences.

text_original: Furthermore, we have lacked sufficient governmental machinery to aid labor and management in resolving their differences.
text_preceding: There have been abuses and harmful practices which limit the effectiveness of our system of collective bargaining.
text_following: Certain labor-management problems need attention at once and certain others, by reason of their complexity, need exhaustive investigation and study.

text_original: Certain labor-management problems need attention at once and certain others, by reason of their complexity, need exhaustive investigation and study.
text_preceding: Furthermore, we have lacked sufficient governmental machinery to aid labor and management in resolving their differences.
text_following: We should enact legislation to correct certain abuses and to provide additional governmental assistance in bargaining.

text_original: We should enact legislation to correct certain abuses and to provide additional governmental assistance in bargaining.
text_preceding: Certain labor-management problems need attention at once and certain others, by reason of their complexity, need exhaustive investigation and study.
text_following: But we should also concern ourselves with the basic causes of labor-management difficulties.

text_original: But we should also concern ourselves with the basic causes of labor-management difficulties.
text_preceding: We should enact legislation to correct certain abuses and to provide additional governmental assistance in bargaining.
text_following: In the light of these considerations, I propose to you and urge your cooperation in effecting the following four-point program to reduce industrial strife: Point number one is the early enactment of legislation to prevent certain unjustifiable practices.

text_original: In the light of these considerations, I propose to you and urge your cooperation in effecting the following four-point program to reduce industrial strife: Point number one is the early enactment of legislation to prevent certain unjustifiable practices.
text_preceding: But we should also concern ourselves with the basic causes of labor-management difficulties.
text_following: First, under this point, are jurisdictional strikes.

text_original: First, under this point, are jurisdictional strikes.
text_preceding: In the light of these considerations, I propose to you and urge your cooperation in effecting the following four-point program to reduce industrial strife: Point number one is the early enactment of legislation to prevent certain unjustifiable practices.
text_following: In such strikes the public and the employer are innocent bystanders who are injured by a collision between rival unions.

text_original: In such strikes the public and the employer are innocent bystanders who are injured by a collision between rival unions.
text_preceding: First, under this point, are jurisdictional strikes.
text_following: This type of dispute hurts production, industry, and the public-and labor itself.

text_original: This type of dispute hurts production, industry, and the public-and labor itself.
text_preceding: In such strikes the public and the employer are innocent bystanders who are injured by a collision between rival unions.
text_following: I consider jurisdictional strikes indefensible.

text_original: I consider jurisdictional strikes indefensible.
text_preceding: This type of dispute hurts production, industry, and the public-and labor itself.
text_following: The National Labor Relations Act provides procedures for determining which union represents employees of a particular employer.

text_original: The National Labor Relations Act provides procedures for determining which union represents employees of a particular employer.
text_preceding: I consider jurisdictional strikes indefensible.
text_following: In some jurisdictional disputes, however, minority unions strike to compel employers to deal with them despite a legal duty to bargain with the majority union.

text_original: In some jurisdictional disputes, however, minority unions strike to compel employers to deal with them despite a legal duty to bargain with the majority union.
text_preceding: The National Labor Relations Act provides procedures for determining which union represents employees of a particular employer.
text_following: Strikes to compel an employer to violate the law are inexcusable.

text_original: Strikes to compel an employer to violate the law are inexcusable.
text_preceding: In some jurisdictional disputes, however, minority unions strike to compel employers to deal with them despite a legal duty to bargain with the majority union.
text_following: Legislation to prevent such strikes is clearly desirable.

text_original: Legislation to prevent such strikes is clearly desirable.
text_preceding: Strikes to compel an employer to violate the law are inexcusable.
text_following: Another form of inter-union disagreement is the jurisdictional strike involving the question of which labor union is entitled to perform a particular task.

text_original: Another form of inter-union disagreement is the jurisdictional strike involving the question of which labor union is entitled to perform a particular task.
text_preceding: Legislation to prevent such strikes is clearly desirable.
text_following: When rival unions are unable to settle such disputes themselves, provision must be made for peaceful and binding determination of the issues.

text_original: When rival unions are unable to settle such disputes themselves, provision must be made for peaceful and binding determination of the issues.
text_preceding: Another form of inter-union disagreement is the jurisdictional strike involving the question of which labor union is entitled to perform a particular task.
text_following: A second unjustifiable practice is the secondary boycott, when used to further jurisdictional disputes or to compel employers to violate the National Labor Relations Act.

text_original: A second unjustifiable practice is the secondary boycott, when used to further jurisdictional disputes or to compel employers to violate the National Labor Relations Act.
text_preceding: When rival unions are unable to settle such disputes themselves, provision must be made for peaceful and binding determination of the issues.
text_following: Not all secondary boycotts are unjustified.

text_original: Not all secondary boycotts are unjustified.
text_preceding: A second unjustifiable practice is the secondary boycott, when used to further jurisdictional disputes or to compel employers to violate the National Labor Relations Act.
text_following: We must judge them on the basis of their objectives.

text_original: We must judge them on the basis of their objectives.
text_preceding: Not all secondary boycotts are unjustified.
text_following: For example, boycotts intended to protect wage rates and working conditions should be distinguished from those in furtherance of jurisdictional disputes.

text_original: For example, boycotts intended to protect wage rates and working conditions should be distinguished from those in furtherance of jurisdictional disputes.
text_preceding: We must judge them on the basis of their objectives.
text_following: The structure of industry sometimes requires unions, as a matter of self-preservation, to extend the conflict beyond a particular employer.

text_original: The structure of industry sometimes requires unions, as a matter of self-preservation, to extend the conflict beyond a particular employer.
text_preceding: For example, boycotts intended to protect wage rates and working conditions should be distinguished from those in furtherance of jurisdictional disputes.
text_following: There should be no blanket prohibition against boycotts.

text_original: There should be no blanket prohibition against boycotts.
text_preceding: The structure of industry sometimes requires unions, as a matter of self-preservation, to extend the conflict beyond a particular employer.
text_following: The appropriate goal is legislation which prohibits secondary boycotts in pursuance of unjustifiable objectives, but does not impair the union's right to preserve its own existence and the gains made in genuine collective bargaining.

text_original: The appropriate goal is legislation which prohibits secondary boycotts in pursuance of unjustifiable objectives, but does not impair the union's right to preserve its own existence and the gains made in genuine collective bargaining.
text_preceding: There should be no blanket prohibition against boycotts.
text_following: A third practice that should be corrected is the use of economic force, by either labor or management, to decide issues arising out of the interpretation of existing contracts.

text_original: A third practice that should be corrected is the use of economic force, by either labor or management, to decide issues arising out of the interpretation of existing contracts.
text_preceding: The appropriate goal is legislation which prohibits secondary boycotts in pursuance of unjustifiable objectives, but does not impair the union's right to preserve its own existence and the gains made in genuine collective bargaining.
text_following: Collective bargaining agreements, like other contracts, should he faithfully adhered to by both parties.

text_original: Collective bargaining agreements, like other contracts, should he faithfully adhered to by both parties.
text_preceding: A third practice that should be corrected is the use of economic force, by either labor or management, to decide issues arising out of the interpretation of existing contracts.
text_following: In the most enlightened union-management relationships, disputes over the interpretation of contract terms are settled peaceably by negotiation or arbitration.

text_original: In the most enlightened union-management relationships, disputes over the interpretation of contract terms are settled peaceably by negotiation or arbitration.
text_preceding: Collective bargaining agreements, like other contracts, should he faithfully adhered to by both parties.
text_following: Legislation should be enacted to provide machinery whereby unsettled disputes concerning the interpretation of an existing agreement may be referred by either party to final and binding arbitration.

text_original: Legislation should be enacted to provide machinery whereby unsettled disputes concerning the interpretation of an existing agreement may be referred by either party to final and binding arbitration.
text_preceding: In the most enlightened union-management relationships, disputes over the interpretation of contract terms are settled peaceably by negotiation or arbitration.
text_following: Point number two is the extension of facilities within the Department of Labor for assisting collective bargaining.

text_preceding: Legislation should be enacted to provide machinery whereby unsettled disputes concerning the interpretation of an existing agreement may be referred by either party to final and binding arbitration.

text_original: One of our difficulties in avoiding labor strife arises from a lack of order in the collective bargaining process.
text_preceding: Point number two is the extension of facilities within the Department of Labor for assisting collective bargaining.
text_following: The parties often do not have a clear understanding of their responsibility for settling disputes through their own negotiations.

text_preceding: One of our difficulties in avoiding labor strife arises from a lack of order in the collective bargaining process.

text_following: On June 11, 1946, in my message vetoing the Case Bill, I made a comprehensive statement of my views concerning labor-management relations.

text_original: On June 11, 1946, in my message vetoing the Case Bill, I made a comprehensive statement of my views concerning labor-management relations.
text_preceding: Point number three is the broadening of our program of social legislation to alleviate the causes of workers' insecurity.
text_following: I said then, and I repeat now, that the solution of labor-management difficulties is to be found not only in legislation dealing directly with labor relations, but also in a program designed to remove the causes of insecurity felt by many workers in our industrial society.

text_original: I said then, and I repeat now, that the solution of labor-management difficulties is to be found not only in legislation dealing directly with labor relations, but also in a program designed to remove the causes of insecurity felt by many workers in our industrial society.
text_preceding: On June 11, 1946, in my message vetoing the Case Bill, I made a comprehensive statement of my views concerning labor-management relations.
text_following: In this connection, for example, the Congress should consider the extension and broadening of our social security system, better housing, a comprehensive national health program, and provision for a fair minimum wage.

text_preceding: I said then, and I repeat now, that the solution of labor-management difficulties is to be found not only in legislation dealing directly with labor relations, but also in a program designed to remove the causes of insecurity felt by many workers in our industrial society.
text_following: Point number four is the appointment of a Temporary Joint Commission to inquire into the entire field of labor-management relations.

text_original: Point number four is the appointment of a Temporary Joint Commission to inquire into the entire field of labor-management relations.
text_preceding: In this connection, for example, the Congress should consider the extension and broadening of our social security system, better housing, a comprehensive national health program, and provision for a fair minimum wage.

text_preceding: Point number four is the appointment of a Temporary Joint Commission to inquire into the entire field of labor-management relations.
text_following: The President, the Congress, and management and labor have a continuing responsibility to cooperate in seeking and finding the solution of these problems.

text_original: The President, the Congress, and management and labor have a continuing responsibility to cooperate in seeking and finding the solution of these problems.
text_preceding: I recommend that the Congress provide for the appointment of a Temporary Joint Commission to undertake this broad study.
text_following: I therefore recommend that the Commission be composed as follows: twelve to be chosen by the Congress from members of both parties in the House and the Senate, and eight representing the public, management and labor, to be appointed by the President.

text_original: I therefore recommend that the Commission be composed as follows: twelve to be chosen by the Congress from members of both parties in the House and the Senate, and eight representing the public, management and labor, to be appointed by the President.
text_preceding: The President, the Congress, and management and labor have a continuing responsibility to cooperate in seeking and finding the solution of these problems.
text_following: The Commission should be charged with investigating and making recommendations upon certain major subjects, among others: First, the special and unique problem of nationwide strikes in vital industries affecting the public interest.

text_original: The Commission should be charged with investigating and making recommendations upon certain major subjects, among others: First, the special and unique problem of nationwide strikes in vital industries affecting the public interest.
text_preceding: I therefore recommend that the Commission be composed as follows: twelve to be chosen by the Congress from members of both parties in the House and the Senate, and eight representing the public, management and labor, to be appointed by the President.
text_following: In particular, the Commission should examine into the question of how to settle or prevent such strikes without endangering our general democratic freedoms.

text_original: In particular, the Commission should examine into the question of how to settle or prevent such strikes without endangering our general democratic freedoms.
text_preceding: The Commission should be charged with investigating and making recommendations upon certain major subjects, among others: First, the special and unique problem of nationwide strikes in vital industries affecting the public interest.
text_following: Upon a proper solution of this problem may depend the whole industrial future of the United States.

text_original: Upon a proper solution of this problem may depend the whole industrial future of the United States.
text_preceding: In particular, the Commission should examine into the question of how to settle or prevent such strikes without endangering our general democratic freedoms.

text_original: The paralyzing effects of a nationwide strike in such industries as transportation, coal, oil, steel, or communications can result in national disaster.
text_preceding: Upon a proper solution of this problem may depend the whole industrial future of the United States.
text_following: We have been able to avoid such disaster, in recent years, only by the use of extraordinary war powers.

text_original: We have been able to avoid such disaster, in recent years, only by the use of extraordinary war powers.
text_preceding: The paralyzing effects of a nationwide strike in such industries as transportation, coal, oil, steel, or communications can result in national disaster.

text_preceding: We have been able to avoid such disaster, in recent years, only by the use of extraordinary war powers.

text_preceding: All those powers will soon be gone.

text_following: RESTRICTION OF MONOPOLY AND PROMOTION OF PRIVATE ENTERPRISE: The second major policy I desire to lay before you has to do with the growing concentration of economic power and the threat to free competitive private enterprise.

text_original: RESTRICTION OF MONOPOLY AND PROMOTION OF PRIVATE ENTERPRISE: The second major policy I desire to lay before you has to do with the growing concentration of economic power and the threat to free competitive private enterprise.
text_preceding: I recommend that this Commission make its first report, including specific legislative recommendations, not later than March 15, 1947.
text_following: In 1941 the Temporary National Economic Committee completed a comprehensive investigation into the workings of the national economy.

text_original: In 1941 the Temporary National Economic Committee completed a comprehensive investigation into the workings of the national economy.
text_preceding: RESTRICTION OF MONOPOLY AND PROMOTION OF PRIVATE ENTERPRISE: The second major policy I desire to lay before you has to do with the growing concentration of economic power and the threat to free competitive private enterprise.
text_following: The Committee's study showed that, despite a half century of anti-trust law enforcement, one of the gravest threats to our welfare lay in the increasing concentration of power in the hands of a small number of giant organizations.

text_original: The Committee's study showed that, despite a half century of anti-trust law enforcement, one of the gravest threats to our welfare lay in the increasing concentration of power in the hands of a small number of giant organizations.
text_preceding: In 1941 the Temporary National Economic Committee completed a comprehensive investigation into the workings of the national economy.
text_following: During the war, this long-standing tendency toward economic concentration was accelerated.

text_original: During the war, this long-standing tendency toward economic concentration was accelerated.
text_preceding: The Committee's study showed that, despite a half century of anti-trust law enforcement, one of the gravest threats to our welfare lay in the increasing concentration of power in the hands of a small number of giant organizations.
text_following: As a consequence, we now find that to a greater extent than ever before, whole industries are dominated by one or a few large organizations which can restrict production in the interest of higher profits and thus reduce employment and purchasing power.

text_original: As a consequence, we now find that to a greater extent than ever before, whole industries are dominated by one or a few large organizations which can restrict production in the interest of higher profits and thus reduce employment and purchasing power.
text_preceding: During the war, this long-standing tendency toward economic concentration was accelerated.
text_following: In an effort to assure full opportunity and free competition to business we will vigorously enforce the anti-trust laws.

text_original: In an effort to assure full opportunity and free competition to business we will vigorously enforce the anti-trust laws.
text_preceding: As a consequence, we now find that to a greater extent than ever before, whole industries are dominated by one or a few large organizations which can restrict production in the interest of higher profits and thus reduce employment and purchasing power.
text_following: There is much the Congress can do to cooperate and assist in this program.

text_original: There is much the Congress can do to cooperate and assist in this program.
text_preceding: In an effort to assure full opportunity and free competition to business we will vigorously enforce the anti-trust laws.
text_following: To strengthen and enforce the laws that regulate business practices is not enough.

text_original: To strengthen and enforce the laws that regulate business practices is not enough.
text_preceding: There is much the Congress can do to cooperate and assist in this program.
text_following: Enforcement must be supplemented by positive measures of aid to new enterprises.

text_original: Enforcement must be supplemented by positive measures of aid to new enterprises.
text_preceding: To strengthen and enforce the laws that regulate business practices is not enough.
text_following: Government assistance, research programs, and credit powers should be designed and used to promote the growth of new firms and new industries.

text_original: Government assistance, research programs, and credit powers should be designed and used to promote the growth of new firms and new industries.
text_preceding: Enforcement must be supplemented by positive measures of aid to new enterprises.
text_following: Assistance to small business is particularly important at this time when thousands of veterans who are potential business and industrial leaders are beginning their careers.

text_original: Assistance to small business is particularly important at this time when thousands of veterans who are potential business and industrial leaders are beginning their careers.
text_preceding: Government assistance, research programs, and credit powers should be designed and used to promote the growth of new firms and new industries.
text_following: We should also give special attention to the decentralization of industry and the development of areas that are now under-industrialized.

text_original: We should also give special attention to the decentralization of industry and the development of areas that are now under-industrialized.
text_preceding: Assistance to small business is particularly important at this time when thousands of veterans who are potential business and industrial leaders are beginning their careers.
text_following: HOUSING: The third major policy is also of great Importance to the national economy-an aggressive program to encourage home construction.

text_original: HOUSING: The third major policy is also of great Importance to the national economy-an aggressive program to encourage home construction.
text_preceding: We should also give special attention to the decentralization of industry and the development of areas that are now under-industrialized.
text_following: The first Federal program to relieve the veterans' housing shortage was announced in February 1946.

text_original: The first Federal program to relieve the veterans' housing shortage was announced in February 1946.
text_preceding: HOUSING: The third major policy is also of great Importance to the national economy-an aggressive program to encourage home construction.
text_following: In 1946 one million family housing units have been put under construction and more than 665,000 units have already been completed.

text_original: In 1946 one million family housing units have been put under construction and more than 665,000 units have already been completed.
text_preceding: The first Federal program to relieve the veterans' housing shortage was announced in February 1946.
text_following: The rate of expansion in construction has broken all records.

text_original: The rate of expansion in construction has broken all records.
text_preceding: In 1946 one million family housing units have been put under construction and more than 665,000 units have already been completed.
text_following: In the coming year the number of dwelling units built will approach, if not surpass, the top construction year of 1926.

text_original: In the coming year the number of dwelling units built will approach, if not surpass, the top construction year of 1926.
text_preceding: The rate of expansion in construction has broken all records.
text_following: The primary responsibility to deliver housing at reasonable prices that veterans can afford rests with private industry and with labor.

text_original: The primary responsibility to deliver housing at reasonable prices that veterans can afford rests with private industry and with labor.
text_preceding: In the coming year the number of dwelling units built will approach, if not surpass, the top construction year of 1926.
text_following: The Government will continue to expedite the flow of key building materials, to limit nonresidential construction, and to give financial support where it will do the most good.

text_original: The Government will continue to expedite the flow of key building materials, to limit nonresidential construction, and to give financial support where it will do the most good.
text_preceding: The primary responsibility to deliver housing at reasonable prices that veterans can afford rests with private industry and with labor.
text_following: Measures to stimulate rental housing and new types of housing construction will receive special emphasis.

text_original: Measures to stimulate rental housing and new types of housing construction will receive special emphasis.
text_preceding: The Government will continue to expedite the flow of key building materials, to limit nonresidential construction, and to give financial support where it will do the most good.
text_following: To reach our long-range goal of adequate housing for all our people, comprehensive housing legislation is urgently required, similar to the non-partisan bill passed by the Senate last year.

text_original: To reach our long-range goal of adequate housing for all our people, comprehensive housing legislation is urgently required, similar to the non-partisan bill passed by the Senate last year.
text_preceding: Measures to stimulate rental housing and new types of housing construction will receive special emphasis.
text_following: At a minimum, such legislation should open the way for rebuilding the blighted areas of our cities and should establish positive incentives for the investment of billions of dollars of private capital in large-scale rental housing projects.

text_original: At a minimum, such legislation should open the way for rebuilding the blighted areas of our cities and should establish positive incentives for the investment of billions of dollars of private capital in large-scale rental housing projects.
text_preceding: To reach our long-range goal of adequate housing for all our people, comprehensive housing legislation is urgently required, similar to the non-partisan bill passed by the Senate last year.
text_following: It should provide for improvement of housing in rural areas and for the construction, over a 4-year period, of half a million units of public low-rental housing.

text_original: It should provide for improvement of housing in rural areas and for the construction, over a 4-year period, of half a million units of public low-rental housing.
text_preceding: At a minimum, such legislation should open the way for rebuilding the blighted areas of our cities and should establish positive incentives for the investment of billions of dollars of private capital in large-scale rental housing projects.
text_following: It should authorize a single peacetime Federal housing agency to assure efficient use of our resources on the vast housing front.

text_preceding: It should provide for improvement of housing in rural areas and for the construction, over a 4-year period, of half a million units of public low-rental housing.

text_following: Prudent management of public finance requires that we begin the process of reducing the public debt.

text_original: The budget which I shall submit to you this week has a small margin of surplus.
text_preceding: Prudent management of public finance requires that we begin the process of reducing the public debt.
text_following: In the Budget Message I am making recommendations which, if accepted, will result in a substantially larger surplus which should be applied to debt retirement.

text_preceding: The budget which I shall submit to you this week has a small margin of surplus.
text_following: One of these recommendations is that the Congress take early action to continue throughout the next fiscal year the war excise tax rates which, under the present law, will expire on June 30, 1947.

text_following: AGRICULTURE: The fifth major policy has to do with the welfare of our farm population.

text_original: AGRICULTURE: The fifth major policy has to do with the welfare of our farm population.
text_preceding: and I hope that the Congress will cooperate in this program of economy.
text_following: Production of food reached record heights in 1946.

text_original: Production of food reached record heights in 1946.
text_preceding: AGRICULTURE: The fifth major policy has to do with the welfare of our farm population.
text_following: Much of our tremendous grain crop can readily be sold abroad and thus will become no threat to our domestic markets.

text_original: Much of our tremendous grain crop can readily be sold abroad and thus will become no threat to our domestic markets.

text_following: But in the next few years American agriculture can face the same dangers it did after World War I.

text_preceding: The purpose of these laws was to permit an orderly transition from war to peace.
text_following: We must not wait until the guarantees expire to set the stage for permanent farm welfare.

text_original: Over a year ago I presented to the Congress my views on a national health program.
text_preceding: HEALTH AND GENERAL WELFARE: Of all our national resources, none is of more basic value than the health of our people.
text_following: The Congress acted on several of the recommendations in this program: mental health, the health of mothers and children, and hospital construction.

text_original: The Congress acted on several of the recommendations in this program: mental health, the health of mothers and children, and hospital construction.
text_preceding: Over a year ago I presented to the Congress my views on a national health program.
text_following: I urge this Congress to complete the work begun last year and to enact the most important recommendation of the program-to provide adequate medical care to all who need it, not as charity but on the basis of payments made by the beneficiaries of the program.

text_original: I urge this Congress to complete the work begun last year and to enact the most important recommendation of the program-to provide adequate medical care to all who need it, not as charity but on the basis of payments made by the beneficiaries of the program.
text_preceding: The Congress acted on several of the recommendations in this program: mental health, the health of mothers and children, and hospital construction.
text_following: One administrative change would help greatly to further our national program in the fields of health, education, and welfare.
