text_preceding: In the meantime we shall constantly seek meaningful agreements to settle this and other problems, knowing full well that not only the integrity of a single city, but the hope of all free peoples is at stake.
text_following: The International Monetary Fund and the World Bank have both fully proven their worth as instruments of international financial cooperation.

text_original: The International Monetary Fund and the World Bank have both fully proven their worth as instruments of international financial cooperation.
text_preceding: We need, likewise, to continue helping to build the economic base so essential to the Free World's stability and strength.
text_following: Their Executive Directors have recommended an increase in each member country's subscription.

text_original: Their Executive Directors have recommended an increase in each member country's subscription.
text_preceding: The International Monetary Fund and the World Bank have both fully proven their worth as instruments of international financial cooperation.
text_following: I am requesting the Congress for immediate approval of our share of these increases.

text_original: I am requesting the Congress for immediate approval of our share of these increases.
text_preceding: Their Executive Directors have recommended an increase in each member country's subscription.
text_following: We are now negotiating with representatives of the twenty Latin American Republics for the creation of an inter-American financial institution.

text_original: We are now negotiating with representatives of the twenty Latin American Republics for the creation of an inter-American financial institution.
text_preceding: I am requesting the Congress for immediate approval of our share of these increases.
text_following: Its purpose would be to join all the American Republics in a common institution which would promote and finance development in Latin America, and make more effective the use of capital from the World Bank, the Export-Import Bank, and private sources.

text_original: Its purpose would be to join all the American Republics in a common institution which would promote and finance development in Latin America, and make more effective the use of capital from the World Bank, the Export-Import Bank, and private sources.
text_preceding: We are now negotiating with representatives of the twenty Latin American Republics for the creation of an inter-American financial institution.
text_following: Private enterprise continues to make major contributions to economic development in all parts of the world.

text_original: Private enterprise continues to make major contributions to economic development in all parts of the world.
text_preceding: Its purpose would be to join all the American Republics in a common institution which would promote and finance development in Latin America, and make more effective the use of capital from the World Bank, the Export-Import Bank, and private sources.
text_following: But we have not yet marshaled the full potential of American business for this task, particularly in countries which have recently attained their independence.

text_original: But we have not yet marshaled the full potential of American business for this task, particularly in countries which have recently attained their independence.
text_preceding: Private enterprise continues to make major contributions to economic development in all parts of the world.
text_following: I shall present to this Congress a program designed to encourage greater participation by private enterprise in economic development abroad.

text_original: I shall present to this Congress a program designed to encourage greater participation by private enterprise in economic development abroad.
text_preceding: But we have not yet marshaled the full potential of American business for this task, particularly in countries which have recently attained their independence.
text_following: Further, all of us know that to advance the cause of freedom we must do much more than help build sound economies.

text_original: Further, all of us know that to advance the cause of freedom we must do much more than help build sound economies.
text_preceding: I shall present to this Congress a program designed to encourage greater participation by private enterprise in economic development abroad.
text_following: The spiritual, intellectual, and physical strength of people throughout the world will in the last analysis determine their willingness and their ability to resist Communism.

text_original: The spiritual, intellectual, and physical strength of people throughout the world will in the last analysis determine their willingness and their ability to resist Communism.
text_preceding: Further, all of us know that to advance the cause of freedom we must do much more than help build sound economies.
text_following: To give a single illustration of our many efforts in these fields: We have been a participant in the effort that has been made over the past few years against one of the great scourges of mankind--disease.

text_original: To give a single illustration of our many efforts in these fields: We have been a participant in the effort that has been made over the past few years against one of the great scourges of mankind--disease.
text_preceding: The spiritual, intellectual, and physical strength of people throughout the world will in the last analysis determine their willingness and their ability to resist Communism.
text_following: Through the Mutual Security program public health officials are being trained by American universities to serve in less developed countries.

text_original: Through the Mutual Security program public health officials are being trained by American universities to serve in less developed countries.
text_preceding: To give a single illustration of our many efforts in these fields: We have been a participant in the effort that has been made over the past few years against one of the great scourges of mankind--disease.
text_following: We are engaged in intensive malaria eradication projects in many parts of the world.

text_original: We are engaged in intensive malaria eradication projects in many parts of the world.
text_preceding: Through the Mutual Security program public health officials are being trained by American universities to serve in less developed countries.
text_following: America's major successes in our own country prove the feasibility of success everywhere.

text_original: America's major successes in our own country prove the feasibility of success everywhere.
text_preceding: We are engaged in intensive malaria eradication projects in many parts of the world.
text_following: By these and other means we shall continue and expand our campaign against the afflictions that now bring needless suffering and death to so many of the world's people.

text_original: By these and other means we shall continue and expand our campaign against the afflictions that now bring needless suffering and death to so many of the world's people.
text_preceding: America's major successes in our own country prove the feasibility of success everywhere.
text_following: We wish to be part of a great shared effort toward the triumph of health.

text_original: We wish to be part of a great shared effort toward the triumph of health.
text_preceding: By these and other means we shall continue and expand our campaign against the afflictions that now bring needless suffering and death to so many of the world's people.
text_following: IV. America is best described by one word, freedom.

text_original: IV. America is best described by one word, freedom.
text_preceding: We wish to be part of a great shared effort toward the triumph of health.
text_following: If we hope to strengthen freedom in the world we must be ever mindful of how our own conduct reacts elsewhere.

text_original: If we hope to strengthen freedom in the world we must be ever mindful of how our own conduct reacts elsewhere.
text_preceding: IV. America is best described by one word, freedom.
text_following: No nation has ever been so floodlighted by world opinion as the United States is today.

text_original: No nation has ever been so floodlighted by world opinion as the United States is today.
text_preceding: If we hope to strengthen freedom in the world we must be ever mindful of how our own conduct reacts elsewhere.
text_following: Everything we do is carefully scrutinized by other peoples throughout the world.

text_original: Everything we do is carefully scrutinized by other peoples throughout the world.
text_preceding: No nation has ever been so floodlighted by world opinion as the United States is today.
text_following: The bad is seen along with the good.

text_original: The bad is seen along with the good.
text_preceding: Everything we do is carefully scrutinized by other peoples throughout the world.
text_following: But as free men we are also responsible for correcting the errors and imperfections of our ways.

text_original: But as free men we are also responsible for correcting the errors and imperfections of our ways.
text_preceding: The bad is seen along with the good.
text_following: Last January I made comprehensive recommendations to the Congress for legislation in the labor-management field.

text_original: Last January I made comprehensive recommendations to the Congress for legislation in the labor-management field.
text_preceding: But as free men we are also responsible for correcting the errors and imperfections of our ways.
text_following: To my disappointment, Congress failed to act.

text_original: To my disappointment, Congress failed to act.
text_preceding: Last January I made comprehensive recommendations to the Congress for legislation in the labor-management field.
text_following: The McClellan Committee disclosures of corruption, racketeering, and abuse of trust and power in labor-management affairs have aroused America and amazed other peoples.

text_original: The McClellan Committee disclosures of corruption, racketeering, and abuse of trust and power in labor-management affairs have aroused America and amazed other peoples.
text_preceding: To my disappointment, Congress failed to act.
text_following: They emphasize the need for improved local law enforcement and the enactment of effective Federal legislation to protect the public interest and to insure the rights and economic freedoms of millions of American workers.

text_original: They emphasize the need for improved local law enforcement and the enactment of effective Federal legislation to protect the public interest and to insure the rights and economic freedoms of millions of American workers.
text_preceding: The McClellan Committee disclosures of corruption, racketeering, and abuse of trust and power in labor-management affairs have aroused America and amazed other peoples.
text_following: Halfhearted measures will not do.

text_original: Halfhearted measures will not do.
text_preceding: They emphasize the need for improved local law enforcement and the enactment of effective Federal legislation to protect the public interest and to insure the rights and economic freedoms of millions of American workers.
text_following: I shall recommend prompt enactment of legislation designed: To safeguard workers' funds in union treasuries against misuse of any kind whatsoever.

text_original: I shall recommend prompt enactment of legislation designed: To safeguard workers' funds in union treasuries against misuse of any kind whatsoever.
text_preceding: Halfhearted measures will not do.
text_following: To protect the rights and freedoms of individual union members, including the basic right to free and secret elections of officers.

text_original: To protect the rights and freedoms of individual union members, including the basic right to free and secret elections of officers.
text_preceding: I shall recommend prompt enactment of legislation designed: To safeguard workers' funds in union treasuries against misuse of any kind whatsoever.
text_following: To advance true and responsible collective bargaining.

text_original: To advance true and responsible collective bargaining.
text_preceding: To protect the rights and freedoms of individual union members, including the basic right to free and secret elections of officers.
text_following: To protect the public and innocent third parties from unfair and coercive practices such as boycotting and blackmail picketing.

text_original: To protect the public and innocent third parties from unfair and coercive practices such as boycotting and blackmail picketing.
text_preceding: To advance true and responsible collective bargaining.
text_following: The workers and the public must have these vital protections.

text_original: The workers and the public must have these vital protections.
text_preceding: To protect the public and innocent third parties from unfair and coercive practices such as boycotting and blackmail picketing.
text_following: In other areas of human rights--freedom from discrimination in voting, in public education, in access to jobs, and in other respects-- the world is likewise watching our conduct.

text_original: In other areas of human rights--freedom from discrimination in voting, in public education, in access to jobs, and in other respects-- the world is likewise watching our conduct.
text_preceding: The workers and the public must have these vital protections.
text_following: The image of America abroad is not improved when school children, through closing of some of our schools and through no fault of their own, are deprived of their opportunity for an education.

text_original: The image of America abroad is not improved when school children, through closing of some of our schools and through no fault of their own, are deprived of their opportunity for an education.
text_preceding: In other areas of human rights--freedom from discrimination in voting, in public education, in access to jobs, and in other respects-- the world is likewise watching our conduct.
text_following: The government of a free people has no purpose more noble than to work for the maximum realization of equality of opportunity under law.

text_original: The government of a free people has no purpose more noble than to work for the maximum realization of equality of opportunity under law.
text_preceding: The image of America abroad is not improved when school children, through closing of some of our schools and through no fault of their own, are deprived of their opportunity for an education.
text_following: This is not the sole responsibility of any one branch of our government.

text_original: This is not the sole responsibility of any one branch of our government.
text_preceding: The government of a free people has no purpose more noble than to work for the maximum realization of equality of opportunity under law.
text_following: The judicial arm, which has the ultimate authority for interpreting the Constitution, has held that certain state laws and practices discriminate upon racial grounds and are unconstitutional.

text_original: The judicial arm, which has the ultimate authority for interpreting the Constitution, has held that certain state laws and practices discriminate upon racial grounds and are unconstitutional.
text_preceding: This is not the sole responsibility of any one branch of our government.
text_following: Whenever the supremacy of the Constitution of the United States is challenged I shall continue to take every action necessary to uphold it.

text_original: Whenever the supremacy of the Constitution of the United States is challenged I shall continue to take every action necessary to uphold it.
text_preceding: The judicial arm, which has the ultimate authority for interpreting the Constitution, has held that certain state laws and practices discriminate upon racial grounds and are unconstitutional.
text_following: One of the fundamental concepts of our constitutional system is that it guarantees to every individual, regardless of race, religion, or national origin, the equal protection of the laws.

text_original: One of the fundamental concepts of our constitutional system is that it guarantees to every individual, regardless of race, religion, or national origin, the equal protection of the laws.
text_preceding: Whenever the supremacy of the Constitution of the United States is challenged I shall continue to take every action necessary to uphold it.
text_following: Those of us who are privileged to hold public office have a solemn obligation to make meaningful this inspiring objective.

text_original: Those of us who are privileged to hold public office have a solemn obligation to make meaningful this inspiring objective.
text_preceding: One of the fundamental concepts of our constitutional system is that it guarantees to every individual, regardless of race, religion, or national origin, the equal protection of the laws.
text_following: We can fulfill that obligation by our leadership in teaching, persuading, demonstrating, and in enforcing the law.

text_original: We can fulfill that obligation by our leadership in teaching, persuading, demonstrating, and in enforcing the law.
text_preceding: Those of us who are privileged to hold public office have a solemn obligation to make meaningful this inspiring objective.
text_following: We are making noticeable progress in the field of civil rights-- we are moving forward toward achievement of equality of opportunity for all people everywhere in the United States.

text_original: We are making noticeable progress in the field of civil rights-- we are moving forward toward achievement of equality of opportunity for all people everywhere in the United States.
text_preceding: We can fulfill that obligation by our leadership in teaching, persuading, demonstrating, and in enforcing the law.
text_following: In the interest of the nation and of each of its citizens, that progress must continue.

text_original: In the interest of the nation and of each of its citizens, that progress must continue.
text_preceding: We are making noticeable progress in the field of civil rights-- we are moving forward toward achievement of equality of opportunity for all people everywhere in the United States.
text_following: Legislative proposals of the Administration in this field will be submitted to the Congress early in the session.

text_original: Legislative proposals of the Administration in this field will be submitted to the Congress early in the session.
text_preceding: In the interest of the nation and of each of its citizens, that progress must continue.
text_following: All of us should help to make clear that the government is united in the common purpose of giving support to the law and the decisions of the Courts.

text_original: All of us should help to make clear that the government is united in the common purpose of giving support to the law and the decisions of the Courts.
text_preceding: Legislative proposals of the Administration in this field will be submitted to the Congress early in the session.
text_following: By moving steadily toward the goal of greater freedom under law, for our own people, we shall be the better prepared to work for the cause of freedom under law throughout the world.

text_original: By moving steadily toward the goal of greater freedom under law, for our own people, we shall be the better prepared to work for the cause of freedom under law throughout the world.
text_preceding: All of us should help to make clear that the government is united in the common purpose of giving support to the law and the decisions of the Courts.
text_following: All peoples are sorely tired of the fear, destruction, and the waste of war.

text_original: All peoples are sorely tired of the fear, destruction, and the waste of war.
text_preceding: By moving steadily toward the goal of greater freedom under law, for our own people, we shall be the better prepared to work for the cause of freedom under law throughout the world.
text_following: As never before, the world knows the human and material costs of war and seeks to replace force with a genuine rule of law among nations.

text_original: As never before, the world knows the human and material costs of war and seeks to replace force with a genuine rule of law among nations.
text_preceding: All peoples are sorely tired of the fear, destruction, and the waste of war.
text_following: It is my purpose to intensify efforts during the coming two years in seeking ways to supplement the procedures of the United Nations and other bodies with similar objectives, to the end that the rule of law may replace the rule of force in the affairs of nations.

text_original: It is my purpose to intensify efforts during the coming two years in seeking ways to supplement the procedures of the United Nations and other bodies with similar objectives, to the end that the rule of law may replace the rule of force in the affairs of nations.
text_preceding: As never before, the world knows the human and material costs of war and seeks to replace force with a genuine rule of law among nations.
text_following: Measures toward this end will be proposed later, including a re-examination of our own relation to the International Court of Justice.

text_original: Measures toward this end will be proposed later, including a re-examination of our own relation to the International Court of Justice.
text_preceding: It is my purpose to intensify efforts during the coming two years in seeking ways to supplement the procedures of the United Nations and other bodies with similar objectives, to the end that the rule of law may replace the rule of force in the affairs of nations.
text_following: Finally--let us remind ourselves that Marxist scripture is not new; it is not the gospel of the future.

text_original: Finally--let us remind ourselves that Marxist scripture is not new; it is not the gospel of the future.
text_preceding: Measures toward this end will be proposed later, including a re-examination of our own relation to the International Court of Justice.
text_following: Its basic objective is dictatorship, old as history.

text_original: Its basic objective is dictatorship, old as history.
text_preceding: Finally--let us remind ourselves that Marxist scripture is not new; it is not the gospel of the future.
text_following: What is new is the shining prospect that man can build a world where all can live in dignity.

text_original: What is new is the shining prospect that man can build a world where all can live in dignity.
text_preceding: Its basic objective is dictatorship, old as history.
text_following: We seek victory--not over any nation or people--but over the ancient enemies of us all; victory over ignorance, poverty, disease, and human degradation wherever they may be found.

text_original: We seek victory--not over any nation or people--but over the ancient enemies of us all; victory over ignorance, poverty, disease, and human degradation wherever they may be found.
text_preceding: What is new is the shining prospect that man can build a world where all can live in dignity.
text_following: We march in the noblest of causes--human freedom.

text_original: We march in the noblest of causes--human freedom.
text_preceding: We seek victory--not over any nation or people--but over the ancient enemies of us all; victory over ignorance, poverty, disease, and human degradation wherever they may be found.
text_following: If we make ourselves worthy of America's ideals, if we do not forget that our nation was founded on the premise that all men are creatures of God's making, the world will come to know that it is free men who carry forward the true promise of human progress and dignity.

text_original: If we make ourselves worthy of America's ideals, if we do not forget that our nation was founded on the premise that all men are creatures of God's making, the world will come to know that it is free men who carry forward the true promise of human progress and dignity.
text_preceding: We march in the noblest of causes--human freedom.

text_original: Mr. Speaker, Mr. President, Members of the House and Senate, my fellow Americans: I will be brief, for our time is necessarily short and our agenda is already long.
text_following: Last year's congressional session was the longest in peacetime history.

text_original: Last year's congressional session was the longest in peacetime history.
text_preceding: Mr. Speaker, Mr. President, Members of the House and Senate, my fellow Americans: I will be brief, for our time is necessarily short and our agenda is already long.
text_following: With that foundation, let us work together to make this year's session the best in the Nation's history.

text_original: With that foundation, let us work together to make this year's session the best in the Nation's history.
text_preceding: Last year's congressional session was the longest in peacetime history.
text_following: Let this session of Congress be known as the session which did more for civil rights than the last hundred sessions combined;

text_original: Let this session of Congress be known as the session which did more for civil rights than the last hundred sessions combined;
text_preceding: With that foundation, let us work together to make this year's session the best in the Nation's history.
text_following: as the session which enacted the most far-reaching tax cut of our time;

text_original: as the session which enacted the most far-reaching tax cut of our time;
text_preceding: Let this session of Congress be known as the session which did more for civil rights than the last hundred sessions combined;
text_following: as the session which declared all-out war on human poverty and unemployment in these United States;

text_original: as the session which declared all-out war on human poverty and unemployment in these United States;
text_preceding: as the session which enacted the most far-reaching tax cut of our time;
text_following: as the session which finally recognized the health needs of all of our older citizens;

text_original: as the session which finally recognized the health needs of all of our older citizens;
text_preceding: as the session which declared all-out war on human poverty and unemployment in these United States;
text_following: as the session which reformed our tangled transportation and transit policies;

text_original: as the session which reformed our tangled transportation and transit policies;
text_preceding: as the session which finally recognized the health needs of all of our older citizens;
text_following: as the session which achieved the most effective, efficient foreign aid program ever;

text_original: as the session which achieved the most effective, efficient foreign aid program ever;
text_preceding: as the session which reformed our tangled transportation and transit policies;
text_following: and as the session which helped to build more homes, more schools, more libraries, and more hospitals than any single session of Congress in the history of our Republic.

text_original: and as the session which helped to build more homes, more schools, more libraries, and more hospitals than any single session of Congress in the history of our Republic.
text_preceding: as the session which achieved the most effective, efficient foreign aid program ever;
text_following: All this and more can and must be done.

text_original: All this and more can and must be done.
text_preceding: and as the session which helped to build more homes, more schools, more libraries, and more hospitals than any single session of Congress in the history of our Republic.
text_following: It can be done by this summer, and it can be done without any increase in spending.

text_original: It can be done by this summer, and it can be done without any increase in spending.
text_preceding: All this and more can and must be done.
text_following: In fact, under the budget that I shall shortly submit, it can be done with an actual reduction in Federal expenditures and Federal employment.

text_original: In fact, under the budget that I shall shortly submit, it can be done with an actual reduction in Federal expenditures and Federal employment.
text_preceding: It can be done by this summer, and it can be done without any increase in spending.
text_following: We have in 1964 a unique opportunity and obligation--to prove the success of our system;

text_original: We have in 1964 a unique opportunity and obligation--to prove the success of our system;
text_preceding: In fact, under the budget that I shall shortly submit, it can be done with an actual reduction in Federal expenditures and Federal employment.
text_following: If we fail, if we fritter and fumble away our opportunity in needless, senseless quarrels between Democrats and Republicans, or between the House and the Senate, or between the South and North, or between the Congress and the administration, then history will rightfully judge us harshly.

text_original: If we fail, if we fritter and fumble away our opportunity in needless, senseless quarrels between Democrats and Republicans, or between the House and the Senate, or between the South and North, or between the Congress and the administration, then history will rightfully judge us harshly.
text_preceding: We have in 1964 a unique opportunity and obligation--to prove the success of our system;
text_following: But if we succeed, if we can achieve these goals by forging in this country a greater sense of union, then, and only then, can we take full satisfaction in the State of the Union.

text_original: But if we succeed, if we can achieve these goals by forging in this country a greater sense of union, then, and only then, can we take full satisfaction in the State of the Union.
text_preceding: If we fail, if we fritter and fumble away our opportunity in needless, senseless quarrels between Democrats and Republicans, or between the House and the Senate, or between the South and North, or between the Congress and the administration, then history will rightfully judge us harshly.
text_following: Here in the Congress you can demonstrate effective legislative leadership by discharging the public business with clarity and dispatch, voting each important proposal up, or voting it down, but at least bringing it to a fair and a final vote.

text_original: Here in the Congress you can demonstrate effective legislative leadership by discharging the public business with clarity and dispatch, voting each important proposal up, or voting it down, but at least bringing it to a fair and a final vote.
text_preceding: But if we succeed, if we can achieve these goals by forging in this country a greater sense of union, then, and only then, can we take full satisfaction in the State of the Union.
text_following: Let us carry forward the plans and programs of John Fitzgerald Kennedy--not because of our sorrow or sympathy, but because they are right.

text_original: Let us carry forward the plans and programs of John Fitzgerald Kennedy--not because of our sorrow or sympathy, but because they are right.
text_preceding: Here in the Congress you can demonstrate effective legislative leadership by discharging the public business with clarity and dispatch, voting each important proposal up, or voting it down, but at least bringing it to a fair and a final vote.
text_following: In his memory today, I especially ask all members of my own political faith, in this election year, to put your country ahead of your party, and to always debate principles; never debate personalities.

text_original: In his memory today, I especially ask all members of my own political faith, in this election year, to put your country ahead of your party, and to always debate principles; never debate personalities.
text_preceding: Let us carry forward the plans and programs of John Fitzgerald Kennedy--not because of our sorrow or sympathy, but because they are right.
text_following: For my part, I pledge a progressive administration which is efficient, and honest and frugal.

text_original: For my part, I pledge a progressive administration which is efficient, and honest and frugal.
text_preceding: In his memory today, I especially ask all members of my own political faith, in this election year, to put your country ahead of your party, and to always debate principles; never debate personalities.
text_following: The budget to be submitted to the Congress shortly is in full accord with this pledge.

text_original: The budget to be submitted to the Congress shortly is in full accord with this pledge.
text_preceding: For my part, I pledge a progressive administration which is efficient, and honest and frugal.
text_following: It will cut our deficit in half--from $10 billion to $4,900 million.

text_original: It will cut our deficit in half--from $10 billion to $4,900 million.
text_preceding: The budget to be submitted to the Congress shortly is in full accord with this pledge.
text_following: It will be, in proportion to our national output, the smallest budget since 1951.

text_original: It will be, in proportion to our national output, the smallest budget since 1951.
text_preceding: It will cut our deficit in half--from $10 billion to $4,900 million.
text_following: It will call for a substantial reduction in Federal employment, a feat accomplished only once before in the last 10 years.

text_original: It will call for a substantial reduction in Federal employment, a feat accomplished only once before in the last 10 years.
text_preceding: It will be, in proportion to our national output, the smallest budget since 1951.
text_following: While maintaining the full strength of our combat defenses, it will call for the lowest number of civilian personnel in the Department of Defense since 1950.

text_original: While maintaining the full strength of our combat defenses, it will call for the lowest number of civilian personnel in the Department of Defense since 1950.
text_preceding: It will call for a substantial reduction in Federal employment, a feat accomplished only once before in the last 10 years.
text_following: It will call for total expenditures of $97,900 million--compared to $98,400 million for the current year, a reduction of more than $500 million.

text_original: It will call for total expenditures of $97,900 million--compared to $98,400 million for the current year, a reduction of more than $500 million.
text_preceding: While maintaining the full strength of our combat defenses, it will call for the lowest number of civilian personnel in the Department of Defense since 1950.
text_following: It will call for new obligational authority of $103,800 million--a reduction of more than $4 billion below last year's request of $107,900 million.

text_original: It will call for new obligational authority of $103,800 million--a reduction of more than $4 billion below last year's request of $107,900 million.
text_preceding: It will call for total expenditures of $97,900 million--compared to $98,400 million for the current year, a reduction of more than $500 million.
text_following: But it is not a standstill budget, for America cannot afford to stand still.

text_original: But it is not a standstill budget, for America cannot afford to stand still.
text_preceding: It will call for new obligational authority of $103,800 million--a reduction of more than $4 billion below last year's request of $107,900 million.
text_following: Unfortunately, many Americans live on the outskirts of hope--some because of their poverty, and some because of their color, and all too many because of both.

text_original: Unfortunately, many Americans live on the outskirts of hope--some because of their poverty, and some because of their color, and all too many because of both.
text_preceding: But it is not a standstill budget, for America cannot afford to stand still.
text_following: Our task is to help replace their despair with opportunity.

text_original: Our task is to help replace their despair with opportunity.
text_preceding: Unfortunately, many Americans live on the outskirts of hope--some because of their poverty, and some because of their color, and all too many because of both.
text_following: Our people's needs are expanding.

text_original: Our people's needs are expanding.
text_preceding: Our task is to help replace their despair with opportunity.
text_following: This administration today, here and now, declares unconditional war on poverty in America.

text_original: This administration today, here and now, declares unconditional war on poverty in America.
text_preceding: Our people's needs are expanding.
text_following: I urge this Congress and all Americans to join with me in that effort.

text_original: I urge this Congress and all Americans to join with me in that effort.
text_preceding: This administration today, here and now, declares unconditional war on poverty in America.
text_following: But by closing down obsolete installations, by curtailing less urgent programs, by cutting back where cutting back seems to be wise, by insisting on a dollar's worth for a dollar spent, I am able to recommend in this reduced budget the most Federal support in history for education, for health, for retraining the unemployed, and for helping the economically and the physically handicapped.

text_original: But by closing down obsolete installations, by curtailing less urgent programs, by cutting back where cutting back seems to be wise, by insisting on a dollar's worth for a dollar spent, I am able to recommend in this reduced budget the most Federal support in history for education, for health, for retraining the unemployed, and for helping the economically and the physically handicapped.
text_preceding: I urge this Congress and all Americans to join with me in that effort.
text_following: It will not be a short or easy struggle, no single weapon or strategy will suffice, but we shall not rest until that war is won.

text_original: It will not be a short or easy struggle, no single weapon or strategy will suffice, but we shall not rest until that war is won.
text_preceding: But by closing down obsolete installations, by curtailing less urgent programs, by cutting back where cutting back seems to be wise, by insisting on a dollar's worth for a dollar spent, I am able to recommend in this reduced budget the most Federal support in history for education, for health, for retraining the unemployed, and for helping the economically and the physically handicapped.
text_following: This budget, and this year's legislative program, are designed to help each and every American citizen fulfill his basic hopes--his hopes for a fair chance to make good;

text_original: This budget, and this year's legislative program, are designed to help each and every American citizen fulfill his basic hopes--his hopes for a fair chance to make good;
text_preceding: It will not be a short or easy struggle, no single weapon or strategy will suffice, but we shall not rest until that war is won.
text_following: The richest Nation on earth can afford to win it.

text_original: The richest Nation on earth can afford to win it.
text_preceding: This budget, and this year's legislative program, are designed to help each and every American citizen fulfill his basic hopes--his hopes for a fair chance to make good;
text_following: One thousand dollars invested in salvaging an unemployable youth today can return $40,000 or more in his lifetime.

text_original: One thousand dollars invested in salvaging an unemployable youth today can return $40,000 or more in his lifetime.
text_preceding: The richest Nation on earth can afford to win it.
text_following: Poverty is a national problem, requiring improved national organization and support.

text_original: Poverty is a national problem, requiring improved national organization and support.
text_preceding: One thousand dollars invested in salvaging an unemployable youth today can return $40,000 or more in his lifetime.
text_following: But this attack, to be effective, must also be organized at the State and the local level and must be supported and directed by State and local efforts.

text_original: But this attack, to be effective, must also be organized at the State and the local level and must be supported and directed by State and local efforts.
text_preceding: Poverty is a national problem, requiring improved national organization and support.
text_following: For the war against poverty will not be won here in Washington.

text_original: For the war against poverty will not be won here in Washington.
text_preceding: But this attack, to be effective, must also be organized at the State and the local level and must be supported and directed by State and local efforts.
text_following: It must be won in the field, in every private home, in every public office, from the courthouse to the White House.

text_original: It must be won in the field, in every private home, in every public office, from the courthouse to the White House.
text_preceding: For the war against poverty will not be won here in Washington.
text_following: The program I shall propose will emphasize this cooperative approach to help that one-fifth of all American families with incomes too small to even meet their basic needs.

text_original: The program I shall propose will emphasize this cooperative approach to help that one-fifth of all American families with incomes too small to even meet their basic needs.
text_preceding: It must be won in the field, in every private home, in every public office, from the courthouse to the White House.
text_following: Our chief weapons in a more pinpointed attack will be better schools, and better health, and better homes, and better training, and better job opportunities to help more Americans, especially young Americans, escape from squalor and misery and unemployment rolls where other citizens help to carry them.

text_original: Our chief weapons in a more pinpointed attack will be better schools, and better health, and better homes, and better training, and better job opportunities to help more Americans, especially young Americans, escape from squalor and misery and unemployment rolls where other citizens help to carry them.
text_preceding: The program I shall propose will emphasize this cooperative approach to help that one-fifth of all American families with incomes too small to even meet their basic needs.
text_following: Very often a lack of jobs and money is not the cause of poverty, but the symptom.

text_original: Very often a lack of jobs and money is not the cause of poverty, but the symptom.
text_preceding: Our chief weapons in a more pinpointed attack will be better schools, and better health, and better homes, and better training, and better job opportunities to help more Americans, especially young Americans, escape from squalor and misery and unemployment rolls where other citizens help to carry them.
text_following: The cause may lie deeper--in our failure to give our fellow citizens a fair chance to develop their own capacities, in a lack of education and training, in a lack of medical care and housing, in a lack of decent communities in which to live and bring up their children.

text_original: The cause may lie deeper--in our failure to give our fellow citizens a fair chance to develop their own capacities, in a lack of education and training, in a lack of medical care and housing, in a lack of decent communities in which to live and bring up their children.
text_preceding: Very often a lack of jobs and money is not the cause of poverty, but the symptom.
text_following: But whatever the cause, our joint Federal-local effort must pursue poverty, pursue it wherever it exists--in city slums and small towns, in sharecropper shacks or in migrant worker camps, on Indian Reservations, among whites as well as Negroes, among the young as well as the aged, in the boom towns and in the depressed areas.

text_original: But whatever the cause, our joint Federal-local effort must pursue poverty, pursue it wherever it exists--in city slums and small towns, in sharecropper shacks or in migrant worker camps, on Indian Reservations, among whites as well as Negroes, among the young as well as the aged, in the boom towns and in the depressed areas.
text_preceding: The cause may lie deeper--in our failure to give our fellow citizens a fair chance to develop their own capacities, in a lack of education and training, in a lack of medical care and housing, in a lack of decent communities in which to live and bring up their children.
text_following: Our aim is not only to relieve the symptom of poverty, but to cure it and, above all, to prevent it.

text_original: Our aim is not only to relieve the symptom of poverty, but to cure it and, above all, to prevent it.
text_preceding: But whatever the cause, our joint Federal-local effort must pursue poverty, pursue it wherever it exists--in city slums and small towns, in sharecropper shacks or in migrant worker camps, on Indian Reservations, among whites as well as Negroes, among the young as well as the aged, in the boom towns and in the depressed areas.
text_following: No single piece of legislation, however, is going to suffice.

text_original: No single piece of legislation, however, is going to suffice.
text_preceding: Our aim is not only to relieve the symptom of poverty, but to cure it and, above all, to prevent it.
text_following: We will launch a special effort in the chronically distressed areas of Appalachia.

text_original: We will launch a special effort in the chronically distressed areas of Appalachia.
text_preceding: No single piece of legislation, however, is going to suffice.
text_following: We must expand our small but our successful area redevelopment program.

text_original: We must expand our small but our successful area redevelopment program.
text_preceding: We will launch a special effort in the chronically distressed areas of Appalachia.
text_following: We must enact youth employment legislation to put jobless, aimless, hopeless youngsters to work on useful projects.

text_original: We must enact youth employment legislation to put jobless, aimless, hopeless youngsters to work on useful projects.
text_preceding: We must expand our small but our successful area redevelopment program.
text_following: We must distribute more food to the needy through a broader food stamp program.

text_original: We must distribute more food to the needy through a broader food stamp program.
text_preceding: We must enact youth employment legislation to put jobless, aimless, hopeless youngsters to work on useful projects.
text_following: We must create a National Service Corps to help the economically handicapped of our own country as the Peace Corps now helps those abroad.

text_original: We must create a National Service Corps to help the economically handicapped of our own country as the Peace Corps now helps those abroad.
text_preceding: We must distribute more food to the needy through a broader food stamp program.
text_following: We must modernize our unemployment insurance and establish a high-level commission on automation.

text_original: We must modernize our unemployment insurance and establish a high-level commission on automation.
text_preceding: We must create a National Service Corps to help the economically handicapped of our own country as the Peace Corps now helps those abroad.
text_following: If we have the brain power to invent these machines, we have the brain power to make certain that they are a boon and not a bane to humanity.

text_original: If we have the brain power to invent these machines, we have the brain power to make certain that they are a boon and not a bane to humanity.
text_preceding: We must modernize our unemployment insurance and establish a high-level commission on automation.
text_following: We must extend the coverage of our minimum wage laws to more than 2 million workers now lacking this basic protection of purchasing power.

text_original: We must extend the coverage of our minimum wage laws to more than 2 million workers now lacking this basic protection of purchasing power.
text_preceding: If we have the brain power to invent these machines, we have the brain power to make certain that they are a boon and not a bane to humanity.
text_following: We must, by including special school aid funds as part of our education program, improve the quality of teaching, training, and counseling in our hardest hit areas.

text_original: We must, by including special school aid funds as part of our education program, improve the quality of teaching, training, and counseling in our hardest hit areas.
text_preceding: We must extend the coverage of our minimum wage laws to more than 2 million workers now lacking this basic protection of purchasing power.
text_following: We must build more libraries in every area and more hospitals and nursing homes under the Hill-Burton Act, and train more nurses to staff them.

text_original: We must build more libraries in every area and more hospitals and nursing homes under the Hill-Burton Act, and train more nurses to staff them.
text_preceding: We must, by including special school aid funds as part of our education program, improve the quality of teaching, training, and counseling in our hardest hit areas.
text_following: We must provide hospital insurance for our older citizens financed by every worker and his employer under Social Security, contributing no more than $1 a month during the employee's working career to protect him in his old age in a dignified manner without cost to the Treasury, against the devastating hardship of prolonged or repeated illness.

text_original: We must provide hospital insurance for our older citizens financed by every worker and his employer under Social Security, contributing no more than $1 a month during the employee's working career to protect him in his old age in a dignified manner without cost to the Treasury, against the devastating hardship of prolonged or repeated illness.
text_preceding: We must build more libraries in every area and more hospitals and nursing homes under the Hill-Burton Act, and train more nurses to staff them.
text_following: We must, as a part of a revised housing and urban renewal program, give more help to those displaced by slum clearance, provide more housing for our poor and our elderly, and seek as our ultimate goal in our free enterprise system a decent home for every American family.

text_original: We must, as a part of a revised housing and urban renewal program, give more help to those displaced by slum clearance, provide more housing for our poor and our elderly, and seek as our ultimate goal in our free enterprise system a decent home for every American family.
text_preceding: We must provide hospital insurance for our older citizens financed by every worker and his employer under Social Security, contributing no more than $1 a month during the employee's working career to protect him in his old age in a dignified manner without cost to the Treasury, against the devastating hardship of prolonged or repeated illness.
text_following: We must help obtain more modern mass transit within our communities as well as low-cost transportation between them.

text_original: We must help obtain more modern mass transit within our communities as well as low-cost transportation between them.
text_preceding: We must, as a part of a revised housing and urban renewal program, give more help to those displaced by slum clearance, provide more housing for our poor and our elderly, and seek as our ultimate goal in our free enterprise system a decent home for every American family.
text_following: Above all, we must release $11 billion of tax reduction into the private spending stream to create new jobs and new markets in every area of this land.

text_original: Above all, we must release $11 billion of tax reduction into the private spending stream to create new jobs and new markets in every area of this land.
text_preceding: We must help obtain more modern mass transit within our communities as well as low-cost transportation between them.
text_following: These programs are obviously not for the poor or the underprivileged alone.

text_original: These programs are obviously not for the poor or the underprivileged alone.
text_preceding: Above all, we must release $11 billion of tax reduction into the private spending stream to create new jobs and new markets in every area of this land.
text_following: Every American will benefit by the extension of social security to cover the hospital costs of their aged parents.

text_original: Every American will benefit by the extension of social security to cover the hospital costs of their aged parents.
text_preceding: These programs are obviously not for the poor or the underprivileged alone.
text_following: Every American community will benefit from the construction or modernization of schools, libraries, hospitals, and nursing homes, from the training of more nurses and from the improvement of urban renewal in public transit.

text_original: Every American community will benefit from the construction or modernization of schools, libraries, hospitals, and nursing homes, from the training of more nurses and from the improvement of urban renewal in public transit.
text_preceding: Every American will benefit by the extension of social security to cover the hospital costs of their aged parents.
text_following: And every individual American taxpayer and every corporate taxpayer will benefit from the earliest possible passage of the pending tax bill from both the new investment it will bring and the new jobs that it will create.

text_original: And every individual American taxpayer and every corporate taxpayer will benefit from the earliest possible passage of the pending tax bill from both the new investment it will bring and the new jobs that it will create.
text_preceding: Every American community will benefit from the construction or modernization of schools, libraries, hospitals, and nursing homes, from the training of more nurses and from the improvement of urban renewal in public transit.
text_following: That tax bill has been thoroughly discussed for a year.

text_original: That tax bill has been thoroughly discussed for a year.
text_preceding: And every individual American taxpayer and every corporate taxpayer will benefit from the earliest possible passage of the pending tax bill from both the new investment it will bring and the new jobs that it will create.
text_following: The new budget clearly allows it.

text_original: The new budget clearly allows it.
text_preceding: That tax bill has been thoroughly discussed for a year.
text_following: Our taxpayers surely deserve it.

text_original: Our taxpayers surely deserve it.
text_preceding: The new budget clearly allows it.
text_following: Our economy strongly demands it.

text_original: Our economy strongly demands it.
text_preceding: Our taxpayers surely deserve it.
text_following: And every month of delay dilutes its benefits in 1964 for consumption, for investment, and for employment.

text_original: And every month of delay dilutes its benefits in 1964 for consumption, for investment, and for employment.
text_preceding: Our economy strongly demands it.
text_following: For until the bill is signed, its investment incentives cannot be deemed certain, and the withholding rate cannot be reduced-- and the most damaging and devastating thing you can do to any businessman in America is to keep him in doubt and to keep him guessing on what our tax policy is.

text_original: For until the bill is signed, its investment incentives cannot be deemed certain, and the withholding rate cannot be reduced-- and the most damaging and devastating thing you can do to any businessman in America is to keep him in doubt and to keep him guessing on what our tax policy is.
text_preceding: And every month of delay dilutes its benefits in 1964 for consumption, for investment, and for employment.
text_following: And I say that we should now reduce to 14 percent instead of 15 percent our withholding rate.

text_original: And I say that we should now reduce to 14 percent instead of 15 percent our withholding rate.
text_preceding: For until the bill is signed, its investment incentives cannot be deemed certain, and the withholding rate cannot be reduced-- and the most damaging and devastating thing you can do to any businessman in America is to keep him in doubt and to keep him guessing on what our tax policy is.
text_following: I therefore urge the Congress to take final action on this bill by the first of February, if at all possible.

text_original: I therefore urge the Congress to take final action on this bill by the first of February, if at all possible.
text_preceding: And I say that we should now reduce to 14 percent instead of 15 percent our withholding rate.
text_following: For however proud we may be of the unprecedented progress of our free enterprise economy over the last 3 years, we should not and we cannot permit it to pause.

text_original: For however proud we may be of the unprecedented progress of our free enterprise economy over the last 3 years, we should not and we cannot permit it to pause.
text_preceding: I therefore urge the Congress to take final action on this bill by the first of February, if at all possible.
text_following: In 1963, for the first time in history, we crossed the 70 million job mark, but we will soon need more than 75 million jobs.

text_original: In 1963, for the first time in history, we crossed the 70 million job mark, but we will soon need more than 75 million jobs.
text_preceding: For however proud we may be of the unprecedented progress of our free enterprise economy over the last 3 years, we should not and we cannot permit it to pause.
text_following: In 1963 our gross national product reached the $600 billion level--$100 billion higher than when we took office.

text_original: In 1963 our gross national product reached the $600 billion level--$100 billion higher than when we took office.
text_preceding: In 1963, for the first time in history, we crossed the 70 million job mark, but we will soon need more than 75 million jobs.
text_following: But it easily could and it should be still $30 billion higher today than it is.

text_original: But it easily could and it should be still $30 billion higher today than it is.
text_preceding: In 1963 our gross national product reached the $600 billion level--$100 billion higher than when we took office.
text_following: Wages and profits and family income are also at their highest levels in history--but I would remind you that 4 million workers and 13 percent of our industrial capacity are still idle today.

text_original: Wages and profits and family income are also at their highest levels in history--but I would remind you that 4 million workers and 13 percent of our industrial capacity are still idle today.
text_preceding: But it easily could and it should be still $30 billion higher today than it is.
text_following: We need a tax cut now to keep this country moving.

text_original: We need a tax cut now to keep this country moving.
text_preceding: Wages and profits and family income are also at their highest levels in history--but I would remind you that 4 million workers and 13 percent of our industrial capacity are still idle today.
text_following: For our goal is not merely to spread the work.

text_original: For our goal is not merely to spread the work.
text_preceding: We need a tax cut now to keep this country moving.
text_following: Our goal is to create more jobs.

text_original: Our goal is to create more jobs.
text_preceding: For our goal is not merely to spread the work.
text_following: I believe the enactment of a 35-hour week would sharply increase costs, would invite inflation, would impair our ability to compete, and merely share instead of creating employment.

text_original: I believe the enactment of a 35-hour week would sharply increase costs, would invite inflation, would impair our ability to compete, and merely share instead of creating employment.
text_preceding: Our goal is to create more jobs.
text_following: But I am equally opposed to the 45- or 50-hour week in those industries where consistently excessive use of overtime causes increased unemployment.

text_original: But I am equally opposed to the 45- or 50-hour week in those industries where consistently excessive use of overtime causes increased unemployment.
text_preceding: I believe the enactment of a 35-hour week would sharply increase costs, would invite inflation, would impair our ability to compete, and merely share instead of creating employment.
text_following: So, therefore, I recommend legislation authorizing the creation of a tripartite industry committee to determine on an industry-by-industry basis as to where a higher penalty rate for overtime would increase job openings without unduly increasing costs, and authorizing the establishment of such higher rates.

text_original: So, therefore, I recommend legislation authorizing the creation of a tripartite industry committee to determine on an industry-by-industry basis as to where a higher penalty rate for overtime would increase job openings without unduly increasing costs, and authorizing the establishment of such higher rates.
text_preceding: But I am equally opposed to the 45- or 50-hour week in those industries where consistently excessive use of overtime causes increased unemployment.
text_following: Let me make one principle of this administration abundantly clear: All of these increased opportunities--in employment, in education, in housing, and in every field--must be open to Americans of every color.

text_original: Let me make one principle of this administration abundantly clear: All of these increased opportunities--in employment, in education, in housing, and in every field--must be open to Americans of every color.
text_preceding: So, therefore, I recommend legislation authorizing the creation of a tripartite industry committee to determine on an industry-by-industry basis as to where a higher penalty rate for overtime would increase job openings without unduly increasing costs, and authorizing the establishment of such higher rates.
text_following: As far as the writ of Federal law will run, we must abolish not some, but all racial discrimination.

text_original: As far as the writ of Federal law will run, we must abolish not some, but all racial discrimination.
text_preceding: Let me make one principle of this administration abundantly clear: All of these increased opportunities--in employment, in education, in housing, and in every field--must be open to Americans of every color.
text_following: For this is not merely an economic issue, or a social, political, or international issue.

text_original: For this is not merely an economic issue, or a social, political, or international issue.
text_preceding: As far as the writ of Federal law will run, we must abolish not some, but all racial discrimination.
text_following: It is a moral issue, and it must be met by the passage this session of the bill now pending in the House.

text_original: It is a moral issue, and it must be met by the passage this session of the bill now pending in the House.
text_preceding: For this is not merely an economic issue, or a social, political, or international issue.
text_following: All members of the public should have equal access to facilities open to the public.

text_original: All members of the public should have equal access to facilities open to the public.
text_preceding: It is a moral issue, and it must be met by the passage this session of the bill now pending in the House.
text_following: All members of the public should be equally eligible for Federal benefits that are financed by the public.

text_original: All members of the public should be equally eligible for Federal benefits that are financed by the public.
text_preceding: All members of the public should have equal access to facilities open to the public.
text_following: All members of the public should have an equal chance to vote for public officials and to send their children to good public schools and to contribute their talents to the public good.

text_original: All members of the public should have an equal chance to vote for public officials and to send their children to good public schools and to contribute their talents to the public good.
text_preceding: All members of the public should be equally eligible for Federal benefits that are financed by the public.
text_following: Today, Americans of all races stand side by side in Berlin and in Viet Nam.

text_original: Today, Americans of all races stand side by side in Berlin and in Viet Nam.
text_preceding: All members of the public should have an equal chance to vote for public officials and to send their children to good public schools and to contribute their talents to the public good.
text_following: They died side by side in Korea.

text_original: They died side by side in Korea.
text_preceding: Today, Americans of all races stand side by side in Berlin and in Viet Nam.
text_following: Surely they can work and eat and travel side by side in their own country.

text_original: Surely they can work and eat and travel side by side in their own country.
text_preceding: They died side by side in Korea.
text_following: We must also lift by legislation the bars of discrimination against those who seek entry into our country, particularly those who have much needed skills and those joining their families.

text_original: We must also lift by legislation the bars of discrimination against those who seek entry into our country, particularly those who have much needed skills and those joining their families.
text_preceding: Surely they can work and eat and travel side by side in their own country.
text_following: We must advance toward this goal in 1964 in at least 10 different ways, not as partisans, but as patriots.

text_original: We must advance toward this goal in 1964 in at least 10 different ways, not as partisans, but as patriots.
text_preceding: We must also lift by legislation the bars of discrimination against those who seek entry into our country, particularly those who have much needed skills and those joining their families.
text_following: First, we must maintain--and our reduced defense budget will maintain--that margin of military safety and superiority obtained through 3 years of steadily increasing both the quality and the quantity of our strategic, our conventional, and our anti-guerrilla forces.

text_original: First, we must maintain--and our reduced defense budget will maintain--that margin of military safety and superiority obtained through 3 years of steadily increasing both the quality and the quantity of our strategic, our conventional, and our anti-guerrilla forces.
text_preceding: We must advance toward this goal in 1964 in at least 10 different ways, not as partisans, but as patriots.
text_following: In 1964 we will be better prepared than ever before to defend the cause of freedom, whether it is threatened by outright aggression or by the infiltration practiced by those in Hanoi and Havana, who ship arms and men across international borders to foment insurrection.

text_original: In 1964 we will be better prepared than ever before to defend the cause of freedom, whether it is threatened by outright aggression or by the infiltration practiced by those in Hanoi and Havana, who ship arms and men across international borders to foment insurrection.
text_preceding: First, we must maintain--and our reduced defense budget will maintain--that margin of military safety and superiority obtained through 3 years of steadily increasing both the quality and the quantity of our strategic, our conventional, and our anti-guerrilla forces.
text_following: And we must continue to use that strength as John Kennedy used it in the Cuban crisis and for the test ban treaty--to demonstrate both the futility of nuclear war and the possibilities of lasting peace.

text_original: And we must continue to use that strength as John Kennedy used it in the Cuban crisis and for the test ban treaty--to demonstrate both the futility of nuclear war and the possibilities of lasting peace.
text_preceding: In 1964 we will be better prepared than ever before to defend the cause of freedom, whether it is threatened by outright aggression or by the infiltration practiced by those in Hanoi and Havana, who ship arms and men across international borders to foment insurrection.
text_following: Second, we must take new steps--and we shall make new proposals at Geneva--toward the control and the eventual abolition of arms.

text_original: Second, we must take new steps--and we shall make new proposals at Geneva--toward the control and the eventual abolition of arms.
text_preceding: And we must continue to use that strength as John Kennedy used it in the Cuban crisis and for the test ban treaty--to demonstrate both the futility of nuclear war and the possibilities of lasting peace.
text_following: Even in the absence of agreement, we must not stockpile arms beyond our needs or seek an excess of military power that could be provocative as well as wasteful.

text_original: Even in the absence of agreement, we must not stockpile arms beyond our needs or seek an excess of military power that could be provocative as well as wasteful.
text_preceding: Second, we must take new steps--and we shall make new proposals at Geneva--toward the control and the eventual abolition of arms.
text_following: It is in this spirit that in this fiscal year we are cutting back our production of enriched uranium by 25 percent.

text_original: It is in this spirit that in this fiscal year we are cutting back our production of enriched uranium by 25 percent.
text_preceding: Even in the absence of agreement, we must not stockpile arms beyond our needs or seek an excess of military power that could be provocative as well as wasteful.
text_following: We are shutting down four plutonium piles.

text_original: We are shutting down four plutonium piles.
text_preceding: It is in this spirit that in this fiscal year we are cutting back our production of enriched uranium by 25 percent.
text_following: We are closing many nonessential military installations.

text_original: We are closing many nonessential military installations.
text_preceding: We are shutting down four plutonium piles.
text_following: And it is in this spirit that we today call on our adversaries to do the same.

text_original: And it is in this spirit that we today call on our adversaries to do the same.
text_preceding: We are closing many nonessential military installations.
text_following: Third, we must make increased use of our food as an instrument of peace--making it available by sale or trade or loan or donation-- to hungry people in all nations which tell us of their needs and accept proper conditions of distribution.

text_original: Third, we must make increased use of our food as an instrument of peace--making it available by sale or trade or loan or donation-- to hungry people in all nations which tell us of their needs and accept proper conditions of distribution.
text_preceding: And it is in this spirit that we today call on our adversaries to do the same.
text_following: Fourth, we must assure our pre-eminence in the peaceful exploration of outer space, focusing on an expedition to the moon in this decade-- in cooperation with other powers if possible, alone if necessary.

text_original: Fourth, we must assure our pre-eminence in the peaceful exploration of outer space, focusing on an expedition to the moon in this decade-- in cooperation with other powers if possible, alone if necessary.
text_preceding: Third, we must make increased use of our food as an instrument of peace--making it available by sale or trade or loan or donation-- to hungry people in all nations which tell us of their needs and accept proper conditions of distribution.
text_following: Fifth, we must expand world trade.

text_original: Fifth, we must expand world trade.
text_preceding: Fourth, we must assure our pre-eminence in the peaceful exploration of outer space, focusing on an expedition to the moon in this decade-- in cooperation with other powers if possible, alone if necessary.
text_following: Having recognized in the Act of 1962 that we must buy as well as sell, we now expect our trading partners to recognize that we must sell as well as buy.

text_original: Having recognized in the Act of 1962 that we must buy as well as sell, we now expect our trading partners to recognize that we must sell as well as buy.
text_preceding: Fifth, we must expand world trade.
text_following: We are willing to give them competitive access to our market, asking only that they do the same for us.

text_original: We are willing to give them competitive access to our market, asking only that they do the same for us.
text_preceding: Having recognized in the Act of 1962 that we must buy as well as sell, we now expect our trading partners to recognize that we must sell as well as buy.
text_following: Sixth, we must continue, through such measures as the interest equalization tax, as well as the cooperation of other nations, our recent progress toward balancing our international accounts.

text_original: Sixth, we must continue, through such measures as the interest equalization tax, as well as the cooperation of other nations, our recent progress toward balancing our international accounts.
text_preceding: We are willing to give them competitive access to our market, asking only that they do the same for us.
text_following: This administration must and will preserve the present gold value of the dollar.

text_original: This administration must and will preserve the present gold value of the dollar.
text_preceding: Sixth, we must continue, through such measures as the interest equalization tax, as well as the cooperation of other nations, our recent progress toward balancing our international accounts.
text_following: Seventh, we must become better neighbors with the free states of the Americas, working with the councils of the OAS, with a stronger Alliance for Progress, and with all the men and women of this hemisphere who really believe in liberty and justice for all.

text_original: Seventh, we must become better neighbors with the free states of the Americas, working with the councils of the OAS, with a stronger Alliance for Progress, and with all the men and women of this hemisphere who really believe in liberty and justice for all.
text_preceding: This administration must and will preserve the present gold value of the dollar.
text_following: Eighth, we must strengthen the ability of free nations everywhere to develop their independence and raise their standard of living, and thereby frustrate those who prey on poverty and chaos.

text_original: Eighth, we must strengthen the ability of free nations everywhere to develop their independence and raise their standard of living, and thereby frustrate those who prey on poverty and chaos.
text_preceding: Seventh, we must become better neighbors with the free states of the Americas, working with the councils of the OAS, with a stronger Alliance for Progress, and with all the men and women of this hemisphere who really believe in liberty and justice for all.
text_following: To do this, the rich must help the poor--and we must do our part.

text_original: To do this, the rich must help the poor--and we must do our part.
text_preceding: Eighth, we must strengthen the ability of free nations everywhere to develop their independence and raise their standard of living, and thereby frustrate those who prey on poverty and chaos.
text_following: We must achieve a more rigorous administration of our development assistance, with larger roles for private investors, for other industrialized nations, and for international agencies and for the recipient nations themselves.

text_original: We must achieve a more rigorous administration of our development assistance, with larger roles for private investors, for other industrialized nations, and for international agencies and for the recipient nations themselves.
text_preceding: To do this, the rich must help the poor--and we must do our part.
text_following: Ninth, we must strengthen our Atlantic and Pacific partnerships, maintain our alliances and make the United Nations a more effective instrument for national independence and international order.

text_original: Ninth, we must strengthen our Atlantic and Pacific partnerships, maintain our alliances and make the United Nations a more effective instrument for national independence and international order.
text_preceding: We must achieve a more rigorous administration of our development assistance, with larger roles for private investors, for other industrialized nations, and for international agencies and for the recipient nations themselves.
text_following: Tenth, and finally, we must develop with our allies new means of bridging the gap between the East and the West, facing danger boldly wherever danger exists, but being equally bold in our search for new agreements which can enlarge the hopes of all, while violating the interests of none.

text_original: Tenth, and finally, we must develop with our allies new means of bridging the gap between the East and the West, facing danger boldly wherever danger exists, but being equally bold in our search for new agreements which can enlarge the hopes of all, while violating the interests of none.
text_preceding: Ninth, we must strengthen our Atlantic and Pacific partnerships, maintain our alliances and make the United Nations a more effective instrument for national independence and international order.
text_following: In short, I would say to the Congress that we must be constantly prepared for the worst, and constantly acting for the best.

text_original: In short, I would say to the Congress that we must be constantly prepared for the worst, and constantly acting for the best.
text_preceding: Tenth, and finally, we must develop with our allies new means of bridging the gap between the East and the West, facing danger boldly wherever danger exists, but being equally bold in our search for new agreements which can enlarge the hopes of all, while violating the interests of none.
text_following: We must be strong enough to win any war, and we must be wise enough to prevent one.

text_original: We must be strong enough to win any war, and we must be wise enough to prevent one.
text_preceding: In short, I would say to the Congress that we must be constantly prepared for the worst, and constantly acting for the best.
text_following: We shall neither act as aggressors nor tolerate acts of aggression.

text_original: We shall neither act as aggressors nor tolerate acts of aggression.
text_preceding: We must be strong enough to win any war, and we must be wise enough to prevent one.
text_following: We intend to bury no one, and we do not intend to be buried.

text_original: We intend to bury no one, and we do not intend to be buried.
text_preceding: We shall neither act as aggressors nor tolerate acts of aggression.
text_following: We can fight, if we must, as we have fought before, but we pray that we will never have to fight again.
