text_original: We can fight, if we must, as we have fought before, but we pray that we will never have to fight again.
text_preceding: We intend to bury no one, and we do not intend to be buried.
text_following: My good friends and my fellow Americans: In these last 7 sorrowful weeks, we have learned anew that nothing is so enduring as faith, and nothing is so degrading as hate.

text_original: My good friends and my fellow Americans: In these last 7 sorrowful weeks, we have learned anew that nothing is so enduring as faith, and nothing is so degrading as hate.
text_preceding: We can fight, if we must, as we have fought before, but we pray that we will never have to fight again.
text_following: John Kennedy was a victim of hate, but he was also a great builder of faith--faith in our fellow Americans, whatever their creed or their color or their station in life; faith in the future of man, whatever his divisions and differences.

text_original: John Kennedy was a victim of hate, but he was also a great builder of faith--faith in our fellow Americans, whatever their creed or their color or their station in life; faith in the future of man, whatever his divisions and differences.
text_preceding: My good friends and my fellow Americans: In these last 7 sorrowful weeks, we have learned anew that nothing is so enduring as faith, and nothing is so degrading as hate.
text_following: This faith was echoed in all parts of the world.

text_original: This faith was echoed in all parts of the world.
text_preceding: John Kennedy was a victim of hate, but he was also a great builder of faith--faith in our fellow Americans, whatever their creed or their color or their station in life; faith in the future of man, whatever his divisions and differences.
text_following: On every continent and in every land to which Mrs.Johnson and I traveled, we found faith and hope and love toward this land of America and toward our people.

text_original: On every continent and in every land to which Mrs.Johnson and I traveled, we found faith and hope and love toward this land of America and toward our people.
text_preceding: This faith was echoed in all parts of the world.
text_following: So I ask you now in the Congress and in the country to join with me in expressing and fulfilling that faith in working for a nation, a nation that is free from want and a world that is free from hate--a world of peace and justice, and freedom and abundance, for our time and for all time to come.

text_original: So I ask you now in the Congress and in the country to join with me in expressing and fulfilling that faith in working for a nation, a nation that is free from want and a world that is free from hate--a world of peace and justice, and freedom and abundance, for our time and for all time to come.
text_preceding: On every continent and in every land to which Mrs.Johnson and I traveled, we found faith and hope and love toward this land of America and toward our people.

text_original: On this Hill which was my home, I am stirred by old friendships.
text_following: Though total agreement between the Executive and the Congress is impossible, total respect is important.

text_original: Though total agreement between the Executive and the Congress is impossible, total respect is important.
text_preceding: On this Hill which was my home, I am stirred by old friendships.
text_following: I am proud to be among my colleagues of the Congress whose legacy to their trust is their loyalty to their Nation.

text_original: I am proud to be among my colleagues of the Congress whose legacy to their trust is their loyalty to their Nation.
text_preceding: Though total agreement between the Executive and the Congress is impossible, total respect is important.
text_following: I am not unaware of the inner emotions of the new Members of this body tonight.

text_original: I am not unaware of the inner emotions of the new Members of this body tonight.
text_preceding: I am proud to be among my colleagues of the Congress whose legacy to their trust is their loyalty to their Nation.
text_following: Twenty-eight years ago, I felt as you do now.

text_original: Twenty-eight years ago, I felt as you do now.
text_preceding: I am not unaware of the inner emotions of the new Members of this body tonight.
text_following: You will soon learn that you are among men whose first love is their country, men who try each day to do as best they can what they believe is right.

text_original: You will soon learn that you are among men whose first love is their country, men who try each day to do as best they can what they believe is right.
text_preceding: Twenty-eight years ago, I felt as you do now.
text_following: We are entering the third century of the pursuit of American union.

text_original: We are entering the third century of the pursuit of American union.
text_preceding: You will soon learn that you are among men whose first love is their country, men who try each day to do as best they can what they believe is right.
text_following: Two hundred years ago, in 1765, nine assembled colonies first joined together to demand freedom from arbitrary power.

text_original: Two hundred years ago, in 1765, nine assembled colonies first joined together to demand freedom from arbitrary power.
text_preceding: We are entering the third century of the pursuit of American union.
text_following: For the first century we struggled to hold together the first continental union of democracy in the history of man.

text_original: For the first century we struggled to hold together the first continental union of democracy in the history of man.
text_preceding: Two hundred years ago, in 1765, nine assembled colonies first joined together to demand freedom from arbitrary power.
text_following: One hundred years ago, in 1865, following a terrible test of blood and fire, the compact of union was finally sealed.

text_original: One hundred years ago, in 1865, following a terrible test of blood and fire, the compact of union was finally sealed.
text_preceding: For the first century we struggled to hold together the first continental union of democracy in the history of man.
text_following: For a second century we labored to establish a unity of purpose and interest among the many groups which make up the American community.

text_original: For a second century we labored to establish a unity of purpose and interest among the many groups which make up the American community.
text_preceding: One hundred years ago, in 1865, following a terrible test of blood and fire, the compact of union was finally sealed.
text_following: That struggle has often brought pain and violence.

text_original: That struggle has often brought pain and violence.
text_preceding: For a second century we labored to establish a unity of purpose and interest among the many groups which make up the American community.
text_following: But we have achieved a unity of interest among our people that is unmatched in the history of freedom.

text_original: But we have achieved a unity of interest among our people that is unmatched in the history of freedom.
text_preceding: That struggle has often brought pain and violence.
text_following: And so tonight, now, in 1965, we begin a new quest for union.

text_original: And so tonight, now, in 1965, we begin a new quest for union.
text_preceding: But we have achieved a unity of interest among our people that is unmatched in the history of freedom.
text_following: We seek the unity of man with the world that he has built--with the knowledge that can save or destroy him--with the cities which can stimulate or stifle him--with the wealth and the machines which can enrich or menace his spirit.

text_original: We seek the unity of man with the world that he has built--with the knowledge that can save or destroy him--with the cities which can stimulate or stifle him--with the wealth and the machines which can enrich or menace his spirit.
text_preceding: And so tonight, now, in 1965, we begin a new quest for union.
text_following: We seek to establish a harmony between man and society which will allow each of us to enlarge the meaning of his life and all of us to elevate the quality of our civilization.

text_original: We seek to establish a harmony between man and society which will allow each of us to enlarge the meaning of his life and all of us to elevate the quality of our civilization.
text_preceding: We seek the unity of man with the world that he has built--with the knowledge that can save or destroy him--with the cities which can stimulate or stifle him--with the wealth and the machines which can enrich or menace his spirit.
text_following: This is the search that we begin tonight.

text_original: This is the search that we begin tonight.
text_preceding: We seek to establish a harmony between man and society which will allow each of us to enlarge the meaning of his life and all of us to elevate the quality of our civilization.
text_following: State of the World: But the unity we seek cannot realize its full promise in isolation.

text_original: State of the World: But the unity we seek cannot realize its full promise in isolation.
text_preceding: This is the search that we begin tonight.
text_following: For today the state of the Union depends, in large measure, upon the state of the world.

text_original: For today the state of the Union depends, in large measure, upon the state of the world.
text_preceding: State of the World: But the unity we seek cannot realize its full promise in isolation.
text_following: Our concern and interest, compassion and vigilance, extend to every corner of a dwindling planet.

text_original: Our concern and interest, compassion and vigilance, extend to every corner of a dwindling planet.
text_preceding: For today the state of the Union depends, in large measure, upon the state of the world.
text_following: Yet, it is not merely our concern but the concern of all free men.

text_original: Yet, it is not merely our concern but the concern of all free men.
text_preceding: Our concern and interest, compassion and vigilance, extend to every corner of a dwindling planet.
text_following: We will not, and we should not, assume that it is the task of Americans alone to settle all the conflicts of a torn and troubled world.

text_original: We will not, and we should not, assume that it is the task of Americans alone to settle all the conflicts of a torn and troubled world.
text_preceding: Yet, it is not merely our concern but the concern of all free men.
text_following: Let the foes of freedom take no comfort from this.

text_original: Let the foes of freedom take no comfort from this.
text_preceding: We will not, and we should not, assume that it is the task of Americans alone to settle all the conflicts of a torn and troubled world.
text_following: For in concert with other nations, we shall help men defend their freedom.

text_original: For in concert with other nations, we shall help men defend their freedom.
text_preceding: Let the foes of freedom take no comfort from this.
text_following: Our first aim remains the safety and the well-being of our own country.

text_original: Our first aim remains the safety and the well-being of our own country.
text_preceding: For in concert with other nations, we shall help men defend their freedom.
text_following: We are prepared to live as good neighbors with all, but we cannot be indifferent to acts designed to injure our interests, or our citizens, or our establishments abroad.

text_original: We are prepared to live as good neighbors with all, but we cannot be indifferent to acts designed to injure our interests, or our citizens, or our establishments abroad.
text_preceding: Our first aim remains the safety and the well-being of our own country.
text_following: The community of nations requires mutual respect.

text_original: The community of nations requires mutual respect.
text_preceding: We are prepared to live as good neighbors with all, but we cannot be indifferent to acts designed to injure our interests, or our citizens, or our establishments abroad.
text_following: We shall extend it--and we shall expect it.

text_original: We shall extend it--and we shall expect it.
text_preceding: The community of nations requires mutual respect.
text_following: I intend to ask for nothing that is not clearly right and to submit to nothing that is wrong.

text_original: I intend to ask for nothing that is not clearly right and to submit to nothing that is wrong.
text_preceding: We shall extend it--and we shall expect it.
text_following: And he promised, that the honor of my country shall never be stained by an apology from me for the statement of truth or for the performance of duty.

text_original: And he promised, that the honor of my country shall never be stained by an apology from me for the statement of truth or for the performance of duty.
text_preceding: I intend to ask for nothing that is not clearly right and to submit to nothing that is wrong.
text_following: That was this Nation's policy in the 1830's and that is this Nation's policy in the 1960's.

text_original: That was this Nation's policy in the 1830's and that is this Nation's policy in the 1960's.
text_preceding: And he promised, that the honor of my country shall never be stained by an apology from me for the statement of truth or for the performance of duty.
text_following: Our own freedom and growth have never been the final goal of the American dream.

text_original: Our own freedom and growth have never been the final goal of the American dream.
text_preceding: That was this Nation's policy in the 1830's and that is this Nation's policy in the 1960's.
text_following: We were never meant to be an oasis of liberty and abundance in a worldwide desert of disappointed dreams.

text_original: We were never meant to be an oasis of liberty and abundance in a worldwide desert of disappointed dreams.
text_preceding: Our own freedom and growth have never been the final goal of the American dream.
text_following: Our Nation was created to help strike away the chains of ignorance and misery and tyranny wherever they keep man less than God means him to be.

text_original: Our Nation was created to help strike away the chains of ignorance and misery and tyranny wherever they keep man less than God means him to be.
text_preceding: We were never meant to be an oasis of liberty and abundance in a worldwide desert of disappointed dreams.
text_following: We are moving toward that destiny, never more rapidly than we have moved in the last 4 years.

text_original: We are moving toward that destiny, never more rapidly than we have moved in the last 4 years.
text_preceding: Our Nation was created to help strike away the chains of ignorance and misery and tyranny wherever they keep man less than God means him to be.
text_following: In this period we have built a military power strong enough to meet any threat and destroy any adversary.

text_original: In this period we have built a military power strong enough to meet any threat and destroy any adversary.
text_preceding: We are moving toward that destiny, never more rapidly than we have moved in the last 4 years.
text_following: And that superiority will continue to grow so long as this office is mine--and you sit on Capitol Hill.

text_original: And that superiority will continue to grow so long as this office is mine--and you sit on Capitol Hill.
text_preceding: In this period we have built a military power strong enough to meet any threat and destroy any adversary.
text_following: In this period no new nation has become Communist, and the unity of the Communist empire has begun to crumble.

text_original: In this period no new nation has become Communist, and the unity of the Communist empire has begun to crumble.
text_preceding: And that superiority will continue to grow so long as this office is mine--and you sit on Capitol Hill.
text_following: In this period we have resolved in friendship our disputes with our neighbors of the hemisphere, and joined in an Alliance for Progress toward economic growth and political democracy.

text_original: In this period we have resolved in friendship our disputes with our neighbors of the hemisphere, and joined in an Alliance for Progress toward economic growth and political democracy.
text_preceding: In this period no new nation has become Communist, and the unity of the Communist empire has begun to crumble.
text_following: In this period we have taken more steps toward peace--including the test ban treaty--than at any time since the cold war began.

text_original: In this period we have taken more steps toward peace--including the test ban treaty--than at any time since the cold war began.
text_preceding: In this period we have resolved in friendship our disputes with our neighbors of the hemisphere, and joined in an Alliance for Progress toward economic growth and political democracy.
text_following: In this period we have relentlessly pursued our advances toward the conquest of space.

text_original: In this period we have relentlessly pursued our advances toward the conquest of space.
text_preceding: In this period we have taken more steps toward peace--including the test ban treaty--than at any time since the cold war began.
text_following: Most important of all, in this period, the United States has reemerged into the fullness of its self-confidence and purpose.

text_original: Most important of all, in this period, the United States has reemerged into the fullness of its self-confidence and purpose.
text_preceding: In this period we have relentlessly pursued our advances toward the conquest of space.
text_following: No longer are we called upon to get America moving.

text_original: No longer are we called upon to get America moving.
text_preceding: Most important of all, in this period, the United States has reemerged into the fullness of its self-confidence and purpose.
text_following: No longer do we doubt our strength or resolution.

text_original: No longer do we doubt our strength or resolution.
text_preceding: No longer are we called upon to get America moving.
text_following: We are strong and we have proven our resolve.

text_original: We are strong and we have proven our resolve.
text_preceding: No longer do we doubt our strength or resolution.
text_following: No longer can anyone wonder whether we are in the grip of historical decay.

text_original: No longer can anyone wonder whether we are in the grip of historical decay.
text_preceding: We are strong and we have proven our resolve.
text_following: We know that history is ours to make.

text_original: We know that history is ours to make.
text_preceding: No longer can anyone wonder whether we are in the grip of historical decay.
text_following: And if there is great danger, there is now also the excitement of great expectations.

text_original: And if there is great danger, there is now also the excitement of great expectations.
text_preceding: We know that history is ours to make.
text_following: America and the communist nations:Yet we still live in a troubled and perilous world.

text_original: America and the communist nations:Yet we still live in a troubled and perilous world.
text_preceding: And if there is great danger, there is now also the excitement of great expectations.
text_following: There is no longer a single threat.

text_original: There is no longer a single threat.
text_preceding: America and the communist nations:Yet we still live in a troubled and perilous world.
text_following: They differ in intensity and in danger.

text_original: They differ in intensity and in danger.
text_preceding: There is no longer a single threat.
text_following: They require different attitudes and different answers.

text_original: They require different attitudes and different answers.
text_preceding: They differ in intensity and in danger.
text_following: With the Soviet Union we seek peaceful understandings that can lessen the danger to freedom.

text_original: With the Soviet Union we seek peaceful understandings that can lessen the danger to freedom.
text_preceding: They require different attitudes and different answers.
text_following: Last fall I asked the American people to choose that course.

text_original: Last fall I asked the American people to choose that course.
text_preceding: With the Soviet Union we seek peaceful understandings that can lessen the danger to freedom.
text_following: I will carry forward their command.

text_original: I will carry forward their command.
text_preceding: Last fall I asked the American people to choose that course.
text_following: If we are to live together in peace, we must come to know each other better.

text_original: If we are to live together in peace, we must come to know each other better.
text_preceding: I will carry forward their command.
text_following: I am sure that the American people would welcome a chance to listen to the Soviet leaders on our television--as I would like the Soviet people to hear our leaders on theirs.

text_original: I am sure that the American people would welcome a chance to listen to the Soviet leaders on our television--as I would like the Soviet people to hear our leaders on theirs.
text_preceding: If we are to live together in peace, we must come to know each other better.
text_following: I hope the new Soviet leaders can visit America so they can learn about our country at firsthand.

text_original: I hope the new Soviet leaders can visit America so they can learn about our country at firsthand.
