text_original: I hope those debates will be marked by new proposals and by a seriousness that matches the gravity of the questions themselves.
text_preceding: Therefore, each of them should be-and doubtless will be-debated by candidates for public office this year.
text_following: These are not appropriate subjects for narrow partisan oratory.

text_original: These are not appropriate subjects for narrow partisan oratory.
text_preceding: I hope those debates will be marked by new proposals and by a seriousness that matches the gravity of the questions themselves.
text_following: They go to the heart of what we Americans are all about-all of us, Democrats and Republicans.

text_original: They go to the heart of what we Americans are all about-all of us, Democrats and Republicans.
text_preceding: These are not appropriate subjects for narrow partisan oratory.
text_following: Tonight I have spoken of some of the goals I should like to see America reach.

text_original: Tonight I have spoken of some of the goals I should like to see America reach.
text_preceding: They go to the heart of what we Americans are all about-all of us, Democrats and Republicans.
text_following: Many of them can be achieved this year- others by the time we celebrate our Nation's 200th birthday-the bicentennial of our independence.

text_original: Many of them can be achieved this year- others by the time we celebrate our Nation's 200th birthday-the bicentennial of our independence.
text_preceding: Tonight I have spoken of some of the goals I should like to see America reach.
text_following: Several of these goals are going to be very hard to reach.

text_original: Several of these goals are going to be very hard to reach.
text_preceding: Many of them can be achieved this year- others by the time we celebrate our Nation's 200th birthday-the bicentennial of our independence.
text_following: But the State of our Union will be much stronger 8 years from now on our 200th birthday if we resolve to reach these goals now.

text_original: But the State of our Union will be much stronger 8 years from now on our 200th birthday if we resolve to reach these goals now.
text_preceding: Several of these goals are going to be very hard to reach.
text_following: They are more important-much more important-than the identity of the party or the President who will then be in office.

text_original: They are more important-much more important-than the identity of the party or the President who will then be in office.
text_preceding: But the State of our Union will be much stronger 8 years from now on our 200th birthday if we resolve to reach these goals now.
text_following: These goals are what the fighting and our alliances are really meant to protect.

text_original: These goals are what the fighting and our alliances are really meant to protect.
text_preceding: They are more important-much more important-than the identity of the party or the President who will then be in office.
text_following: If ever there was a people who sought more than mere abundance, it is our people.

text_original: If ever there was a people who sought more than mere abundance, it is our people.
text_preceding: These goals are what the fighting and our alliances are really meant to protect.
text_following: If ever there was a nation that was capable of solving its problems, it is this Nation.

text_original: If ever there was a nation that was capable of solving its problems, it is this Nation.
text_preceding: If ever there was a people who sought more than mere abundance, it is our people.
text_following: If ever there were a time to know the pride and the excitement and the hope of being an American-it is this time.

text_original: If ever there were a time to know the pride and the excitement and the hope of being an American-it is this time.
text_preceding: If ever there was a nation that was capable of solving its problems, it is this Nation.
text_following: So this, my friends, is the State of our Union: seeking, building, tested many times in this past year-and always equal to the test.

text_original: So this, my friends, is the State of our Union: seeking, building, tested many times in this past year-and always equal to the test.
text_preceding: If ever there were a time to know the pride and the excitement and the hope of being an American-it is this time.

text_original: The traditional form of the President's annual report giving to the Congress Information of the State of the Union is a single message or address.
text_following: As the affairs and concerns of our Union have multiplied over the years, however, so too have the subjects that require discussion in State of the Union Messages.

text_original: As the affairs and concerns of our Union have multiplied over the years, however, so too have the subjects that require discussion in State of the Union Messages.
text_preceding: The traditional form of the President's annual report giving to the Congress Information of the State of the Union is a single message or address.
text_following: This year in particular, with so many changes in Government programs under consideration--and with our very philosophy about the relationship between the individual and the State at an historic crossroads--a single, all-embracing State of the Union Message would not appear to be adequate.

text_original: This year in particular, with so many changes in Government programs under consideration--and with our very philosophy about the relationship between the individual and the State at an historic crossroads--a single, all-embracing State of the Union Message would not appear to be adequate.
text_preceding: As the affairs and concerns of our Union have multiplied over the years, however, so too have the subjects that require discussion in State of the Union Messages.
text_following: I have therefore decided to present my 1973 State of the Union report in the form of a series of messages during these early weeks of the 93rd Congress.

text_original: I have therefore decided to present my 1973 State of the Union report in the form of a series of messages during these early weeks of the 93rd Congress.
text_preceding: This year in particular, with so many changes in Government programs under consideration--and with our very philosophy about the relationship between the individual and the State at an historic crossroads--a single, all-embracing State of the Union Message would not appear to be adequate.
text_following: The purpose of this first message in the series is to give a concise overview of where we stand as a people today, and to outline some of the general goals that I believe we should pursue over the next year and beyond.

text_original: The purpose of this first message in the series is to give a concise overview of where we stand as a people today, and to outline some of the general goals that I believe we should pursue over the next year and beyond.
text_preceding: I have therefore decided to present my 1973 State of the Union report in the form of a series of messages during these early weeks of the 93rd Congress.
text_following: In coming weeks, I will send to the Congress further State of the Union reports on specific areas of policy including economic affairs, natural resources, human resources, community development and foreign and defense policy.

text_original: In coming weeks, I will send to the Congress further State of the Union reports on specific areas of policy including economic affairs, natural resources, human resources, community development and foreign and defense policy.
text_preceding: The purpose of this first message in the series is to give a concise overview of where we stand as a people today, and to outline some of the general goals that I believe we should pursue over the next year and beyond.
text_following: The new course these messages will outline represents a fresh approach to Government: an approach that addresses the realities of the 1970s, not those of the 1930s or of the 1960s.

text_original: The new course these messages will outline represents a fresh approach to Government: an approach that addresses the realities of the 1970s, not those of the 1930s or of the 1960s.
text_preceding: In coming weeks, I will send to the Congress further State of the Union reports on specific areas of policy including economic affairs, natural resources, human resources, community development and foreign and defense policy.
text_following: The role of the Federal Government as we approach our third century of independence should not be to dominate any facet of American life, but rather to aid and encourage people, communities and institutions to deal with as many of the difficulties and challenges facing them as possible, and to help see to it that every American has a full and equal opportunity to realize his or her potential.

text_original: The role of the Federal Government as we approach our third century of independence should not be to dominate any facet of American life, but rather to aid and encourage people, communities and institutions to deal with as many of the difficulties and challenges facing them as possible, and to help see to it that every American has a full and equal opportunity to realize his or her potential.
text_preceding: The new course these messages will outline represents a fresh approach to Government: an approach that addresses the realities of the 1970s, not those of the 1930s or of the 1960s.
text_following: If we were to continue to expand the Federal Government at the rate of the past several decades, it soon would consume us entirely.

text_original: If we were to continue to expand the Federal Government at the rate of the past several decades, it soon would consume us entirely.
text_preceding: The role of the Federal Government as we approach our third century of independence should not be to dominate any facet of American life, but rather to aid and encourage people, communities and institutions to deal with as many of the difficulties and challenges facing them as possible, and to help see to it that every American has a full and equal opportunity to realize his or her potential.
text_following: The time has come when we must make clear choices-- choices between old programs that set worthy goals but failed to reach them and new programs that provide a better way to realize those goals;

text_original: The time has come when we must make clear choices-- choices between old programs that set worthy goals but failed to reach them and new programs that provide a better way to realize those goals;
text_preceding: If we were to continue to expand the Federal Government at the rate of the past several decades, it soon would consume us entirely.
text_following: and choices, too, between competing programs--all of which may be desirable in themselves but only some of which we can afford with the finite resources at our command.

text_original: and choices, too, between competing programs--all of which may be desirable in themselves but only some of which we can afford with the finite resources at our command.
text_preceding: The time has come when we must make clear choices-- choices between old programs that set worthy goals but failed to reach them and new programs that provide a better way to realize those goals;
text_following: Because our resources are not infinite, we also face a critical choice in 1973 between holding the line in Government spending and adopting expensive programs which will surely force up taxes and refuel inflation.

text_original: Because our resources are not infinite, we also face a critical choice in 1973 between holding the line in Government spending and adopting expensive programs which will surely force up taxes and refuel inflation.
text_preceding: and choices, too, between competing programs--all of which may be desirable in themselves but only some of which we can afford with the finite resources at our command.
text_following: Finally, it is vital at this time that we restore a greater sense of responsibility at the State and local level, and among individual Americans.

text_original: Finally, it is vital at this time that we restore a greater sense of responsibility at the State and local level, and among individual Americans.
text_preceding: Because our resources are not infinite, we also face a critical choice in 1973 between holding the line in Government spending and adopting expensive programs which will surely force up taxes and refuel inflation.
text_following: WHERE WE STAND: The basic state of our Union today is sound, and full of promise.

text_original: WHERE WE STAND: The basic state of our Union today is sound, and full of promise.
text_preceding: Finally, it is vital at this time that we restore a greater sense of responsibility at the State and local level, and among individual Americans.
text_following: We enter 1973 economically strong, militarily secure and, most important of all, at peace after a long and trying war.

text_original: We enter 1973 economically strong, militarily secure and, most important of all, at peace after a long and trying war.
text_preceding: WHERE WE STAND: The basic state of our Union today is sound, and full of promise.
text_following: America continues to provide a better and more abundant life for more of its people than any other nation in the world.

text_original: America continues to provide a better and more abundant life for more of its people than any other nation in the world.
text_preceding: We enter 1973 economically strong, militarily secure and, most important of all, at peace after a long and trying war.
text_following: We have passed through one of the most difficult periods in our history without surrendering to despair and without dishonoring our ideals as a people.

text_original: We have passed through one of the most difficult periods in our history without surrendering to despair and without dishonoring our ideals as a people.
text_preceding: America continues to provide a better and more abundant life for more of its people than any other nation in the world.
text_following: Looking back, there is a lesson in all this for all of us.

text_original: Looking back, there is a lesson in all this for all of us.
text_preceding: We have passed through one of the most difficult periods in our history without surrendering to despair and without dishonoring our ideals as a people.
text_following: The lesson is one that we sometimes had to learn the hard way over the past few years.

text_original: The lesson is one that we sometimes had to learn the hard way over the past few years.
text_preceding: Looking back, there is a lesson in all this for all of us.
text_following: That lesson is that even potentially destructive forces can be converted into positive forces when we know how to channel them, and when we use common sense and common decency to create a climate of mutual respect and goodwill.

text_original: That lesson is that even potentially destructive forces can be converted into positive forces when we know how to channel them, and when we use common sense and common decency to create a climate of mutual respect and goodwill.
text_preceding: The lesson is one that we sometimes had to learn the hard way over the past few years.
text_following: By working together and harnessing the forces of nature, Americans have unlocked some of the great mysteries of the universe.

text_original: By working together and harnessing the forces of nature, Americans have unlocked some of the great mysteries of the universe.
text_preceding: That lesson is that even potentially destructive forces can be converted into positive forces when we know how to channel them, and when we use common sense and common decency to create a climate of mutual respect and goodwill.
text_following: Men have walked the surface of the moon and soared to new heights of discovery.

text_original: Men have walked the surface of the moon and soared to new heights of discovery.
text_preceding: By working together and harnessing the forces of nature, Americans have unlocked some of the great mysteries of the universe.
text_following: This same spirit of discovery is helping us to conquer disease and suffering that have plagued our own planet since the dawn of time.

text_original: This same spirit of discovery is helping us to conquer disease and suffering that have plagued our own planet since the dawn of time.
text_preceding: Men have walked the surface of the moon and soared to new heights of discovery.
text_following: By working together with the leaders of other nations, we have been able to build a new hope for lasting peace--for a structure of world order in which common interest outweighs old animosities, and in which a new generation of the human family can grow up at peace in a changing world.

text_original: By working together with the leaders of other nations, we have been able to build a new hope for lasting peace--for a structure of world order in which common interest outweighs old animosities, and in which a new generation of the human family can grow up at peace in a changing world.
text_preceding: This same spirit of discovery is helping us to conquer disease and suffering that have plagued our own planet since the dawn of time.
text_following: At home, we have learned that by working together we can create prosperity without fanning inflation; we can restore order without weakening freedom.

text_original: At home, we have learned that by working together we can create prosperity without fanning inflation; we can restore order without weakening freedom.
text_preceding: By working together with the leaders of other nations, we have been able to build a new hope for lasting peace--for a structure of world order in which common interest outweighs old animosities, and in which a new generation of the human family can grow up at peace in a changing world.
text_following: THE CHALLENGES WE FACE: These first years of the 1970s have been good years for America.

text_original: THE CHALLENGES WE FACE: These first years of the 1970s have been good years for America.
text_preceding: At home, we have learned that by working together we can create prosperity without fanning inflation; we can restore order without weakening freedom.
text_following: Our job--all of us together--is to make 1973 and the years to come even better ones.

text_original: Our job--all of us together--is to make 1973 and the years to come even better ones.
text_preceding: THE CHALLENGES WE FACE: These first years of the 1970s have been good years for America.
text_following: I believe that we can make the years leading to our Bicentennial the best four years in American history.

text_original: I believe that we can make the years leading to our Bicentennial the best four years in American history.
text_preceding: Our job--all of us together--is to make 1973 and the years to come even better ones.
text_following: But we must never forget that nothing worthwhile can be achieved without the will to succeed and the strength to sacrifice.

text_original: But we must never forget that nothing worthwhile can be achieved without the will to succeed and the strength to sacrifice.
text_preceding: I believe that we can make the years leading to our Bicentennial the best four years in American history.
text_following: Hard decisions must be made, and we must stick by them.

text_original: Hard decisions must be made, and we must stick by them.
text_preceding: But we must never forget that nothing worthwhile can be achieved without the will to succeed and the strength to sacrifice.
text_following: In the field of foreign policy, we must remember that a strong America--an America whose word is believed and whose strength is respected--is essential to continued peace and understanding in the world.

text_original: In the field of foreign policy, we must remember that a strong America--an America whose word is believed and whose strength is respected--is essential to continued peace and understanding in the world.
text_preceding: Hard decisions must be made, and we must stick by them.
text_following: The peace with honor we have achieved in Vietnam has strengthened this basic American credibility.

text_original: The peace with honor we have achieved in Vietnam has strengthened this basic American credibility.
text_preceding: In the field of foreign policy, we must remember that a strong America--an America whose word is believed and whose strength is respected--is essential to continued peace and understanding in the world.
text_following: We must act in such a way in coming years that this credibility will remain intact, and with it, the world stability of which it is so indispensable a part.

text_original: We must act in such a way in coming years that this credibility will remain intact, and with it, the world stability of which it is so indispensable a part.
text_preceding: The peace with honor we have achieved in Vietnam has strengthened this basic American credibility.
text_following: At home, we must reject the mistaken notion--a notion that has dominated too much of the public dialogue for too long--that ever bigger Government is the answer to every problem.

text_original: At home, we must reject the mistaken notion--a notion that has dominated too much of the public dialogue for too long--that ever bigger Government is the answer to every problem.
text_preceding: We must act in such a way in coming years that this credibility will remain intact, and with it, the world stability of which it is so indispensable a part.
text_following: We have learned only too well that heavy taxation and excessive Government spending are not a cure-all.

text_original: We have learned only too well that heavy taxation and excessive Government spending are not a cure-all.
text_preceding: At home, we must reject the mistaken notion--a notion that has dominated too much of the public dialogue for too long--that ever bigger Government is the answer to every problem.
text_following: In too many cases, instead of solving the problems they were aimed at, they have merely placed an ever heavier burden on the shoulders of the American taxpayer, in the form of higher taxes and a higher cost of living.

text_original: In too many cases, instead of solving the problems they were aimed at, they have merely placed an ever heavier burden on the shoulders of the American taxpayer, in the form of higher taxes and a higher cost of living.
text_preceding: We have learned only too well that heavy taxation and excessive Government spending are not a cure-all.
text_following: At the same time they have deceived our people because many of the intended beneficiaries received far less than was promised, thus undermining public faith in the effectiveness of Government as a whole.

text_original: At the same time they have deceived our people because many of the intended beneficiaries received far less than was promised, thus undermining public faith in the effectiveness of Government as a whole.
text_preceding: In too many cases, instead of solving the problems they were aimed at, they have merely placed an ever heavier burden on the shoulders of the American taxpayer, in the form of higher taxes and a higher cost of living.
text_following: The time has come for us to draw the line.

text_original: The time has come for us to draw the line.
text_preceding: At the same time they have deceived our people because many of the intended beneficiaries received far less than was promised, thus undermining public faith in the effectiveness of Government as a whole.
text_following: The time has come for the responsible leaders of both political parties to take a stand against overgrown Government and for the American taxpayer.

text_original: The time has come for the responsible leaders of both political parties to take a stand against overgrown Government and for the American taxpayer.
text_preceding: The time has come for us to draw the line.
text_following: We are not spending the Federal Government's money, we are spending the taxpayer's money, and it must be spent in a way which guarantees his money's worth and yields the fullest possible benefit to the people being helped.

text_original: We are not spending the Federal Government's money, we are spending the taxpayer's money, and it must be spent in a way which guarantees his money's worth and yields the fullest possible benefit to the people being helped.
text_preceding: The time has come for the responsible leaders of both political parties to take a stand against overgrown Government and for the American taxpayer.
text_following: The answer to many of the domestic problems we face is not higher taxes and more spending.

text_original: The answer to many of the domestic problems we face is not higher taxes and more spending.
text_preceding: We are not spending the Federal Government's money, we are spending the taxpayer's money, and it must be spent in a way which guarantees his money's worth and yields the fullest possible benefit to the people being helped.
text_following: It is less waste, more results and greater freedom for the individual American to earn a rightful place in his own community--and for States and localities to address their own needs in their own ways, in the light of their own priorities.

text_original: It is less waste, more results and greater freedom for the individual American to earn a rightful place in his own community--and for States and localities to address their own needs in their own ways, in the light of their own priorities.
text_preceding: The answer to many of the domestic problems we face is not higher taxes and more spending.
text_following: to excessive Federal spending and higher taxes, we can help achieve this goal.

text_original: to excessive Federal spending and higher taxes, we can help achieve this goal.
text_preceding: It is less waste, more results and greater freedom for the individual American to earn a rightful place in his own community--and for States and localities to address their own needs in their own ways, in the light of their own priorities.
text_following: COMING MESSAGES: The policies which I will outline to the Congress in the weeks ahead represent a reaffirmation, not an abdication, of Federal responsibility.

text_original: COMING MESSAGES: The policies which I will outline to the Congress in the weeks ahead represent a reaffirmation, not an abdication, of Federal responsibility.
text_preceding: to excessive Federal spending and higher taxes, we can help achieve this goal.
text_following: They represent a pragmatic rededication to social compassion and national excellence, in place of the combination of good intentions and fuzzy follow-through which too often in the past was thought sufficient.

text_original: They represent a pragmatic rededication to social compassion and national excellence, in place of the combination of good intentions and fuzzy follow-through which too often in the past was thought sufficient.
text_preceding: COMING MESSAGES: The policies which I will outline to the Congress in the weeks ahead represent a reaffirmation, not an abdication, of Federal responsibility.
text_following: In the field of economic affairs, our objectives will be to hold down taxes, to continue controlling inflation, to promote economic growth, to increase productivity, to encourage foreign trade, to keep farm income high, to bolster small business, and to promote better labor-management relations.

text_original: In the field of economic affairs, our objectives will be to hold down taxes, to continue controlling inflation, to promote economic growth, to increase productivity, to encourage foreign trade, to keep farm income high, to bolster small business, and to promote better labor-management relations.
text_preceding: They represent a pragmatic rededication to social compassion and national excellence, in place of the combination of good intentions and fuzzy follow-through which too often in the past was thought sufficient.
text_following: In the area of natural resources, my recommendations will include programs to preserve and enhance the environment, to advance science and technology, and to assure balanced use of our irreplaceable natural resources.

text_original: In the area of natural resources, my recommendations will include programs to preserve and enhance the environment, to advance science and technology, and to assure balanced use of our irreplaceable natural resources.
text_preceding: In the field of economic affairs, our objectives will be to hold down taxes, to continue controlling inflation, to promote economic growth, to increase productivity, to encourage foreign trade, to keep farm income high, to bolster small business, and to promote better labor-management relations.
text_following: In developing human resources, I will have recommendations to advance the Nation's health and education, to improve conditions of people in need, to carry forward our increasingly successful attacks on crime, drug abuse and injustice, and to deal with such important areas of special concern as consumer affairs.

text_original: In developing human resources, I will have recommendations to advance the Nation's health and education, to improve conditions of people in need, to carry forward our increasingly successful attacks on crime, drug abuse and injustice, and to deal with such important areas of special concern as consumer affairs.
text_preceding: In the area of natural resources, my recommendations will include programs to preserve and enhance the environment, to advance science and technology, and to assure balanced use of our irreplaceable natural resources.
text_following: We will continue and improve our Nation's efforts to assist those who have served in the Armed Services in Vietnam through better job and training opportunities.

text_original: We will continue and improve our Nation's efforts to assist those who have served in the Armed Services in Vietnam through better job and training opportunities.
text_preceding: In developing human resources, I will have recommendations to advance the Nation's health and education, to improve conditions of people in need, to carry forward our increasingly successful attacks on crime, drug abuse and injustice, and to deal with such important areas of special concern as consumer affairs.
text_following: We must do a better job in community development--in creating more livable communities, in which all of our children can grow up with fuller access to opportunity and greater immunity to the social evils and blights which now plague so many of our towns and cities.

text_original: We must do a better job in community development--in creating more livable communities, in which all of our children can grow up with fuller access to opportunity and greater immunity to the social evils and blights which now plague so many of our towns and cities.
text_preceding: We will continue and improve our Nation's efforts to assist those who have served in the Armed Services in Vietnam through better job and training opportunities.
text_following: I shall have proposals to help us achieve this.

text_original: I shall have proposals to help us achieve this.
text_preceding: We must do a better job in community development--in creating more livable communities, in which all of our children can grow up with fuller access to opportunity and greater immunity to the social evils and blights which now plague so many of our towns and cities.
text_following: I shall also deal with our defense and foreign policies, and with our new approaches to the role and structure of Government itself.

text_original: I shall also deal with our defense and foreign policies, and with our new approaches to the role and structure of Government itself.
text_preceding: I shall have proposals to help us achieve this.
text_following: Considered as a whole, this series of messages will be a blueprint for modernizing the concept and the functions of American Government to meet the needs of our people.

text_original: Considered as a whole, this series of messages will be a blueprint for modernizing the concept and the functions of American Government to meet the needs of our people.
text_preceding: I shall also deal with our defense and foreign policies, and with our new approaches to the role and structure of Government itself.
text_following: Converting it into reality will require a spirit of cooperation and shared commitment on the part of all branches of the Government, for the goals we seek are not those of any single party or faction, they are goals for the betterment of all Americans.

text_original: Converting it into reality will require a spirit of cooperation and shared commitment on the part of all branches of the Government, for the goals we seek are not those of any single party or faction, they are goals for the betterment of all Americans.
text_preceding: Considered as a whole, this series of messages will be a blueprint for modernizing the concept and the functions of American Government to meet the needs of our people.
text_following: As President, I recognize that I cannot do this job alone.

text_original: As President, I recognize that I cannot do this job alone.
text_preceding: Converting it into reality will require a spirit of cooperation and shared commitment on the part of all branches of the Government, for the goals we seek are not those of any single party or faction, they are goals for the betterment of all Americans.
text_following: The Congress must help, and I pledge to do my part to achieve a constructive working relationship with the Congress.

text_original: The Congress must help, and I pledge to do my part to achieve a constructive working relationship with the Congress.
text_preceding: As President, I recognize that I cannot do this job alone.
text_following: My sincere hope is that the executive and legislative branches can work together in this great undertaking in a positive spirit of mutual respect and cooperation.

text_original: My sincere hope is that the executive and legislative branches can work together in this great undertaking in a positive spirit of mutual respect and cooperation.
text_preceding: The Congress must help, and I pledge to do my part to achieve a constructive working relationship with the Congress.
text_following: Working together--the Congress, the President and the people-- I am confident that we can translate these proposals into an action program that can reform and revitalize American Government and, even more important, build a better life for all Americans.

text_original: Working together--the Congress, the President and the people-- I am confident that we can translate these proposals into an action program that can reform and revitalize American Government and, even more important, build a better life for all Americans.
text_preceding: My sincere hope is that the executive and legislative branches can work together in this great undertaking in a positive spirit of mutual respect and cooperation.

text_original: Mr. Speaker, Mr. Vice President, Members of the 94th Congress, and distinguished guests: As we begin our Bicentennial, America is still one of the youngest nations in recorded history.
text_following: Long before our forefathers came to these shores, men and women had been struggling on this planet to forge a better life for themselves and their families.

text_original: Long before our forefathers came to these shores, men and women had been struggling on this planet to forge a better life for themselves and their families.
text_preceding: Mr. Speaker, Mr. Vice President, Members of the 94th Congress, and distinguished guests: As we begin our Bicentennial, America is still one of the youngest nations in recorded history.
text_following: In man's long, upward march from savagery and slavery--throughout the nearly 2,000 years of the Christian calendar, the nearly 6,000 years of Jewish reckoning--there have been many deep, terrifying valleys, but also many bright and towering peaks.

text_original: In man's long, upward march from savagery and slavery--throughout the nearly 2,000 years of the Christian calendar, the nearly 6,000 years of Jewish reckoning--there have been many deep, terrifying valleys, but also many bright and towering peaks.
text_preceding: Long before our forefathers came to these shores, men and women had been struggling on this planet to forge a better life for themselves and their families.
text_following: One peak stands highest in the ranges of human history.

text_original: One peak stands highest in the ranges of human history.
text_preceding: In man's long, upward march from savagery and slavery--throughout the nearly 2,000 years of the Christian calendar, the nearly 6,000 years of Jewish reckoning--there have been many deep, terrifying valleys, but also many bright and towering peaks.
text_following: One example shines forth of a people uniting to produce abundance and to share the good life fairly and with freedom.

text_original: One example shines forth of a people uniting to produce abundance and to share the good life fairly and with freedom.
text_preceding: One peak stands highest in the ranges of human history.
text_following: One union holds out the promise of justice and opportunity for every citizen: That union is the United States of America.

text_original: One union holds out the promise of justice and opportunity for every citizen: That union is the United States of America.
text_preceding: One example shines forth of a people uniting to produce abundance and to share the good life fairly and with freedom.
text_following: We have not remade paradise on Earth.

text_original: We have not remade paradise on Earth.
text_preceding: One union holds out the promise of justice and opportunity for every citizen: That union is the United States of America.
text_following: We know perfection will not be found here.

text_original: We know perfection will not be found here.
text_preceding: We have not remade paradise on Earth.
text_following: But think for a minute how far we have come in 200 years.

text_original: But think for a minute how far we have come in 200 years.
text_preceding: We know perfection will not be found here.
text_following: We came from many roots, and we have many branches.

text_original: We came from many roots, and we have many branches.
text_preceding: But think for a minute how far we have come in 200 years.
text_following: Yet all Americans across the eight generations that separate us from the stirring deeds of 1776, those who know no other homeland and those who just found refuge among our shores, say in unison: I am proud of America, and I am proud to be an American.

text_original: Yet all Americans across the eight generations that separate us from the stirring deeds of 1776, those who know no other homeland and those who just found refuge among our shores, say in unison: I am proud of America, and I am proud to be an American.
text_preceding: We came from many roots, and we have many branches.
text_following: Life will be a little better here for my children than for me.

text_original: Life will be a little better here for my children than for me.
text_preceding: Yet all Americans across the eight generations that separate us from the stirring deeds of 1776, those who know no other homeland and those who just found refuge among our shores, say in unison: I am proud of America, and I am proud to be an American.
text_following: I believe this not because I am told to believe it, but because life has been better for me than it was for my father and my mother.

text_original: I believe this not because I am told to believe it, but because life has been better for me than it was for my father and my mother.
text_preceding: Life will be a little better here for my children than for me.
text_following: I know it will be better for my children because my hands, my brains, my voice, and my vote can help make it happen.

text_original: I know it will be better for my children because my hands, my brains, my voice, and my vote can help make it happen.
text_preceding: I believe this not because I am told to believe it, but because life has been better for me than it was for my father and my mother.
text_following: It has happened here in America.

text_original: It has happened here in America.
text_preceding: I know it will be better for my children because my hands, my brains, my voice, and my vote can help make it happen.
text_following: It has happened to you and to me.

text_original: It has happened to you and to me.
text_preceding: It has happened here in America.
text_following: Government exists to create and preserve conditions in which people can translate their ideas into practical reality.

text_original: Government exists to create and preserve conditions in which people can translate their ideas into practical reality.
text_preceding: It has happened to you and to me.
text_following: In the best of times, much is lost in translation.

text_original: In the best of times, much is lost in translation.
text_preceding: Government exists to create and preserve conditions in which people can translate their ideas into practical reality.
text_following: Sometimes we have tried and failed.

text_original: Sometimes we have tried and failed.
text_preceding: In the best of times, much is lost in translation.
text_following: Always we have had the best of intentions.

text_original: Always we have had the best of intentions.
text_preceding: Sometimes we have tried and failed.
text_following: But in the recent past, we sometimes forgot the sound principles that guided us through most of our history.

text_original: But in the recent past, we sometimes forgot the sound principles that guided us through most of our history.
text_preceding: Always we have had the best of intentions.
text_following: We wanted to accomplish great things and solve age-old problems.

text_original: We wanted to accomplish great things and solve age-old problems.
text_preceding: But in the recent past, we sometimes forgot the sound principles that guided us through most of our history.
text_following: And we became overconfident of our abilities.

text_original: And we became overconfident of our abilities.
text_preceding: We wanted to accomplish great things and solve age-old problems.
text_following: We tried to be a policeman abroad and the indulgent parent here at home.

text_original: We tried to be a policeman abroad and the indulgent parent here at home.
text_preceding: And we became overconfident of our abilities.
text_following: We thought we could transform the country through massive national programs, but often the programs did not work.

text_original: We thought we could transform the country through massive national programs, but often the programs did not work.
text_preceding: We tried to be a policeman abroad and the indulgent parent here at home.
text_following: Too often they only made things worse.

text_original: Too often they only made things worse.
text_preceding: We thought we could transform the country through massive national programs, but often the programs did not work.
text_following: In our rush to accomplish great deeds quickly, we trampled on sound principles of restraint and endangered the rights of individuals.

text_original: In our rush to accomplish great deeds quickly, we trampled on sound principles of restraint and endangered the rights of individuals.
text_preceding: Too often they only made things worse.
text_following: We unbalanced our economic system by the huge and unprecedented growth of Federal expenditures and borrowing.

text_original: We unbalanced our economic system by the huge and unprecedented growth of Federal expenditures and borrowing.
text_preceding: In our rush to accomplish great deeds quickly, we trampled on sound principles of restraint and endangered the rights of individuals.
text_following: And we were not totally honest with ourselves about how much these programs would cost and how we would pay for them.

text_original: And we were not totally honest with ourselves about how much these programs would cost and how we would pay for them.
text_preceding: We unbalanced our economic system by the huge and unprecedented growth of Federal expenditures and borrowing.
text_following: Finally, we shifted our emphasis from defense to domestic problems while our adversaries continued a massive buildup of arms.

text_original: Finally, we shifted our emphasis from defense to domestic problems while our adversaries continued a massive buildup of arms.
text_preceding: And we were not totally honest with ourselves about how much these programs would cost and how we would pay for them.
text_following: The time has now come for a fundamentally different approach--for a new realism that is true to the great principles upon which this Nation was founded.

text_original: The time has now come for a fundamentally different approach--for a new realism that is true to the great principles upon which this Nation was founded.
text_preceding: Finally, we shifted our emphasis from defense to domestic problems while our adversaries continued a massive buildup of arms.
text_following: We must introduce a new balance to our economy--a balance that favors not only sound, active government but also a much more vigorous, healthy economy that can create new jobs and hold down prices.

text_original: We must introduce a new balance to our economy--a balance that favors not only sound, active government but also a much more vigorous, healthy economy that can create new jobs and hold down prices.
text_preceding: The time has now come for a fundamentally different approach--for a new realism that is true to the great principles upon which this Nation was founded.
text_following: We must introduce a new balance in the relationship between the individual and the government--a balance that favors greater individual freedom and self-reliance.

text_original: We must introduce a new balance in the relationship between the individual and the government--a balance that favors greater individual freedom and self-reliance.
text_preceding: We must introduce a new balance to our economy--a balance that favors not only sound, active government but also a much more vigorous, healthy economy that can create new jobs and hold down prices.
text_following: We must strike a new balance in our system of federalism--a balance that favors greater responsibility and freedom for the leaders of our State and local governments.

text_original: We must strike a new balance in our system of federalism--a balance that favors greater responsibility and freedom for the leaders of our State and local governments.
text_preceding: We must introduce a new balance in the relationship between the individual and the government--a balance that favors greater individual freedom and self-reliance.
text_following: We must introduce a new balance between the spending on domestic programs and spending on defense--a balance that ensures we will fully meet our obligation to the needy while also protecting our security in a world that is still hostile to freedom.

text_original: We must introduce a new balance between the spending on domestic programs and spending on defense--a balance that ensures we will fully meet our obligation to the needy while also protecting our security in a world that is still hostile to freedom.
text_preceding: We must strike a new balance in our system of federalism--a balance that favors greater responsibility and freedom for the leaders of our State and local governments.
text_following: And in all that we do, we must be more honest with the American people, promising them no more than we can deliver and delivering all that we promise.

text_original: And in all that we do, we must be more honest with the American people, promising them no more than we can deliver and delivering all that we promise.
text_preceding: We must introduce a new balance between the spending on domestic programs and spending on defense--a balance that ensures we will fully meet our obligation to the needy while also protecting our security in a world that is still hostile to freedom.
text_following: The genius of America has been its incredible ability to improve the lives of its citizens through a unique combination of governmental and free citizen activity.

text_original: The genius of America has been its incredible ability to improve the lives of its citizens through a unique combination of governmental and free citizen activity.
text_preceding: And in all that we do, we must be more honest with the American people, promising them no more than we can deliver and delivering all that we promise.
text_following: History and experience tells us that moral progress cannot come in comfortable and in complacent times, but out of trial and out of confusion.

text_original: History and experience tells us that moral progress cannot come in comfortable and in complacent times, but out of trial and out of confusion.
text_preceding: The genius of America has been its incredible ability to improve the lives of its citizens through a unique combination of governmental and free citizen activity.
text_following: Tom Paine aroused the troubled Americans of 1776 to stand up to the times that try men's souls because the harder the conflict, the more glorious the triumph.

text_original: Tom Paine aroused the troubled Americans of 1776 to stand up to the times that try men's souls because the harder the conflict, the more glorious the triumph.
text_preceding: History and experience tells us that moral progress cannot come in comfortable and in complacent times, but out of trial and out of confusion.
text_following: Just a year ago I reported that the state of the Union was not good.

text_original: Just a year ago I reported that the state of the Union was not good.
text_preceding: Tom Paine aroused the troubled Americans of 1776 to stand up to the times that try men's souls because the harder the conflict, the more glorious the triumph.
text_following: Tonight, I report that the state of our Union is better--in many ways a lot better--but still not good enough.

text_original: Tonight, I report that the state of our Union is better--in many ways a lot better--but still not good enough.
text_preceding: Just a year ago I reported that the state of the Union was not good.
text_following: To paraphrase Tom Paine, 1975 was not a year for summer soldiers and sunshine patriots.

text_original: To paraphrase Tom Paine, 1975 was not a year for summer soldiers and sunshine patriots.
text_preceding: Tonight, I report that the state of our Union is better--in many ways a lot better--but still not good enough.
text_following: It was a year of fears and alarms and of dire forecasts-- most of which never happened and won't happen.

text_original: It was a year of fears and alarms and of dire forecasts-- most of which never happened and won't happen.
text_preceding: To paraphrase Tom Paine, 1975 was not a year for summer soldiers and sunshine patriots.
text_following: As you recall, the year 1975 opened with rancor and with bitterness.

text_original: As you recall, the year 1975 opened with rancor and with bitterness.
text_preceding: It was a year of fears and alarms and of dire forecasts-- most of which never happened and won't happen.
text_following: Political misdeeds of the past had neither been forgotten nor forgiven.

text_original: Political misdeeds of the past had neither been forgotten nor forgiven.
text_preceding: As you recall, the year 1975 opened with rancor and with bitterness.
text_following: The longest, most divisive war in our history was winding toward an unhappy conclusion.

text_original: The longest, most divisive war in our history was winding toward an unhappy conclusion.
text_preceding: Political misdeeds of the past had neither been forgotten nor forgiven.
text_following: Many feared that the end of that foreign war of men and machines meant the beginning of a domestic war of recrimination and reprisal.

text_original: Many feared that the end of that foreign war of men and machines meant the beginning of a domestic war of recrimination and reprisal.
text_preceding: The longest, most divisive war in our history was winding toward an unhappy conclusion.
text_following: Friends and adversaries abroad were asking whether America had lost its nerve.

text_original: Friends and adversaries abroad were asking whether America had lost its nerve.
text_preceding: Many feared that the end of that foreign war of men and machines meant the beginning of a domestic war of recrimination and reprisal.
text_following: Finally, our economy was ravaged by inflation--inflation that was plunging us into the worse recession in four decades.

text_original: Finally, our economy was ravaged by inflation--inflation that was plunging us into the worse recession in four decades.
text_preceding: Friends and adversaries abroad were asking whether America had lost its nerve.
text_following: At the same time, Americans became increasingly alienated from big institutions.

text_original: At the same time, Americans became increasingly alienated from big institutions.
text_preceding: Finally, our economy was ravaged by inflation--inflation that was plunging us into the worse recession in four decades.
text_following: They were steadily losing confidence, not just in big government but in big business, big labor, and big education, among others.

text_original: They were steadily losing confidence, not just in big government but in big business, big labor, and big education, among others.
text_preceding: At the same time, Americans became increasingly alienated from big institutions.
text_following: And so, 1975 was a year of hard decisions, difficult compromises, and a new realism that taught us something important about America.

text_original: And so, 1975 was a year of hard decisions, difficult compromises, and a new realism that taught us something important about America.
text_preceding: They were steadily losing confidence, not just in big government but in big business, big labor, and big education, among others.
text_following: It brought back a needed measure of common sense, steadfastness, and self-discipline.

text_original: It brought back a needed measure of common sense, steadfastness, and self-discipline.
text_preceding: And so, 1975 was a year of hard decisions, difficult compromises, and a new realism that taught us something important about America.
text_following: Americans did not panic or demand instant but useless cures.

text_original: Americans did not panic or demand instant but useless cures.
text_preceding: It brought back a needed measure of common sense, steadfastness, and self-discipline.
text_following: In all sectors, people met their difficult problems with the restraint and with responsibility worthy of their great heritage.

text_original: In all sectors, people met their difficult problems with the restraint and with responsibility worthy of their great heritage.
text_preceding: Americans did not panic or demand instant but useless cures.
text_following: Add up the separate pieces of progress in 1975, subtract the setbacks, and the sum total shows that we are not only headed in a new direction, a direction which I proposed 12 months ago, but it turned out to be the right direction.

text_original: Add up the separate pieces of progress in 1975, subtract the setbacks, and the sum total shows that we are not only headed in a new direction, a direction which I proposed 12 months ago, but it turned out to be the right direction.
text_preceding: In all sectors, people met their difficult problems with the restraint and with responsibility worthy of their great heritage.
text_following: It is the right direction because it follows the truly revolutionary American concept of 1776, which holds that in a free society the making of public policy and successful problemsolving involves much more than government.

text_original: It is the right direction because it follows the truly revolutionary American concept of 1776, which holds that in a free society the making of public policy and successful problemsolving involves much more than government.
text_preceding: Add up the separate pieces of progress in 1975, subtract the setbacks, and the sum total shows that we are not only headed in a new direction, a direction which I proposed 12 months ago, but it turned out to be the right direction.
text_following: It involves a full partnership among all branches and all levels of government, private institutions, and individual citizens.

text_original: It involves a full partnership among all branches and all levels of government, private institutions, and individual citizens.
text_preceding: It is the right direction because it follows the truly revolutionary American concept of 1776, which holds that in a free society the making of public policy and successful problemsolving involves much more than government.
text_following: Common sense tells me to stick to that steady course.

text_original: Common sense tells me to stick to that steady course.
text_preceding: It involves a full partnership among all branches and all levels of government, private institutions, and individual citizens.
text_following: Take the state of our economy.

text_original: Take the state of our economy.
text_preceding: Common sense tells me to stick to that steady course.
text_following: Last January, most things were rapidly getting worse.

text_original: Last January, most things were rapidly getting worse.
text_preceding: Take the state of our economy.
text_following: This January, most things are slowly but surely getting better.

text_original: This January, most things are slowly but surely getting better.
text_preceding: Last January, most things were rapidly getting worse.
text_following: The worst recession since World War II turned around in April.

text_original: The worst recession since World War II turned around in April.
text_preceding: This January, most things are slowly but surely getting better.
text_following: The best cost-of-living news of the past year is that double-digit inflation of 12 percent or higher was cut almost in half.

text_original: The best cost-of-living news of the past year is that double-digit inflation of 12 percent or higher was cut almost in half.
text_preceding: The worst recession since World War II turned around in April.
text_following: The worst--unemployment remains far too high.

text_original: The worst--unemployment remains far too high.
text_preceding: The best cost-of-living news of the past year is that double-digit inflation of 12 percent or higher was cut almost in half.
text_following: Today, nearly 1,700,000 more Americans are working than at the bottom of the recession.

text_original: Today, nearly 1,700,000 more Americans are working than at the bottom of the recession.
text_preceding: The worst--unemployment remains far too high.
text_following: At year's end, people were again being hired much faster than they were being laid off.

text_original: At year's end, people were again being hired much faster than they were being laid off.
text_preceding: Today, nearly 1,700,000 more Americans are working than at the bottom of the recession.
text_following: Many Americans have not yet felt these changes in their daily lives.

text_original: Many Americans have not yet felt these changes in their daily lives.
text_preceding: At year's end, people were again being hired much faster than they were being laid off.
text_following: They still see prices going up far too fast, and they still know the fear of unemployment.

text_original: They still see prices going up far too fast, and they still know the fear of unemployment.
text_preceding: Many Americans have not yet felt these changes in their daily lives.
text_following: We need more and more jobs every year.

text_original: We need more and more jobs every year.
text_preceding: They still see prices going up far too fast, and they still know the fear of unemployment.
text_following: Today's economy has produced over 85 million jobs for Americans, but we need a lot more jobs, especially for the young.

text_original: Today's economy has produced over 85 million jobs for Americans, but we need a lot more jobs, especially for the young.
text_preceding: We need more and more jobs every year.
text_following: My first objective is to have sound economic growth without inflation.

text_original: My first objective is to have sound economic growth without inflation.
text_preceding: Today's economy has produced over 85 million jobs for Americans, but we need a lot more jobs, especially for the young.
text_following: We all know from recent experience what runaway inflation does to ruin every other worthy purpose.

text_original: We all know from recent experience what runaway inflation does to ruin every other worthy purpose.
text_preceding: My first objective is to have sound economic growth without inflation.
text_following: For many Americans, the way to a healthy, noninflationary economy has become increasingly apparent.

text_original: For many Americans, the way to a healthy, noninflationary economy has become increasingly apparent.
text_preceding: We all know from recent experience what runaway inflation does to ruin every other worthy purpose.
text_following: The Government must stop spending so much and stop borrowing so much of our money.

text_original: The Government must stop spending so much and stop borrowing so much of our money.
text_preceding: For many Americans, the way to a healthy, noninflationary economy has become increasingly apparent.
text_following: More money must remain in private hands where it will do the most good.

text_original: More money must remain in private hands where it will do the most good.
text_preceding: The Government must stop spending so much and stop borrowing so much of our money.
text_following: To hold down the cost of living, we must hold down the cost of government.

text_original: To hold down the cost of living, we must hold down the cost of government.
text_preceding: More money must remain in private hands where it will do the most good.
text_following: In the past decade, the Federal budget has been growing at an average rate of over 10 percent a year.

text_original: In the past decade, the Federal budget has been growing at an average rate of over 10 percent a year.
text_preceding: To hold down the cost of living, we must hold down the cost of government.
text_following: The budget I am submitting Wednesday cuts this rate of growth in half.

text_original: The budget I am submitting Wednesday cuts this rate of growth in half.
text_preceding: In the past decade, the Federal budget has been growing at an average rate of over 10 percent a year.
text_following: I have kept my promise to submit a budget for the next fiscal year of $395 billion.

text_original: I have kept my promise to submit a budget for the next fiscal year of $395 billion.
text_preceding: The budget I am submitting Wednesday cuts this rate of growth in half.
text_following: In fact, it is $394.2 billion.

text_original: In fact, it is $394.2 billion.
text_preceding: I have kept my promise to submit a budget for the next fiscal year of $395 billion.
text_following: By holding down the growth of Federal spending, we can afford additional tax cuts and return to the people who pay taxes more decisionmaking power over their own lives.

text_original: By holding down the growth of Federal spending, we can afford additional tax cuts and return to the people who pay taxes more decisionmaking power over their own lives.
text_preceding: In fact, it is $394.2 billion.
text_following: Last month I signed legislation to extend the 1975 tax reductions for the first 6 months of this year.

text_original: Last month I signed legislation to extend the 1975 tax reductions for the first 6 months of this year.
text_preceding: By holding down the growth of Federal spending, we can afford additional tax cuts and return to the people who pay taxes more decisionmaking power over their own lives.
text_following: I now propose that effective July 1, 1976, we give our taxpayers a tax cut of approximately $10 billion more than Congress agreed to in December.

text_original: I now propose that effective July 1, 1976, we give our taxpayers a tax cut of approximately $10 billion more than Congress agreed to in December.
text_preceding: Last month I signed legislation to extend the 1975 tax reductions for the first 6 months of this year.
text_following: My broader tax reduction would mean that for a family of four making $15,000 a year, there will be $227 more in take-home pay annually.

text_original: My broader tax reduction would mean that for a family of four making $15,000 a year, there will be $227 more in take-home pay annually.
text_preceding: I now propose that effective July 1, 1976, we give our taxpayers a tax cut of approximately $10 billion more than Congress agreed to in December.
text_following: Hardworking Americans caught in the middle can really use that kind of extra cash.

text_original: Hardworking Americans caught in the middle can really use that kind of extra cash.
text_preceding: My broader tax reduction would mean that for a family of four making $15,000 a year, there will be $227 more in take-home pay annually.
text_following: My recommendations for a firm restraint on the growth of Federal spending and for greater tax reduction are simple and straightforward.

text_original: My recommendations for a firm restraint on the growth of Federal spending and for greater tax reduction are simple and straightforward.
text_preceding: Hardworking Americans caught in the middle can really use that kind of extra cash.
text_following: For every dollar saved in cutting the growth in the Federal budget, we can have an added dollar of Federal tax reduction.

text_original: For every dollar saved in cutting the growth in the Federal budget, we can have an added dollar of Federal tax reduction.
text_preceding: My recommendations for a firm restraint on the growth of Federal spending and for greater tax reduction are simple and straightforward.
text_following: We can achieve a balanced budget by 1979 if we have the courage and the wisdom to continue to reduce the growth of Federal spending.

text_original: We can achieve a balanced budget by 1979 if we have the courage and the wisdom to continue to reduce the growth of Federal spending.
text_preceding: For every dollar saved in cutting the growth in the Federal budget, we can have an added dollar of Federal tax reduction.
text_following: One test of a healthy economy is a job for every American who wants to work.

text_original: One test of a healthy economy is a job for every American who wants to work.
text_preceding: We can achieve a balanced budget by 1979 if we have the courage and the wisdom to continue to reduce the growth of Federal spending.
text_following: Government--our kind of government--cannot create that many jobs.

text_original: Government--our kind of government--cannot create that many jobs.
text_preceding: One test of a healthy economy is a job for every American who wants to work.
text_following: But the Federal Government can create conditions and incentives for private business and industry to make more and more jobs.

text_original: But the Federal Government can create conditions and incentives for private business and industry to make more and more jobs.
text_preceding: Government--our kind of government--cannot create that many jobs.
text_following: Five out of six jobs in this country are in private business and in industry.

text_original: Five out of six jobs in this country are in private business and in industry.
text_preceding: But the Federal Government can create conditions and incentives for private business and industry to make more and more jobs.
text_following: Common sense tells us this is the place to look for more jobs and to find them faster.

text_original: Common sense tells us this is the place to look for more jobs and to find them faster.
text_preceding: Five out of six jobs in this country are in private business and in industry.
text_following: I mean real, rewarding, permanent jobs.

text_original: I mean real, rewarding, permanent jobs.
text_preceding: Common sense tells us this is the place to look for more jobs and to find them faster.
text_following: To achieve this we must offer the American people greater incentives to invest in the future.

text_original: To achieve this we must offer the American people greater incentives to invest in the future.
text_preceding: I mean real, rewarding, permanent jobs.
text_following: My tax proposals are a major step in that direction.

text_original: My tax proposals are a major step in that direction.
text_preceding: To achieve this we must offer the American people greater incentives to invest in the future.
text_following: To supplement these proposals, I ask that Congress enact changes in Federal tax laws that will speed up plant expansion and the purchase of new equipment.

text_original: To supplement these proposals, I ask that Congress enact changes in Federal tax laws that will speed up plant expansion and the purchase of new equipment.
text_preceding: My tax proposals are a major step in that direction.
text_following: My recommendations will concentrate this job-creation tax incentive in areas where the unemployment rate now runs over 7 percent.

text_original: My recommendations will concentrate this job-creation tax incentive in areas where the unemployment rate now runs over 7 percent.
text_preceding: To supplement these proposals, I ask that Congress enact changes in Federal tax laws that will speed up plant expansion and the purchase of new equipment.
text_following: Legislation to get this started must be approved at the earliest possible date.

text_original: Legislation to get this started must be approved at the earliest possible date.
text_preceding: My recommendations will concentrate this job-creation tax incentive in areas where the unemployment rate now runs over 7 percent.
text_following: Within the strict budget total that I will recommend for the coming year, I will ask for additional housing assistance for 500,000 families.

text_original: Within the strict budget total that I will recommend for the coming year, I will ask for additional housing assistance for 500,000 families.
text_preceding: Legislation to get this started must be approved at the earliest possible date.
text_following: These programs will expand housing opportunities, spur construction, and help to house moderate- and low-income families.

text_original: These programs will expand housing opportunities, spur construction, and help to house moderate- and low-income families.
text_preceding: Within the strict budget total that I will recommend for the coming year, I will ask for additional housing assistance for 500,000 families.
text_following: We had a disappointing year in the housing industry in 1975.

text_original: We had a disappointing year in the housing industry in 1975.
text_preceding: These programs will expand housing opportunities, spur construction, and help to house moderate- and low-income families.
text_following: But with lower interest rates and available mortgage money, we can have a healthy recovery in 1976.

text_original: But with lower interest rates and available mortgage money, we can have a healthy recovery in 1976.
text_preceding: We had a disappointing year in the housing industry in 1975.
text_following: A necessary condition of a healthy economy is freedom from the petty tyranny of massive government regulation.

text_original: A necessary condition of a healthy economy is freedom from the petty tyranny of massive government regulation.
text_preceding: But with lower interest rates and available mortgage money, we can have a healthy recovery in 1976.
text_following: We are wasting literally millions of working hours costing billions of taxpayers' and consumers' dollars because of bureaucratic redtape.

text_original: We are wasting literally millions of working hours costing billions of taxpayers' and consumers' dollars because of bureaucratic redtape.
text_preceding: A necessary condition of a healthy economy is freedom from the petty tyranny of massive government regulation.
text_following: The American farmer, who now feeds 215 million Americans, but also millions worldwide, has shown how much more he can produce without the shackles of government control.

text_original: The American farmer, who now feeds 215 million Americans, but also millions worldwide, has shown how much more he can produce without the shackles of government control.
text_preceding: We are wasting literally millions of working hours costing billions of taxpayers' and consumers' dollars because of bureaucratic redtape.
text_following: Now, we badly need reforms in other key areas in our economy: the airlines, trucking, railroads, and financial institutions.

text_original: Now, we badly need reforms in other key areas in our economy: the airlines, trucking, railroads, and financial institutions.
text_preceding: The American farmer, who now feeds 215 million Americans, but also millions worldwide, has shown how much more he can produce without the shackles of government control.
