text_original: I would direct a question to those who have indicated already an unwillingness to accept such a plan: Have they an alternative which offers a greater chance of balancing the budget, reducing and eliminating inflation, stimulating the creation of jobs, and reducing the tax burden?
text_preceding: Over 7 million man and woman hours of work by State and local officials are required to fill out government forms.
text_following: And, if they haven't, are they suggesting we can continue on the present course without coming to a day of reckoning?

text_original: And, if they haven't, are they suggesting we can continue on the present course without coming to a day of reckoning?
text_preceding: I would direct a question to those who have indicated already an unwillingness to accept such a plan: Have they an alternative which offers a greater chance of balancing the budget, reducing and eliminating inflation, stimulating the creation of jobs, and reducing the tax burden?
text_following: If we don't do this, inflation and the growing tax burden will put an end to everything we believe in and our dreams for the future.

text_original: If we don't do this, inflation and the growing tax burden will put an end to everything we believe in and our dreams for the future.
text_preceding: And, if they haven't, are they suggesting we can continue on the present course without coming to a day of reckoning?
text_following: We don't have an option of living with inflation and its attendant tragedy, millions of productive people willing and able to work but unable to find a buyer for their work in the job market.

text_original: We don't have an option of living with inflation and its attendant tragedy, millions of productive people willing and able to work but unable to find a buyer for their work in the job market.
text_preceding: If we don't do this, inflation and the growing tax burden will put an end to everything we believe in and our dreams for the future.
text_following: We have an alternative, and that is the program for economic recovery.

text_original: We have an alternative, and that is the program for economic recovery.
text_preceding: We don't have an option of living with inflation and its attendant tragedy, millions of productive people willing and able to work but unable to find a buyer for their work in the job market.
text_following: True, it'll take time for the favorable effects of our proposal to be felt.

text_original: True, it'll take time for the favorable effects of our proposal to be felt.
text_preceding: We have an alternative, and that is the program for economic recovery.
text_following: The people are watching and waiting.

text_original: The people are watching and waiting.
text_preceding: True, it'll take time for the favorable effects of our proposal to be felt.

text_original: Mr. Speaker, Mr. President, distinguished members of Congress, honored guests and fellow citizens.
text_following: May I congratulate all of you who are members of this historic 100th Congress of the United States of America.

text_original: May I congratulate all of you who are members of this historic 100th Congress of the United States of America.
text_preceding: Mr. Speaker, Mr. President, distinguished members of Congress, honored guests and fellow citizens.
text_following: In this 200th anniversary year of our Constitution, you and I stand on the shoulders of giants--men whose words and deeds put wind in the sails of freedom.

text_original: In this 200th anniversary year of our Constitution, you and I stand on the shoulders of giants--men whose words and deeds put wind in the sails of freedom.
text_preceding: May I congratulate all of you who are members of this historic 100th Congress of the United States of America.
text_following: However, we must always remember that our Constitution is to be celebrated not for being old, but for being young--young with the same energy, spirit, and promise that filled each eventful day in Philadelphia's State House.

text_original: However, we must always remember that our Constitution is to be celebrated not for being old, but for being young--young with the same energy, spirit, and promise that filled each eventful day in Philadelphia's State House.
text_preceding: In this 200th anniversary year of our Constitution, you and I stand on the shoulders of giants--men whose words and deeds put wind in the sails of freedom.
text_following: We will be guided tonight by their acts; and we will be guided forever by their words.

text_original: We will be guided tonight by their acts; and we will be guided forever by their words.
text_preceding: However, we must always remember that our Constitution is to be celebrated not for being old, but for being young--young with the same energy, spirit, and promise that filled each eventful day in Philadelphia's State House.
text_following: Now, forgive me, but I can't resist sharing a story from those historic days.

text_original: Now, forgive me, but I can't resist sharing a story from those historic days.
text_preceding: We will be guided tonight by their acts; and we will be guided forever by their words.
text_following: Philadelphia was bursting with civic pride in the spring of 1787, and its newspapers began embellishing the arrival of the Convention delegates with elaborate social classifications.

text_original: Philadelphia was bursting with civic pride in the spring of 1787, and its newspapers began embellishing the arrival of the Convention delegates with elaborate social classifications.
text_preceding: Now, forgive me, but I can't resist sharing a story from those historic days.
text_following: And all others were referred to as the following respectable characters.

text_original: And all others were referred to as the following respectable characters.
text_preceding: Philadelphia was bursting with civic pride in the spring of 1787, and its newspapers began embellishing the arrival of the Convention delegates with elaborate social classifications.
text_following: Well, for this 100th Congress, I invoke special Executive powers to declare that each of you must never be titled less than Honorable with a capital H.

text_original: Well, for this 100th Congress, I invoke special Executive powers to declare that each of you must never be titled less than Honorable with a capital H.
text_preceding: And all others were referred to as the following respectable characters.
text_following: Incidentally, I'm delighted you're celebrating the 100th birthday of the Congress.

text_original: Incidentally, I'm delighted you're celebrating the 100th birthday of the Congress.
text_preceding: Well, for this 100th Congress, I invoke special Executive powers to declare that each of you must never be titled less than Honorable with a capital H.
text_following: It's always a pleasure to congratulate someone with more birthdays than I've had.

text_original: It's always a pleasure to congratulate someone with more birthdays than I've had.
text_preceding: Incidentally, I'm delighted you're celebrating the 100th birthday of the Congress.
text_following: Now, there's a new face at this place of honor tonight.

text_original: Now, there's a new face at this place of honor tonight.
text_preceding: It's always a pleasure to congratulate someone with more birthdays than I've had.
text_following: And please join me in warm congratulations to the Speaker of the House, Jim Wright.

text_original: And please join me in warm congratulations to the Speaker of the House, Jim Wright.
text_preceding: Now, there's a new face at this place of honor tonight.
text_following: Mr. Speaker, you might recall a similar situation in your very first session of Congress, 32 years ago.

text_original: Mr. Speaker, you might recall a similar situation in your very first session of Congress, 32 years ago.
text_preceding: And please join me in warm congratulations to the Speaker of the House, Jim Wright.
text_following: I cannot find better words than those used by President Eisenhower that evening.

text_original: I cannot find better words than those used by President Eisenhower that evening.
text_preceding: Mr. Speaker, you might recall a similar situation in your very first session of Congress, 32 years ago.
text_following: We shall have much to do together;

text_original: We shall have much to do together;
text_preceding: I cannot find better words than those used by President Eisenhower that evening.
text_following: To you, Mr. Speaker, and to Senate Majority Leader Robert Byrd, who brings 34 years of distinguished service to the Congress, may I say: though there are changes in the Congress, America's interests remain the same.

text_original: To you, Mr. Speaker, and to Senate Majority Leader Robert Byrd, who brings 34 years of distinguished service to the Congress, may I say: though there are changes in the Congress, America's interests remain the same.
text_preceding: We shall have much to do together;
text_following: And I am confident that, along with Republican leaders Bob Michel and Bob Dole, this Congress can make history.

text_original: And I am confident that, along with Republican leaders Bob Michel and Bob Dole, this Congress can make history.
text_preceding: To you, Mr. Speaker, and to Senate Majority Leader Robert Byrd, who brings 34 years of distinguished service to the Congress, may I say: though there are changes in the Congress, America's interests remain the same.
text_following: Six Years ago, I was here to ask the Congress to join me in America's New Beginning.

text_original: Six Years ago, I was here to ask the Congress to join me in America's New Beginning.
text_preceding: And I am confident that, along with Republican leaders Bob Michel and Bob Dole, this Congress can make history.
text_following: Well, the results are something of which we can all be proud.

text_original: Well, the results are something of which we can all be proud.
text_preceding: Six Years ago, I was here to ask the Congress to join me in America's New Beginning.
text_following: Our inflation rate is now the lowest in a in a quarter of a century.

text_original: Our inflation rate is now the lowest in a in a quarter of a century.
text_preceding: Well, the results are something of which we can all be proud.
text_following: The prime interest rate has fallen from the 21 and a half percent the month before we took office to seven and a half percent today, and those rates have triggered the most housing starts in eight years.

text_original: The prime interest rate has fallen from the 21 and a half percent the month before we took office to seven and a half percent today, and those rates have triggered the most housing starts in eight years.
text_preceding: Our inflation rate is now the lowest in a in a quarter of a century.
text_following: The unemployment rate--still too high--is the lowest in nearly seven years, and our people have created nearly 13 million new jobs.

text_original: The unemployment rate--still too high--is the lowest in nearly seven years, and our people have created nearly 13 million new jobs.
text_preceding: The prime interest rate has fallen from the 21 and a half percent the month before we took office to seven and a half percent today, and those rates have triggered the most housing starts in eight years.
text_following: Over 61 percent of everyone over the age of 16, male and female, is employed the highest percentage on record.

text_original: Over 61 percent of everyone over the age of 16, male and female, is employed the highest percentage on record.
text_preceding: The unemployment rate--still too high--is the lowest in nearly seven years, and our people have created nearly 13 million new jobs.
text_following: Let's roll up our sleeves and go to work, and put America's economic engine at full throttle.

text_original: Let's roll up our sleeves and go to work, and put America's economic engine at full throttle.
text_preceding: Over 61 percent of everyone over the age of 16, male and female, is employed the highest percentage on record.
text_following: We can also be heartened by our progress across the world.

text_original: We can also be heartened by our progress across the world.
text_preceding: Let's roll up our sleeves and go to work, and put America's economic engine at full throttle.
text_following: Most important, America is at peace tonight, and freedom is on the march.

text_original: Most important, America is at peace tonight, and freedom is on the march.
text_preceding: We can also be heartened by our progress across the world.
text_following: And we've done much these past years to restore our defenses, our alliances, and our leadership in the world.

text_original: And we've done much these past years to restore our defenses, our alliances, and our leadership in the world.
text_preceding: Most important, America is at peace tonight, and freedom is on the march.
text_following: Our sons and daughters in the services once again wear their uniforms with pride.

text_original: Our sons and daughters in the services once again wear their uniforms with pride.
text_preceding: And we've done much these past years to restore our defenses, our alliances, and our leadership in the world.
text_following: But though we've made much progress, I have one major regret.

text_original: But though we've made much progress, I have one major regret.
text_preceding: Our sons and daughters in the services once again wear their uniforms with pride.
text_following: I took a risk with regard to our action in Iran.

text_original: I took a risk with regard to our action in Iran.
text_preceding: But though we've made much progress, I have one major regret.
text_following: It did not work, and for that I assume full responsibility.

text_original: It did not work, and for that I assume full responsibility.
text_preceding: I took a risk with regard to our action in Iran.
text_following: I do not believe it was wrong to try to establish contacts with a country of strategic importance or to try to save lives.

text_original: I do not believe it was wrong to try to establish contacts with a country of strategic importance or to try to save lives.
text_preceding: It did not work, and for that I assume full responsibility.
text_following: And certainly it was not wrong to try to secure freedom for our citizens held in barbaric captivity.

text_original: And certainly it was not wrong to try to secure freedom for our citizens held in barbaric captivity.
text_preceding: I do not believe it was wrong to try to establish contacts with a country of strategic importance or to try to save lives.
text_following: But we did not achieve what we wished, and serious mistakes were made in trying to do so.

text_original: But we did not achieve what we wished, and serious mistakes were made in trying to do so.
text_preceding: And certainly it was not wrong to try to secure freedom for our citizens held in barbaric captivity.
text_following: We will get to the bottom of this, and I will take whatever action is called for.

text_original: We will get to the bottom of this, and I will take whatever action is called for.
text_preceding: But we did not achieve what we wished, and serious mistakes were made in trying to do so.
text_following: But in debating the past --in debating the past, we must not deny ourselves the successes of the future.

text_original: But in debating the past --in debating the past, we must not deny ourselves the successes of the future.
text_preceding: We will get to the bottom of this, and I will take whatever action is called for.
text_following: Let it never be said of this generation of Americans that we became so obsessed with failure that we refused to take risks that could further the cause of peace and freedom in the world.

text_original: Let it never be said of this generation of Americans that we became so obsessed with failure that we refused to take risks that could further the cause of peace and freedom in the world.
text_preceding: But in debating the past --in debating the past, we must not deny ourselves the successes of the future.
text_following: Much is at stake here, and the nation and the world are watching--to see if we go forward together in the national interest, or if we let partisanship weaken us.

text_original: Much is at stake here, and the nation and the world are watching--to see if we go forward together in the national interest, or if we let partisanship weaken us.
text_preceding: Let it never be said of this generation of Americans that we became so obsessed with failure that we refused to take risks that could further the cause of peace and freedom in the world.
text_following: And let there be no mistake about American policy: we will not sit idly by if our interests or our friends in the Middle East are threatened, nor will we yield to terrorist blackmail.

text_original: And let there be no mistake about American policy: we will not sit idly by if our interests or our friends in the Middle East are threatened, nor will we yield to terrorist blackmail.
text_preceding: Much is at stake here, and the nation and the world are watching--to see if we go forward together in the national interest, or if we let partisanship weaken us.
text_following: And now, ladies and gentlemen of the Congress, why don't we get to work?

text_original: And now, ladies and gentlemen of the Congress, why don't we get to work?
text_preceding: And let there be no mistake about American policy: we will not sit idly by if our interests or our friends in the Middle East are threatened, nor will we yield to terrorist blackmail.
text_following: I am pleased to report that, because of our efforts to rebuild the strength of America, the world is a safer place.

text_original: I am pleased to report that, because of our efforts to rebuild the strength of America, the world is a safer place.
text_preceding: And now, ladies and gentlemen of the Congress, why don't we get to work?
text_following: Earlier this month, I submitted a budget to defend America and maintain our momentum to make up for neglect in the last decade.

text_original: Earlier this month, I submitted a budget to defend America and maintain our momentum to make up for neglect in the last decade.
text_preceding: I am pleased to report that, because of our efforts to rebuild the strength of America, the world is a safer place.
text_following: While the world is safer, it is not safe.

text_original: While the world is safer, it is not safe.
text_preceding: Earlier this month, I submitted a budget to defend America and maintain our momentum to make up for neglect in the last decade.
text_following: Since 1970, the Soviets have invested $500 billion more on their military forces than we have.

text_original: Since 1970, the Soviets have invested $500 billion more on their military forces than we have.
text_preceding: While the world is safer, it is not safe.
text_following: Even today, though nearly one in three Soviet families is without running hot water, and the average family spends two hours a day shopping for the basic necessities of life, their government still found the resources to transfer $75 billion in weapons to client states in the past five years--clients like Syria, Vietnam, Cuba, Libya, Angola, Ethiopia, Afghanistan, and Nicaragua.

text_original: Even today, though nearly one in three Soviet families is without running hot water, and the average family spends two hours a day shopping for the basic necessities of life, their government still found the resources to transfer $75 billion in weapons to client states in the past five years--clients like Syria, Vietnam, Cuba, Libya, Angola, Ethiopia, Afghanistan, and Nicaragua.
text_preceding: Since 1970, the Soviets have invested $500 billion more on their military forces than we have.
text_following: With 120,000 Soviet combat and military personnel and 15,000 military advisers in Asia, Africa, and Latin America, can anyone still doubt their single-minded determination to expand their power?

text_original: With 120,000 Soviet combat and military personnel and 15,000 military advisers in Asia, Africa, and Latin America, can anyone still doubt their single-minded determination to expand their power?
text_preceding: Even today, though nearly one in three Soviet families is without running hot water, and the average family spends two hours a day shopping for the basic necessities of life, their government still found the resources to transfer $75 billion in weapons to client states in the past five years--clients like Syria, Vietnam, Cuba, Libya, Angola, Ethiopia, Afghanistan, and Nicaragua.
text_following: Despite this, the Congress cut my request for critical U.S. security assistance to free nations by 21 percent this year, and cut defense requests by $85 billion in the last three years.

text_original: Despite this, the Congress cut my request for critical U.S. security assistance to free nations by 21 percent this year, and cut defense requests by $85 billion in the last three years.
text_preceding: With 120,000 Soviet combat and military personnel and 15,000 military advisers in Asia, Africa, and Latin America, can anyone still doubt their single-minded determination to expand their power?
text_following: These assistance programs serve our national interests as well as mutual interests, and when the programs are devastated, American interests are harmed.

text_original: These assistance programs serve our national interests as well as mutual interests, and when the programs are devastated, American interests are harmed.
text_preceding: Despite this, the Congress cut my request for critical U.S. security assistance to free nations by 21 percent this year, and cut defense requests by $85 billion in the last three years.
text_following: My friends, it's my duty as President to say to you again tonight that there is no surer way to lose freedom than to lose our resolve.

text_original: My friends, it's my duty as President to say to you again tonight that there is no surer way to lose freedom than to lose our resolve.
text_preceding: These assistance programs serve our national interests as well as mutual interests, and when the programs are devastated, American interests are harmed.
text_following: Today, the brave people of Afghanistan are showing that resolve.

text_original: Today, the brave people of Afghanistan are showing that resolve.
text_preceding: My friends, it's my duty as President to say to you again tonight that there is no surer way to lose freedom than to lose our resolve.
text_following: The Soviet Union says it wants a peaceful settlement in Afghanistan, yet it continues a brutal war and props up a regime whose days are clearly numbered.

text_original: The Soviet Union says it wants a peaceful settlement in Afghanistan, yet it continues a brutal war and props up a regime whose days are clearly numbered.
text_preceding: Today, the brave people of Afghanistan are showing that resolve.
text_following: We are ready to support a political solution that guarantees the rapid withdrawal of all Soviet troops and genuine self-determination for the Afghan people.

text_original: We are ready to support a political solution that guarantees the rapid withdrawal of all Soviet troops and genuine self-determination for the Afghan people.
text_preceding: The Soviet Union says it wants a peaceful settlement in Afghanistan, yet it continues a brutal war and props up a regime whose days are clearly numbered.
text_following: In Central America, too, the cause of freedom is being tested.

text_original: In Central America, too, the cause of freedom is being tested.
text_preceding: We are ready to support a political solution that guarantees the rapid withdrawal of all Soviet troops and genuine self-determination for the Afghan people.
text_following: And our resolve is being tested there as well.

text_original: And our resolve is being tested there as well.
text_preceding: In Central America, too, the cause of freedom is being tested.
text_following: Here, especially, the world is watching to see how this Nation responds.

text_original: Here, especially, the world is watching to see how this Nation responds.
text_preceding: And our resolve is being tested there as well.
text_following: Today, over 90 percent of the people of Latin America live in democracy.

text_original: Today, over 90 percent of the people of Latin America live in democracy.
text_preceding: Here, especially, the world is watching to see how this Nation responds.
text_following: Democracy is on the march in Central and South America.

text_original: Democracy is on the march in Central and South America.
text_preceding: Today, over 90 percent of the people of Latin America live in democracy.
text_following: Communist Nicaragua is the odd man out--suppressing the Church, the press, and democratic dissent and promoting subversion in the region.

text_original: Communist Nicaragua is the odd man out--suppressing the Church, the press, and democratic dissent and promoting subversion in the region.
text_preceding: Democracy is on the march in Central and South America.
text_following: We support diplomatic efforts, but these efforts can never succeed if the Sandinistas win their war against the Nicaraguan people.

text_original: We support diplomatic efforts, but these efforts can never succeed if the Sandinistas win their war against the Nicaraguan people.
text_preceding: Communist Nicaragua is the odd man out--suppressing the Church, the press, and democratic dissent and promoting subversion in the region.
text_following: Our commitment to a Western Hemisphere safe from aggression did not occur by spontaneous generation on the day that we took office.

text_original: Our commitment to a Western Hemisphere safe from aggression did not occur by spontaneous generation on the day that we took office.
text_preceding: We support diplomatic efforts, but these efforts can never succeed if the Sandinistas win their war against the Nicaraguan people.
text_following: It began with the Monroe Doctrine in 1823 and continues our historic bipartisan American policy.

text_original: It began with the Monroe Doctrine in 1823 and continues our historic bipartisan American policy.
text_preceding: Our commitment to a Western Hemisphere safe from aggression did not occur by spontaneous generation on the day that we took office.
text_following: are determined to do everything possible to maintain peace on this hemisphere.

text_original: are determined to do everything possible to maintain peace on this hemisphere.
text_preceding: It began with the Monroe Doctrine in 1823 and continues our historic bipartisan American policy.
text_following: President Truman was very blunt: International communism seeks to crush and undermine and destroy the independence of the Americans.

text_original: President Truman was very blunt: International communism seeks to crush and undermine and destroy the independence of the Americans.
text_preceding: are determined to do everything possible to maintain peace on this hemisphere.
text_following: We cannot let that happen here.

text_original: We cannot let that happen here.
text_preceding: President Truman was very blunt: International communism seeks to crush and undermine and destroy the independence of the Americans.
text_following: And John F. Kennedy made clear that Communist domination in this hemisphere can never be negotiated.

text_original: And John F. Kennedy made clear that Communist domination in this hemisphere can never be negotiated.
text_preceding: We cannot let that happen here.
text_following: Some in this Congress may choose to depart from this historic commitment, but I will not.

text_original: Some in this Congress may choose to depart from this historic commitment, but I will not.
text_preceding: And John F. Kennedy made clear that Communist domination in this hemisphere can never be negotiated.
text_following: This year we celebrate the second century of our Constitution.

text_original: This year we celebrate the second century of our Constitution.
text_preceding: Some in this Congress may choose to depart from this historic commitment, but I will not.
text_following: The Sandinistas just signed theirs two weeks ago -and then suspended it.

text_preceding: This year we celebrate the second century of our Constitution.
text_following: We won't know how my words tonight will be reported there, for one simple reason: there is no free press in Nicaragua.

text_original: We won't know how my words tonight will be reported there, for one simple reason: there is no free press in Nicaragua.
text_preceding: The Sandinistas just signed theirs two weeks ago -and then suspended it.
text_following: Nicaraguan freedom fighters have never asked us to wage their battle, but I will fight and effort to shut off their lifeblood and consign them to death, defeat, or a life without freedom.

text_original: Nicaraguan freedom fighters have never asked us to wage their battle, but I will fight and effort to shut off their lifeblood and consign them to death, defeat, or a life without freedom.
text_preceding: We won't know how my words tonight will be reported there, for one simple reason: there is no free press in Nicaragua.
text_following: There must be no Soviet beachhead in Central America.

text_preceding: Nicaraguan freedom fighters have never asked us to wage their battle, but I will fight and effort to shut off their lifeblood and consign them to death, defeat, or a life without freedom.
text_following: You know, we Americans have always preferred dialogue to conflict, and so we always remain open to more constructive relations with the Soviet Union.

text_original: You know, we Americans have always preferred dialogue to conflict, and so we always remain open to more constructive relations with the Soviet Union.
text_preceding: There must be no Soviet beachhead in Central America.
text_following: But more responsible Soviet conduct around the world is a key element of the U.S. -Soviet agenda.

text_original: But more responsible Soviet conduct around the world is a key element of the U.S. -Soviet agenda.
text_preceding: You know, we Americans have always preferred dialogue to conflict, and so we always remain open to more constructive relations with the Soviet Union.
text_following: Progress is also required on the other items of our agenda as well real respect for human rights, and more open contacts between our societies, and, of course, arms reduction.

text_original: Progress is also required on the other items of our agenda as well real respect for human rights, and more open contacts between our societies, and, of course, arms reduction.
text_preceding: But more responsible Soviet conduct around the world is a key element of the U.S. -Soviet agenda.
text_following: In Iceland last October, we had one moment of opportunity that the Soviets dashed because they sought to cripple our Strategic Defense Initiative--SDI.

text_original: In Iceland last October, we had one moment of opportunity that the Soviets dashed because they sought to cripple our Strategic Defense Initiative--SDI.
text_preceding: Progress is also required on the other items of our agenda as well real respect for human rights, and more open contacts between our societies, and, of course, arms reduction.
text_following: I wouldn't let them do it then.

text_original: I wouldn't let them do it then.
text_preceding: In Iceland last October, we had one moment of opportunity that the Soviets dashed because they sought to cripple our Strategic Defense Initiative--SDI.
text_following: I won't let them do it now or in the future.

text_original: I won't let them do it now or in the future.
text_preceding: I wouldn't let them do it then.
text_following: This is the most positive and promising defense program we have undertaken.

text_original: This is the most positive and promising defense program we have undertaken.
text_preceding: I won't let them do it now or in the future.
text_following: It's the path for both sides--to a safer future;

text_original: It's the path for both sides--to a safer future;
text_preceding: This is the most positive and promising defense program we have undertaken.
text_following: a system that defends human life instead of threatening it.

text_preceding: It's the path for both sides--to a safer future;
text_following: The United States has made serious, fair, and far-reaching proposals to the Soviet Union, and this is a moment of rare opportunity for arms reduction.

text_original: The United States has made serious, fair, and far-reaching proposals to the Soviet Union, and this is a moment of rare opportunity for arms reduction.

text_following: But I will need, and American negotiators in Geneva will need Congress' support.

text_following: Enacting the Soviet negotiating position into American law would not be the way to win a good agreement.

text_original: Enacting the Soviet negotiating position into American law would not be the way to win a good agreement.
text_preceding: But I will need, and American negotiators in Geneva will need Congress' support.
text_following: So I must tell you in this Congress I will veto any effort that undercuts our national security and our negotiating leverage.

text_original: So I must tell you in this Congress I will veto any effort that undercuts our national security and our negotiating leverage.
