text_following: Now, today, we also find ourselves engaged in expanding peaceful commerce across the world.

text_original: Now, today, we also find ourselves engaged in expanding peaceful commerce across the world.
text_preceding: So I must tell you in this Congress I will veto any effort that undercuts our national security and our negotiating leverage.
text_following: We will work to expand our opportunities in international markets through the Uruguay round of trade negotiations and to complete an historic free trade arrangement between the world's two largest trading partners--Canada and the United States.

text_original: We will work to expand our opportunities in international markets through the Uruguay round of trade negotiations and to complete an historic free trade arrangement between the world's two largest trading partners--Canada and the United States.
text_preceding: Now, today, we also find ourselves engaged in expanding peaceful commerce across the world.
text_following: Our basic trade policy remains the same: we remain opposed as ever to protectionism because America's growth and future depend on trade.

text_original: Our basic trade policy remains the same: we remain opposed as ever to protectionism because America's growth and future depend on trade.
text_preceding: We will work to expand our opportunities in international markets through the Uruguay round of trade negotiations and to complete an historic free trade arrangement between the world's two largest trading partners--Canada and the United States.
text_following: But we would insist on trade that is fair and free.

text_original: But we would insist on trade that is fair and free.
text_preceding: Our basic trade policy remains the same: we remain opposed as ever to protectionism because America's growth and future depend on trade.
text_following: We are always willing to be trade partners but never trade patsies.

text_original: We are always willing to be trade partners but never trade patsies.
text_preceding: But we would insist on trade that is fair and free.
text_following: Now from foreign borders, let us return to our own because America in the world is only as strong as America at home.

text_original: Now from foreign borders, let us return to our own because America in the world is only as strong as America at home.
text_preceding: We are always willing to be trade partners but never trade patsies.
text_following: This 100th Congress has high responsibilities.

text_original: This 100th Congress has high responsibilities.
text_preceding: Now from foreign borders, let us return to our own because America in the world is only as strong as America at home.
text_following: I begin with a gentle reminder that many of these are simply the incomplete obligations of the past.

text_original: I begin with a gentle reminder that many of these are simply the incomplete obligations of the past.
text_preceding: This 100th Congress has high responsibilities.
text_following: The American people deserve to be impatient because we do not yet have the public house in order.

text_original: The American people deserve to be impatient because we do not yet have the public house in order.
text_preceding: I begin with a gentle reminder that many of these are simply the incomplete obligations of the past.
text_following: We've had great success in restoring our economic integrity, and we've rescued our nation from the worst economic mess since the Depression.

text_original: We've had great success in restoring our economic integrity, and we've rescued our nation from the worst economic mess since the Depression.
text_preceding: The American people deserve to be impatient because we do not yet have the public house in order.
text_following: For starters, the federal deficit is outrageous.

text_original: For starters, the federal deficit is outrageous.
text_preceding: We've had great success in restoring our economic integrity, and we've rescued our nation from the worst economic mess since the Depression.
text_following: For years I've asked that we stop pushing onto our children the excesses of our government.

text_original: For years I've asked that we stop pushing onto our children the excesses of our government.
text_preceding: For starters, the federal deficit is outrageous.
text_following: And what the Congress finally needs to do is pass a constitutional amendment that mandates a balanced budget--and forces government to live within its means.

text_original: And what the Congress finally needs to do is pass a constitutional amendment that mandates a balanced budget--and forces government to live within its means.
text_preceding: For years I've asked that we stop pushing onto our children the excesses of our government.
text_following: States, cities, and the families of America balance their budgets.

text_original: States, cities, and the families of America balance their budgets.
text_preceding: And what the Congress finally needs to do is pass a constitutional amendment that mandates a balanced budget--and forces government to live within its means.
text_following: Next--the budget process is a sorry spectacle.

text_original: Next--the budget process is a sorry spectacle.
text_preceding: States, cities, and the families of America balance their budgets.
text_following: The missing of deadlines and the nightmare of monstrous continuing resolutions packing hundreds of billions of dollars of spending into one bill must be stopped.

text_original: The missing of deadlines and the nightmare of monstrous continuing resolutions packing hundreds of billions of dollars of spending into one bill must be stopped.
text_preceding: Next--the budget process is a sorry spectacle.
text_following: We ask the Congress, once again: Give us the same tool that 43 Governors have--a line-item veto so we can carve out the boondoggles and pork--those items that would never survive on their own.

text_original: We ask the Congress, once again: Give us the same tool that 43 Governors have--a line-item veto so we can carve out the boondoggles and pork--those items that would never survive on their own.
text_preceding: The missing of deadlines and the nightmare of monstrous continuing resolutions packing hundreds of billions of dollars of spending into one bill must be stopped.
text_following: I will send the Congress broad recommendations on the budget, but first I'd like to see yours.

text_original: I will send the Congress broad recommendations on the budget, but first I'd like to see yours.
text_preceding: We ask the Congress, once again: Give us the same tool that 43 Governors have--a line-item veto so we can carve out the boondoggles and pork--those items that would never survive on their own.
text_following: Let's go to work and get this done together.

text_original: Let's go to work and get this done together.
text_preceding: I will send the Congress broad recommendations on the budget, but first I'd like to see yours.
text_following: But now, let's talk about this year's budget.

text_original: But now, let's talk about this year's budget.
text_preceding: Let's go to work and get this done together.
text_following: Even though I have submitted it within the Gramm-Rudman-Hollings deficit reduction target, I have seen suggestions that we might postpone that timetable.

text_original: Even though I have submitted it within the Gramm-Rudman-Hollings deficit reduction target, I have seen suggestions that we might postpone that timetable.
text_preceding: But now, let's talk about this year's budget.
text_following: Well, I think the American people are tired of hearing the same old excuses.

text_original: Well, I think the American people are tired of hearing the same old excuses.
text_preceding: Even though I have submitted it within the Gramm-Rudman-Hollings deficit reduction target, I have seen suggestions that we might postpone that timetable.
text_following: Together, we made a commitment to balance the budget: now, let's keep it.

text_original: Together, we made a commitment to balance the budget: now, let's keep it.
text_preceding: Well, I think the American people are tired of hearing the same old excuses.
text_following: As for those suggestions that the answer is higher taxes, the American people have repeatedly rejected that shopworn advice.

text_original: As for those suggestions that the answer is higher taxes, the American people have repeatedly rejected that shopworn advice.
text_preceding: Together, we made a commitment to balance the budget: now, let's keep it.
text_following: They know that we don't have deficits because people are taxed too little; we have deficits because big government spends too much.

text_original: They know that we don't have deficits because people are taxed too little; we have deficits because big government spends too much.
text_preceding: As for those suggestions that the answer is higher taxes, the American people have repeatedly rejected that shopworn advice.
text_following: Now, next month, next month, I'll place two additional reforms before the Congress.

text_original: Now, next month, next month, I'll place two additional reforms before the Congress.
text_preceding: They know that we don't have deficits because people are taxed too little; we have deficits because big government spends too much.
text_following: We've created a welfare monster that is a shocking indictment of our sense of priorities.

text_original: We've created a welfare monster that is a shocking indictment of our sense of priorities.
text_preceding: Now, next month, next month, I'll place two additional reforms before the Congress.
text_following: Our national welfare system consists of some 59 major programs and over 6,000 pages of federal laws and regulations on which more than $132 billion was spent in 1985.

text_original: Our national welfare system consists of some 59 major programs and over 6,000 pages of federal laws and regulations on which more than $132 billion was spent in 1985.
text_preceding: We've created a welfare monster that is a shocking indictment of our sense of priorities.
text_following: I will propose a new national welfare strategy--a program of welfare reform through state-sponsored, community-based demonstration projects.

text_original: I will propose a new national welfare strategy--a program of welfare reform through state-sponsored, community-based demonstration projects.
text_preceding: Our national welfare system consists of some 59 major programs and over 6,000 pages of federal laws and regulations on which more than $132 billion was spent in 1985.
text_following: This is the time to reform this outmoded social dinosaur and finally break the poverty trap.

text_original: This is the time to reform this outmoded social dinosaur and finally break the poverty trap.
text_preceding: I will propose a new national welfare strategy--a program of welfare reform through state-sponsored, community-based demonstration projects.
text_following: Now, we will never abandon those who, through no fault of their own, must have our help.

text_original: Now, we will never abandon those who, through no fault of their own, must have our help.
text_preceding: This is the time to reform this outmoded social dinosaur and finally break the poverty trap.
text_following: But let us work to see how many can be freed from the dependency of welfare and made self-supporting, which the great majority of welfare recipients want more than anything else.

text_original: But let us work to see how many can be freed from the dependency of welfare and made self-supporting, which the great majority of welfare recipients want more than anything else.
text_preceding: Now, we will never abandon those who, through no fault of their own, must have our help.
text_following: Next, let us remove a financial specter facing our older Americans--the fear of an illness so expensive that it can result in having to make an intolerable choice between bankruptcy and death.

text_original: Next, let us remove a financial specter facing our older Americans--the fear of an illness so expensive that it can result in having to make an intolerable choice between bankruptcy and death.
text_preceding: But let us work to see how many can be freed from the dependency of welfare and made self-supporting, which the great majority of welfare recipients want more than anything else.
text_following: I will submit legislation shortly to help free the elderly from the fear of catastrophic illness.

text_original: I will submit legislation shortly to help free the elderly from the fear of catastrophic illness.
text_preceding: Next, let us remove a financial specter facing our older Americans--the fear of an illness so expensive that it can result in having to make an intolerable choice between bankruptcy and death.
text_following: Now, let's turn to the future.

text_original: Now, let's turn to the future.
text_preceding: I will submit legislation shortly to help free the elderly from the fear of catastrophic illness.
text_following: It's widely said that America is losing her competitive edge.

text_original: It's widely said that America is losing her competitive edge.
text_preceding: Now, let's turn to the future.
text_following: Well, that won't happen if we act now.

text_original: Well, that won't happen if we act now.
text_preceding: It's widely said that America is losing her competitive edge.
text_following: How well prepared are we to enter the 21st century?

text_original: How well prepared are we to enter the 21st century?
text_preceding: Well, that won't happen if we act now.
text_following: In my lifetime, America set the standard for the world.

text_original: In my lifetime, America set the standard for the world.
text_preceding: How well prepared are we to enter the 21st century?
text_following: It is now time to determine that we should enter the next century having achieved a level of excellence unsurpassed in history.

text_original: It is now time to determine that we should enter the next century having achieved a level of excellence unsurpassed in history.
text_preceding: In my lifetime, America set the standard for the world.
text_following: We will achieve this first, by guaranteeing that government does everything possible to promote America's ability to compete.

text_original: We will achieve this first, by guaranteeing that government does everything possible to promote America's ability to compete.
text_preceding: It is now time to determine that we should enter the next century having achieved a level of excellence unsurpassed in history.
text_following: Second, we must act as individuals in a quest for excellence that will not be measured by new proposals or billions in new funding.

text_original: Second, we must act as individuals in a quest for excellence that will not be measured by new proposals or billions in new funding.
text_preceding: We will achieve this first, by guaranteeing that government does everything possible to promote America's ability to compete.
text_following: Rather, it involves an expenditure of American spirit and just plain American grit.

text_original: Rather, it involves an expenditure of American spirit and just plain American grit.
text_preceding: Second, we must act as individuals in a quest for excellence that will not be measured by new proposals or billions in new funding.
text_following: The Congress will soon receive my comprehensive proposals to enhance our competitiveness--including new science and technology centers and strong new funding for basic research.

text_original: The Congress will soon receive my comprehensive proposals to enhance our competitiveness--including new science and technology centers and strong new funding for basic research.
text_preceding: Rather, it involves an expenditure of American spirit and just plain American grit.
text_following: The bill will include legal and regulatory reforms and weapons to fight unfair trade practices.

text_original: The bill will include legal and regulatory reforms and weapons to fight unfair trade practices.
text_preceding: The Congress will soon receive my comprehensive proposals to enhance our competitiveness--including new science and technology centers and strong new funding for basic research.
text_following: Competitiveness also means giving our farmers a shot at participating fairly and fully in a changing world market.

text_original: Competitiveness also means giving our farmers a shot at participating fairly and fully in a changing world market.
text_preceding: The bill will include legal and regulatory reforms and weapons to fight unfair trade practices.
text_following: Preparing for the future must begin, as always, with our children.

text_original: Preparing for the future must begin, as always, with our children.
text_preceding: Competitiveness also means giving our farmers a shot at participating fairly and fully in a changing world market.
text_following: We need to set for them new and more rigorous goals.

text_original: We need to set for them new and more rigorous goals.
text_preceding: Preparing for the future must begin, as always, with our children.
text_following: We must demand more of ourselves and our children by raising literacy levels dramatically by the year 2000.

text_original: We must demand more of ourselves and our children by raising literacy levels dramatically by the year 2000.
text_preceding: We need to set for them new and more rigorous goals.
text_following: Our children should master the basic concepts of math and science, and let's insist that students not leave high school until they have studied and understood the basic documents of our national heritage.

text_original: Our children should master the basic concepts of math and science, and let's insist that students not leave high school until they have studied and understood the basic documents of our national heritage.
text_preceding: We must demand more of ourselves and our children by raising literacy levels dramatically by the year 2000.
text_following: There's one more thing we can't let up on.

text_original: There's one more thing we can't let up on.
text_preceding: Our children should master the basic concepts of math and science, and let's insist that students not leave high school until they have studied and understood the basic documents of our national heritage.
text_following: Let's redouble our personal efforts to provide for every child a safe and drug-free learning environment.

text_original: Let's redouble our personal efforts to provide for every child a safe and drug-free learning environment.
text_preceding: There's one more thing we can't let up on.
text_following: If our crusade against drugs succeeds with our children, we will defeat that scourge all over the country.

text_original: If our crusade against drugs succeeds with our children, we will defeat that scourge all over the country.
text_preceding: Let's redouble our personal efforts to provide for every child a safe and drug-free learning environment.
text_following: Finally, let's stop suppressing the spiritual core of our national being.

text_original: Finally, let's stop suppressing the spiritual core of our national being.
text_preceding: If our crusade against drugs succeeds with our children, we will defeat that scourge all over the country.
text_following: Our nation could not have been conceived without divine help.

text_original: Our nation could not have been conceived without divine help.
text_preceding: Finally, let's stop suppressing the spiritual core of our national being.
text_following: Why is it that we can build a nation with our prayers but we can't use a schoolroom for voluntary prayer?

text_original: Why is it that we can build a nation with our prayers but we can't use a schoolroom for voluntary prayer?
text_preceding: Our nation could not have been conceived without divine help.
text_following: The 100th Congress of the United States should be remembered as the one that ended the expulsion of God from America's classrooms.

text_original: The 100th Congress of the United States should be remembered as the one that ended the expulsion of God from America's classrooms.
text_preceding: Why is it that we can build a nation with our prayers but we can't use a schoolroom for voluntary prayer?
text_following: The quest for excellence into the 21st century begins in the schoolroom but must go next to the workplace.

text_original: The quest for excellence into the 21st century begins in the schoolroom but must go next to the workplace.
text_preceding: The 100th Congress of the United States should be remembered as the one that ended the expulsion of God from America's classrooms.
text_following: More than 20 million new jobs will be created before the new century unfolds, and, by then, our economy should be able to provide a job for everyone who wants to work.

text_original: More than 20 million new jobs will be created before the new century unfolds, and, by then, our economy should be able to provide a job for everyone who wants to work.
text_preceding: The quest for excellence into the 21st century begins in the schoolroom but must go next to the workplace.
text_following: We must also enable our workers to adapt to the rapidly changing nature of the workplace, and I will propose substantial new federal commitments keyed to re-training and Job mobility.

text_original: We must also enable our workers to adapt to the rapidly changing nature of the workplace, and I will propose substantial new federal commitments keyed to re-training and Job mobility.
text_preceding: More than 20 million new jobs will be created before the new century unfolds, and, by then, our economy should be able to provide a job for everyone who wants to work.
text_following: Over the next few weeks, I will be sending the Congress a complete series of these special messages--on budget reform, welfare reform, competitiveness, including education, trade, worker training and assistance, agriculture, and other subjects.

text_original: Over the next few weeks, I will be sending the Congress a complete series of these special messages--on budget reform, welfare reform, competitiveness, including education, trade, worker training and assistance, agriculture, and other subjects.
text_preceding: We must also enable our workers to adapt to the rapidly changing nature of the workplace, and I will propose substantial new federal commitments keyed to re-training and Job mobility.
text_following: The Congress can give us these tools, but to make these tools work, it really comes down to just being our best, and that is the core of American greatness.

text_original: The Congress can give us these tools, but to make these tools work, it really comes down to just being our best, and that is the core of American greatness.
text_preceding: Over the next few weeks, I will be sending the Congress a complete series of these special messages--on budget reform, welfare reform, competitiveness, including education, trade, worker training and assistance, agriculture, and other subjects.
text_following: The responsibility of freedom presses us towards higher knowledge and, I believe, moral and spiritual greatness.

text_original: The responsibility of freedom presses us towards higher knowledge and, I believe, moral and spiritual greatness.
text_preceding: The Congress can give us these tools, but to make these tools work, it really comes down to just being our best, and that is the core of American greatness.
text_following: Through lower taxes and smaller government, government has its ways of freeing people's spirits.

text_original: Through lower taxes and smaller government, government has its ways of freeing people's spirits.
text_preceding: The responsibility of freedom presses us towards higher knowledge and, I believe, moral and spiritual greatness.
text_following: But only we, each of us, can let the spirit soar against our own individual standards.

text_original: But only we, each of us, can let the spirit soar against our own individual standards.
text_preceding: Through lower taxes and smaller government, government has its ways of freeing people's spirits.
text_following: Excellence is what makes freedom ring.

text_original: Excellence is what makes freedom ring.
text_preceding: But only we, each of us, can let the spirit soar against our own individual standards.
text_following: And isn't that what we do best?

text_original: And isn't that what we do best?
text_preceding: Excellence is what makes freedom ring.
text_following: We're entering our third century now, but it's wrong to judge our nation by its Years.

text_original: We're entering our third century now, but it's wrong to judge our nation by its Years.
text_preceding: And isn't that what we do best?
text_following: The calendar can't measure America because we were meant to be an endless experiment in freedom with no limit to our reaches, no boundaries to what we can do, no end point to our hopes.

text_original: The calendar can't measure America because we were meant to be an endless experiment in freedom with no limit to our reaches, no boundaries to what we can do, no end point to our hopes.
text_preceding: We're entering our third century now, but it's wrong to judge our nation by its Years.
text_following: The United States Constitution is the impassioned and inspired vehicle by which we travel through history.

text_original: The United States Constitution is the impassioned and inspired vehicle by which we travel through history.
text_preceding: The calendar can't measure America because we were meant to be an endless experiment in freedom with no limit to our reaches, no boundaries to what we can do, no end point to our hopes.
text_following: It grew out of the most fundamental inspiration of our existence: that we are here to serve Him by living free--that living free releases in us the noblest of impulses and the best of our abilities.

text_original: It grew out of the most fundamental inspiration of our existence: that we are here to serve Him by living free--that living free releases in us the noblest of impulses and the best of our abilities.
text_preceding: The United States Constitution is the impassioned and inspired vehicle by which we travel through history.
text_following: That we would use these gifts for good and generous purposes and would secure them not just for ourselves, and for our children, but for all mankind.

text_original: That we would use these gifts for good and generous purposes and would secure them not just for ourselves, and for our children, but for all mankind.
text_preceding: It grew out of the most fundamental inspiration of our existence: that we are here to serve Him by living free--that living free releases in us the noblest of impulses and the best of our abilities.
text_following: Over the years--I won't count if you don't nothing has been so heartwarming to me as speaking to America's young.

text_original: Over the years--I won't count if you don't nothing has been so heartwarming to me as speaking to America's young.
text_preceding: That we would use these gifts for good and generous purposes and would secure them not just for ourselves, and for our children, but for all mankind.
text_following: And the little ones especially so fresh-faced and so eager to know -well, from time to time I've been with them, they will ask about our Constitution, and I hope you Members of Congress will not deem this a breach of protocol if you'll permit me to share these thoughts again with the young people who might be listening or watching this evening.

text_original: And the little ones especially so fresh-faced and so eager to know -well, from time to time I've been with them, they will ask about our Constitution, and I hope you Members of Congress will not deem this a breach of protocol if you'll permit me to share these thoughts again with the young people who might be listening or watching this evening.
text_preceding: Over the years--I won't count if you don't nothing has been so heartwarming to me as speaking to America's young.
text_following: I have read the constitutions of a number of countries including the Soviet Union's.

text_original: I have read the constitutions of a number of countries including the Soviet Union's.
text_preceding: And the little ones especially so fresh-faced and so eager to know -well, from time to time I've been with them, they will ask about our Constitution, and I hope you Members of Congress will not deem this a breach of protocol if you'll permit me to share these thoughts again with the young people who might be listening or watching this evening.
text_following: Now some people are surprised to hear that they have a constitution, and it even supposedly grants a number of freedoms to its people.

text_original: Now some people are surprised to hear that they have a constitution, and it even supposedly grants a number of freedoms to its people.
text_preceding: I have read the constitutions of a number of countries including the Soviet Union's.
text_following: Many countries have written into their constitution provisions for freedom of speech and freedom of assembly.

text_original: Many countries have written into their constitution provisions for freedom of speech and freedom of assembly.
text_preceding: Now some people are surprised to hear that they have a constitution, and it even supposedly grants a number of freedoms to its people.
text_following: Well, if this is true, why is the Constitution of the United States so exceptional?

text_original: Well, if this is true, why is the Constitution of the United States so exceptional?
text_preceding: Many countries have written into their constitution provisions for freedom of speech and freedom of assembly.
text_following: Well, the difference is so small that it almost escapes you - but it's so great it tells you the whole story in just three words: We the people.

text_original: Well, the difference is so small that it almost escapes you - but it's so great it tells you the whole story in just three words: We the people.
text_preceding: Well, if this is true, why is the Constitution of the United States so exceptional?
text_following: In those other constitutions, the government tells the people of those countries what they are allowed to do.

text_original: In those other constitutions, the government tells the people of those countries what they are allowed to do.
text_preceding: Well, the difference is so small that it almost escapes you - but it's so great it tells you the whole story in just three words: We the people.
text_following: In our Constitution, we the people tell the government what it can do and that it can do only those things listed in that document and no others.

text_original: In our Constitution, we the people tell the government what it can do and that it can do only those things listed in that document and no others.
text_preceding: In those other constitutions, the government tells the people of those countries what they are allowed to do.
text_following: Virtually every other revolution in history has just exchanged one set of rulers for another set of rulers.

text_original: Virtually every other revolution in history has just exchanged one set of rulers for another set of rulers.
text_preceding: In our Constitution, we the people tell the government what it can do and that it can do only those things listed in that document and no others.
text_following: Our revolution is the first to say the people are the masters, and government is their servant.

text_original: Our revolution is the first to say the people are the masters, and government is their servant.
text_preceding: Virtually every other revolution in history has just exchanged one set of rulers for another set of rulers.
text_following: And you young people out there, don't ever forget that.

text_original: And you young people out there, don't ever forget that.
text_preceding: Our revolution is the first to say the people are the masters, and government is their servant.
text_following: Some day, you could be in this room--but wherever you are, America is depending on you to reach your highest and be your best because here, in America, we the people are in charge.

text_original: Some day, you could be in this room--but wherever you are, America is depending on you to reach your highest and be your best because here, in America, we the people are in charge.
text_preceding: And you young people out there, don't ever forget that.
text_following: Those are the kids on Christmas Day looking out from a frozen sentry post on the 38th Parallel in Korea, or aboard an aircraft carrier in the Mediterranean.

text_original: Those are the kids on Christmas Day looking out from a frozen sentry post on the 38th Parallel in Korea, or aboard an aircraft carrier in the Mediterranean.
text_preceding: Some day, you could be in this room--but wherever you are, America is depending on you to reach your highest and be your best because here, in America, we the people are in charge.
text_following: Those are the warm-hearted whose numbers we can't begin to count who'll begin the day with a little prayer for hostages they will never know and MIA families they will never meet.

text_original: Those are the warm-hearted whose numbers we can't begin to count who'll begin the day with a little prayer for hostages they will never know and MIA families they will never meet.
text_preceding: Those are the kids on Christmas Day looking out from a frozen sentry post on the 38th Parallel in Korea, or aboard an aircraft carrier in the Mediterranean.
text_following: Because that's the way we are, this unique breed we call Americans.

text_original: Because that's the way we are, this unique breed we call Americans.
text_preceding: Those are the warm-hearted whose numbers we can't begin to count who'll begin the day with a little prayer for hostages they will never know and MIA families they will never meet.
text_following: They're farmers on tough times, but who never stop feeding a hungry world.

text_original: They're farmers on tough times, but who never stop feeding a hungry world.
text_preceding: Because that's the way we are, this unique breed we call Americans.
text_following: They're the volunteers at the hospital choking back their tears for the hundredth time, caring for a baby struggling for life because of a mother who used drugs.

text_original: They're the volunteers at the hospital choking back their tears for the hundredth time, caring for a baby struggling for life because of a mother who used drugs.
text_preceding: They're farmers on tough times, but who never stop feeding a hungry world.
text_following: And you'll forgive me a special memory--it's a million mothers like Nelle Reagan who never knew a stranger or turned a hungry person away from her kitchen door.

text_original: And you'll forgive me a special memory--it's a million mothers like Nelle Reagan who never knew a stranger or turned a hungry person away from her kitchen door.
text_preceding: They're the volunteers at the hospital choking back their tears for the hundredth time, caring for a baby struggling for life because of a mother who used drugs.
text_following: They refute last week's television commentary downgrading our optimism and our idealism.

text_original: They refute last week's television commentary downgrading our optimism and our idealism.
text_preceding: And you'll forgive me a special memory--it's a million mothers like Nelle Reagan who never knew a stranger or turned a hungry person away from her kitchen door.
text_following: They are the entrepreneurs, the builders, the pioneers, and a lot of regular folks the true heroes of our land who make up the most uncommon nation of doers in history.

text_original: They are the entrepreneurs, the builders, the pioneers, and a lot of regular folks the true heroes of our land who make up the most uncommon nation of doers in history.
text_preceding: They refute last week's television commentary downgrading our optimism and our idealism.
text_following: You know they're Americans because their spirit is as big as the universe and their hearts are bigger than their spirits.

text_original: You know they're Americans because their spirit is as big as the universe and their hearts are bigger than their spirits.
text_preceding: They are the entrepreneurs, the builders, the pioneers, and a lot of regular folks the true heroes of our land who make up the most uncommon nation of doers in history.
text_following: Starting the third century of a dream and standing up to some cynic who's trying to tell us we're not going to get any better.

text_original: Starting the third century of a dream and standing up to some cynic who's trying to tell us we're not going to get any better.
text_preceding: You know they're Americans because their spirit is as big as the universe and their hearts are bigger than their spirits.
text_following: Well, I can't tell it any better than the real thing--a story recorded by James Madison from the final moments of the Constitutional Convention--September 17th, 1787.

text_original: Well, I can't tell it any better than the real thing--a story recorded by James Madison from the final moments of the Constitutional Convention--September 17th, 1787.
text_preceding: Starting the third century of a dream and standing up to some cynic who's trying to tell us we're not going to get any better.
text_following: As the last few members signed the document, Benjamin Franklin--the oldest delegate at 81 years, and in frail health--looked over toward the chair where George Washington daily presided.

text_original: As the last few members signed the document, Benjamin Franklin--the oldest delegate at 81 years, and in frail health--looked over toward the chair where George Washington daily presided.
text_preceding: Well, I can't tell it any better than the real thing--a story recorded by James Madison from the final moments of the Constitutional Convention--September 17th, 1787.
text_following: At the back of the chair was painted the picture of a sun on the horizon.

text_original: At the back of the chair was painted the picture of a sun on the horizon.
text_preceding: As the last few members signed the document, Benjamin Franklin--the oldest delegate at 81 years, and in frail health--looked over toward the chair where George Washington daily presided.
text_following: And turning to those sitting next to him, Franklin observed that artists found it difficult in their painting to distinguish between a rising and a setting sun.

text_original: And turning to those sitting next to him, Franklin observed that artists found it difficult in their painting to distinguish between a rising and a setting sun.
text_preceding: At the back of the chair was painted the picture of a sun on the horizon.
text_following: Well, I know if we were there, we could see those delegates sitting around Franklin--leaning in to listen more closely to him.

text_original: Well, I know if we were there, we could see those delegates sitting around Franklin--leaning in to listen more closely to him.
text_preceding: And turning to those sitting next to him, Franklin observed that artists found it difficult in their painting to distinguish between a rising and a setting sun.
text_following: I have often looked at that picture behind the President without being able to tell whether it was a rising or setting Sun: But now at length I have the happiness to know that it is a rising and not a setting Sun.

text_original: I have often looked at that picture behind the President without being able to tell whether it was a rising or setting Sun: But now at length I have the happiness to know that it is a rising and not a setting Sun.
text_preceding: Well, I know if we were there, we could see those delegates sitting around Franklin--leaning in to listen more closely to him.
text_following: Well, you can bet it's rising, because, my fellow citizens, America isn't finished her best days have just begun.

text_original: Well, you can bet it's rising, because, my fellow citizens, America isn't finished her best days have just begun.
text_preceding: I have often looked at that picture behind the President without being able to tell whether it was a rising or setting Sun: But now at length I have the happiness to know that it is a rising and not a setting Sun.
text_following: Thank you, God bless you and God bless America.

text_original: Thank you, God bless you and God bless America.
text_preceding: Well, you can bet it's rising, because, my fellow citizens, America isn't finished her best days have just begun.

text_original: Mr. Speaker and Mr. President, distinguished Members of Congress, honored guests, and fellow citizens: Thank you very much for that warm reception.
text_following: You know, with the big buildup this address has had, I wanted to make sure it would be a big hit, but I couldn't convince Barbara to deliver it for me.

text_original: You know, with the big buildup this address has had, I wanted to make sure it would be a big hit, but I couldn't convince Barbara to deliver it for me.
text_preceding: Mr. Speaker and Mr. President, distinguished Members of Congress, honored guests, and fellow citizens: Thank you very much for that warm reception.
text_following: I see the Speaker and the Vice President are laughing.

text_original: I see the Speaker and the Vice President are laughing.
text_preceding: You know, with the big buildup this address has had, I wanted to make sure it would be a big hit, but I couldn't convince Barbara to deliver it for me.
text_following: They saw what I did in Japan, and they're just happy they're sitting behind me.

text_original: They saw what I did in Japan, and they're just happy they're sitting behind me.
text_preceding: I see the Speaker and the Vice President are laughing.
text_following: I mean to speak tonight of big things, of big changes and the promises they hold, and of some big problems and how, together, we can solve them and move our country forward as the undisputed leader of the age.

text_original: I mean to speak tonight of big things, of big changes and the promises they hold, and of some big problems and how, together, we can solve them and move our country forward as the undisputed leader of the age.
text_preceding: They saw what I did in Japan, and they're just happy they're sitting behind me.
text_following: We gather tonight at a dramatic and deeply promising time in our history, and in the history of man on Earth.

text_original: We gather tonight at a dramatic and deeply promising time in our history, and in the history of man on Earth.
text_preceding: I mean to speak tonight of big things, of big changes and the promises they hold, and of some big problems and how, together, we can solve them and move our country forward as the undisputed leader of the age.
text_following: For in the past 12 months, the world has known changes of almost Biblical proportions.

text_original: For in the past 12 months, the world has known changes of almost Biblical proportions.
text_preceding: We gather tonight at a dramatic and deeply promising time in our history, and in the history of man on Earth.
text_following: And even now, months after the failed coup that doomed a failed system, I'm not sure we've absorbed the full impact, the full import of what happened.

text_original: And even now, months after the failed coup that doomed a failed system, I'm not sure we've absorbed the full impact, the full import of what happened.
text_preceding: For in the past 12 months, the world has known changes of almost Biblical proportions.
text_following: Even as President, with the most fascinating possible vantage point, there were times when I was so busy managing progress and helping to lead change that I didn't always show the joy that was in my heart.

text_original: Even as President, with the most fascinating possible vantage point, there were times when I was so busy managing progress and helping to lead change that I didn't always show the joy that was in my heart.
text_preceding: And even now, months after the failed coup that doomed a failed system, I'm not sure we've absorbed the full impact, the full import of what happened.
text_following: But the biggest thing that has happened in the world in my life, in our lives, is this: By the grace of God, America won the cold war.

text_original: But the biggest thing that has happened in the world in my life, in our lives, is this: By the grace of God, America won the cold war.
text_preceding: Even as President, with the most fascinating possible vantage point, there were times when I was so busy managing progress and helping to lead change that I didn't always show the joy that was in my heart.
text_following: I mean to speak this evening of the changes that can take place in our country, now that we can stop making the sacrifices we had to make when we had an avowed enemy that was a superpower.

text_original: I mean to speak this evening of the changes that can take place in our country, now that we can stop making the sacrifices we had to make when we had an avowed enemy that was a superpower.
text_preceding: But the biggest thing that has happened in the world in my life, in our lives, is this: By the grace of God, America won the cold war.
text_following: Now we can look homeward even more and move to set right what needs to be set right.

text_original: Now we can look homeward even more and move to set right what needs to be set right.
text_preceding: I mean to speak this evening of the changes that can take place in our country, now that we can stop making the sacrifices we had to make when we had an avowed enemy that was a superpower.
text_following: But let me tell you something I've been thinking these past few months.

text_original: But let me tell you something I've been thinking these past few months.
text_preceding: Now we can look homeward even more and move to set right what needs to be set right.
text_following: It's a kind of rollcall of honor.

text_original: It's a kind of rollcall of honor.
text_preceding: But let me tell you something I've been thinking these past few months.
text_following: And I think of those who won it, in places like Korea and Vietnam.

text_original: And I think of those who won it, in places like Korea and Vietnam.
text_preceding: It's a kind of rollcall of honor.
text_following: And some of them didn't come back.

text_original: And some of them didn't come back.
text_preceding: And I think of those who won it, in places like Korea and Vietnam.
text_following: Back then they were heroes, but this year they were victors.

text_original: Back then they were heroes, but this year they were victors.
text_preceding: And some of them didn't come back.
text_following: The long rollcall, all the G.Joes and Janes, all the ones who fought faithfully for freedom, who hit the ground and sucked the dust and knew their share of horror.

text_original: The long rollcall, all the G.Joes and Janes, all the ones who fought faithfully for freedom, who hit the ground and sucked the dust and knew their share of horror.
text_preceding: Back then they were heroes, but this year they were victors.
text_following: This may seem frivolous, and I don't mean it so, but it's moving to me how the world saw them.

text_original: This may seem frivolous, and I don't mean it so, but it's moving to me how the world saw them.
text_preceding: The long rollcall, all the G.Joes and Janes, all the ones who fought faithfully for freedom, who hit the ground and sucked the dust and knew their share of horror.
text_following: The world saw not only their special valor but their special style: their rambunctious, optimistic bravery, their do-or-die unity unhampered by class or race or region.

text_original: The world saw not only their special valor but their special style: their rambunctious, optimistic bravery, their do-or-die unity unhampered by class or race or region.
text_preceding: This may seem frivolous, and I don't mean it so, but it's moving to me how the world saw them.
text_following: What a group of kids we've sent out into the world.

text_original: What a group of kids we've sent out into the world.
text_preceding: The world saw not only their special valor but their special style: their rambunctious, optimistic bravery, their do-or-die unity unhampered by class or race or region.
text_following: And there's another to be singled out, though it may seem inelegant, and I mean a mass of people called the American taxpayer.

text_original: And there's another to be singled out, though it may seem inelegant, and I mean a mass of people called the American taxpayer.
text_preceding: What a group of kids we've sent out into the world.
text_following: No one ever thinks to thank the people who pay a country's bill or an alliance's bill.

text_original: No one ever thinks to thank the people who pay a country's bill or an alliance's bill.
text_preceding: And there's another to be singled out, though it may seem inelegant, and I mean a mass of people called the American taxpayer.
text_following: But for half a century now, the American people have shouldered the burden and paid taxes that were higher than they would have been to support a defense that was bigger than it would have been if imperial communism had never existed.

text_original: But for half a century now, the American people have shouldered the burden and paid taxes that were higher than they would have been to support a defense that was bigger than it would have been if imperial communism had never existed.
text_preceding: No one ever thinks to thank the people who pay a country's bill or an alliance's bill.
text_following: And here's a fact I wouldn't mind the world acknowledging: The American taxpayer bore the brunt of the burden and deserves a hunk of the glory.

text_original: And here's a fact I wouldn't mind the world acknowledging: The American taxpayer bore the brunt of the burden and deserves a hunk of the glory.
text_preceding: But for half a century now, the American people have shouldered the burden and paid taxes that were higher than they would have been to support a defense that was bigger than it would have been if imperial communism had never existed.
text_following: So now, for the first time in 35 years, our strategic bombers stand down.

text_original: So now, for the first time in 35 years, our strategic bombers stand down.
text_preceding: And here's a fact I wouldn't mind the world acknowledging: The American taxpayer bore the brunt of the burden and deserves a hunk of the glory.
text_following: No longer are they on 'round-the-clock alert.

text_original: No longer are they on 'round-the-clock alert.
text_preceding: So now, for the first time in 35 years, our strategic bombers stand down.
text_following: Tomorrow our children will go to school and study history and how plants grow.

text_original: Tomorrow our children will go to school and study history and how plants grow.
text_preceding: No longer are they on 'round-the-clock alert.
text_following: And they won't have, as my children did, air raid drills in which they crawl under their desks and cover their heads in case of nuclear war.

text_original: And they won't have, as my children did, air raid drills in which they crawl under their desks and cover their heads in case of nuclear war.
text_preceding: Tomorrow our children will go to school and study history and how plants grow.
text_following: My grandchildren don't have to do that and won't have the bad dreams children had once, in decades past.

text_original: My grandchildren don't have to do that and won't have the bad dreams children had once, in decades past.
text_preceding: And they won't have, as my children did, air raid drills in which they crawl under their desks and cover their heads in case of nuclear war.
text_following: But the long, drawn-out dread is over.

text_original: But the long, drawn-out dread is over.
text_preceding: My grandchildren don't have to do that and won't have the bad dreams children had once, in decades past.
text_following: A year ago tonight, I spoke to you at a moment of high peril.

text_original: A year ago tonight, I spoke to you at a moment of high peril.
text_preceding: But the long, drawn-out dread is over.
text_following: American forces had just unleashed Operation Desert Storm.

text_original: American forces had just unleashed Operation Desert Storm.
text_preceding: A year ago tonight, I spoke to you at a moment of high peril.
text_following: And after 40 days in the desert skies and 4 days on the ground, the men and women of America's Armed Forces and our allies accomplished the goals that I declared and that you endorsed: We liberated Kuwait.

text_original: And after 40 days in the desert skies and 4 days on the ground, the men and women of America's Armed Forces and our allies accomplished the goals that I declared and that you endorsed: We liberated Kuwait.
text_preceding: American forces had just unleashed Operation Desert Storm.
text_following: Soon after, the Arab world and Israel sat down to talk seriously and comprehensively about peace, an historic first.

text_original: Soon after, the Arab world and Israel sat down to talk seriously and comprehensively about peace, an historic first.
text_preceding: And after 40 days in the desert skies and 4 days on the ground, the men and women of America's Armed Forces and our allies accomplished the goals that I declared and that you endorsed: We liberated Kuwait.
text_following: And soon after that, at Christmas, the last American hostages came home.

text_original: And soon after that, at Christmas, the last American hostages came home.
text_preceding: Soon after, the Arab world and Israel sat down to talk seriously and comprehensively about peace, an historic first.
text_following: Much good can come from the prudent use of power.

text_original: Much good can come from the prudent use of power.
text_preceding: And soon after that, at Christmas, the last American hostages came home.
text_following: And much good can come of this: A world once divided into two armed camps now recognizes one sole and preeminent power, the United States of America.

text_original: And much good can come of this: A world once divided into two armed camps now recognizes one sole and preeminent power, the United States of America.
text_preceding: Much good can come from the prudent use of power.
text_following: And they regard this with no dread.

text_original: And they regard this with no dread.
text_preceding: And much good can come of this: A world once divided into two armed camps now recognizes one sole and preeminent power, the United States of America.
text_following: For the world trusts us with power, and the world is right.

text_original: For the world trusts us with power, and the world is right.
text_preceding: And they regard this with no dread.
text_following: They trust us to be fair and restrained.

text_original: They trust us to be fair and restrained.
text_preceding: For the world trusts us with power, and the world is right.
text_following: They trust us to be on the side of decency.

text_original: They trust us to be on the side of decency.
text_preceding: They trust us to be fair and restrained.
text_following: They trust us to do what's right.

text_original: They trust us to do what's right.
text_preceding: They trust us to be on the side of decency.
text_following: A few days after the war began, I received a telegram from Joanne Speicher, the wife of the first pilot killed in the Gulf, Lieutenant Commander Scott Speicher.

text_original: A few days after the war began, I received a telegram from Joanne Speicher, the wife of the first pilot killed in the Gulf, Lieutenant Commander Scott Speicher.
text_preceding: They trust us to do what's right.
text_following: Even in her grief, she wanted me to know that some day when her children were old enough, she would tell them ``that their father went away to war because it was the right thing to do.

text_original: Even in her grief, she wanted me to know that some day when her children were old enough, she would tell them ``that their father went away to war because it was the right thing to do.
text_preceding: A few days after the war began, I received a telegram from Joanne Speicher, the wife of the first pilot killed in the Gulf, Lieutenant Commander Scott Speicher.
text_following: And she said it all: It was the right thing to do.

text_original: And she said it all: It was the right thing to do.
text_preceding: Even in her grief, she wanted me to know that some day when her children were old enough, she would tell them ``that their father went away to war because it was the right thing to do.
text_following: There were honest differences right here in this Chamber.

text_original: There were honest differences right here in this Chamber.
text_preceding: And she said it all: It was the right thing to do.
text_following: But when the war began, you put partisanship aside, and we supported our troops.

text_original: But when the war began, you put partisanship aside, and we supported our troops.
text_preceding: There were honest differences right here in this Chamber.
text_following: This is still a time for pride, but this is no time to boast.

text_original: This is still a time for pride, but this is no time to boast.
text_preceding: But when the war began, you put partisanship aside, and we supported our troops.
text_following: For problems face us, and we must stand together once again and solve them and not let our country down.

text_original: For problems face us, and we must stand together once again and solve them and not let our country down.
text_preceding: This is still a time for pride, but this is no time to boast.
text_following: Two years ago, I began planning cuts in military spending that reflected the changes of the new era.

text_original: Two years ago, I began planning cuts in military spending that reflected the changes of the new era.
text_preceding: For problems face us, and we must stand together once again and solve them and not let our country down.
text_following: But now, this year, with imperial communism gone, that process can be accelerated.

text_original: But now, this year, with imperial communism gone, that process can be accelerated.
text_preceding: Two years ago, I began planning cuts in military spending that reflected the changes of the new era.
text_following: Tonight I can tell you of dramatic changes in our strategic nuclear force.

text_original: Tonight I can tell you of dramatic changes in our strategic nuclear force.
text_preceding: But now, this year, with imperial communism gone, that process can be accelerated.
text_following: These are actions we are taking on our own because they are the right thing to do.

text_original: These are actions we are taking on our own because they are the right thing to do.
text_preceding: Tonight I can tell you of dramatic changes in our strategic nuclear force.
text_following: After completing 20 planes for which we have begun procurement, we will shut down further production of the B - 2 bombers.

text_original: After completing 20 planes for which we have begun procurement, we will shut down further production of the B - 2 bombers.
text_preceding: These are actions we are taking on our own because they are the right thing to do.
text_following: We will cancel the small ICBM program.

text_original: We will cancel the small ICBM program.
text_preceding: After completing 20 planes for which we have begun procurement, we will shut down further production of the B - 2 bombers.
text_following: We will cease production of new warheads for our sea-based ballistic missiles.

text_original: We will cease production of new warheads for our sea-based ballistic missiles.
text_preceding: We will cancel the small ICBM program.
text_following: We will stop all new production of the Peacekeeper missile.

text_original: We will stop all new production of the Peacekeeper missile.
text_preceding: We will cease production of new warheads for our sea-based ballistic missiles.
text_following: And we will not purchase any more advanced cruise missiles.

text_original: And we will not purchase any more advanced cruise missiles.
text_preceding: We will stop all new production of the Peacekeeper missile.
text_following: This weekend I will meet at Camp David with Boris Yeltsin of the Russian Federation.

text_original: This weekend I will meet at Camp David with Boris Yeltsin of the Russian Federation.
text_preceding: And we will not purchase any more advanced cruise missiles.
text_following: I've informed President Yeltsin that if the Commonwealth, the former Soviet Union, will eliminate all land-based multiple-warhead ballistic missiles, I will do the following: We will eliminate all Peacekeeper missiles.

text_original: I've informed President Yeltsin that if the Commonwealth, the former Soviet Union, will eliminate all land-based multiple-warhead ballistic missiles, I will do the following: We will eliminate all Peacekeeper missiles.
text_preceding: This weekend I will meet at Camp David with Boris Yeltsin of the Russian Federation.
text_following: We will reduce the number of warheads on Minuteman missiles to one and reduce the number of warheads on our sea-based missiles by about one-third.

text_original: We will reduce the number of warheads on Minuteman missiles to one and reduce the number of warheads on our sea-based missiles by about one-third.
text_preceding: I've informed President Yeltsin that if the Commonwealth, the former Soviet Union, will eliminate all land-based multiple-warhead ballistic missiles, I will do the following: We will eliminate all Peacekeeper missiles.
text_following: And we will convert a substantial portion of our strategic bombers to primarily conventional use.

text_original: And we will convert a substantial portion of our strategic bombers to primarily conventional use.
text_preceding: We will reduce the number of warheads on Minuteman missiles to one and reduce the number of warheads on our sea-based missiles by about one-third.
text_following: President Yeltsin's early response has been very positive, and I expect our talks at Camp David to be fruitful.

text_original: President Yeltsin's early response has been very positive, and I expect our talks at Camp David to be fruitful.
text_preceding: And we will convert a substantial portion of our strategic bombers to primarily conventional use.
text_following: I want you to know that for half a century, American Presidents have longed to make such decisions and say such words.

text_original: I want you to know that for half a century, American Presidents have longed to make such decisions and say such words.
text_preceding: President Yeltsin's early response has been very positive, and I expect our talks at Camp David to be fruitful.
text_following: But even in the midst of celebration, we must keep caution as a friend.

text_original: But even in the midst of celebration, we must keep caution as a friend.
text_preceding: I want you to know that for half a century, American Presidents have longed to make such decisions and say such words.
text_following: For the world is still a dangerous place.

text_original: For the world is still a dangerous place.
text_preceding: But even in the midst of celebration, we must keep caution as a friend.
text_following: Only the dead have seen the end of conflict.

text_original: Only the dead have seen the end of conflict.
text_preceding: For the world is still a dangerous place.
text_following: And though yesterday's challenges are behind us, tomorrow's are being born.

text_original: And though yesterday's challenges are behind us, tomorrow's are being born.
text_preceding: Only the dead have seen the end of conflict.
text_following: The Secretary of Defense recommended these cuts after consultation with the Joint Chiefs of Staff.

text_original: The Secretary of Defense recommended these cuts after consultation with the Joint Chiefs of Staff.
text_preceding: And though yesterday's challenges are behind us, tomorrow's are being born.
text_following: And I make them with confidence.

text_original: And I make them with confidence.
text_preceding: The Secretary of Defense recommended these cuts after consultation with the Joint Chiefs of Staff.
text_following: The reductions I have approved will save us an additional $50 billion over the next 5 years.

text_original: The reductions I have approved will save us an additional $50 billion over the next 5 years.
text_preceding: And I make them with confidence.
text_following: By 1997, we will have cut defense by 30 percent since I took office.

text_original: By 1997, we will have cut defense by 30 percent since I took office.
text_preceding: The reductions I have approved will save us an additional $50 billion over the next 5 years.
text_following: These cuts are deep, and you must know my resolve: This deep, and no deeper.

text_original: These cuts are deep, and you must know my resolve: This deep, and no deeper.
text_preceding: By 1997, we will have cut defense by 30 percent since I took office.
text_following: To do less would be insensible to progress, but to do more would be ignorant of history.

text_original: To do less would be insensible to progress, but to do more would be ignorant of history.
text_preceding: These cuts are deep, and you must know my resolve: This deep, and no deeper.
text_following: We must not go back to the days of ``the hollow army.

text_original: We must not go back to the days of ``the hollow army.
text_preceding: To do less would be insensible to progress, but to do more would be ignorant of history.
text_following: We cannot repeat the mistakes made twice in this century when armistice was followed by recklessness and defense was purged as if the world were permanently safe.

text_original: We cannot repeat the mistakes made twice in this century when armistice was followed by recklessness and defense was purged as if the world were permanently safe.
text_preceding: We must not go back to the days of ``the hollow army.
text_following: I remind you this evening that I have asked for your support in funding a program to protect our country from limited nuclear missile attack.

text_original: I remind you this evening that I have asked for your support in funding a program to protect our country from limited nuclear missile attack.
text_preceding: We cannot repeat the mistakes made twice in this century when armistice was followed by recklessness and defense was purged as if the world were permanently safe.
text_following: We must have this protection because too many people in too many countries have access to nuclear arms.

text_original: We must have this protection because too many people in too many countries have access to nuclear arms.
text_preceding: I remind you this evening that I have asked for your support in funding a program to protect our country from limited nuclear missile attack.
text_following: And I urge you again to pass the Strategic Defense Initiative, SDI.

text_original: And I urge you again to pass the Strategic Defense Initiative, SDI.
text_preceding: We must have this protection because too many people in too many countries have access to nuclear arms.
text_following: There are those who say that now we can turn away from the world, that we have no special role, no special place.

text_original: There are those who say that now we can turn away from the world, that we have no special role, no special place.
text_preceding: And I urge you again to pass the Strategic Defense Initiative, SDI.
text_following: But we are the United States of America, the leader of the West that has become the leader of the world.

text_original: But we are the United States of America, the leader of the West that has become the leader of the world.
text_preceding: There are those who say that now we can turn away from the world, that we have no special role, no special place.
text_following: And as long as I am President, I will continue to lead in support of freedom everywhere, not out of arrogance, not out of altruism, but for the safety and security of our children.

text_original: And as long as I am President, I will continue to lead in support of freedom everywhere, not out of arrogance, not out of altruism, but for the safety and security of our children.
text_preceding: But we are the United States of America, the leader of the West that has become the leader of the world.

text_preceding: And as long as I am President, I will continue to lead in support of freedom everywhere, not out of arrogance, not out of altruism, but for the safety and security of our children.

text_following: And now to our troubles at home.

text_original: And now to our troubles at home.

text_following: the primary problem is our economy.

text_original: the primary problem is our economy.
text_preceding: And now to our troubles at home.
text_following: Inflation, that thief, is down.

text_original: Inflation, that thief, is down.
text_preceding: the primary problem is our economy.
text_following: But unemployment is too high, some industries are in trouble, and growth is not what it should be.

text_original: But unemployment is too high, some industries are in trouble, and growth is not what it should be.
text_preceding: Inflation, that thief, is down.
text_following: Let me tell you right from the start and right from the heart, I know we're in hard times.

text_original: Let me tell you right from the start and right from the heart, I know we're in hard times.
text_preceding: But unemployment is too high, some industries are in trouble, and growth is not what it should be.
text_following: But I know something else: This will not stand.

text_original: But I know something else: This will not stand.
text_preceding: Let me tell you right from the start and right from the heart, I know we're in hard times.
text_following: My friends in this Chamber, in this Chamber we can bring the same courage and sense of common purpose to the economy that we brought to Desert Storm.

text_original: My friends in this Chamber, in this Chamber we can bring the same courage and sense of common purpose to the economy that we brought to Desert Storm.
text_preceding: But I know something else: This will not stand.
text_following: And we can defeat hard times together.

text_original: And we can defeat hard times together.
text_preceding: My friends in this Chamber, in this Chamber we can bring the same courage and sense of common purpose to the economy that we brought to Desert Storm.
text_following: One reason is that you're patriots, and you want the best for your country.

text_original: One reason is that you're patriots, and you want the best for your country.
text_preceding: And we can defeat hard times together.
text_following: And I believe that in your hearts you want to put partisanship aside and get the job done because it's the right thing to do.

text_original: And I believe that in your hearts you want to put partisanship aside and get the job done because it's the right thing to do.
text_preceding: One reason is that you're patriots, and you want the best for your country.
text_following: The power of America rests in a stirring but simple idea, that people will do great things if only you set them free.

text_original: The power of America rests in a stirring but simple idea, that people will do great things if only you set them free.
text_preceding: And I believe that in your hearts you want to put partisanship aside and get the job done because it's the right thing to do.
text_following: Well, we're going to set the economy free.

text_original: Well, we're going to set the economy free.
text_preceding: The power of America rests in a stirring but simple idea, that people will do great things if only you set them free.
text_following: For if this age of miracles and wonders has taught us anything, it's that if we can change the world we can change America.

text_original: For if this age of miracles and wonders has taught us anything, it's that if we can change the world we can change America.
text_preceding: Well, we're going to set the economy free.
text_following: We must make it easier for people to invest money and create new products, new industries, and new jobs.

text_original: We must make it easier for people to invest money and create new products, new industries, and new jobs.
text_preceding: For if this age of miracles and wonders has taught us anything, it's that if we can change the world we can change America.
text_following: We must clear away the obstacles to growth: high taxes, high regulation, red tape, and yes, wasteful Government spending.

text_original: We must clear away the obstacles to growth: high taxes, high regulation, red tape, and yes, wasteful Government spending.
text_preceding: We must make it easier for people to invest money and create new products, new industries, and new jobs.
text_following: None of this will happen with a snap of the fingers, but it will happen.

text_original: None of this will happen with a snap of the fingers, but it will happen.
text_preceding: We must clear away the obstacles to growth: high taxes, high regulation, red tape, and yes, wasteful Government spending.
text_following: And the test of a plan isn't whether it's called new or dazzling.

text_original: And the test of a plan isn't whether it's called new or dazzling.
text_preceding: None of this will happen with a snap of the fingers, but it will happen.
text_following: The American people aren't impressed by gimmicks;

text_original: The American people aren't impressed by gimmicks;
text_preceding: And the test of a plan isn't whether it's called new or dazzling.
text_following: they're smarter on this score than all of us in this room.

text_preceding: The American people aren't impressed by gimmicks;
text_following: The only test of a plan is: Is it sound, and will it work?

text_original: The only test of a plan is: Is it sound, and will it work?
text_preceding: they're smarter on this score than all of us in this room.
text_following: We must have a short-term plan to address our immediate needs and heat up the economy.

text_original: We must have a short-term plan to address our immediate needs and heat up the economy.
text_preceding: The only test of a plan is: Is it sound, and will it work?
text_following: And then we need a longer term plan to keep combustion going and to guarantee our place in the world economy.

text_original: And then we need a longer term plan to keep combustion going and to guarantee our place in the world economy.
text_preceding: We must have a short-term plan to address our immediate needs and heat up the economy.
text_following: There are certain things that a President can do without Congress, and I'm going to do them.

text_original: There are certain things that a President can do without Congress, and I'm going to do them.
text_preceding: And then we need a longer term plan to keep combustion going and to guarantee our place in the world economy.
text_following: I have, this evening, asked major Cabinet departments and Federal agencies to institute a 90-day moratorium on any new Federal regulations that could hinder growth.

text_original: I have, this evening, asked major Cabinet departments and Federal agencies to institute a 90-day moratorium on any new Federal regulations that could hinder growth.
text_preceding: There are certain things that a President can do without Congress, and I'm going to do them.
text_following: In those 90 days, major departments and agencies will carry out a top-to-bottom review of all regulations, old and new, to stop the ones that will hurt growth and speed up those that will help growth.

text_original: In those 90 days, major departments and agencies will carry out a top-to-bottom review of all regulations, old and new, to stop the ones that will hurt growth and speed up those that will help growth.
text_preceding: I have, this evening, asked major Cabinet departments and Federal agencies to institute a 90-day moratorium on any new Federal regulations that could hinder growth.
text_following: I have directed Cabinet departments and Federal agencies to speed up progrowth expenditures as quickly as possible.

text_original: I have directed Cabinet departments and Federal agencies to speed up progrowth expenditures as quickly as possible.
text_preceding: In those 90 days, major departments and agencies will carry out a top-to-bottom review of all regulations, old and new, to stop the ones that will hurt growth and speed up those that will help growth.
text_following: This should put an extra $10 billion into the economy in the next 6 months.

text_original: This should put an extra $10 billion into the economy in the next 6 months.
text_preceding: I have directed Cabinet departments and Federal agencies to speed up progrowth expenditures as quickly as possible.
text_following: And our new transportation bill provides more than $150 billion for construction and maintenance projects that are vital to our growth and well-being.

text_original: And our new transportation bill provides more than $150 billion for construction and maintenance projects that are vital to our growth and well-being.
text_preceding: This should put an extra $10 billion into the economy in the next 6 months.
text_following: And that means jobs building roads, jobs building bridges, and jobs building railways.

text_preceding: And our new transportation bill provides more than $150 billion for construction and maintenance projects that are vital to our growth and well-being.

text_original: And I have, this evening, directed the Secretary of the Treasury to change the Federal tax withholding tables.
text_preceding: And that means jobs building roads, jobs building bridges, and jobs building railways.

text_preceding: And I have, this evening, directed the Secretary of the Treasury to change the Federal tax withholding tables.
text_following: Something tells me a number of taxpayers may take us up on this one.

text_preceding: With this change, millions of Americans from whom the Government withholds more than necessary can now choose to have the Government withhold less from their paychecks.
