text_following: Finally, working with the Federal Reserve, we will continue to support monetary policy that keeps both interest rates and inflation down.

text_original: Finally, working with the Federal Reserve, we will continue to support monetary policy that keeps both interest rates and inflation down.
text_preceding: This initiative could return about $25 billion back into our economy over the next 12 months, money people can use to help pay for clothing, college, or to get a new car.
text_following: Now, these are the things I can do.

text_original: Now, these are the things I can do.
text_preceding: Finally, working with the Federal Reserve, we will continue to support monetary policy that keeps both interest rates and inflation down.
text_following: And now, Members of Congress, let me tell you what you can do for your country.

text_original: And now, Members of Congress, let me tell you what you can do for your country.
text_preceding: Now, these are the things I can do.
text_following: You must pass the other elements of my plan to meet our economic needs.

text_original: You must pass the other elements of my plan to meet our economic needs.
text_preceding: And now, Members of Congress, let me tell you what you can do for your country.
text_following: Everyone knows that investment spurs recovery.

text_original: Everyone knows that investment spurs recovery.
text_preceding: You must pass the other elements of my plan to meet our economic needs.
text_following: I am proposing this evening a change in the alternative minimum tax and the creation of a new 15-percent investment tax allowance.

text_original: I am proposing this evening a change in the alternative minimum tax and the creation of a new 15-percent investment tax allowance.
text_preceding: Everyone knows that investment spurs recovery.
text_following: This will encourage businesses to accelerate investment and bring people back to work.

text_original: This will encourage businesses to accelerate investment and bring people back to work.
text_preceding: I am proposing this evening a change in the alternative minimum tax and the creation of a new 15-percent investment tax allowance.
text_following: Real estate has led our economy out of almost all the tough times we've ever had.

text_original: Real estate has led our economy out of almost all the tough times we've ever had.
text_preceding: This will encourage businesses to accelerate investment and bring people back to work.
text_following: Once building starts, carpenters and plumbers work; people buy homes and take out mortgages.

text_original: Once building starts, carpenters and plumbers work; people buy homes and take out mortgages.
text_preceding: Real estate has led our economy out of almost all the tough times we've ever had.
text_following: My plan would modify the passive loss rule for active real estate developers.

text_original: My plan would modify the passive loss rule for active real estate developers.
text_preceding: Once building starts, carpenters and plumbers work; people buy homes and take out mortgages.
text_following: And it would make it easier for pension plans to purchase real estate.

text_original: And it would make it easier for pension plans to purchase real estate.
text_preceding: My plan would modify the passive loss rule for active real estate developers.
text_following: For those Americans who dream of buying a first home but who can't quite afford it, my plan would allow first-time homebuyers to withdraw savings from IRA's without penalty and provide a $5,000 tax credit for the first purchase of that home.

text_original: For those Americans who dream of buying a first home but who can't quite afford it, my plan would allow first-time homebuyers to withdraw savings from IRA's without penalty and provide a $5,000 tax credit for the first purchase of that home.
text_preceding: And it would make it easier for pension plans to purchase real estate.
text_following: And finally, my immediate plan calls on Congress to give crucial help to people who own a home, to everyone who has a business or a farm or a single investment.

text_original: And finally, my immediate plan calls on Congress to give crucial help to people who own a home, to everyone who has a business or a farm or a single investment.
text_preceding: For those Americans who dream of buying a first home but who can't quite afford it, my plan would allow first-time homebuyers to withdraw savings from IRA's without penalty and provide a $5,000 tax credit for the first purchase of that home.
text_following: This time, at this hour, I cannot take no for an answer.

text_original: This time, at this hour, I cannot take no for an answer.
text_preceding: And finally, my immediate plan calls on Congress to give crucial help to people who own a home, to everyone who has a business or a farm or a single investment.
text_following: You must cut the capital gains tax on the people of our country.

text_original: You must cut the capital gains tax on the people of our country.
text_preceding: This time, at this hour, I cannot take no for an answer.
text_following: Never has an issue been more demagogued by its opponents.

text_original: Never has an issue been more demagogued by its opponents.
text_preceding: You must cut the capital gains tax on the people of our country.
text_following: They are wrong, and they know it.

text_original: They are wrong, and they know it.
text_preceding: Never has an issue been more demagogued by its opponents.
text_following: Sixty percent of the people who benefit from lower capital gains have incomes under $50,000.

text_original: Sixty percent of the people who benefit from lower capital gains have incomes under $50,000.
text_preceding: They are wrong, and they know it.
text_following: A cut in the capital gains tax increases jobs and helps just about everyone in our country.

text_original: A cut in the capital gains tax increases jobs and helps just about everyone in our country.
text_preceding: Sixty percent of the people who benefit from lower capital gains have incomes under $50,000.
text_following: And so, I'm asking you to cut the capital gains tax to a maximum of 15.4 percent.

text_original: And so, I'm asking you to cut the capital gains tax to a maximum of 15.4 percent.
text_preceding: A cut in the capital gains tax increases jobs and helps just about everyone in our country.
text_following: you kind of remind me of the old definition of the Puritan who couldn't sleep at night, worrying that somehow, someone somewhere was out having a good time.

text_preceding: And so, I'm asking you to cut the capital gains tax to a maximum of 15.4 percent.
text_following: The opponents of this measure and those who have authored various so-called soak-the-rich bills that are floating around this Chamber should be reminded of something: When they aim at the big guy, they usually hit the little guy.

text_following: This, then, is my short-term plan.

text_preceding: And maybe it's time that stopped.

text_preceding: This, then, is my short-term plan.
text_following: While my plan is being passed and kicking in, we've got to care for those in trouble today.

text_preceding: Your part, Members of Congress, requires enactment of these commonsense proposals that will have a strong effect on the economy without breaking the budget agreement and without raising tax rates.

text_original: I have provided for up to $4.4 billion in my budget to extend Federal unemployment benefits.
text_preceding: While my plan is being passed and kicking in, we've got to care for those in trouble today.
text_following: And I ask for congressional action right away.

text_following: I know and you know that my plan is unveiled in a political season.

text_preceding: And I ask for congressional action right away.
text_following: I know and you know that everything I propose will be viewed by some in merely partisan terms.

text_following: And my aim is to increase our Nation's good.

text_preceding: But I ask you to know what is in my heart.
text_following: I'm doing what I think is right, and I am proposing what I know will help.

text_preceding: And my aim is to increase our Nation's good.
text_following: I pride myself that I'm a prudent man, and I believe that patience is a virtue.

text_original: I pride myself that I'm a prudent man, and I believe that patience is a virtue.
text_preceding: I'm doing what I think is right, and I am proposing what I know will help.
text_following: But I understand that politics is, for some, a game and that sometimes the game is to stop all progress and then decry the lack of improvement.

text_preceding: I pride myself that I'm a prudent man, and I believe that patience is a virtue.
text_following: But let me tell you: Far more important than my political future and far more important than yours is the well-being of our country.

text_preceding: But I understand that politics is, for some, a game and that sometimes the game is to stop all progress and then decry the lack of improvement.
text_following: Members of this Chamber are practical people, and I know you won't resent some practical advice.

text_preceding: But let me tell you: Far more important than my political future and far more important than yours is the well-being of our country.
text_following: When people put their party's fortunes, whatever the party, whatever side of this aisle, before the public good, they court defeat not only for their country but for themselves.

text_original: When people put their party's fortunes, whatever the party, whatever side of this aisle, before the public good, they court defeat not only for their country but for themselves.

text_preceding: When people put their party's fortunes, whatever the party, whatever side of this aisle, before the public good, they court defeat not only for their country but for themselves.
text_following: I submit my plan tomorrow, and I'm asking you to pass it by March 20th.

text_preceding: And they will certainly deserve it.
text_following: And I ask the American people to let you know they want this action by March 20th.

text_preceding: I submit my plan tomorrow, and I'm asking you to pass it by March 20th.
text_following: From the day after that, if it must be, the battle is joined.

text_preceding: And I ask the American people to let you know they want this action by March 20th.
text_following: And you know, when principle is at stake I relish a good, fair fight.

text_preceding: From the day after that, if it must be, the battle is joined.
text_following: I said my plan has two parts, and it does.

text_following: And it's the second part that is the heart of the matter.

text_preceding: I said my plan has two parts, and it does.
text_following: For it's not enough to get an immediate burst.

text_original: For it's not enough to get an immediate burst.
text_preceding: And it's the second part that is the heart of the matter.
text_following: We need long-term improvement in our economic position.

text_original: We need long-term improvement in our economic position.
text_preceding: For it's not enough to get an immediate burst.
text_following: We all know that the key to our economic future is to ensure that America continues as an economic leader of the world.

text_original: We all know that the key to our economic future is to ensure that America continues as an economic leader of the world.
text_preceding: We need long-term improvement in our economic position.
text_following: Here, then, is my long-term plan to guarantee our future.

text_original: Here, then, is my long-term plan to guarantee our future.
text_preceding: We all know that the key to our economic future is to ensure that America continues as an economic leader of the world.
text_following: First, trade: We will work to break down the walls that stop world trade.

text_original: First, trade: We will work to break down the walls that stop world trade.
text_preceding: Here, then, is my long-term plan to guarantee our future.
text_following: We will work to open markets everywhere.

text_original: We will work to open markets everywhere.
text_preceding: First, trade: We will work to break down the walls that stop world trade.
text_following: And in our major trade negotiations, I will continue pushing to eliminate tariffs and subsidies that damage America's farmers and workers.

text_original: And in our major trade negotiations, I will continue pushing to eliminate tariffs and subsidies that damage America's farmers and workers.
text_preceding: We will work to open markets everywhere.
text_following: And we'll get more good American jobs within our own hemisphere through the North American free trade agreement and through the Enterprise for the Americas Initiative.

text_preceding: And in our major trade negotiations, I will continue pushing to eliminate tariffs and subsidies that damage America's farmers and workers.

text_following: The workplace of the future will demand more highly skilled workers than ever, more people who are computer-literate, highly educated.

text_preceding: But changes are here, and more are coming.

text_following: And we must revolutionize America's schools.

text_preceding: And we must revolutionize America's schools.

text_following: That was my second long-term proposal, and here's my third: We must make commonsense investments that will help us compete, long-term, in the marketplace.

text_preceding: Congress, pass my comprehensive crime bill.

text_original: My plan would encourage real estate construction by extending tax incentives for mortgage revenue bonds and low-income housing.

text_following: And I ask tonight for record expenditures for the program that helps children born into want move into excellence, Head Start.

text_following: For this, too, bears on whether or not we can compete in the world.

text_original: For this, too, bears on whether or not we can compete in the world.

text_following: American health costs have been exploding.

text_original: American health costs have been exploding.
text_preceding: For this, too, bears on whether or not we can compete in the world.

text_original: This year America will spend over $800 billion on health, and that is expected to grow to 1.6 trillion by the end of the decade.
text_preceding: American health costs have been exploding.
text_following: The cost of health care shows up not only in your family budget but in the price of everything we buy and everything we sell.

text_original: The cost of health care shows up not only in your family budget but in the price of everything we buy and everything we sell.
text_preceding: This year America will spend over $800 billion on health, and that is expected to grow to 1.6 trillion by the end of the decade.

text_original: When health coverage for a fellow on an assembly line costs thousands of dollars, the cost goes into the products he makes, and you pay the bill.
text_preceding: The cost of health care shows up not only in your family budget but in the price of everything we buy and everything we sell.
text_following: Now, some pretend we can have it both ways.

text_original: Now, some pretend we can have it both ways.
text_preceding: When health coverage for a fellow on an assembly line costs thousands of dollars, the cost goes into the products he makes, and you pay the bill.

text_following: It will mean higher taxes, fewer jobs, and eventually a system under complete Government control.

text_following: And we can move toward a nationalized system, a system which will restrict patient choice in picking a doctor and force the Government to ration services arbitrarily.

text_original: And we can move toward a nationalized system, a system which will restrict patient choice in picking a doctor and force the Government to ration services arbitrarily.

text_following: And what we'll get is patients in long lines, indifferent service, and a huge new tax burden.

text_original: And what we'll get is patients in long lines, indifferent service, and a huge new tax burden.
text_preceding: And we can move toward a nationalized system, a system which will restrict patient choice in picking a doctor and force the Government to ration services arbitrarily.
text_following: Or we can reform our own private health care system, which still gives us, for all its flaws, the best quality health care in the world.

text_original: Or we can reform our own private health care system, which still gives us, for all its flaws, the best quality health care in the world.
text_preceding: And what we'll get is patients in long lines, indifferent service, and a huge new tax burden.
text_following: Well, let's build on our strengths.

text_original: Well, let's build on our strengths.
text_preceding: Or we can reform our own private health care system, which still gives us, for all its flaws, the best quality health care in the world.
text_following: My plan provides insurance security for all Americans while preserving and increasing the idea of choice.

text_original: My plan provides insurance security for all Americans while preserving and increasing the idea of choice.
text_preceding: Well, let's build on our strengths.
text_following: We make basic health insurance affordable for all low-income people not now covered, and we do it by providing a health insurance tax credit of up to $3,750 for each low-income family.

text_original: We make basic health insurance affordable for all low-income people not now covered, and we do it by providing a health insurance tax credit of up to $3,750 for each low-income family.
text_preceding: My plan provides insurance security for all Americans while preserving and increasing the idea of choice.
text_following: And the middle class gets help, too.

text_original: And the middle class gets help, too.
text_preceding: We make basic health insurance affordable for all low-income people not now covered, and we do it by providing a health insurance tax credit of up to $3,750 for each low-income family.
text_following: And by reforming the health insurance market, my plan assures that Americans will have access to basic health insurance even if they change jobs or develop serious health problems.

text_original: And by reforming the health insurance market, my plan assures that Americans will have access to basic health insurance even if they change jobs or develop serious health problems.
text_preceding: And the middle class gets help, too.
text_following: We must bring costs under control, preserve quality, preserve choice, and reduce the people's nagging daily worry about health insurance.

text_original: We must bring costs under control, preserve quality, preserve choice, and reduce the people's nagging daily worry about health insurance.
text_preceding: And by reforming the health insurance market, my plan assures that Americans will have access to basic health insurance even if they change jobs or develop serious health problems.
text_following: My plan, the details of which I'll announce very shortly, does just that.

text_original: My plan, the details of which I'll announce very shortly, does just that.
text_preceding: We must bring costs under control, preserve quality, preserve choice, and reduce the people's nagging daily worry about health insurance.
text_following: Seventh, we must get the Federal deficit under control.

text_original: Seventh, we must get the Federal deficit under control.
text_preceding: My plan, the details of which I'll announce very shortly, does just that.
text_following: We now have, in law, enforceable spending caps and a requirement that we pay for the programs we create.

text_original: We now have, in law, enforceable spending caps and a requirement that we pay for the programs we create.
text_preceding: Seventh, we must get the Federal deficit under control.
text_following: There are those in Congress who would ease that discipline now.

text_original: There are those in Congress who would ease that discipline now.
text_preceding: We now have, in law, enforceable spending caps and a requirement that we pay for the programs we create.
text_following: But I cannot let them do it, and I won't.

text_original: But I cannot let them do it, and I won't.
text_preceding: There are those in Congress who would ease that discipline now.
text_following: My plan would freeze all domestic discretionary budget authority, which means no more next year than this year.

text_original: My plan would freeze all domestic discretionary budget authority, which means no more next year than this year.
text_preceding: But I cannot let them do it, and I won't.
text_following: I will not tamper with Social Security, but I would put real caps on the growth of uncontrolled spending.

text_original: I will not tamper with Social Security, but I would put real caps on the growth of uncontrolled spending.
text_preceding: My plan would freeze all domestic discretionary budget authority, which means no more next year than this year.
text_following: And I would also freeze Federal domestic Government employment.

text_original: And I would also freeze Federal domestic Government employment.
text_preceding: I will not tamper with Social Security, but I would put real caps on the growth of uncontrolled spending.
text_following: And with the help of Congress, my plan will get rid of 246 programs that don't deserve Federal funding.

text_original: And with the help of Congress, my plan will get rid of 246 programs that don't deserve Federal funding.
text_preceding: And I would also freeze Federal domestic Government employment.
text_following: Some of them have noble titles, but none of them is indispensable.

text_original: Some of them have noble titles, but none of them is indispensable.
text_preceding: And with the help of Congress, my plan will get rid of 246 programs that don't deserve Federal funding.
text_following: We can get rid of each and every one of them.

text_original: We can get rid of each and every one of them.
text_preceding: Some of them have noble titles, but none of them is indispensable.
text_following: You know, it's time we rediscovered a home truth the American people have never forgotten: This Government is too big and spends too much.

text_original: You know, it's time we rediscovered a home truth the American people have never forgotten: This Government is too big and spends too much.
text_preceding: We can get rid of each and every one of them.
text_following: And I call upon Congress to adopt a measure that will help put an end to the annual ritual of filling the budget with pork barrel appropriations.

text_original: And I call upon Congress to adopt a measure that will help put an end to the annual ritual of filling the budget with pork barrel appropriations.
text_preceding: You know, it's time we rediscovered a home truth the American people have never forgotten: This Government is too big and spends too much.
text_following: Every year, the press has a field day making fun of outrageous examples: a Lawrence Welk museum, research grants for Belgian endive.

text_original: Every year, the press has a field day making fun of outrageous examples: a Lawrence Welk museum, research grants for Belgian endive.
text_preceding: And I call upon Congress to adopt a measure that will help put an end to the annual ritual of filling the budget with pork barrel appropriations.
text_following: We all know how these things get into the budget, and maybe you need someone to help you say no.

text_original: We all know how these things get into the budget, and maybe you need someone to help you say no.
text_preceding: Every year, the press has a field day making fun of outrageous examples: a Lawrence Welk museum, research grants for Belgian endive.
text_following: I know how to say it, and I know what I need to make it stick.

text_original: I know how to say it, and I know what I need to make it stick.
text_preceding: We all know how these things get into the budget, and maybe you need someone to help you say no.
text_following: Give me the same thing 43 Governors have, the line-item veto, and let me help you control spending.

text_original: Give me the same thing 43 Governors have, the line-item veto, and let me help you control spending.
text_preceding: I know how to say it, and I know what I need to make it stick.
text_following: We must put an end to unfinanced Federal Government mandates.

text_original: We must put an end to unfinanced Federal Government mandates.
text_preceding: Give me the same thing 43 Governors have, the line-item veto, and let me help you control spending.
text_following: These are the requirements Congress puts on our cities, counties, and States without supplying the money.

text_original: These are the requirements Congress puts on our cities, counties, and States without supplying the money.
text_preceding: We must put an end to unfinanced Federal Government mandates.
text_following: If Congress passes a mandate, it should be forced to pay for it and balance the cost with savings elsewhere.

text_original: If Congress passes a mandate, it should be forced to pay for it and balance the cost with savings elsewhere.
text_preceding: These are the requirements Congress puts on our cities, counties, and States without supplying the money.
text_following: After all, a mandate just increases someone else's burden, and that means higher taxes at the State and local level.

text_original: After all, a mandate just increases someone else's burden, and that means higher taxes at the State and local level.
text_preceding: If Congress passes a mandate, it should be forced to pay for it and balance the cost with savings elsewhere.
text_following: Step eight, Congress should enact the bold reform proposals that are still awaiting congressional action: bank reform, civil justice reform, tort reform, and my national energy strategy.

text_preceding: After all, a mandate just increases someone else's burden, and that means higher taxes at the State and local level.

text_preceding: Step eight, Congress should enact the bold reform proposals that are still awaiting congressional action: bank reform, civil justice reform, tort reform, and my national energy strategy.
text_following: When Barbara holds an AIDS baby in her arms and reads to children, she's saying to every person in this country: Family matters.

text_original: When Barbara holds an AIDS baby in her arms and reads to children, she's saying to every person in this country: Family matters.
text_preceding: And finally, we must strengthen the family because it is the family that has the greatest bearing on our future.

text_original: And I am announcing tonight a new Commission on America's Urban Families.

text_original: I've asked Missouri's Governor John Ashcroft to be Chairman, former Dallas Mayor Annette Strauss to be Cochair.
text_preceding: And I am announcing tonight a new Commission on America's Urban Families.
text_following: You know, I had mayors, the leading mayors from the League of Cities, in the other day at the White House, and they told me something striking.

text_original: You know, I had mayors, the leading mayors from the League of Cities, in the other day at the White House, and they told me something striking.
text_preceding: I've asked Missouri's Governor John Ashcroft to be Chairman, former Dallas Mayor Annette Strauss to be Cochair.
text_following: They said that every one of them, Republican or Democrat, agreed on one thing, that the major cause of the problems of the cities is the dissolution of the family.

text_original: They said that every one of them, Republican or Democrat, agreed on one thing, that the major cause of the problems of the cities is the dissolution of the family.
text_preceding: You know, I had mayors, the leading mayors from the League of Cities, in the other day at the White House, and they told me something striking.
text_following: They asked for this Commission, and they were right to ask because it's time to determine what we can do to keep families together, strong and sound.

text_original: They asked for this Commission, and they were right to ask because it's time to determine what we can do to keep families together, strong and sound.
text_preceding: They said that every one of them, Republican or Democrat, agreed on one thing, that the major cause of the problems of the cities is the dissolution of the family.
text_following: There's one thing we can do right away: Ease the burden of rearing a child.

text_original: There's one thing we can do right away: Ease the burden of rearing a child.
text_preceding: They asked for this Commission, and they were right to ask because it's time to determine what we can do to keep families together, strong and sound.
text_following: I ask you tonight to raise the personal exemption by $500 per child for every family.

text_original: I ask you tonight to raise the personal exemption by $500 per child for every family.
text_preceding: There's one thing we can do right away: Ease the burden of rearing a child.
text_following: For a family with four kids, that's an increase of $2,000.

text_preceding: I ask you tonight to raise the personal exemption by $500 per child for every family.
text_following: This is a good start in the right direction, and it's what we can afford.

text_original: This is a good start in the right direction, and it's what we can afford.
text_preceding: For a family with four kids, that's an increase of $2,000.
text_following: It's time to allow families to deduct the interest they pay on student loans.

text_original: It's time to allow families to deduct the interest they pay on student loans.
text_preceding: This is a good start in the right direction, and it's what we can afford.
text_following: I am asking you to do just that.

text_preceding: It's time to allow families to deduct the interest they pay on student loans.

text_original: And I'm asking you to allow people to use money from their IRA's to pay medical and education expenses, all without penalties.
text_preceding: I am asking you to do just that.
text_following: Ask American parents what they dislike about how things are going in our country, and chances are good that pretty soon they'll get to welfare.

text_preceding: And I'm asking you to allow people to use money from their IRA's to pay medical and education expenses, all without penalties.
text_following: Americans are the most generous people on Earth.

text_original: Americans are the most generous people on Earth.
text_preceding: Ask American parents what they dislike about how things are going in our country, and chances are good that pretty soon they'll get to welfare.
text_following: Welfare was never meant to be a lifestyle.

text_original: Welfare was never meant to be a lifestyle.
text_preceding: Americans are the most generous people on Earth.
text_following: It was never meant to be a habit.

text_original: It was never meant to be a habit.
text_preceding: Welfare was never meant to be a lifestyle.
text_following: It was never supposed to be passed from generation to generation like a legacy.

text_original: It was never supposed to be passed from generation to generation like a legacy.
text_preceding: It was never meant to be a habit.
text_following: It's time to replace the assumptions of the welfare state and help reform the welfare system.

text_original: It's time to replace the assumptions of the welfare state and help reform the welfare system.
text_preceding: It was never supposed to be passed from generation to generation like a legacy.

text_original: States throughout the country are beginning to operate with new assumptions that when able-bodied people receive Government assistance, they have responsibilities to the taxpayer: A responsibility to seek work, education, or job training;

text_following: a responsibility to hold their families together and refrain from having children out of wedlock;

text_original: a responsibility to hold their families together and refrain from having children out of wedlock;

text_preceding: Often, State reform requires waiving certain Federal regulations.
text_following: I want to add, as we make these changes, we work together to improve this system, that our intention is not scapegoating or finger-pointing.

text_preceding: I will act to make that process easier and quicker for every State that asks for our help.
text_following: If you read the papers and watch TV, you know there's been a rise these days in a certain kind of ugliness: racist comments, anti-Semitism, an increased sense of division.

text_original: If you read the papers and watch TV, you know there's been a rise these days in a certain kind of ugliness: racist comments, anti-Semitism, an increased sense of division.
text_preceding: I want to add, as we make these changes, we work together to improve this system, that our intention is not scapegoating or finger-pointing.

text_original: And so, you have my plan for America.
text_preceding: If you read the papers and watch TV, you know there's been a rise these days in a certain kind of ugliness: racist comments, anti-Semitism, an increased sense of division.
text_following: And I'm asking for big things, but I believe in my heart you'll do what's right.

text_original: And I'm asking for big things, but I believe in my heart you'll do what's right.
text_preceding: And so, you have my plan for America.
text_following: You know, it's kind of an American tradition to show a certain skepticism toward our democratic institutions.

text_original: You know, it's kind of an American tradition to show a certain skepticism toward our democratic institutions.
text_preceding: And I'm asking for big things, but I believe in my heart you'll do what's right.
text_following: I myself have sometimes thought the aging process could be delayed if it had to make its way through Congress.

text_original: I myself have sometimes thought the aging process could be delayed if it had to make its way through Congress.
text_preceding: You know, it's kind of an American tradition to show a certain skepticism toward our democratic institutions.
text_following: You will deliberate, and you will discuss, and that is fine.

text_following: But, my friends, the people cannot wait.

text_original: But, my friends, the people cannot wait.
text_preceding: You will deliberate, and you will discuss, and that is fine.
text_following: Someone even said our workers are lazy and uninspired.

text_original: Someone even said our workers are lazy and uninspired.
text_preceding: But, my friends, the people cannot wait.
text_following: You go tell Neil Armstrong standing on the moon.

text_original: You go tell Neil Armstrong standing on the moon.
text_preceding: Someone even said our workers are lazy and uninspired.
text_following: Tell the men and women who put him there.

text_original: Tell the men and women who put him there.
text_preceding: You go tell Neil Armstrong standing on the moon.

text_original: Tell the American farmer who feeds his country and the world.
text_preceding: Tell the men and women who put him there.
text_following: Tell the men and women of Desert Storm.

text_original: Tell the men and women of Desert Storm.
text_preceding: Tell the American farmer who feeds his country and the world.
text_following: Moods come and go, but greatness endures.

text_original: Moods come and go, but greatness endures.
text_preceding: Tell the men and women of Desert Storm.
text_following: And maybe for a moment it's good to remember what, in the dailiness of our lives, we forget: We are still and ever the freest nation on Earth, the kindest nation on Earth, the strongest nation on Earth.

text_preceding: Moods come and go, but greatness endures.
text_following: And we have always risen to the occasion.

text_original: And we have always risen to the occasion.
text_preceding: And maybe for a moment it's good to remember what, in the dailiness of our lives, we forget: We are still and ever the freest nation on Earth, the kindest nation on Earth, the strongest nation on Earth.
text_following: And we are going to lift this Nation out of hard times inch by inch and day by day, and those who would stop us had better step aside.

text_original: And we are going to lift this Nation out of hard times inch by inch and day by day, and those who would stop us had better step aside.
text_preceding: And we have always risen to the occasion.
text_following: Because I look at hard times, and I make this vow: This will not stand.

text_original: Because I look at hard times, and I make this vow: This will not stand.
text_preceding: And we are going to lift this Nation out of hard times inch by inch and day by day, and those who would stop us had better step aside.
text_following: And so, we move on together, a rising nation, the once and future miracle that is still, this night, the hope of the world.

text_original: And so, we move on together, a rising nation, the once and future miracle that is still, this night, the hope of the world.
text_preceding: Because I look at hard times, and I make this vow: This will not stand.
text_following: God bless you, and God bless our beloved country.

text_original: God bless you, and God bless our beloved country.
text_preceding: And so, we move on together, a rising nation, the once and future miracle that is still, this night, the hope of the world.

text_original: Mr. President, Mr. Speaker, members of the 104th Congress, my fellow Americans: Again we are here in the sanctuary of democracy, and once again, our democracy has spoken.
text_following: So let me begin by congratulating all of you here in the 104th Congress, and congratulating you, Mr. Speaker.

text_original: So let me begin by congratulating all of you here in the 104th Congress, and congratulating you, Mr. Speaker.
text_preceding: Mr. President, Mr. Speaker, members of the 104th Congress, my fellow Americans: Again we are here in the sanctuary of democracy, and once again, our democracy has spoken.
text_following: If we agree on nothing else tonight, we must agree that the American people certainly voted for change in 1992 and in 1994.

text_original: If we agree on nothing else tonight, we must agree that the American people certainly voted for change in 1992 and in 1994.
text_preceding: So let me begin by congratulating all of you here in the 104th Congress, and congratulating you, Mr. Speaker.
text_following: And as I look out at you, I know how some of you must have felt in 1992.

text_original: And as I look out at you, I know how some of you must have felt in 1992.
text_preceding: If we agree on nothing else tonight, we must agree that the American people certainly voted for change in 1992 and in 1994.
text_following: 'WE HEARD AMERICA SHOUTING': I must say that in both years we didn't hear America singing, we heard America shouting.

text_original: 'WE HEARD AMERICA SHOUTING': I must say that in both years we didn't hear America singing, we heard America shouting.
text_preceding: And as I look out at you, I know how some of you must have felt in 1992.
text_following: And now all of us, Republicans and Democrats alike, must say: We hear you.

text_original: And now all of us, Republicans and Democrats alike, must say: We hear you.
text_preceding: 'WE HEARD AMERICA SHOUTING': I must say that in both years we didn't hear America singing, we heard America shouting.
text_following: We will work together to earn the jobs you have given us.

text_original: We will work together to earn the jobs you have given us.
text_preceding: And now all of us, Republicans and Democrats alike, must say: We hear you.
text_following: For we are the keepers of the sacred trust, and we must be faithful to it in this new and very demanding era.

text_original: For we are the keepers of the sacred trust, and we must be faithful to it in this new and very demanding era.
text_preceding: We will work together to earn the jobs you have given us.
text_following: It has fallen to every generation since then to preserve that idea -- the American idea -- and to deepen and expand its meaning to new and different times: To Lincoln and his Congress, to preserve the Union and to end slavery.

text_original: It has fallen to every generation since then to preserve that idea -- the American idea -- and to deepen and expand its meaning to new and different times: To Lincoln and his Congress, to preserve the Union and to end slavery.
text_preceding: For we are the keepers of the sacred trust, and we must be faithful to it in this new and very demanding era.
text_following: To Theodore Roosevelt and Woodrow Wilson, to restrain the abuses and excesses of the Industrial Revolution, and to assert our leadership in the world.

text_original: To Theodore Roosevelt and Woodrow Wilson, to restrain the abuses and excesses of the Industrial Revolution, and to assert our leadership in the world.
text_preceding: It has fallen to every generation since then to preserve that idea -- the American idea -- and to deepen and expand its meaning to new and different times: To Lincoln and his Congress, to preserve the Union and to end slavery.
text_following: To Franklin Roosevelt, to fight the failure and pain of the Great Depression, and to win our country's great struggle against fascism.

text_original: To Franklin Roosevelt, to fight the failure and pain of the Great Depression, and to win our country's great struggle against fascism.
text_preceding: To Theodore Roosevelt and Woodrow Wilson, to restrain the abuses and excesses of the Industrial Revolution, and to assert our leadership in the world.
text_following: And to all our presidents since, to fight the Cold War.

text_original: And to all our presidents since, to fight the Cold War.
text_preceding: To Franklin Roosevelt, to fight the failure and pain of the Great Depression, and to win our country's great struggle against fascism.
text_following: Especially, I recall two who struggled to fight that Cold War in partnership with congresses where the majority was of a different party.

text_original: Especially, I recall two who struggled to fight that Cold War in partnership with congresses where the majority was of a different party.
text_preceding: And to all our presidents since, to fight the Cold War.
text_following: To Harry Truman, who summoned us to unparalleled prosperity at home, and who built the architecture of the Cold War.

text_original: To Harry Truman, who summoned us to unparalleled prosperity at home, and who built the architecture of the Cold War.
text_preceding: Especially, I recall two who struggled to fight that Cold War in partnership with congresses where the majority was of a different party.
text_following: And to Ronald Reagan, whom we wish well tonight, and who exhorted us to carry on until the twilight struggle against communism was won.

text_original: And to Ronald Reagan, whom we wish well tonight, and who exhorted us to carry on until the twilight struggle against communism was won.
text_preceding: To Harry Truman, who summoned us to unparalleled prosperity at home, and who built the architecture of the Cold War.
text_following: In another time of change and challenge, I had the honor to be the first president to be elected in the post-Cold War era, an era marked by the global economy, the information revolution, unparalleled change and opportunity and insecurity for the American people.

text_original: In another time of change and challenge, I had the honor to be the first president to be elected in the post-Cold War era, an era marked by the global economy, the information revolution, unparalleled change and opportunity and insecurity for the American people.
text_preceding: And to Ronald Reagan, whom we wish well tonight, and who exhorted us to carry on until the twilight struggle against communism was won.
text_following: I came to this hallowed chamber two years ago on a mission -- to restore the American Dream for all our people and to make sure that we move into the 21st century still the strongest force for freedom and democracy in the entire world.

text_original: I came to this hallowed chamber two years ago on a mission -- to restore the American Dream for all our people and to make sure that we move into the 21st century still the strongest force for freedom and democracy in the entire world.
text_preceding: In another time of change and challenge, I had the honor to be the first president to be elected in the post-Cold War era, an era marked by the global economy, the information revolution, unparalleled change and opportunity and insecurity for the American people.
text_following: I was determined then to tackle the tough problems too long ignored.

text_original: I was determined then to tackle the tough problems too long ignored.
text_preceding: I came to this hallowed chamber two years ago on a mission -- to restore the American Dream for all our people and to make sure that we move into the 21st century still the strongest force for freedom and democracy in the entire world.
text_following: In this effort I am frank to say that I have made my mistakes, and I have learned again the importance of humility in all human endeavor.

text_original: In this effort I am frank to say that I have made my mistakes, and I have learned again the importance of humility in all human endeavor.
text_preceding: I was determined then to tackle the tough problems too long ignored.
text_following: But I am also proud to say tonight that our country is stronger than it was two years ago.

text_original: But I am also proud to say tonight that our country is stronger than it was two years ago.
text_preceding: In this effort I am frank to say that I have made my mistakes, and I have learned again the importance of humility in all human endeavor.
text_following: Record numbers -- record numbers of Americans are succeeding in the new global economy.

text_original: Record numbers -- record numbers of Americans are succeeding in the new global economy.
text_preceding: But I am also proud to say tonight that our country is stronger than it was two years ago.
text_following: We are at peace and we are a force for peace and freedom throughout the world.

text_original: We are at peace and we are a force for peace and freedom throughout the world.
text_preceding: Record numbers -- record numbers of Americans are succeeding in the new global economy.
text_following: We have almost six million new jobs since I became president, and we have the lowest combined rate of unemployment and inflation in 25 years.

text_original: We have almost six million new jobs since I became president, and we have the lowest combined rate of unemployment and inflation in 25 years.
text_preceding: We are at peace and we are a force for peace and freedom throughout the world.
text_following: Our businesses are more productive and here we have worked to bring the deficit down, to expand trade, to put more police on our streets, to give our citizens more of the tools they need to get an education and to rebuild their own communities.

text_original: Our businesses are more productive and here we have worked to bring the deficit down, to expand trade, to put more police on our streets, to give our citizens more of the tools they need to get an education and to rebuild their own communities.
text_preceding: We have almost six million new jobs since I became president, and we have the lowest combined rate of unemployment and inflation in 25 years.
text_following: But the rising tide is not lifting all boats.

text_original: But the rising tide is not lifting all boats.
text_preceding: Our businesses are more productive and here we have worked to bring the deficit down, to expand trade, to put more police on our streets, to give our citizens more of the tools they need to get an education and to rebuild their own communities.
text_following: While our nation is enjoying peace and prosperity, too many of our people are still working harder and harder, for less and less.

text_original: While our nation is enjoying peace and prosperity, too many of our people are still working harder and harder, for less and less.
text_preceding: But the rising tide is not lifting all boats.
text_following: While our businesses are restructuring and growing more productive and competitive, too many of our people still can't be sure of having a job next year or even next month.

text_original: While our businesses are restructuring and growing more productive and competitive, too many of our people still can't be sure of having a job next year or even next month.
text_preceding: While our nation is enjoying peace and prosperity, too many of our people are still working harder and harder, for less and less.
text_following: And far more than our material riches are threatened.

text_original: And far more than our material riches are threatened.
text_preceding: While our businesses are restructuring and growing more productive and competitive, too many of our people still can't be sure of having a job next year or even next month.
text_following: Things far more precious too us -- ourchildren, our families, our values.

text_original: Things far more precious too us -- ourchildren, our families, our values.
text_preceding: And far more than our material riches are threatened.
text_following: Our civil life is suffering in America today.

text_original: Our civil life is suffering in America today.
text_preceding: Things far more precious too us -- ourchildren, our families, our values.
text_following: Citizens are working together less and shouting at each other more.

text_original: Citizens are working together less and shouting at each other more.
text_preceding: Our civil life is suffering in America today.
text_following: The common bonds of community which have been the great strength of our country from its very beginning are badly frayed.

text_original: The common bonds of community which have been the great strength of our country from its very beginning are badly frayed.
text_preceding: Citizens are working together less and shouting at each other more.
text_following: And from that simple proposition, he shaped the New Deal, which helped to restore our nation to prosperity and define the relationship between our people and their government for half a century.

text_original: And from that simple proposition, he shaped the New Deal, which helped to restore our nation to prosperity and define the relationship between our people and their government for half a century.
text_preceding: The common bonds of community which have been the great strength of our country from its very beginning are badly frayed.
text_following: That approach worked in its time.

text_original: That approach worked in its time.
text_preceding: And from that simple proposition, he shaped the New Deal, which helped to restore our nation to prosperity and define the relationship between our people and their government for half a century.
text_following: But we today, we face a very different time and very different conditions.

text_original: But we today, we face a very different time and very different conditions.
text_preceding: That approach worked in its time.
text_following: We are moving from an Industrial Age built on gears and sweat to an Information Age demanding skills and learning and flexibility.

text_original: We are moving from an Industrial Age built on gears and sweat to an Information Age demanding skills and learning and flexibility.
text_preceding: But we today, we face a very different time and very different conditions.
text_following: Our government, once a champion of national purpose, is now seen by many as simply a captive of narrow interests, putting more burdens on our citizens rather than equipping them to get ahead.

text_original: Our government, once a champion of national purpose, is now seen by many as simply a captive of narrow interests, putting more burdens on our citizens rather than equipping them to get ahead.
text_preceding: We are moving from an Industrial Age built on gears and sweat to an Information Age demanding skills and learning and flexibility.
text_following: The values that used to hold us all together seem to be coming apart.

text_original: The values that used to hold us all together seem to be coming apart.
text_preceding: Our government, once a champion of national purpose, is now seen by many as simply a captive of narrow interests, putting more burdens on our citizens rather than equipping them to get ahead.
text_following: So tonight, we must forge a new social compact to meet the challenges of this time.

text_original: So tonight, we must forge a new social compact to meet the challenges of this time.
text_preceding: The values that used to hold us all together seem to be coming apart.
text_following: As we enter a new era, we need a new set of understandings, not just with government, but even more important, with one another as Americans.

text_original: As we enter a new era, we need a new set of understandings, not just with government, but even more important, with one another as Americans.
text_preceding: So tonight, we must forge a new social compact to meet the challenges of this time.
text_following: FORGING THE 'NEW COVENANT': That's what I want to talk with you about tonight.

text_original: FORGING THE 'NEW COVENANT': That's what I want to talk with you about tonight.
text_preceding: As we enter a new era, we need a new set of understandings, not just with government, but even more important, with one another as Americans.
text_following: But it's grounded in a very, very old idea -- that all Americans have not just a right, but a solid responsibility to rise as far as their God-given talents and determination can take them.

text_original: But it's grounded in a very, very old idea -- that all Americans have not just a right, but a solid responsibility to rise as far as their God-given talents and determination can take them.
text_preceding: FORGING THE 'NEW COVENANT': That's what I want to talk with you about tonight.
text_following: And to give something back to their communities and their country in return.

text_original: And to give something back to their communities and their country in return.
text_preceding: But it's grounded in a very, very old idea -- that all Americans have not just a right, but a solid responsibility to rise as far as their God-given talents and determination can take them.
text_following: Opportunity and responsibility: They go hand in hand.

text_original: Opportunity and responsibility: They go hand in hand.
text_preceding: And to give something back to their communities and their country in return.
text_following: We can't have one without the other.

text_original: We can't have one without the other.
text_preceding: Opportunity and responsibility: They go hand in hand.
text_following: And our national community can't hold together without both.

text_original: And our national community can't hold together without both.
text_preceding: We can't have one without the other.
text_following: Our New Covenant is a new set of understandings for how we can equip our people to meet the challenges of a new economy, how we can change the way our government works to fit a different time, and, above all, how we can repair the damaged bonds in our society and come together behind our common purpose.

text_original: Our New Covenant is a new set of understandings for how we can equip our people to meet the challenges of a new economy, how we can change the way our government works to fit a different time, and, above all, how we can repair the damaged bonds in our society and come together behind our common purpose.
text_preceding: And our national community can't hold together without both.
text_following: We must have dramatic change in our economy, our government and ourselves.

text_original: We must have dramatic change in our economy, our government and ourselves.
text_preceding: Our New Covenant is a new set of understandings for how we can equip our people to meet the challenges of a new economy, how we can change the way our government works to fit a different time, and, above all, how we can repair the damaged bonds in our society and come together behind our common purpose.
text_following: My fellow Americans, without regard to party, let us rise to the occasion.

text_original: My fellow Americans, without regard to party, let us rise to the occasion.
text_preceding: We must have dramatic change in our economy, our government and ourselves.
text_following: Let us put aside partisanship and pettiness and pride.

text_original: Let us put aside partisanship and pettiness and pride.
text_preceding: My fellow Americans, without regard to party, let us rise to the occasion.
text_following: As we embark on this new course, let us put our country first, remembering that regardless of party label, we are all Americans.

text_original: As we embark on this new course, let us put our country first, remembering that regardless of party label, we are all Americans.
text_preceding: Let us put aside partisanship and pettiness and pride.
text_following: And let the final test of everything we do be a simple one: Is it good for the American people?

text_original: And let the final test of everything we do be a simple one: Is it good for the American people?
text_preceding: As we embark on this new course, let us put our country first, remembering that regardless of party label, we are all Americans.
text_following: Let me begin by saying that we cannot ask Americans to be better citizens if we are not better servants.

text_original: Let me begin by saying that we cannot ask Americans to be better citizens if we are not better servants.
text_preceding: And let the final test of everything we do be a simple one: Is it good for the American people?
text_following: You made a good start by passing that law which applies to Congress all the laws you put on the private sector, and I was proud to sign it yesterday.

text_original: You made a good start by passing that law which applies to Congress all the laws you put on the private sector, and I was proud to sign it yesterday.
text_preceding: Let me begin by saying that we cannot ask Americans to be better citizens if we are not better servants.
text_following: But we have a lot more to do before people really trust the way things work around here.

text_original: But we have a lot more to do before people really trust the way things work around here.
text_preceding: You made a good start by passing that law which applies to Congress all the laws you put on the private sector, and I was proud to sign it yesterday.
text_following: Three times as many lobbyists are in the streets and corridors of Washington as were here 20 years ago.

text_original: Three times as many lobbyists are in the streets and corridors of Washington as were here 20 years ago.
text_preceding: But we have a lot more to do before people really trust the way things work around here.
text_following: The American people look at their capital and they see a city where the well-connected and the well-protected can work the system, but the interests of ordinary citizens are often left out.

text_original: The American people look at their capital and they see a city where the well-connected and the well-protected can work the system, but the interests of ordinary citizens are often left out.
text_preceding: Three times as many lobbyists are in the streets and corridors of Washington as were here 20 years ago.
text_following: As the new Congress opened its doors, lobbyists were still doing business as usual -- the gifts, the trips, all the things that people are concerned about haven't stopped.

text_original: As the new Congress opened its doors, lobbyists were still doing business as usual -- the gifts, the trips, all the things that people are concerned about haven't stopped.
text_preceding: The American people look at their capital and they see a city where the well-connected and the well-protected can work the system, but the interests of ordinary citizens are often left out.
text_following: Twice this month you missed opportunities to stop these practices.

text_original: Twice this month you missed opportunities to stop these practices.
text_preceding: As the new Congress opened its doors, lobbyists were still doing business as usual -- the gifts, the trips, all the things that people are concerned about haven't stopped.
text_following: I know there were other considerations in those votes, but I want to use something that I've heard my Republican friends say from time to time -- there doesn't have to be a law for everything.

text_original: I know there were other considerations in those votes, but I want to use something that I've heard my Republican friends say from time to time -- there doesn't have to be a law for everything.
text_preceding: Twice this month you missed opportunities to stop these practices.
text_following: So tonight, I ask you to just stop taking the lobbyists' perks.

text_original: So tonight, I ask you to just stop taking the lobbyists' perks.
text_preceding: I know there were other considerations in those votes, but I want to use something that I've heard my Republican friends say from time to time -- there doesn't have to be a law for everything.
text_following: We don't have to wait for legislation to pass to send a strong signal to the American people that things are really changing.

text_original: We don't have to wait for legislation to pass to send a strong signal to the American people that things are really changing.
text_preceding: So tonight, I ask you to just stop taking the lobbyists' perks.
text_following: But I also hope you will send me the strongest possible lobby reform bill, and I'll sign that, too.

text_original: But I also hope you will send me the strongest possible lobby reform bill, and I'll sign that, too.
text_preceding: We don't have to wait for legislation to pass to send a strong signal to the American people that things are really changing.
text_following: We should require lobbyists to tell the people for whom they work what they're spending, what they want.

text_original: We should require lobbyists to tell the people for whom they work what they're spending, what they want.
text_preceding: But I also hope you will send me the strongest possible lobby reform bill, and I'll sign that, too.
text_following: We should also curb the role of big money in elections by capping the cost of campaigns and limiting the influence of PACs.

text_original: We should also curb the role of big money in elections by capping the cost of campaigns and limiting the influence of PACs.
text_preceding: We should require lobbyists to tell the people for whom they work what they're spending, what they want.
text_following: And as I have said for three years, we should work to open the airwaves so that they can be an instrument of democracy, not a weapon of destruction by giving free TV time to candidates for public office.

text_original: And as I have said for three years, we should work to open the airwaves so that they can be an instrument of democracy, not a weapon of destruction by giving free TV time to candidates for public office.
text_preceding: We should also curb the role of big money in elections by capping the cost of campaigns and limiting the influence of PACs.
text_following: When the last Congress killed political reform last year, it was reported in the press that the lobbyists actually stood in the halls of this sacred building and cheered.

text_original: When the last Congress killed political reform last year, it was reported in the press that the lobbyists actually stood in the halls of this sacred building and cheered.
text_preceding: And as I have said for three years, we should work to open the airwaves so that they can be an instrument of democracy, not a weapon of destruction by giving free TV time to candidates for public office.
text_following: This year, let's give the folks at home something to cheer about.

text_original: This year, let's give the folks at home something to cheer about.
text_preceding: When the last Congress killed political reform last year, it was reported in the press that the lobbyists actually stood in the halls of this sacred building and cheered.
text_following: More important, I think we all agree that we have to change the way the government works.

text_original: More important, I think we all agree that we have to change the way the government works.
text_preceding: This year, let's give the folks at home something to cheer about.
text_following: Let's make it smaller, less costly and smaller -- leaner, not meaner.

text_original: Let's make it smaller, less costly and smaller -- leaner, not meaner.
text_preceding: More important, I think we all agree that we have to change the way the government works.
text_following: I just told the Speaker the equal time doctrine is alive and well.

text_original: I just told the Speaker the equal time doctrine is alive and well.
text_preceding: Let's make it smaller, less costly and smaller -- leaner, not meaner.
text_following: The New Covenant approach to governing is as different from the old bureaucratic way as the computer is from the manual typewriter.

text_original: The New Covenant approach to governing is as different from the old bureaucratic way as the computer is from the manual typewriter.
text_preceding: I just told the Speaker the equal time doctrine is alive and well.
text_following: The old way of governing around here protected organized interests.

text_original: The old way of governing around here protected organized interests.
text_preceding: The New Covenant approach to governing is as different from the old bureaucratic way as the computer is from the manual typewriter.
text_following: We should look out for the interests of ordinary people.

text_original: We should look out for the interests of ordinary people.
text_preceding: The old way of governing around here protected organized interests.
text_following: The old way divided us by interest, constituency or class.

text_original: The old way divided us by interest, constituency or class.
text_preceding: We should look out for the interests of ordinary people.
text_following: The New Covenant way should unite us behind a common vision of what's best for our country.

text_original: The New Covenant way should unite us behind a common vision of what's best for our country.
text_preceding: The old way divided us by interest, constituency or class.
text_following: The old way dispensed services through large, top-down, inflexible bureaucracies.

text_original: The old way dispensed services through large, top-down, inflexible bureaucracies.
text_preceding: The New Covenant way should unite us behind a common vision of what's best for our country.
text_following: The New Covenant way should shift these resources and decision-making from bureaucrats to citizens, injecting choice and competition and individual responsibility into national policy.

text_original: The New Covenant way should shift these resources and decision-making from bureaucrats to citizens, injecting choice and competition and individual responsibility into national policy.
text_preceding: The old way dispensed services through large, top-down, inflexible bureaucracies.
text_following: The old way of governing around here actually seemed to reward failure.

text_original: The old way of governing around here actually seemed to reward failure.
text_preceding: The New Covenant way should shift these resources and decision-making from bureaucrats to citizens, injecting choice and competition and individual responsibility into national policy.
text_following: The New Covenant way should have built-in incentives to reward success.

text_original: The New Covenant way should have built-in incentives to reward success.
text_preceding: The old way of governing around here actually seemed to reward failure.
text_following: The old way was centralized here in Washington.

text_original: The old way was centralized here in Washington.
text_preceding: The New Covenant way should have built-in incentives to reward success.
text_following: The New Covenant way must take hold in the communities all across America.

text_original: The New Covenant way must take hold in the communities all across America.
text_preceding: The old way was centralized here in Washington.
text_following: And we should help them to do that.

text_original: And we should help them to do that.
text_preceding: The New Covenant way must take hold in the communities all across America.
text_following: Our job here is to expand opportunity, not bureaucracy.

text_original: Our job here is to expand opportunity, not bureaucracy.
text_preceding: And we should help them to do that.
text_following: To empower people to make the most of their own lives.

text_original: To empower people to make the most of their own lives.
text_preceding: Our job here is to expand opportunity, not bureaucracy.
text_following: And to enhance our security here at home and abroad.

text_original: And to enhance our security here at home and abroad.
text_preceding: To empower people to make the most of their own lives.
text_following: We must not ask government to do what we should do for ourselves.

text_original: We must not ask government to do what we should do for ourselves.
text_preceding: And to enhance our security here at home and abroad.
text_following: We should rely on government as a partner to help us to do more for ourselves and for each other.

text_original: We should rely on government as a partner to help us to do more for ourselves and for each other.
text_preceding: We must not ask government to do what we should do for ourselves.
text_following: BEYOND YESTERDAY'S GOVERNMENT:  I hope very much that as we debate these specific and exciting matters, we can go beyond the sterile discussion between the illusion that there is somehow a program for every problem on the one hand, and the other illusion that the government is a source of every problem we have.

text_original: BEYOND YESTERDAY'S GOVERNMENT:  I hope very much that as we debate these specific and exciting matters, we can go beyond the sterile discussion between the illusion that there is somehow a program for every problem on the one hand, and the other illusion that the government is a source of every problem we have.
text_preceding: We should rely on government as a partner to help us to do more for ourselves and for each other.
text_following: Our job is to get rid of yesterday's government so that our own people can meet today's and tomorrow's needs.

text_original: Our job is to get rid of yesterday's government so that our own people can meet today's and tomorrow's needs.
text_preceding: BEYOND YESTERDAY'S GOVERNMENT:  I hope very much that as we debate these specific and exciting matters, we can go beyond the sterile discussion between the illusion that there is somehow a program for every problem on the one hand, and the other illusion that the government is a source of every problem we have.
text_following: And we ought to do it together.

text_original: And we ought to do it together.
text_preceding: Our job is to get rid of yesterday's government so that our own people can meet today's and tomorrow's needs.
text_following: You know, for years before I became president, I heard others say they would cut government and how bad it was.

text_original: You know, for years before I became president, I heard others say they would cut government and how bad it was.
text_preceding: And we ought to do it together.
text_following: We cut over a quarter of a trillion dollars in spending, more than 300 domestic programs, more than 100,000 positions from the federal bureaucracy in the last two years alone.

text_original: We cut over a quarter of a trillion dollars in spending, more than 300 domestic programs, more than 100,000 positions from the federal bureaucracy in the last two years alone.
text_preceding: You know, for years before I became president, I heard others say they would cut government and how bad it was.
text_following: Based on decisions already made, we will have cut a total of more than a quarter of a million positions from the federal government, making it the smallest it has been since John Kennedy was president, by the time I come here again next year.

text_original: Based on decisions already made, we will have cut a total of more than a quarter of a million positions from the federal government, making it the smallest it has been since John Kennedy was president, by the time I come here again next year.
text_preceding: We cut over a quarter of a trillion dollars in spending, more than 300 domestic programs, more than 100,000 positions from the federal bureaucracy in the last two years alone.
text_following: Under the leadership of Vice President Gore, our initiatives have already saved taxpayers $63 billion.

text_original: Under the leadership of Vice President Gore, our initiatives have already saved taxpayers $63 billion.
text_preceding: Based on decisions already made, we will have cut a total of more than a quarter of a million positions from the federal government, making it the smallest it has been since John Kennedy was president, by the time I come here again next year.
text_following: The age of the $500 hammer and the ashtray you can break on David Letterman is gone.

text_original: The age of the $500 hammer and the ashtray you can break on David Letterman is gone.
text_preceding: Under the leadership of Vice President Gore, our initiatives have already saved taxpayers $63 billion.
text_following: Deadwood programs, like mohair subsidies, are gone.

text_original: Deadwood programs, like mohair subsidies, are gone.
text_preceding: The age of the $500 hammer and the ashtray you can break on David Letterman is gone.
text_following: We've streamlined the Agriculture Department by reducing it by more than 1,200 offices.

text_original: We've streamlined the Agriculture Department by reducing it by more than 1,200 offices.
text_preceding: Deadwood programs, like mohair subsidies, are gone.
text_following: We've slashed the small business loan form from an inch thick to a single page.

text_original: We've slashed the small business loan form from an inch thick to a single page.
text_preceding: We've streamlined the Agriculture Department by reducing it by more than 1,200 offices.
text_following: We've thrown away the government's 10,000-page personnel manual.

text_original: We've thrown away the government's 10,000-page personnel manual.
text_preceding: We've slashed the small business loan form from an inch thick to a single page.
text_following: And the government is working better in important ways: FEMA, the Federal Emergency Management Agency, has gone from being a disaster to helping people in disasters.

text_original: And the government is working better in important ways: FEMA, the Federal Emergency Management Agency, has gone from being a disaster to helping people in disasters.
text_preceding: We've thrown away the government's 10,000-page personnel manual.
text_following: You can ask the farmers in the Middle West who fought the flood there or the people in California who have dealt with floods and earthquakes and fires, and they'll tell you that.

text_original: You can ask the farmers in the Middle West who fought the flood there or the people in California who have dealt with floods and earthquakes and fires, and they'll tell you that.
text_preceding: And the government is working better in important ways: FEMA, the Federal Emergency Management Agency, has gone from being a disaster to helping people in disasters.
text_following: Government workers, working hand in hand with private business, rebuilt Southern California's fractured freeways in record time and under budget.

text_original: Government workers, working hand in hand with private business, rebuilt Southern California's fractured freeways in record time and under budget.
text_preceding: You can ask the farmers in the Middle West who fought the flood there or the people in California who have dealt with floods and earthquakes and fires, and they'll tell you that.
text_following: And because the federal government moved fast, all but one of the 5,600 schools damaged in the earthquake are back in business.

text_original: And because the federal government moved fast, all but one of the 5,600 schools damaged in the earthquake are back in business.
text_preceding: Government workers, working hand in hand with private business, rebuilt Southern California's fractured freeways in record time and under budget.
text_following: Now, there are a lot of other things that I could talk about.

text_original: Now, there are a lot of other things that I could talk about.
text_preceding: And because the federal government moved fast, all but one of the 5,600 schools damaged in the earthquake are back in business.
text_following: I want to just mention one because it will be discussed here in the next few weeks.

text_original: I want to just mention one because it will be discussed here in the next few weeks.
text_preceding: Now, there are a lot of other things that I could talk about.
text_following: University administrators all over the country have told me that they are saving weeks and weeks of bureaucratic time now because of our direct college loan program, which makes college loans cheaper and more affordable, with better repayment terms for students, costs the government less, and cuts out paperwork and bureaucracy for the government and for the universities.

text_original: University administrators all over the country have told me that they are saving weeks and weeks of bureaucratic time now because of our direct college loan program, which makes college loans cheaper and more affordable, with better repayment terms for students, costs the government less, and cuts out paperwork and bureaucracy for the government and for the universities.
text_preceding: I want to just mention one because it will be discussed here in the next few weeks.
text_following: We shouldn't cap that program.

text_original: We shouldn't cap that program.
text_preceding: University administrators all over the country have told me that they are saving weeks and weeks of bureaucratic time now because of our direct college loan program, which makes college loans cheaper and more affordable, with better repayment terms for students, costs the government less, and cuts out paperwork and bureaucracy for the government and for the universities.
text_following: We should give every college in America the opportunity to be a part of it.

text_original: We should give every college in America the opportunity to be a part of it.
text_preceding: We shouldn't cap that program.
text_following: MORE REINVENTING AHEAD: Previous government programs gather dust.

text_original: MORE REINVENTING AHEAD: Previous government programs gather dust.
text_preceding: We should give every college in America the opportunity to be a part of it.
text_following: The reinventing government report is getting results.

text_original: The reinventing government report is getting results.
text_preceding: MORE REINVENTING AHEAD: Previous government programs gather dust.
