text_following: There's going to be a second round of reinventing government.

text_original: There's going to be a second round of reinventing government.
text_preceding: The reinventing government report is getting results.
text_following: We propose to cut $130 billion in spending by shrinking departments, extending our freeze on domestic spending, cutting 60public housing programs down to three, getting rid of over 100 programs we do not need, like the Interstate Commerce Commission and the Helium Reserve Program.

text_original: We propose to cut $130 billion in spending by shrinking departments, extending our freeze on domestic spending, cutting 60public housing programs down to three, getting rid of over 100 programs we do not need, like the Interstate Commerce Commission and the Helium Reserve Program.
text_preceding: There's going to be a second round of reinventing government.
text_following: And we're working on getting rid of unnecessary regulations and making them more sensible.

text_original: And we're working on getting rid of unnecessary regulations and making them more sensible.
text_preceding: We propose to cut $130 billion in spending by shrinking departments, extending our freeze on domestic spending, cutting 60public housing programs down to three, getting rid of over 100 programs we do not need, like the Interstate Commerce Commission and the Helium Reserve Program.
text_following: The programs and regulations that have outlived their usefulness should go.

text_original: The programs and regulations that have outlived their usefulness should go.
text_preceding: And we're working on getting rid of unnecessary regulations and making them more sensible.
text_following: We have to cut yesterday's government to help solve tomorrow's problems.

text_original: We have to cut yesterday's government to help solve tomorrow's problems.
text_preceding: The programs and regulations that have outlived their usefulness should go.
text_following: And we need to get government closer to the people its meant to serve.

text_original: And we need to get government closer to the people its meant to serve.
text_preceding: We have to cut yesterday's government to help solve tomorrow's problems.
text_following: We need to help move programs down to the point where states and communities and private citizens in the private sector can do a better job.

text_original: We need to help move programs down to the point where states and communities and private citizens in the private sector can do a better job.
text_preceding: And we need to get government closer to the people its meant to serve.
text_following: If they can do it, we ought to let them do it.

text_original: If they can do it, we ought to let them do it.
text_preceding: We need to help move programs down to the point where states and communities and private citizens in the private sector can do a better job.
text_following: We should get out of the way and let them do what they can do better.

text_original: We should get out of the way and let them do what they can do better.
text_preceding: If they can do it, we ought to let them do it.
text_following: Taking power away from federal bureaucracies and giving it back to communities and individuals is something everyone should be able to be for.

text_original: Taking power away from federal bureaucracies and giving it back to communities and individuals is something everyone should be able to be for.
text_preceding: We should get out of the way and let them do what they can do better.
text_following: It's time for Congress to stop passing on to the state the cost of decisions we make here in Washington.

text_original: It's time for Congress to stop passing on to the state the cost of decisions we make here in Washington.
text_preceding: Taking power away from federal bureaucracies and giving it back to communities and individuals is something everyone should be able to be for.
text_following: I know there are still serious differences over the details of the unfunded mandates legislation, but I want to work with you to make sure we pass a reasonable bill which will protect the national interests and give justified relief where we need to give it.

text_original: I know there are still serious differences over the details of the unfunded mandates legislation, but I want to work with you to make sure we pass a reasonable bill which will protect the national interests and give justified relief where we need to give it.
text_preceding: It's time for Congress to stop passing on to the state the cost of decisions we make here in Washington.
text_following: For years, Congress concealed in the budget scores of pet spending projects.

text_original: For years, Congress concealed in the budget scores of pet spending projects.
text_preceding: I know there are still serious differences over the details of the unfunded mandates legislation, but I want to work with you to make sure we pass a reasonable bill which will protect the national interests and give justified relief where we need to give it.
text_following: There was a $1 million to study stress in plants, and $12 million for a tick removal program that didn't work.

text_original: There was a $1 million to study stress in plants, and $12 million for a tick removal program that didn't work.
text_preceding: For years, Congress concealed in the budget scores of pet spending projects.
text_following: Those of us who have had them know.

text_original: Those of us who have had them know.
text_preceding: There was a $1 million to study stress in plants, and $12 million for a tick removal program that didn't work.
text_following: If you'll give me the line-item veto, I'll remove some of that nnecessary spending.

text_original: If you'll give me the line-item veto, I'll remove some of that nnecessary spending.
text_preceding: Those of us who have had them know.
text_following: But I think we should all remember, and almost all of us would agree, that government still has important responsibilities.

text_original: But I think we should all remember, and almost all of us would agree, that government still has important responsibilities.
text_preceding: If you'll give me the line-item veto, I'll remove some of that nnecessary spending.
text_following: Our young people -- we should think of this when we cut -- our young people hold our future in their hands.

text_original: Our young people -- we should think of this when we cut -- our young people hold our future in their hands.
text_preceding: But I think we should all remember, and almost all of us would agree, that government still has important responsibilities.
text_following: We still owe a debt to our veterans.

text_original: We still owe a debt to our veterans.
text_preceding: Our young people -- we should think of this when we cut -- our young people hold our future in their hands.
text_following: And our senior citizens have made us what we are.

text_original: And our senior citizens have made us what we are.
text_preceding: We still owe a debt to our veterans.
text_following: But it protects education, veterans, Social Security and Medicare -- and I hope you will do the same thing.

text_original: But it protects education, veterans, Social Security and Medicare -- and I hope you will do the same thing.
text_preceding: And our senior citizens have made us what we are.
text_following: You should, and I hope you will.

text_original: You should, and I hope you will.
text_preceding: But it protects education, veterans, Social Security and Medicare -- and I hope you will do the same thing.
text_following: And when we give more flexibility to the states, let us remember that there are certain fundamental national needs that should be addressed in every state, north and south, east and west -- immunization against childhood disease -- school lunches in all our schools -- Head Start, medical care and nutrition for pregnant women and infants -- medical care and nutrition for pregnant women and infants.

text_original: And when we give more flexibility to the states, let us remember that there are certain fundamental national needs that should be addressed in every state, north and south, east and west -- immunization against childhood disease -- school lunches in all our schools -- Head Start, medical care and nutrition for pregnant women and infants -- medical care and nutrition for pregnant women and infants.
text_preceding: You should, and I hope you will.
text_following: All these things -- all these things are in the national interest.

text_original: All these things -- all these things are in the national interest.
text_preceding: And when we give more flexibility to the states, let us remember that there are certain fundamental national needs that should be addressed in every state, north and south, east and west -- immunization against childhood disease -- school lunches in all our schools -- Head Start, medical care and nutrition for pregnant women and infants -- medical care and nutrition for pregnant women and infants.
text_following: I applaud your desire to get rid of costly and unnecessary regulations.

text_original: I applaud your desire to get rid of costly and unnecessary regulations.
text_preceding: All these things -- all these things are in the national interest.
text_following: But when we deregulate, let's remember what national action in the national interest has given us: safer foods for our families, safer toys for our children, safer nursing homes for our parents, safer cars and highways, and safer workplaces, clean air and cleaner water.

text_original: But when we deregulate, let's remember what national action in the national interest has given us: safer foods for our families, safer toys for our children, safer nursing homes for our parents, safer cars and highways, and safer workplaces, clean air and cleaner water.
text_preceding: I applaud your desire to get rid of costly and unnecessary regulations.
text_following: Do we need common sense and fairness in our regulations?

text_original: Do we need common sense and fairness in our regulations?
text_preceding: But when we deregulate, let's remember what national action in the national interest has given us: safer foods for our families, safer toys for our children, safer nursing homes for our parents, safer cars and highways, and safer workplaces, clean air and cleaner water.
text_following: But we can have common sense and still provide for safe drinking water.

text_original: But we can have common sense and still provide for safe drinking water.
text_preceding: Do we need common sense and fairness in our regulations?
text_following: We can have fairness and still clean up toxic dumps, and we ought to do it.

text_original: We can have fairness and still clean up toxic dumps, and we ought to do it.
text_preceding: But we can have common sense and still provide for safe drinking water.
text_following: Should we cut the deficit more?

text_original: Should we cut the deficit more?
text_preceding: We can have fairness and still clean up toxic dumps, and we ought to do it.
text_following: But we can bring it down in a way that still protects our economic recovery and does not unduly punish people who should not be punished, but instead should be helped.

text_original: But we can bring it down in a way that still protects our economic recovery and does not unduly punish people who should not be punished, but instead should be helped.
text_preceding: Should we cut the deficit more?
text_following: CUTTING THE BUDGET:  I know many of you in this chamber support the balanced budget amendment.

text_original: CUTTING THE BUDGET:  I know many of you in this chamber support the balanced budget amendment.
text_preceding: But we can bring it down in a way that still protects our economic recovery and does not unduly punish people who should not be punished, but instead should be helped.
text_following: I certainly want to balance the budget.

text_original: I certainly want to balance the budget.
text_preceding: CUTTING THE BUDGET:  I know many of you in this chamber support the balanced budget amendment.
text_following: Our administration has done more to bring the budget down and to save money than any in a very, very long time.

text_original: Our administration has done more to bring the budget down and to save money than any in a very, very long time.
text_preceding: I certainly want to balance the budget.
text_following: If you believe passing this amendment is the right thing to do, then you have to be straight with the American people.

text_original: If you believe passing this amendment is the right thing to do, then you have to be straight with the American people.
text_preceding: Our administration has done more to bring the budget down and to save money than any in a very, very long time.
text_following: They have a right to know what you're going to cut, what taxes you're going to raise, and how it's going to affect them.

text_original: They have a right to know what you're going to cut, what taxes you're going to raise, and how it's going to affect them.
text_preceding: If you believe passing this amendment is the right thing to do, then you have to be straight with the American people.
text_following: We should be doing things in the open around here.

text_original: We should be doing things in the open around here.
text_preceding: They have a right to know what you're going to cut, what taxes you're going to raise, and how it's going to affect them.
text_following: For example, everybody ought to know if this proposal is going to endanger Social Security.

text_original: For example, everybody ought to know if this proposal is going to endanger Social Security.
text_preceding: We should be doing things in the open around here.
text_following: I would oppose that, and I think most Americans would.

text_original: I would oppose that, and I think most Americans would.
text_preceding: For example, everybody ought to know if this proposal is going to endanger Social Security.
text_following: Nothing is done more to undermine our sense of common responsibility than our failed welfare system.

text_original: Nothing is done more to undermine our sense of common responsibility than our failed welfare system.
text_preceding: I would oppose that, and I think most Americans would.
text_following: This is one of the problems we have to face here in Washington in our New Covenant.

text_original: This is one of the problems we have to face here in Washington in our New Covenant.
text_preceding: Nothing is done more to undermine our sense of common responsibility than our failed welfare system.
text_following: It lets millions of parents get away without paying their child support.

text_original: It lets millions of parents get away without paying their child support.
text_preceding: This is one of the problems we have to face here in Washington in our New Covenant.
text_following: It keeps a minority, but a significant minority of the people on welfare trapped on it for a very long time.

text_original: It keeps a minority, but a significant minority of the people on welfare trapped on it for a very long time.
text_preceding: It lets millions of parents get away without paying their child support.
text_following: I've worked on this problem for a long time, nearly 15 years now.

text_original: I've worked on this problem for a long time, nearly 15 years now.
text_preceding: It keeps a minority, but a significant minority of the people on welfare trapped on it for a very long time.
text_following: As a governor I had the honor of working with the Reagan administration to write the last welfare reform bill back in 1988.

text_original: As a governor I had the honor of working with the Reagan administration to write the last welfare reform bill back in 1988.
text_preceding: I've worked on this problem for a long time, nearly 15 years now.
text_following: In the last two years we made a good start in continuing the work of welfare reform.

text_original: In the last two years we made a good start in continuing the work of welfare reform.
text_preceding: As a governor I had the honor of working with the Reagan administration to write the last welfare reform bill back in 1988.
text_following: Our administration gave two dozen states the right to slash through federal rules and regulations to reform their own welfare systems, and to try to promote work and responsibility over welfare and dependency.

text_original: Our administration gave two dozen states the right to slash through federal rules and regulations to reform their own welfare systems, and to try to promote work and responsibility over welfare and dependency.
text_preceding: In the last two years we made a good start in continuing the work of welfare reform.
text_following: Last year I introduced the most sweeping welfare reform plan ever presented by an administration.

text_original: Last year I introduced the most sweeping welfare reform plan ever presented by an administration.
text_preceding: Our administration gave two dozen states the right to slash through federal rules and regulations to reform their own welfare systems, and to try to promote work and responsibility over welfare and dependency.
text_following: We have to make welfare what it was meant to be -- a second chance, not a way of life.

text_original: We have to make welfare what it was meant to be -- a second chance, not a way of life.
text_preceding: Last year I introduced the most sweeping welfare reform plan ever presented by an administration.
text_following: We have to help those on welfare move to work as quickly as possible, to provide child care and teach them skills if that's what they need for up to two years.

text_original: We have to help those on welfare move to work as quickly as possible, to provide child care and teach them skills if that's what they need for up to two years.
text_preceding: We have to make welfare what it was meant to be -- a second chance, not a way of life.
text_following: And after that, there ought to be a simple hard rule: anyone who can work must go to work.

text_original: And after that, there ought to be a simple hard rule: anyone who can work must go to work.
text_preceding: We have to help those on welfare move to work as quickly as possible, to provide child care and teach them skills if that's what they need for up to two years.
text_following: If a parent isn't paying child support, they should be forced to pay.

text_original: If a parent isn't paying child support, they should be forced to pay.
text_preceding: And after that, there ought to be a simple hard rule: anyone who can work must go to work.
text_following: We should suspend drivers' licenses, track the across state lines, make them work off what they owe.

text_original: We should suspend drivers' licenses, track the across state lines, make them work off what they owe.
text_preceding: If a parent isn't paying child support, they should be forced to pay.
text_following: Governments do not raise children, people do.

text_original: Governments do not raise children, people do.
text_preceding: We should suspend drivers' licenses, track the across state lines, make them work off what they owe.
text_following: And the parents must take responsibility for the children they bring into this world.

text_original: And the parents must take responsibility for the children they bring into this world.
text_preceding: Governments do not raise children, people do.
text_following: I want to work with you, with all of you, to pass welfare reform.

text_original: I want to work with you, with all of you, to pass welfare reform.
text_preceding: And the parents must take responsibility for the children they bring into this world.
text_following: But our goal must be to liberate people and lift them up, from dependence to independence, from welfare to work, from mere childbearing to responsible parenting.

text_original: But our goal must be to liberate people and lift them up, from dependence to independence, from welfare to work, from mere childbearing to responsible parenting.
text_preceding: I want to work with you, with all of you, to pass welfare reform.
text_following: Our goal should not be to punish them because they happen to be poor.

text_original: Our goal should not be to punish them because they happen to be poor.
text_preceding: But our goal must be to liberate people and lift them up, from dependence to independence, from welfare to work, from mere childbearing to responsible parenting.
text_following: We should -- we should require work and mutual responsibility.

text_original: We should -- we should require work and mutual responsibility.
text_preceding: Our goal should not be to punish them because they happen to be poor.
text_following: But we shouldn't cut people off just because they're poor, they're young, or even because they're unmarried.

text_original: But we shouldn't cut people off just because they're poor, they're young, or even because they're unmarried.
text_preceding: We should -- we should require work and mutual responsibility.
text_following: We should promote responsibility by requiring young mothers to live at home with their parents or in other supervised settings, by requiring them to finish school.

text_original: We should promote responsibility by requiring young mothers to live at home with their parents or in other supervised settings, by requiring them to finish school.
text_preceding: But we shouldn't cut people off just because they're poor, they're young, or even because they're unmarried.
text_following: But we shouldn't put them and their children out on the street.

text_original: But we shouldn't put them and their children out on the street.
text_preceding: We should promote responsibility by requiring young mothers to live at home with their parents or in other supervised settings, by requiring them to finish school.
text_following: And I know all the arguments, pro and con, and I have read and thought about this for a long time.

text_original: And I know all the arguments, pro and con, and I have read and thought about this for a long time.
text_preceding: But we shouldn't put them and their children out on the street.
text_following: I still don't think we can in good conscious punish poor children for the mistakes of their parents.

text_original: I still don't think we can in good conscious punish poor children for the mistakes of their parents.
text_preceding: And I know all the arguments, pro and con, and I have read and thought about this for a long time.
text_following: My fellow Americans, every single survey shows that all the American people care about this without regard to party or race or region.

text_original: My fellow Americans, every single survey shows that all the American people care about this without regard to party or race or region.
text_preceding: I still don't think we can in good conscious punish poor children for the mistakes of their parents.
text_following: So let this be the year we end welfare as we know it.

text_original: So let this be the year we end welfare as we know it.
text_preceding: My fellow Americans, every single survey shows that all the American people care about this without regard to party or race or region.
text_following: But also let this be the year that we are all able to stop using this issue to divide America.

text_original: But also let this be the year that we are all able to stop using this issue to divide America.
text_preceding: So let this be the year we end welfare as we know it.
text_following: No one is more eager to end welfare -- I may be the only president who has actually had the opportunity to sit in a welfare office, who's actually spent hours and hours talking to people on welfare.

text_original: No one is more eager to end welfare -- I may be the only president who has actually had the opportunity to sit in a welfare office, who's actually spent hours and hours talking to people on welfare.
text_preceding: But also let this be the year that we are all able to stop using this issue to divide America.
text_following: And I am telling you, people who are trapped on it know it doesn't work.

text_original: And I am telling you, people who are trapped on it know it doesn't work.
text_preceding: No one is more eager to end welfare -- I may be the only president who has actually had the opportunity to sit in a welfare office, who's actually spent hours and hours talking to people on welfare.
text_following: So we can promote together education and work and good parenting.

text_original: So we can promote together education and work and good parenting.
text_preceding: And I am telling you, people who are trapped on it know it doesn't work.
text_following: I have no problem with punishing bad behavior or the refusal to be a worker or a student, or a responsible parent.

text_original: I have no problem with punishing bad behavior or the refusal to be a worker or a student, or a responsible parent.
text_preceding: So we can promote together education and work and good parenting.
text_following: I just don't want to punish poverty and past mistakes.

text_original: I just don't want to punish poverty and past mistakes.
text_preceding: I have no problem with punishing bad behavior or the refusal to be a worker or a student, or a responsible parent.
text_following: All of us have made our mistakes, and none of us can change our yesterdays.

text_original: All of us have made our mistakes, and none of us can change our yesterdays.
text_preceding: I just don't want to punish poverty and past mistakes.
text_following: But every one of us can change our tomorrows.

text_original: But every one of us can change our tomorrows.
text_preceding: All of us have made our mistakes, and none of us can change our yesterdays.
text_following: And America's best example of that may be Lynn Woolsey, who worked her way off welfare to become a congresswoman from the state of California.

text_original: And America's best example of that may be Lynn Woolsey, who worked her way off welfare to become a congresswoman from the state of California.
text_preceding: But every one of us can change our tomorrows.
text_following: I know the members of this Congress are concerned about crime, as are all the citizens of our country.

text_original: I know the members of this Congress are concerned about crime, as are all the citizens of our country.
text_preceding: And America's best example of that may be Lynn Woolsey, who worked her way off welfare to become a congresswoman from the state of California.
text_following: And I remind you that last year, we passed a very tough crime bill -- longer sentences, three strikes and you're out, almost 60 new capital punishment offenses, more prisons, more prevention, 100,000 more police.

text_original: And I remind you that last year, we passed a very tough crime bill -- longer sentences, three strikes and you're out, almost 60 new capital punishment offenses, more prisons, more prevention, 100,000 more police.
text_preceding: I know the members of this Congress are concerned about crime, as are all the citizens of our country.
text_following: And we paid for it all by reducing the size of the federal bureaucracy and giving the money back to local communities to lower the crime rate.

text_original: And we paid for it all by reducing the size of the federal bureaucracy and giving the money back to local communities to lower the crime rate.
text_preceding: And I remind you that last year, we passed a very tough crime bill -- longer sentences, three strikes and you're out, almost 60 new capital punishment offenses, more prisons, more prevention, 100,000 more police.
text_following: There may be other things we can do to be tougher on crime, to be smarter with crime, to help to lower that rate first.

text_original: There may be other things we can do to be tougher on crime, to be smarter with crime, to help to lower that rate first.
text_preceding: And we paid for it all by reducing the size of the federal bureaucracy and giving the money back to local communities to lower the crime rate.
text_following: Well, if there are, let's talk about them and let's do them.

text_original: Well, if there are, let's talk about them and let's do them.
text_preceding: There may be other things we can do to be tougher on crime, to be smarter with crime, to help to lower that rate first.
text_following: But let's not go back on the things that we did last year that we know work.

text_original: But let's not go back on the things that we did last year that we know work.
text_preceding: Well, if there are, let's talk about them and let's do them.
text_following: That we know work because the local law enforcement officers tell us that we did the right things, because local community leaders who have worked for years and years to lower the crime rate tell us that they work.

text_original: That we know work because the local law enforcement officers tell us that we did the right things, because local community leaders who have worked for years and years to lower the crime rate tell us that they work.
text_preceding: But let's not go back on the things that we did last year that we know work.
text_following: Let's look at the experience of our cities and our rural areas where the crime rate has gone down and ask the people who did it how they did it.

text_original: Let's look at the experience of our cities and our rural areas where the crime rate has gone down and ask the people who did it how they did it.
text_preceding: That we know work because the local law enforcement officers tell us that we did the right things, because local community leaders who have worked for years and years to lower the crime rate tell us that they work.
text_following: And if what we did last year supports the decline in the crime rate -- and I am convinced that it does -- let us not go back on it.

text_original: And if what we did last year supports the decline in the crime rate -- and I am convinced that it does -- let us not go back on it.
text_preceding: Let's look at the experience of our cities and our rural areas where the crime rate has gone down and ask the people who did it how they did it.
text_following: Let's stick with it, implement it.

text_original: Let's stick with it, implement it.
text_preceding: And if what we did last year supports the decline in the crime rate -- and I am convinced that it does -- let us not go back on it.
text_following: We've got four more hard years of work to do to do that.

text_original: We've got four more hard years of work to do to do that.
text_preceding: Let's stick with it, implement it.
text_following: THE BRADY BILL: I don't want to destroy the good atmosphere in the room or in the country tonight, but I have to mention one issue that divided this body greatly last year.

text_original: THE BRADY BILL: I don't want to destroy the good atmosphere in the room or in the country tonight, but I have to mention one issue that divided this body greatly last year.
text_preceding: We've got four more hard years of work to do to do that.
text_following: The last Congress also passed the Brady Bill and, in the crime bill, the ban on 19 assault weapons.

text_original: The last Congress also passed the Brady Bill and, in the crime bill, the ban on 19 assault weapons.
text_preceding: THE BRADY BILL: I don't want to destroy the good atmosphere in the room or in the country tonight, but I have to mention one issue that divided this body greatly last year.
text_following: I don't think it's a secret to anybody in this room that several members of the last Congress who voted for that aren't here tonight because they voted for it.

text_original: I don't think it's a secret to anybody in this room that several members of the last Congress who voted for that aren't here tonight because they voted for it.
text_preceding: The last Congress also passed the Brady Bill and, in the crime bill, the ban on 19 assault weapons.
text_following: And I know, therefore, that some of you who are here because they voted for it are under enormous pressure to repeal it.

text_original: And I know, therefore, that some of you who are here because they voted for it are under enormous pressure to repeal it.
text_preceding: I don't think it's a secret to anybody in this room that several members of the last Congress who voted for that aren't here tonight because they voted for it.
text_following: I just have to tell you how I feel about it.

text_original: I just have to tell you how I feel about it.
text_preceding: And I know, therefore, that some of you who are here because they voted for it are under enormous pressure to repeal it.
text_following: The members of Congress who voted for that bill and I would never do anything to infringe on the right to keep and bear arms to hunt and to engage in other appropriate sporting activities.

text_original: The members of Congress who voted for that bill and I would never do anything to infringe on the right to keep and bear arms to hunt and to engage in other appropriate sporting activities.
text_preceding: I just have to tell you how I feel about it.
text_following: I've done it since I was a boy, and I'm going to keep right on doing it until I can't do it anymore.

text_original: I've done it since I was a boy, and I'm going to keep right on doing it until I can't do it anymore.
text_preceding: The members of Congress who voted for that bill and I would never do anything to infringe on the right to keep and bear arms to hunt and to engage in other appropriate sporting activities.
text_following: But a lot of people laid down their seats in Congress so that police officers and kids wouldn't have to lay down their lives under a hail of assault weapon attack -- and I will not let that be repealed.

text_original: But a lot of people laid down their seats in Congress so that police officers and kids wouldn't have to lay down their lives under a hail of assault weapon attack -- and I will not let that be repealed.
text_preceding: I've done it since I was a boy, and I'm going to keep right on doing it until I can't do it anymore.
text_following: I will not let it be repealed.

text_original: I will not let it be repealed.
text_preceding: But a lot of people laid down their seats in Congress so that police officers and kids wouldn't have to lay down their lives under a hail of assault weapon attack -- and I will not let that be repealed.
text_following: I'd like to talk about a couple of other issues we have to deal with.

text_original: I'd like to talk about a couple of other issues we have to deal with.
text_preceding: I will not let it be repealed.
text_following: I want us to cut more spending, but I hope we won't cut government programs that help to prepare us for the new economy, promote responsibility and are organized from the grass roots up, not by federal bureaucracy.

text_original: I want us to cut more spending, but I hope we won't cut government programs that help to prepare us for the new economy, promote responsibility and are organized from the grass roots up, not by federal bureaucracy.
text_preceding: I'd like to talk about a couple of other issues we have to deal with.
text_following: The very best example of this is the National Service Corps -- AmeriCorps.

text_original: The very best example of this is the National Service Corps -- AmeriCorps.
text_preceding: I want us to cut more spending, but I hope we won't cut government programs that help to prepare us for the new economy, promote responsibility and are organized from the grass roots up, not by federal bureaucracy.
text_following: It passed with strong bipartisan support.

text_original: It passed with strong bipartisan support.
text_preceding: The very best example of this is the National Service Corps -- AmeriCorps.
text_following: And now there are 20,000 Americans, more than every served in one year in the Peace Corps, working all over this country, helping people person to person in local, grass-roots volunteer groups, solving problems and, in the process, earning some money for their education.

text_original: And now there are 20,000 Americans, more than every served in one year in the Peace Corps, working all over this country, helping people person to person in local, grass-roots volunteer groups, solving problems and, in the process, earning some money for their education.
text_preceding: It passed with strong bipartisan support.
text_following: This is citizenship at its best.

text_original: This is citizenship at its best.
text_preceding: And now there are 20,000 Americans, more than every served in one year in the Peace Corps, working all over this country, helping people person to person in local, grass-roots volunteer groups, solving problems and, in the process, earning some money for their education.
text_following: It's good for the AmeriCorps members, but it's good for the rest of us, too.

text_original: It's good for the AmeriCorps members, but it's good for the rest of us, too.
text_preceding: This is citizenship at its best.
text_following: It's the essence of the New Covenant, and we shouldn't stop it.

text_original: It's the essence of the New Covenant, and we shouldn't stop it.
text_preceding: It's good for the AmeriCorps members, but it's good for the rest of us, too.
text_following: All Americans, not only in the states most heavily affected, but in every place in this country, are rightly disturbed by the large numbers of illegal aliens entering our country.

text_original: All Americans, not only in the states most heavily affected, but in every place in this country, are rightly disturbed by the large numbers of illegal aliens entering our country.
text_preceding: It's the essence of the New Covenant, and we shouldn't stop it.
text_following: The jobs they hold might otherwise be held by citizens or legal immigrants.

text_original: The jobs they hold might otherwise be held by citizens or legal immigrants.
text_preceding: All Americans, not only in the states most heavily affected, but in every place in this country, are rightly disturbed by the large numbers of illegal aliens entering our country.
text_following: The public service they use impose burdens on our taxpayers.

text_original: The public service they use impose burdens on our taxpayers.
text_preceding: The jobs they hold might otherwise be held by citizens or legal immigrants.
text_following: That's why our administration has moved aggressively to secure our borders more by hiring a record number of new border guards, by deporting twice as many criminal aliens as ever before, by cracking down on illegal hiring, by barring welfare benefits to illegal aliens.

text_original: That's why our administration has moved aggressively to secure our borders more by hiring a record number of new border guards, by deporting twice as many criminal aliens as ever before, by cracking down on illegal hiring, by barring welfare benefits to illegal aliens.
text_preceding: The public service they use impose burdens on our taxpayers.
text_following: In the budget I will present to you we will try to do more to speed the deportation of illegal aliens who are arrested for crimes, to better identify illegal aliens in the workplace as recommended by the commission headed by former Congresswoman Barbara Jordan.

text_original: In the budget I will present to you we will try to do more to speed the deportation of illegal aliens who are arrested for crimes, to better identify illegal aliens in the workplace as recommended by the commission headed by former Congresswoman Barbara Jordan.
text_preceding: That's why our administration has moved aggressively to secure our borders more by hiring a record number of new border guards, by deporting twice as many criminal aliens as ever before, by cracking down on illegal hiring, by barring welfare benefits to illegal aliens.
text_following: We are a nation of immigrants.

text_original: We are a nation of immigrants.
text_preceding: In the budget I will present to you we will try to do more to speed the deportation of illegal aliens who are arrested for crimes, to better identify illegal aliens in the workplace as recommended by the commission headed by former Congresswoman Barbara Jordan.
text_following: But we are also a nation of laws.

text_original: But we are also a nation of laws.
text_preceding: We are a nation of immigrants.
text_following: It is wrong and ultimately self-defeating for a nation of immigrants to permit the kind of abuse of our immigration laws we have seen in recent years, and we must do more to stop it.

text_original: It is wrong and ultimately self-defeating for a nation of immigrants to permit the kind of abuse of our immigration laws we have seen in recent years, and we must do more to stop it.
text_preceding: But we are also a nation of laws.
text_following: EXPANDING THE MIDDLE CLASS: The most important job of our government in this new era is to empower the American people to succeed in the global economy.

text_original: EXPANDING THE MIDDLE CLASS: The most important job of our government in this new era is to empower the American people to succeed in the global economy.
text_preceding: It is wrong and ultimately self-defeating for a nation of immigrants to permit the kind of abuse of our immigration laws we have seen in recent years, and we must do more to stop it.
text_following: America has always been a land of opportunity, a land where, if you work hard, you can get ahead.

text_original: America has always been a land of opportunity, a land where, if you work hard, you can get ahead.
text_preceding: EXPANDING THE MIDDLE CLASS: The most important job of our government in this new era is to empower the American people to succeed in the global economy.
text_following: We've become a great middle class country.

text_original: We've become a great middle class country.
text_preceding: America has always been a land of opportunity, a land where, if you work hard, you can get ahead.
text_following: Middle class values sustain us.

text_original: Middle class values sustain us.
text_preceding: We've become a great middle class country.
text_following: We must expand that middle class, and shrink the underclass, even as we do everything we can to support the millions of Americans who are already successful in the new economy.

text_original: We must expand that middle class, and shrink the underclass, even as we do everything we can to support the millions of Americans who are already successful in the new economy.
text_preceding: Middle class values sustain us.
text_following: America is once again the world's strongest economic power, almost six million new jobs in the last two years, exports booming, inflation down, high-wage jobs are coming back.

text_original: America is once again the world's strongest economic power, almost six million new jobs in the last two years, exports booming, inflation down, high-wage jobs are coming back.
text_preceding: We must expand that middle class, and shrink the underclass, even as we do everything we can to support the millions of Americans who are already successful in the new economy.
text_following: A record number of American entrepreneurs are living the American Dream.

text_original: A record number of American entrepreneurs are living the American Dream.
text_preceding: America is once again the world's strongest economic power, almost six million new jobs in the last two years, exports booming, inflation down, high-wage jobs are coming back.
text_following: If we want it to stay that way, those who work and lift our nation must have more of its benefits.

text_original: If we want it to stay that way, those who work and lift our nation must have more of its benefits.
text_preceding: A record number of American entrepreneurs are living the American Dream.
text_following: Today, too many of those people are being left out.

text_original: Today, too many of those people are being left out.
text_preceding: If we want it to stay that way, those who work and lift our nation must have more of its benefits.
text_following: They're working harder for less.

text_original: They're working harder for less.
text_preceding: Today, too many of those people are being left out.
text_following: They have less security, less income, less certainty that they can even afford a vacation, much less college for their kids or retirement for themselves.

text_original: They have less security, less income, less certainty that they can even afford a vacation, much less college for their kids or retirement for themselves.
text_preceding: They're working harder for less.
text_following: If we don't act, our economy will probably keep doing what it's been doing since about 1978, when the income growth began to go to those at the very top of our economic scale and the people in the vast middle got very little growth, and people who worked like crazy but were on the bottom then fell even further and further behind in the years afterward -- no matter how hard they worked.

text_original: If we don't act, our economy will probably keep doing what it's been doing since about 1978, when the income growth began to go to those at the very top of our economic scale and the people in the vast middle got very little growth, and people who worked like crazy but were on the bottom then fell even further and further behind in the years afterward -- no matter how hard they worked.
text_preceding: They have less security, less income, less certainty that they can even afford a vacation, much less college for their kids or retirement for themselves.
text_following: We've got to have a government that can be a real partner in making this new economy work for all of our people.

text_original: We've got to have a government that can be a real partner in making this new economy work for all of our people.
text_preceding: If we don't act, our economy will probably keep doing what it's been doing since about 1978, when the income growth began to go to those at the very top of our economic scale and the people in the vast middle got very little growth, and people who worked like crazy but were on the bottom then fell even further and further behind in the years afterward -- no matter how hard they worked.
text_following: A government that helps each and every one of us to get an education, and to have the opportunity to renew our skills.

text_original: A government that helps each and every one of us to get an education, and to have the opportunity to renew our skills.
text_preceding: We've got to have a government that can be a real partner in making this new economy work for all of our people.
text_following: That's why we worked so hard to increase educational opportunities in the last two years -- from Head Start to public schools, to apprenticeships for young people who don't go to college, to making college loans more available and more affordable.

text_original: That's why we worked so hard to increase educational opportunities in the last two years -- from Head Start to public schools, to apprenticeships for young people who don't go to college, to making college loans more available and more affordable.
text_preceding: A government that helps each and every one of us to get an education, and to have the opportunity to renew our skills.
text_following: That's the first thing we have to do.

text_original: That's the first thing we have to do.
text_preceding: That's why we worked so hard to increase educational opportunities in the last two years -- from Head Start to public schools, to apprenticeships for young people who don't go to college, to making college loans more available and more affordable.
text_following: We've got to do something to empower people to improve their skills.

text_original: We've got to do something to empower people to improve their skills.
text_preceding: That's the first thing we have to do.
text_following: LOWERING TAXES: The second thing we ought to do is to help people raise their incomes immediately by lowering their taxes.

text_original: LOWERING TAXES: The second thing we ought to do is to help people raise their incomes immediately by lowering their taxes.
text_preceding: We've got to do something to empower people to improve their skills.
text_following: We took the first step in 1993 with a working family tax cut for 15 million families with incomes under $27,000.

text_original: We took the first step in 1993 with a working family tax cut for 15 million families with incomes under $27,000.
text_preceding: LOWERING TAXES: The second thing we ought to do is to help people raise their incomes immediately by lowering their taxes.
text_following: A tax cut that this year will average about $1,000 a family.

text_original: A tax cut that this year will average about $1,000 a family.
text_preceding: We took the first step in 1993 with a working family tax cut for 15 million families with incomes under $27,000.
text_following: And we also gave tax reductions to most small and new businesses.

text_original: And we also gave tax reductions to most small and new businesses.
text_preceding: A tax cut that this year will average about $1,000 a family.
text_following: Before we could do more than that, we first had to bring down the deficit we inherited, and we had to get economic growth up.

text_original: Before we could do more than that, we first had to bring down the deficit we inherited, and we had to get economic growth up.
text_preceding: And we also gave tax reductions to most small and new businesses.
text_following: And now we can cut taxes in a more comprehensive way.

text_original: And now we can cut taxes in a more comprehensive way.
text_preceding: Before we could do more than that, we first had to bring down the deficit we inherited, and we had to get economic growth up.
text_following: But tax cuts should reinforce and promote our first obligation -- to empower our citizens through education and training to make the most of their own lives.

text_original: But tax cuts should reinforce and promote our first obligation -- to empower our citizens through education and training to make the most of their own lives.
text_preceding: And now we can cut taxes in a more comprehensive way.
text_following: The spotlight should shine on those who make the right choices for themselves, their families and their communities.

text_original: The spotlight should shine on those who make the right choices for themselves, their families and their communities.
text_preceding: But tax cuts should reinforce and promote our first obligation -- to empower our citizens through education and training to make the most of their own lives.
text_following: I have proposed the Middle Class Bill of Rights, which should properly be called the Bill of Rights and Responsibilities because its provisions only benefit those who are working to educate and raise their children and to educate themselves.

text_original: I have proposed the Middle Class Bill of Rights, which should properly be called the Bill of Rights and Responsibilities because its provisions only benefit those who are working to educate and raise their children and to educate themselves.
text_preceding: The spotlight should shine on those who make the right choices for themselves, their families and their communities.
text_following: It will, therefore, give needed tax relief and raise incomes in both the short run and the long run in a way that benefits all of us.

text_original: It will, therefore, give needed tax relief and raise incomes in both the short run and the long run in a way that benefits all of us.
text_preceding: I have proposed the Middle Class Bill of Rights, which should properly be called the Bill of Rights and Responsibilities because its provisions only benefit those who are working to educate and raise their children and to educate themselves.
text_following: First, a tax deduction for all education and training after high school.

text_original: First, a tax deduction for all education and training after high school.
text_preceding: It will, therefore, give needed tax relief and raise incomes in both the short run and the long run in a way that benefits all of us.
text_following: If you think about it, we permit businesses to deduct their investment, we permit individuals to deduct interest on their home mortgages, but today an education is even more important to the economic well-being of our whole country than even those things are.

text_original: If you think about it, we permit businesses to deduct their investment, we permit individuals to deduct interest on their home mortgages, but today an education is even more important to the economic well-being of our whole country than even those things are.
text_preceding: First, a tax deduction for all education and training after high school.
text_following: We should do everything we can to encourage it.

text_original: We should do everything we can to encourage it.
text_preceding: If you think about it, we permit businesses to deduct their investment, we permit individuals to deduct interest on their home mortgages, but today an education is even more important to the economic well-being of our whole country than even those things are.
text_following: And I hope you will support it.

text_original: And I hope you will support it.
text_preceding: We should do everything we can to encourage it.
text_following: Second, we ought to cut taxes, $500 for families with children under 13.

text_original: Second, we ought to cut taxes, $500 for families with children under 13.
text_preceding: And I hope you will support it.
text_following: Third, we ought to foster more savings and personal responsibility by permitting people to establish an Individual Retirement Account and withdraw from it tax free for the cost of education, health care, first-time home-buying or the care of a parent.

text_original: Third, we ought to foster more savings and personal responsibility by permitting people to establish an Individual Retirement Account and withdraw from it tax free for the cost of education, health care, first-time home-buying or the care of a parent.
text_preceding: Second, we ought to cut taxes, $500 for families with children under 13.
text_following: And fourth, we should pass a G.I. Bill for America's workers.

text_original: And fourth, we should pass a G.I. Bill for America's workers.
text_preceding: Third, we ought to foster more savings and personal responsibility by permitting people to establish an Individual Retirement Account and withdraw from it tax free for the cost of education, health care, first-time home-buying or the care of a parent.
text_following: We propose to collapse nearly 70 federal programs and not give the money to the states, but give the money directly to the American people.

text_original: We propose to collapse nearly 70 federal programs and not give the money to the states, but give the money directly to the American people.
text_preceding: And fourth, we should pass a G.I. Bill for America's workers.
text_following: Offer vouchers to them so that they, if they're laid off or if they're working for a very low wage, can get a voucher worth $2,600 a year for up to two years to go to their local community colleges or wherever else they want to get the skills they need to improve their lives.

text_original: Offer vouchers to them so that they, if they're laid off or if they're working for a very low wage, can get a voucher worth $2,600 a year for up to two years to go to their local community colleges or wherever else they want to get the skills they need to improve their lives.
text_preceding: We propose to collapse nearly 70 federal programs and not give the money to the states, but give the money directly to the American people.
text_following: Let's empower people in this way.

text_original: Let's empower people in this way.
text_preceding: Offer vouchers to them so that they, if they're laid off or if they're working for a very low wage, can get a voucher worth $2,600 a year for up to two years to go to their local community colleges or wherever else they want to get the skills they need to improve their lives.
text_following: Move it from the government directly to the workers of America.

text_original: Move it from the government directly to the workers of America.
text_preceding: Let's empower people in this way.
text_following: Now, any one of us can call for a tax cut, but I won't accept one that explodes the deficit or puts our recovery at risk.

text_original: Now, any one of us can call for a tax cut, but I won't accept one that explodes the deficit or puts our recovery at risk.
text_preceding: Move it from the government directly to the workers of America.
text_following: We ought to pay for our tax cuts fully and honestly.

text_original: We ought to pay for our tax cuts fully and honestly.
text_preceding: Now, any one of us can call for a tax cut, but I won't accept one that explodes the deficit or puts our recovery at risk.
text_following: Just two years ago, it was an open question whether we would find the strength to cut the deficit.

text_original: Just two years ago, it was an open question whether we would find the strength to cut the deficit.
text_preceding: We ought to pay for our tax cuts fully and honestly.
text_following: Thanks to the courage of the people who were here then, many of whom didn't return, we did cut the deficit.

text_original: Thanks to the courage of the people who were here then, many of whom didn't return, we did cut the deficit.
text_preceding: Just two years ago, it was an open question whether we would find the strength to cut the deficit.
text_following: We began to do what others said would not be done.

text_original: We began to do what others said would not be done.
text_preceding: Thanks to the courage of the people who were here then, many of whom didn't return, we did cut the deficit.
text_following: We cut the deficit by over $600 billion, about $10,000 for every family in this country.

text_original: We cut the deficit by over $600 billion, about $10,000 for every family in this country.
text_preceding: We began to do what others said would not be done.
text_following: It's coming down three years in a row for the first time since Mr.Truman was president, and I don't think anybody in America wants us to let it explode again

text_original: It's coming down three years in a row for the first time since Mr.Truman was president, and I don't think anybody in America wants us to let it explode again
text_preceding: We cut the deficit by over $600 billion, about $10,000 for every family in this country.
text_following: In the budget I will send you, the Middle Class Bill of Rights is fully paid for by budget cuts in bureaucracy, cuts in programs, cuts in special interest subsidies.

text_original: In the budget I will send you, the Middle Class Bill of Rights is fully paid for by budget cuts in bureaucracy, cuts in programs, cuts in special interest subsidies.
text_preceding: It's coming down three years in a row for the first time since Mr.Truman was president, and I don't think anybody in America wants us to let it explode again
text_following: And the spending cuts will more than double the tax cuts.

text_original: And the spending cuts will more than double the tax cuts.
text_preceding: In the budget I will send you, the Middle Class Bill of Rights is fully paid for by budget cuts in bureaucracy, cuts in programs, cuts in special interest subsidies.
text_following: My budget pays for the Middle Class Bill of Rights without any cuts in Medicare.

text_original: My budget pays for the Middle Class Bill of Rights without any cuts in Medicare.
text_preceding: And the spending cuts will more than double the tax cuts.
text_following: And I will oppose any attempts to pay for tax cuts with Medicare cuts.

text_original: And I will oppose any attempts to pay for tax cuts with Medicare cuts.
text_preceding: My budget pays for the Middle Class Bill of Rights without any cuts in Medicare.
text_following: That's not the right thing to do.

text_original: That's not the right thing to do.
text_preceding: And I will oppose any attempts to pay for tax cuts with Medicare cuts.
text_following: I know that a lot of you have your own ideas about tax relief, and some of them I find quite interesting.

text_original: I know that a lot of you have your own ideas about tax relief, and some of them I find quite interesting.
text_preceding: That's not the right thing to do.
text_following: I really want to work with all of you.

text_original: I really want to work with all of you.
text_preceding: I know that a lot of you have your own ideas about tax relief, and some of them I find quite interesting.
text_following: My test for our proposals will be: Will it create jobs and raise incomes?

text_original: My test for our proposals will be: Will it create jobs and raise incomes?
text_preceding: I really want to work with all of you.
text_following: Will it strengthen our families and support our children?

text_original: Will it strengthen our families and support our children?
text_preceding: My test for our proposals will be: Will it create jobs and raise incomes?
text_following: Will it build the middle class and shrink the underclass?

text_original: Will it build the middle class and shrink the underclass?
text_preceding: Will it strengthen our families and support our children?
text_following: RAISING THE MINIMUM WAGE:  The goal of building the middle class and shrinking the underclass is also why I believe that you should raise the minimum wage.

text_original: RAISING THE MINIMUM WAGE:  The goal of building the middle class and shrinking the underclass is also why I believe that you should raise the minimum wage.
text_preceding: Will it build the middle class and shrink the underclass?
text_following: Two and a half million Americans -- 2.5 million Americans, often women with children, are working out there today for $4.25 an hour.

text_original: Two and a half million Americans -- 2.5 million Americans, often women with children, are working out there today for $4.25 an hour.
text_preceding: RAISING THE MINIMUM WAGE:  The goal of building the middle class and shrinking the underclass is also why I believe that you should raise the minimum wage.
text_following: In terms of real buying power, by next year that minimum wage will be at a 40-year low.

text_original: In terms of real buying power, by next year that minimum wage will be at a 40-year low.
text_preceding: Two and a half million Americans -- 2.5 million Americans, often women with children, are working out there today for $4.25 an hour.
text_following: That's not my idea of how the new economy ought to work.

text_original: That's not my idea of how the new economy ought to work.
text_preceding: In terms of real buying power, by next year that minimum wage will be at a 40-year low.
text_following: Now, I've studied the arguments and the evidence for and against a minimum wage increase.

text_original: Now, I've studied the arguments and the evidence for and against a minimum wage increase.
text_preceding: That's not my idea of how the new economy ought to work.
text_following: I believe the weight of the evidence is that a modest increase does not cost jobs, and may even lure people back into the job market.

text_original: I believe the weight of the evidence is that a modest increase does not cost jobs, and may even lure people back into the job market.
text_preceding: Now, I've studied the arguments and the evidence for and against a minimum wage increase.
text_following: But the most important thing is, you can't make a living on $4.25 an hour.

text_original: But the most important thing is, you can't make a living on $4.25 an hour.
text_preceding: I believe the weight of the evidence is that a modest increase does not cost jobs, and may even lure people back into the job market.
text_following: Especially if you have children, even with the working families tax cut we passed last year.

text_original: Especially if you have children, even with the working families tax cut we passed last year.
text_preceding: But the most important thing is, you can't make a living on $4.25 an hour.
text_following: In the past, the minimum wage has been a bipartisan issue, and I think it should be again.

text_original: In the past, the minimum wage has been a bipartisan issue, and I think it should be again.
text_preceding: Especially if you have children, even with the working families tax cut we passed last year.
text_following: So I want to challenge you to have honest hearings on this.

text_original: So I want to challenge you to have honest hearings on this.
text_preceding: In the past, the minimum wage has been a bipartisan issue, and I think it should be again.
text_following: To find a way to make the minimum wage a living wage.

text_original: To find a way to make the minimum wage a living wage.
text_preceding: So I want to challenge you to have honest hearings on this.
text_following: Members of Congress have been here less than a month, but by the end of the week, 28 days into the new year, every member of Congress will have earned as much in congressional salary as a minimum wage worker makes all year long.

text_original: Members of Congress have been here less than a month, but by the end of the week, 28 days into the new year, every member of Congress will have earned as much in congressional salary as a minimum wage worker makes all year long.
text_preceding: To find a way to make the minimum wage a living wage.
text_following: Everybody else here, including the President, has something else that too many Americans do without, and that's health care.

text_original: Everybody else here, including the President, has something else that too many Americans do without, and that's health care.
text_preceding: Members of Congress have been here less than a month, but by the end of the week, 28 days into the new year, every member of Congress will have earned as much in congressional salary as a minimum wage worker makes all year long.
text_following: Now, last year, we almost came to blows over health care.

text_original: Now, last year, we almost came to blows over health care.
text_preceding: Everybody else here, including the President, has something else that too many Americans do without, and that's health care.
text_following: And the cold, hard fact is that, since last year, since I was here, another 1.1 million Americans in working families have lost their health care.

text_original: And the cold, hard fact is that, since last year, since I was here, another 1.1 million Americans in working families have lost their health care.
text_preceding: Now, last year, we almost came to blows over health care.
text_following: And the cold, hard fact is that many millions more, most of them farmers and small businesspeople and self-employed people, have seen their premiums skyrocket, their co-pays and deductibles go up.

text_original: And the cold, hard fact is that many millions more, most of them farmers and small businesspeople and self-employed people, have seen their premiums skyrocket, their co-pays and deductibles go up.
text_preceding: And the cold, hard fact is that, since last year, since I was here, another 1.1 million Americans in working families have lost their health care.
text_following: There's a whole bunch of people in this country that, in the statistics have health insurance, but really what they've got is a piece of paper that says they won't lose their home if they get sick.

text_original: There's a whole bunch of people in this country that, in the statistics have health insurance, but really what they've got is a piece of paper that says they won't lose their home if they get sick.
text_preceding: And the cold, hard fact is that many millions more, most of them farmers and small businesspeople and self-employed people, have seen their premiums skyrocket, their co-pays and deductibles go up.
text_following: HEALTH SECURITY: Now, I still believe our country has got to move toward providing health security for every American family.

text_original: HEALTH SECURITY: Now, I still believe our country has got to move toward providing health security for every American family.
text_preceding: There's a whole bunch of people in this country that, in the statistics have health insurance, but really what they've got is a piece of paper that says they won't lose their home if they get sick.
text_following: But I know that last year, as the evidence indicates, we bit off more than we could chew.

text_original: But I know that last year, as the evidence indicates, we bit off more than we could chew.
text_preceding: HEALTH SECURITY: Now, I still believe our country has got to move toward providing health security for every American family.
text_following: So I'm asking you that we work together.

text_original: So I'm asking you that we work together.
text_preceding: But I know that last year, as the evidence indicates, we bit off more than we could chew.
text_following: Let's do whatever we have to do to get something done.

text_original: Let's do whatever we have to do to get something done.
text_preceding: So I'm asking you that we work together.
text_following: Let's at least pass meaningful insurance reform so that no American risks losing coverage for facing skyrocketing prices.

text_original: Let's at least pass meaningful insurance reform so that no American risks losing coverage for facing skyrocketing prices.
text_preceding: Let's do whatever we have to do to get something done.
text_following: That nobody loses their coverage because they face high prices or unavailable insurance, when they change jobs and lose a job, or a family member gets sick.

text_original: That nobody loses their coverage because they face high prices or unavailable insurance, when they change jobs and lose a job, or a family member gets sick.
text_preceding: Let's at least pass meaningful insurance reform so that no American risks losing coverage for facing skyrocketing prices.
text_following: I want to work together with all of you who have an interest in this -- with the Democrats who worked on it last time, with the Republican leaders like Senator Dole who has a longtime commitment to health care reform and made some constructive proposals in this area last year.

text_original: I want to work together with all of you who have an interest in this -- with the Democrats who worked on it last time, with the Republican leaders like Senator Dole who has a longtime commitment to health care reform and made some constructive proposals in this area last year.
text_preceding: That nobody loses their coverage because they face high prices or unavailable insurance, when they change jobs and lose a job, or a family member gets sick.
text_following: We ought to make sure that self-employed people in small businesses can buy insurance at more affordable rates through voluntary purchasing pools.

text_original: We ought to make sure that self-employed people in small businesses can buy insurance at more affordable rates through voluntary purchasing pools.
text_preceding: I want to work together with all of you who have an interest in this -- with the Democrats who worked on it last time, with the Republican leaders like Senator Dole who has a longtime commitment to health care reform and made some constructive proposals in this area last year.
text_following: We ought to help families provide long-term care for a sick parent or a disabled child.

text_original: We ought to help families provide long-term care for a sick parent or a disabled child.
text_preceding: We ought to make sure that self-employed people in small businesses can buy insurance at more affordable rates through voluntary purchasing pools.
text_following: We can work to help workers who lose their jobs at least keep their health insurance coverage for a year while they look for work.

text_original: We can work to help workers who lose their jobs at least keep their health insurance coverage for a year while they look for work.
text_preceding: We ought to help families provide long-term care for a sick parent or a disabled child.
text_following: And we can find a way -- it may take some time, but we can find a way -- to make sure that our children have health care.

text_original: And we can find a way -- it may take some time, but we can find a way -- to make sure that our children have health care.
text_preceding: We can work to help workers who lose their jobs at least keep their health insurance coverage for a year while they look for work.
text_following: You know, I think everybody in this room, without regard to party, can be proud of the fact that our country was rated as having the world's most productive economy for the first time in nearly a decade.

text_original: You know, I think everybody in this room, without regard to party, can be proud of the fact that our country was rated as having the world's most productive economy for the first time in nearly a decade.
text_preceding: And we can find a way -- it may take some time, but we can find a way -- to make sure that our children have health care.
text_following: But we can't be proud of the fact that we're the only wealthy country in the world that has a smaller percentage of the work force and their children with health insurance today than we did 10 years ago, the last time we were the most productive economy in the world.

text_original: But we can't be proud of the fact that we're the only wealthy country in the world that has a smaller percentage of the work force and their children with health insurance today than we did 10 years ago, the last time we were the most productive economy in the world.
text_preceding: You know, I think everybody in this room, without regard to party, can be proud of the fact that our country was rated as having the world's most productive economy for the first time in nearly a decade.
text_following: So let's work together on this.

text_original: So let's work together on this.
text_preceding: But we can't be proud of the fact that we're the only wealthy country in the world that has a smaller percentage of the work force and their children with health insurance today than we did 10 years ago, the last time we were the most productive economy in the world.
text_following: It is too important for politics as usual.

text_original: It is too important for politics as usual.
text_preceding: So let's work together on this.
text_following: SECURITY ABROAD:  Much of what the American people are thinking about tonight is what we've already talked about.

text_original: SECURITY ABROAD:  Much of what the American people are thinking about tonight is what we've already talked about.
text_preceding: It is too important for politics as usual.
text_following: A lot of people think that the security concerns of America today are entirely internal to our borders.

text_original: A lot of people think that the security concerns of America today are entirely internal to our borders.
text_preceding: SECURITY ABROAD:  Much of what the American people are thinking about tonight is what we've already talked about.
text_following: They relate to the security of our jobs and our homes, and our incomes and our children, our streets, our health and protecting those borders.

text_original: They relate to the security of our jobs and our homes, and our incomes and our children, our streets, our health and protecting those borders.
text_preceding: A lot of people think that the security concerns of America today are entirely internal to our borders.
text_following: Now that the Cold War has passed, it's tempting to believe that all the security issues, with the possible exception of trade, reside here at home.

text_original: Now that the Cold War has passed, it's tempting to believe that all the security issues, with the possible exception of trade, reside here at home.
text_preceding: They relate to the security of our jobs and our homes, and our incomes and our children, our streets, our health and protecting those borders.
text_following: Our security still depends upon our continued world leadership for peace and freedom and democracy.

text_original: Our security still depends upon our continued world leadership for peace and freedom and democracy.
text_preceding: Now that the Cold War has passed, it's tempting to believe that all the security issues, with the possible exception of trade, reside here at home.
text_following: We still can't be strong at home unless we're strong abroad.

text_original: We still can't be strong at home unless we're strong abroad.
text_preceding: Our security still depends upon our continued world leadership for peace and freedom and democracy.
text_following: The financial crisis in Mexico is a case in point.

text_original: The financial crisis in Mexico is a case in point.
text_preceding: We still can't be strong at home unless we're strong abroad.
text_following: I know it's not popular to say it tonight, but we have to act.

text_original: I know it's not popular to say it tonight, but we have to act.
text_preceding: The financial crisis in Mexico is a case in point.
text_following: Not for the Mexican people, but for the sake of the millions of Americans whose livelihoods are tied to Mexico's well-being.

text_original: Not for the Mexican people, but for the sake of the millions of Americans whose livelihoods are tied to Mexico's well-being.
text_preceding: I know it's not popular to say it tonight, but we have to act.
text_following: If we want to secure American jobs, preserve American exports, safeguard America's borders, then we must pass the stabilization program and help to put Mexico back on track.

text_original: If we want to secure American jobs, preserve American exports, safeguard America's borders, then we must pass the stabilization program and help to put Mexico back on track.
text_preceding: Not for the Mexican people, but for the sake of the millions of Americans whose livelihoods are tied to Mexico's well-being.
text_following: Now let me repeat: it's not a loan, it's not foreign aid, it's not a bail out.

text_original: Now let me repeat: it's not a loan, it's not foreign aid, it's not a bail out.
text_preceding: If we want to secure American jobs, preserve American exports, safeguard America's borders, then we must pass the stabilization program and help to put Mexico back on track.
text_following: We will be given a guarantee like co-signing a note with good collateral that will cover our risks.

text_original: We will be given a guarantee like co-signing a note with good collateral that will cover our risks.
text_preceding: Now let me repeat: it's not a loan, it's not foreign aid, it's not a bail out.
text_following: This legislation is the right thing for America.

text_original: This legislation is the right thing for America.
text_preceding: We will be given a guarantee like co-signing a note with good collateral that will cover our risks.
text_following: That's why the bipartisan leadership has supported it.

text_original: That's why the bipartisan leadership has supported it.
text_preceding: This legislation is the right thing for America.
