text_original: I've seen the hopeful faces of young graduates from New York to California, and our newest officers at West Point, Annapolis, Colorado Springs, New London.
text_preceding: I believe this because over and over in my six years in office, I have seen America at its best.
text_following: I've mourned with grieving families in Tucson and Newtown, in Boston, in West Texas, and West Virginia.

text_original: I've mourned with grieving families in Tucson and Newtown, in Boston, in West Texas, and West Virginia.
text_preceding: I've seen the hopeful faces of young graduates from New York to California, and our newest officers at West Point, Annapolis, Colorado Springs, New London.
text_following: I've watched Americans beat back adversity from the Gulf Coast to the Great Plains, from Midwest assembly lines to the Mid-Atlantic seaboard.

text_original: I've watched Americans beat back adversity from the Gulf Coast to the Great Plains, from Midwest assembly lines to the Mid-Atlantic seaboard.
text_preceding: I've mourned with grieving families in Tucson and Newtown, in Boston, in West Texas, and West Virginia.
text_following: I've seen something like gay marriage go from a wedge issue used to drive us apart to a story of freedom across our country, a civil right now legal in states that seven in 10 Americans call home.

text_original: I've seen something like gay marriage go from a wedge issue used to drive us apart to a story of freedom across our country, a civil right now legal in states that seven in 10 Americans call home.
text_preceding: I've watched Americans beat back adversity from the Gulf Coast to the Great Plains, from Midwest assembly lines to the Mid-Atlantic seaboard.
text_following: So I know the good, and optimistic, and big-hearted generosity of the American people who every day live the idea that we are our brother's keeper and our sister's keeper.

text_original: So I know the good, and optimistic, and big-hearted generosity of the American people who every day live the idea that we are our brother's keeper and our sister's keeper.
text_preceding: I've seen something like gay marriage go from a wedge issue used to drive us apart to a story of freedom across our country, a civil right now legal in states that seven in 10 Americans call home.
text_following: And I know they expect those of us who serve here to set a better example.

text_original: And I know they expect those of us who serve here to set a better example.
text_preceding: So I know the good, and optimistic, and big-hearted generosity of the American people who every day live the idea that we are our brother's keeper and our sister's keeper.
text_following: So the question for those of us here tonight is how we, all of us, can better reflect America's hopes.

text_original: So the question for those of us here tonight is how we, all of us, can better reflect America's hopes.
text_preceding: And I know they expect those of us who serve here to set a better example.
text_following: I've served in Congress with many of you.

text_original: I've served in Congress with many of you.
text_preceding: So the question for those of us here tonight is how we, all of us, can better reflect America's hopes.
text_following: There are a lot of good people here, on both sides of the aisle.

text_original: There are a lot of good people here, on both sides of the aisle.
text_preceding: I've served in Congress with many of you.
text_following: And many of you have told me that this isn't what you signed up for -- arguing past each other on cable shows, the constant fundraising, always looking over your shoulder at how the base will react to every decision.

text_original: And many of you have told me that this isn't what you signed up for -- arguing past each other on cable shows, the constant fundraising, always looking over your shoulder at how the base will react to every decision.
text_preceding: There are a lot of good people here, on both sides of the aisle.
text_following: Imagine if we broke out of these tired old patterns.

text_original: Imagine if we broke out of these tired old patterns.
text_preceding: And many of you have told me that this isn't what you signed up for -- arguing past each other on cable shows, the constant fundraising, always looking over your shoulder at how the base will react to every decision.
text_following: Imagine if we did something different.

text_original: Imagine if we did something different.
text_preceding: Imagine if we broke out of these tired old patterns.
text_following: Understand, a better politics isn't one where Democrats abandon their agenda or Republicans simply embrace mine.

text_original: Understand, a better politics isn't one where Democrats abandon their agenda or Republicans simply embrace mine.
text_preceding: Imagine if we did something different.
text_following: A better politics is one where we appeal to each other's basic decency instead of our basest fears.

text_original: A better politics is one where we appeal to each other's basic decency instead of our basest fears.
text_preceding: Understand, a better politics isn't one where Democrats abandon their agenda or Republicans simply embrace mine.
text_following: A better politics is one where we debate without demonizing each other;

text_original: A better politics is one where we debate without demonizing each other;
text_preceding: A better politics is one where we appeal to each other's basic decency instead of our basest fears.
text_following: where we talk issues and values, and principles and facts, rather than _√Ç¬å√Ç¬Å√Ç¬å√É¬≥√Ç¬å√Ç¬Å√Ç¬å√Ç¬ögotcha_√Ç¬å√Ç¬Å√Ç¬å√É¬≥√Ç¬å√Ç¬Å√Ç¬å√Ç¬Ç moments, or trivial gaffes, or fake controversies that have nothing to do with people's daily lives.

text_original: where we talk issues and values, and principles and facts, rather than _√Ç¬å√Ç¬Å√Ç¬å√É¬≥√Ç¬å√Ç¬Å√Ç¬å√Ç¬ögotcha_√Ç¬å√Ç¬Å√Ç¬å√É¬≥√Ç¬å√Ç¬Å√Ç¬å√Ç¬Ç moments, or trivial gaffes, or fake controversies that have nothing to do with people's daily lives.
text_preceding: A better politics is one where we debate without demonizing each other;
text_following: A politics -- a better politics is one where we spend less time drowning in dark money for ads that pull us into the gutter, and spend more time lifting young people up with a sense of purpose and possibility, asking them to join in the great mission of building America.

text_original: A politics -- a better politics is one where we spend less time drowning in dark money for ads that pull us into the gutter, and spend more time lifting young people up with a sense of purpose and possibility, asking them to join in the great mission of building America.
text_preceding: where we talk issues and values, and principles and facts, rather than _√Ç¬å√Ç¬Å√Ç¬å√É¬≥√Ç¬å√Ç¬Å√Ç¬å√Ç¬ögotcha_√Ç¬å√Ç¬Å√Ç¬å√É¬≥√Ç¬å√Ç¬Å√Ç¬å√Ç¬Ç moments, or trivial gaffes, or fake controversies that have nothing to do with people's daily lives.
text_following: If we're going to have arguments, let's have arguments, but let's make them debates worthy of this body and worthy of this country.

text_original: If we're going to have arguments, let's have arguments, but let's make them debates worthy of this body and worthy of this country.
text_preceding: A politics -- a better politics is one where we spend less time drowning in dark money for ads that pull us into the gutter, and spend more time lifting young people up with a sense of purpose and possibility, asking them to join in the great mission of building America.
text_following: We still may not agree on a woman's right to choose, but surely we can agree it's a good thing that teen pregnancies and abortions are nearing all-time lows, and that every woman should have access to the health care that she needs.

text_original: We still may not agree on a woman's right to choose, but surely we can agree it's a good thing that teen pregnancies and abortions are nearing all-time lows, and that every woman should have access to the health care that she needs.
text_preceding: If we're going to have arguments, let's have arguments, but let's make them debates worthy of this body and worthy of this country.
text_following: Yes, passions still fly on immigration, but surely we can all see something of ourselves in the striving young student, and agree that no one benefits when a hardworking mom is snatched from her child, and that it's possible to shape a law that upholds our tradition as a nation of laws and a nation of immigrants.

text_original: Yes, passions still fly on immigration, but surely we can all see something of ourselves in the striving young student, and agree that no one benefits when a hardworking mom is snatched from her child, and that it's possible to shape a law that upholds our tradition as a nation of laws and a nation of immigrants.
text_preceding: We still may not agree on a woman's right to choose, but surely we can agree it's a good thing that teen pregnancies and abortions are nearing all-time lows, and that every woman should have access to the health care that she needs.
text_following: I've talked to Republicans and Democrats about that.

text_original: I've talked to Republicans and Democrats about that.
text_preceding: Yes, passions still fly on immigration, but surely we can all see something of ourselves in the striving young student, and agree that no one benefits when a hardworking mom is snatched from her child, and that it's possible to shape a law that upholds our tradition as a nation of laws and a nation of immigrants.
text_following: That's something that we can share.

text_original: That's something that we can share.
text_preceding: I've talked to Republicans and Democrats about that.
text_following: We may go at it in campaign season, but surely we can agree that the right to vote is sacred;

text_original: We may go at it in campaign season, but surely we can agree that the right to vote is sacred;
text_preceding: That's something that we can share.
text_following: that it's being denied to too many -- (applause) -- and that on this 50th anniversary of the great march from Selma to Montgomery and the passage of the Voting Rights Act, we can come together, Democrats and Republicans, to make voting easier for every single American.

text_original: that it's being denied to too many -- (applause) -- and that on this 50th anniversary of the great march from Selma to Montgomery and the passage of the Voting Rights Act, we can come together, Democrats and Republicans, to make voting easier for every single American.
text_preceding: We may go at it in campaign season, but surely we can agree that the right to vote is sacred;
text_following: We may have different takes on the events of Ferguson and New York.

text_original: We may have different takes on the events of Ferguson and New York.
text_preceding: that it's being denied to too many -- (applause) -- and that on this 50th anniversary of the great march from Selma to Montgomery and the passage of the Voting Rights Act, we can come together, Democrats and Republicans, to make voting easier for every single American.
text_following: But surely we can understand a father who fears his son can't walk home without being harassed.

text_original: But surely we can understand a father who fears his son can't walk home without being harassed.
text_preceding: We may have different takes on the events of Ferguson and New York.
text_following: And surely we can understand the wife who won't rest until the police officer she married walks through the front door at the end of his shift.

text_original: And surely we can understand the wife who won't rest until the police officer she married walks through the front door at the end of his shift.
text_preceding: But surely we can understand a father who fears his son can't walk home without being harassed.
text_following: And surely we can agree that it's a good thing that for the first time in 40 years, the crime rate and the incarceration rate have come down together, and use that as a starting point for Democrats and Republicans, community leaders and law enforcement, to reform America's criminal justice system so that it protects and serves all of us.

text_original: And surely we can agree that it's a good thing that for the first time in 40 years, the crime rate and the incarceration rate have come down together, and use that as a starting point for Democrats and Republicans, community leaders and law enforcement, to reform America's criminal justice system so that it protects and serves all of us.
text_preceding: And surely we can understand the wife who won't rest until the police officer she married walks through the front door at the end of his shift.
text_following: That's how we start rebuilding trust.

text_original: That's how we start rebuilding trust.
text_preceding: And surely we can agree that it's a good thing that for the first time in 40 years, the crime rate and the incarceration rate have come down together, and use that as a starting point for Democrats and Republicans, community leaders and law enforcement, to reform America's criminal justice system so that it protects and serves all of us.
text_following: That's how we move this country forward.

text_original: That's how we move this country forward.
text_preceding: That's how we start rebuilding trust.
text_following: That's what the American people want.

text_original: That's what the American people want.
text_preceding: That's how we move this country forward.
text_following: And that's what they deserve.

text_original: And that's what they deserve.
text_preceding: That's what the American people want.
text_following: I have no more campaigns to run.

text_original: I have no more campaigns to run.
text_preceding: And that's what they deserve.
text_following: My only agenda -- (laughter -- I know because I won both of them.

text_original: My only agenda -- (laughter -- I know because I won both of them.
text_preceding: I have no more campaigns to run.
text_following: My only agenda for the next two years is the same as the one I've had since the day I swore an oath on the steps of this Capitol -- to do what I believe is best for America.

text_original: My only agenda for the next two years is the same as the one I've had since the day I swore an oath on the steps of this Capitol -- to do what I believe is best for America.
text_preceding: My only agenda -- (laughter -- I know because I won both of them.
text_following: If you share the broad vision I outlined tonight, I ask you to join me in the work at hand.

text_original: If you share the broad vision I outlined tonight, I ask you to join me in the work at hand.
text_preceding: My only agenda for the next two years is the same as the one I've had since the day I swore an oath on the steps of this Capitol -- to do what I believe is best for America.
text_following: If you disagree with parts of it, I hope you'll at least work with me where you do agree.

text_original: If you disagree with parts of it, I hope you'll at least work with me where you do agree.
text_preceding: If you share the broad vision I outlined tonight, I ask you to join me in the work at hand.
text_following: And I commit to every Republican here tonight that I will not only seek out your ideas, I will seek to work with you to make this country stronger.

text_original: And I commit to every Republican here tonight that I will not only seek out your ideas, I will seek to work with you to make this country stronger.
text_preceding: If you disagree with parts of it, I hope you'll at least work with me where you do agree.
text_following: Because I want this chamber, I want this city to reflect the truth -- that for all our blind spots and shortcomings, we are a people with the strength and generosity of spirit to bridge divides, to unite in common effort, to help our neighbors, whether down the street or on the other side of the world.

text_original: Because I want this chamber, I want this city to reflect the truth -- that for all our blind spots and shortcomings, we are a people with the strength and generosity of spirit to bridge divides, to unite in common effort, to help our neighbors, whether down the street or on the other side of the world.
text_preceding: And I commit to every Republican here tonight that I will not only seek out your ideas, I will seek to work with you to make this country stronger.
text_following: I want our actions to tell every child in every neighborhood, your life matters, and we are committed to improving your life chances as committed as we are to working on behalf of our own kids.

text_original: I want our actions to tell every child in every neighborhood, your life matters, and we are committed to improving your life chances as committed as we are to working on behalf of our own kids.
text_preceding: Because I want this chamber, I want this city to reflect the truth -- that for all our blind spots and shortcomings, we are a people with the strength and generosity of spirit to bridge divides, to unite in common effort, to help our neighbors, whether down the street or on the other side of the world.
text_following: I want future generations to know that we are a people who see our differences as a great gift, that we're a people who value the dignity and worth of every citizen -- man and woman, young and old, black and white, Latino, Asian, immigrant, Native American, gay, straight, Americans with mental illness or physical disability.

text_following: that we are the United States of America.

text_original: We, too, have made it through some hard times.

text_following: Fifteen years into this new century, we have picked ourselves up, dusted ourselves off, and begun again the work of remaking America.

text_original: Fifteen years into this new century, we have picked ourselves up, dusted ourselves off, and begun again the work of remaking America.

text_original: We have laid a new foundation.

text_original: Let's begin this new chapter together -- and let's start the work right now.

text_original: Mr. Speaker, Mr. Vice President, Members of Congress, my fellow Americans:Tonight marks the eighth year that I've come here to report on the State of the Union.
text_following: And for this final one, I'm going to try to make it a little shorter.

text_original: And for this final one, I'm going to try to make it a little shorter.
text_preceding: Mr. Speaker, Mr. Vice President, Members of Congress, my fellow Americans:Tonight marks the eighth year that I've come here to report on the State of the Union.
text_following: I know some of you are antsy to get back to Iowa.

text_original: I know some of you are antsy to get back to Iowa.
text_preceding: And for this final one, I'm going to try to make it a little shorter.
text_following: I'll be shaking hands afterwards if you want some tips.

text_original: I'll be shaking hands afterwards if you want some tips.
text_preceding: I know some of you are antsy to get back to Iowa.
text_following: And I understand that because it's an election season, expectations for what we will achieve this year are low.

text_original: And I understand that because it's an election season, expectations for what we will achieve this year are low.
text_preceding: I'll be shaking hands afterwards if you want some tips.
text_following: But, Mr. Speaker, I appreciate the constructive approach that you and the other leaders took at the end of last year to pass a budget and make tax cuts permanent for working families.

text_original: But, Mr. Speaker, I appreciate the constructive approach that you and the other leaders took at the end of last year to pass a budget and make tax cuts permanent for working families.
text_preceding: And I understand that because it's an election season, expectations for what we will achieve this year are low.
text_following: So I hope we can work together this year on some bipartisan priorities like criminal justice reform and helping people who are battling prescription drug abuse and heroin abuse.

text_original: So I hope we can work together this year on some bipartisan priorities like criminal justice reform and helping people who are battling prescription drug abuse and heroin abuse.
text_preceding: But, Mr. Speaker, I appreciate the constructive approach that you and the other leaders took at the end of last year to pass a budget and make tax cuts permanent for working families.
text_following: So, who knows, we might surprise the cynics again.

text_original: So, who knows, we might surprise the cynics again.
text_preceding: So I hope we can work together this year on some bipartisan priorities like criminal justice reform and helping people who are battling prescription drug abuse and heroin abuse.
text_following: But tonight, I want to go easy on the traditional list of proposals for the year ahead.

text_original: But tonight, I want to go easy on the traditional list of proposals for the year ahead.
text_preceding: So, who knows, we might surprise the cynics again.
text_following: Don't worry, I've got plenty, from helping students learn to write computer code to personalizing medical treatments for patients.

text_original: Don't worry, I've got plenty, from helping students learn to write computer code to personalizing medical treatments for patients.
text_preceding: But tonight, I want to go easy on the traditional list of proposals for the year ahead.
text_following: And I will keep pushing for progress on the work that I believe still needs to be done.

text_original: And I will keep pushing for progress on the work that I believe still needs to be done.
text_preceding: Don't worry, I've got plenty, from helping students learn to write computer code to personalizing medical treatments for patients.
text_following: Fixing a broken immigration system.

text_original: Fixing a broken immigration system.
text_preceding: And I will keep pushing for progress on the work that I believe still needs to be done.
text_following: Protecting our kids from gun violence.

text_original: Protecting our kids from gun violence.
text_preceding: Fixing a broken immigration system.
text_following: All these things still matter to hardworking families.

text_original: All these things still matter to hardworking families.
text_preceding: Protecting our kids from gun violence.
text_following: They're still the right thing to do.

text_original: They're still the right thing to do.
text_preceding: All these things still matter to hardworking families.
text_following: And I won't let up until they get done.

text_original: And I won't let up until they get done.
text_preceding: They're still the right thing to do.
text_following: But for my final address to this chamber, I don't want to just talk about next year.

text_original: But for my final address to this chamber, I don't want to just talk about next year.
text_preceding: And I won't let up until they get done.
text_following: I want to focus on the next five years, the next 10 years, and beyond.

text_original: I want to focus on the next five years, the next 10 years, and beyond.
text_preceding: But for my final address to this chamber, I don't want to just talk about next year.
text_following: I want to focus on our future.

text_original: I want to focus on our future.
text_preceding: I want to focus on the next five years, the next 10 years, and beyond.
text_following: We live in a time of extraordinary change -- change that's reshaping the way we live, the way we work, our planet, our place in the world.

text_original: We live in a time of extraordinary change -- change that's reshaping the way we live, the way we work, our planet, our place in the world.
text_preceding: I want to focus on our future.
text_following: It's change that promises amazing medical breakthroughs, but also economic disruptions that strain working families.

text_original: It's change that promises amazing medical breakthroughs, but also economic disruptions that strain working families.
text_preceding: We live in a time of extraordinary change -- change that's reshaping the way we live, the way we work, our planet, our place in the world.
text_following: It promises education for girls in the most remote villages, but also connects terrorists plotting an ocean away.

text_original: It promises education for girls in the most remote villages, but also connects terrorists plotting an ocean away.
text_preceding: It's change that promises amazing medical breakthroughs, but also economic disruptions that strain working families.
text_following: It's change that can broaden opportunity, or widen inequality.

text_original: It's change that can broaden opportunity, or widen inequality.
text_preceding: It promises education for girls in the most remote villages, but also connects terrorists plotting an ocean away.
text_following: And whether we like it or not, the pace of this change will only accelerate.

text_original: And whether we like it or not, the pace of this change will only accelerate.
text_preceding: It's change that can broaden opportunity, or widen inequality.
text_following: America has been through big changes before -- wars and depression, the influx of new immigrants, workers fighting for a fair deal, movements to expand civil rights.

text_original: America has been through big changes before -- wars and depression, the influx of new immigrants, workers fighting for a fair deal, movements to expand civil rights.
text_preceding: And whether we like it or not, the pace of this change will only accelerate.
text_following: Each time, there have been those who told us to fear the future;

text_original: Each time, there have been those who told us to fear the future;
text_preceding: America has been through big changes before -- wars and depression, the influx of new immigrants, workers fighting for a fair deal, movements to expand civil rights.
text_following: who claimed we could slam the brakes on change;

text_original: who claimed we could slam the brakes on change;
text_preceding: Each time, there have been those who told us to fear the future;
text_following: who promised to restore past glory if we just got some group or idea that was threatening America under control.

text_original: who promised to restore past glory if we just got some group or idea that was threatening America under control.
text_preceding: who claimed we could slam the brakes on change;
text_following: And each time, we overcame those fears.

text_original: And each time, we overcame those fears.
text_preceding: who promised to restore past glory if we just got some group or idea that was threatening America under control.
text_following: We did not, in the words of Lincoln, adhere to the "dogmas of the quiet past."

text_original: We did not, in the words of Lincoln, adhere to the "dogmas of the quiet past."
text_preceding: And each time, we overcame those fears.
text_following: Instead we thought anew, and acted anew.

text_original: Instead we thought anew, and acted anew.
text_preceding: We did not, in the words of Lincoln, adhere to the "dogmas of the quiet past."
text_following: We made change work for us, always extending America's promise outward, to the next frontier, to more people.

text_original: We made change work for us, always extending America's promise outward, to the next frontier, to more people.
text_preceding: Instead we thought anew, and acted anew.
text_following: And because we did -- because we saw opportunity where others saw only peril -- we emerged stronger and better than before.

text_original: And because we did -- because we saw opportunity where others saw only peril -- we emerged stronger and better than before.
text_preceding: We made change work for us, always extending America's promise outward, to the next frontier, to more people.
text_following: What was true then can be true now.

text_original: What was true then can be true now.
text_preceding: And because we did -- because we saw opportunity where others saw only peril -- we emerged stronger and better than before.
text_following: Our unique strengths as a nation -- our optimism and work ethic, our spirit of discovery, our diversity, our commitment to rule of law -- these things give us everything we need to ensure prosperity and security for generations to come.

text_original: Our unique strengths as a nation -- our optimism and work ethic, our spirit of discovery, our diversity, our commitment to rule of law -- these things give us everything we need to ensure prosperity and security for generations to come.

text_following: Will we respond to the changes of our time with fear, turning inward as a nation, turning against each other as a people?

text_preceding: And because he's gone to the mat for all of us on so many issues over the past 40 years, I'm putting Joe in charge of Mission Control.
text_following: We need the same level of commitment when it comes to developing clean energy sources.

text_original: We need the same level of commitment when it comes to developing clean energy sources.
text_preceding: For the loved ones we've all lost, for the families that we can still save, let's make America the country that cures cancer once and for all.
text_following: Look, if anybody still wants to dispute the science around climate change, have at it.

text_original: Look, if anybody still wants to dispute the science around climate change, have at it.
text_preceding: We need the same level of commitment when it comes to developing clean energy sources.
text_following: You will be pretty lonely, because you'll be debating our military, most of America's business leaders, the majority of the American people, almost the entire scientific community, and 200 nations around the world who agree it's a problem and intend to solve it.

text_original: You will be pretty lonely, because you'll be debating our military, most of America's business leaders, the majority of the American people, almost the entire scientific community, and 200 nations around the world who agree it's a problem and intend to solve it.
text_preceding: Look, if anybody still wants to dispute the science around climate change, have at it.
text_following: But even if -- even if the planet wasn't at stake, even if 2014 wasn't the warmest year on record -- until 2015 turned out to be even hotter -- why would we want to pass up the chance for American businesses to produce and sell the energy of the future?

text_original: But even if -- even if the planet wasn't at stake, even if 2014 wasn't the warmest year on record -- until 2015 turned out to be even hotter -- why would we want to pass up the chance for American businesses to produce and sell the energy of the future?

text_following: Listen, seven years ago, we made the single biggest investment in clean energy in our history.

text_original: Listen, seven years ago, we made the single biggest investment in clean energy in our history.
text_preceding: But even if -- even if the planet wasn't at stake, even if 2014 wasn't the warmest year on record -- until 2015 turned out to be even hotter -- why would we want to pass up the chance for American businesses to produce and sell the energy of the future?
text_following: In fields from Iowa to Texas, wind power is now cheaper than dirtier, conventional power.

text_original: In fields from Iowa to Texas, wind power is now cheaper than dirtier, conventional power.
text_preceding: Listen, seven years ago, we made the single biggest investment in clean energy in our history.
text_following: On rooftops from Arizona to New York, solar is saving Americans tens of millions of dollars a year on their energy bills, and employs more Americans than coal -- in jobs that pay better than average.

text_original: On rooftops from Arizona to New York, solar is saving Americans tens of millions of dollars a year on their energy bills, and employs more Americans than coal -- in jobs that pay better than average.
text_preceding: In fields from Iowa to Texas, wind power is now cheaper than dirtier, conventional power.
text_following: We're taking steps to give homeowners the freedom to generate and store their own energy -- something, by the way, that environmentalists and Tea Partiers have teamed up to support.

text_preceding: On rooftops from Arizona to New York, solar is saving Americans tens of millions of dollars a year on their energy bills, and employs more Americans than coal -- in jobs that pay better than average.
text_following: And meanwhile, we've cut our imports of foreign oil by nearly 60 percent, and cut carbon pollution more than any other country on Earth.

text_original: And meanwhile, we've cut our imports of foreign oil by nearly 60 percent, and cut carbon pollution more than any other country on Earth.
text_preceding: We're taking steps to give homeowners the freedom to generate and store their own energy -- something, by the way, that environmentalists and Tea Partiers have teamed up to support.
text_following: Gas under two bucks a gallon ain't bad, either.

text_original: Gas under two bucks a gallon ain't bad, either.
text_preceding: And meanwhile, we've cut our imports of foreign oil by nearly 60 percent, and cut carbon pollution more than any other country on Earth.
text_following: Now we've got to accelerate the transition away from old, dirtier energy sources.

text_original: Now we've got to accelerate the transition away from old, dirtier energy sources.
text_preceding: Gas under two bucks a gallon ain't bad, either.
text_following: Rather than subsidize the past, we should invest in the future -- especially in communities that rely on fossil fuels.

text_original: Rather than subsidize the past, we should invest in the future -- especially in communities that rely on fossil fuels.
text_preceding: Now we've got to accelerate the transition away from old, dirtier energy sources.
text_following: We do them no favor when we don't show them where the trends are going.

text_original: We do them no favor when we don't show them where the trends are going.
text_preceding: Rather than subsidize the past, we should invest in the future -- especially in communities that rely on fossil fuels.
text_following: That's why I'm going to push to change the way we manage our oil and coal resources, so that they better reflect the costs they impose on taxpayers and our planet.

text_original: That's why I'm going to push to change the way we manage our oil and coal resources, so that they better reflect the costs they impose on taxpayers and our planet.
text_preceding: We do them no favor when we don't show them where the trends are going.
text_following: And that way, we put money back into those communities, and put tens of thousands of Americans to work building a 21st century transportation system.

text_preceding: That's why I'm going to push to change the way we manage our oil and coal resources, so that they better reflect the costs they impose on taxpayers and our planet.

text_original: Now, none of this is going to happen overnight.
text_preceding: And that way, we put money back into those communities, and put tens of thousands of Americans to work building a 21st century transportation system.
text_following: And, yes, there are plenty of entrenched interests who want to protect the status quo.

text_original: And, yes, there are plenty of entrenched interests who want to protect the status quo.
text_preceding: Now, none of this is going to happen overnight.
text_following: But the jobs we'll create, the money we'll save, the planet we'll preserve -- that is the kind of future our kids and our grandkids deserve.

text_original: But the jobs we'll create, the money we'll save, the planet we'll preserve -- that is the kind of future our kids and our grandkids deserve.
text_preceding: And, yes, there are plenty of entrenched interests who want to protect the status quo.
text_following: Climate change is just one of many issues where our security is linked to the rest of the world.

text_preceding: But the jobs we'll create, the money we'll save, the planet we'll preserve -- that is the kind of future our kids and our grandkids deserve.

text_original: And that's why the third big question that we have to answer together is how to keep America safe and strong without either isolating ourselves or trying to nation-build everywhere there's a problem.
text_preceding: Climate change is just one of many issues where our security is linked to the rest of the world.
text_following: I told you earlier all the talk of America's economic decline is political hot air.

text_original: I told you earlier all the talk of America's economic decline is political hot air.
text_preceding: And that's why the third big question that we have to answer together is how to keep America safe and strong without either isolating ourselves or trying to nation-build everywhere there's a problem.

text_original: Well, so is all the rhetoric you hear about our enemies getting stronger and America getting weaker.

text_following: The United States of America is the most powerful nation on Earth.

text_original: The United States of America is the most powerful nation on Earth.
text_preceding: Well, so is all the rhetoric you hear about our enemies getting stronger and America getting weaker.
text_following: We spend more on our military than the next eight nations combined.

text_original: We spend more on our military than the next eight nations combined.
text_preceding: The United States of America is the most powerful nation on Earth.
text_following: Our troops are the finest fighting force in the history of the world.

text_original: Our troops are the finest fighting force in the history of the world.
text_preceding: We spend more on our military than the next eight nations combined.
text_following: No nation attacks us directly, or our allies, because they know that's the path to ruin.

text_original: No nation attacks us directly, or our allies, because they know that's the path to ruin.
text_preceding: Our troops are the finest fighting force in the history of the world.

text_preceding: No nation attacks us directly, or our allies, because they know that's the path to ruin.

text_original: Now, as someone who begins every day with an intelligence briefing, I know this is a dangerous time.
text_preceding: I mean, it's useful to level the set here, because when we don't, we don't make good decisions.
text_following: But that's not primarily because of some looming superpower out there, and certainly not because of diminished American strength.

text_original: But that's not primarily because of some looming superpower out there, and certainly not because of diminished American strength.
text_preceding: Now, as someone who begins every day with an intelligence briefing, I know this is a dangerous time.
text_following: In today's world, we're threatened less by evil empires and more by failing states.

text_original: In today's world, we're threatened less by evil empires and more by failing states.
text_preceding: But that's not primarily because of some looming superpower out there, and certainly not because of diminished American strength.
text_following: The Middle East is going through a transformation that will play out for a generation, rooted in conflicts that date back millennia.

text_original: The Middle East is going through a transformation that will play out for a generation, rooted in conflicts that date back millennia.
text_preceding: In today's world, we're threatened less by evil empires and more by failing states.

text_preceding: The Middle East is going through a transformation that will play out for a generation, rooted in conflicts that date back millennia.

text_original: Even as their economy severely contracts, Russia is pouring resources in to prop up Ukraine and Syria -- client states that they saw slipping away from their orbit.
text_preceding: Economic headwinds are blowing in from a Chinese economy that is in significant transition.
text_following: And the international system we built after World War II is now struggling to keep pace with this new reality.

text_original: And the international system we built after World War II is now struggling to keep pace with this new reality.

text_following: It's up to us, the United States of America, to help remake that system.

text_original: It's up to us, the United States of America, to help remake that system.
text_preceding: And the international system we built after World War II is now struggling to keep pace with this new reality.
text_following: And to do that well it means that we've got to set priorities.

text_original: And to do that well it means that we've got to set priorities.
text_preceding: It's up to us, the United States of America, to help remake that system.
text_following: Priority number one is protecting the American people and going after terrorist networks.

text_original: Priority number one is protecting the American people and going after terrorist networks.
text_preceding: And to do that well it means that we've got to set priorities.
text_following: Both al Qaeda and now ISIL pose a direct threat to our people, because in today's world, even a handful of terrorists who place no value on human life, including their own, can do a lot of damage.

text_preceding: When we lead nearly 200 nations to the most ambitious agreement in history to fight climate change, yes, that helps vulnerable countries, but it also protects our kids.
text_following: When we help African countries feed their people and care for the sick, it's the right thing to do, and it prevents the next pandemic from reaching our shores.

text_following: Our Constitution begins with those three simple words, words we've come to recognize mean all the people, not just some;

text_original: Our Constitution begins with those three simple words, words we've come to recognize mean all the people, not just some;

text_following: words that insist we rise and fall together, and that's how we might perfect our Union.

text_original: words that insist we rise and fall together, and that's how we might perfect our Union.

text_following: And that brings me to the fourth, and maybe the most important thing that I want to say tonight.

text_original: And that brings me to the fourth, and maybe the most important thing that I want to say tonight.
text_preceding: words that insist we rise and fall together, and that's how we might perfect our Union.
text_following: The future we want -- all of us want -- opportunity and security for our families, a rising standard of living, a sustainable, peaceful planet for our kids -- all that is within our reach.

text_original: The future we want -- all of us want -- opportunity and security for our families, a rising standard of living, a sustainable, peaceful planet for our kids -- all that is within our reach.
text_preceding: And that brings me to the fourth, and maybe the most important thing that I want to say tonight.
text_following: But it will only happen if we work together.

text_original: But it will only happen if we work together.
text_preceding: The future we want -- all of us want -- opportunity and security for our families, a rising standard of living, a sustainable, peaceful planet for our kids -- all that is within our reach.
text_following: It will only happen if we can have rational, constructive debates.

text_original: It will only happen if we can have rational, constructive debates.
text_preceding: But it will only happen if we work together.
text_following: It will only happen if we fix our politics.

text_original: It will only happen if we fix our politics.
text_preceding: It will only happen if we can have rational, constructive debates.
text_following: A better politics doesn't mean we have to agree on everything.

text_original: A better politics doesn't mean we have to agree on everything.
text_preceding: It will only happen if we fix our politics.
text_following: This is a big country -- different regions, different attitudes, different interests.

text_original: This is a big country -- different regions, different attitudes, different interests.
text_preceding: A better politics doesn't mean we have to agree on everything.
text_following: That's one of our strengths, too.

text_original: That's one of our strengths, too.
text_preceding: This is a big country -- different regions, different attitudes, different interests.
text_following: Our Founders distributed power between states and branches of government, and expected us to argue, just as they did, fiercely, over the size and shape of government, over commerce and foreign relations, over the meaning of liberty and the imperatives of security.

text_original: Our Founders distributed power between states and branches of government, and expected us to argue, just as they did, fiercely, over the size and shape of government, over commerce and foreign relations, over the meaning of liberty and the imperatives of security.
text_preceding: That's one of our strengths, too.
text_following: But democracy does require basic bonds of trust between its citizens.

text_original: But democracy does require basic bonds of trust between its citizens.
text_preceding: Our Founders distributed power between states and branches of government, and expected us to argue, just as they did, fiercely, over the size and shape of government, over commerce and foreign relations, over the meaning of liberty and the imperatives of security.
text_following: It doesn't work if we think the people who disagree with us are all motivated by malice.

text_original: It doesn't work if we think the people who disagree with us are all motivated by malice.
text_preceding: But democracy does require basic bonds of trust between its citizens.
text_following: It doesn't work if we think that our political opponents are unpatriotic or trying to weaken America.

text_original: It doesn't work if we think that our political opponents are unpatriotic or trying to weaken America.
text_preceding: It doesn't work if we think the people who disagree with us are all motivated by malice.
text_following: Democracy grinds to a halt without a willingness to compromise, or when even basic facts are contested, or when we listen only to those who agree with us.

text_original: Democracy grinds to a halt without a willingness to compromise, or when even basic facts are contested, or when we listen only to those who agree with us.
text_preceding: It doesn't work if we think that our political opponents are unpatriotic or trying to weaken America.
text_following: Our public life withers when only the most extreme voices get all the attention.

text_original: Our public life withers when only the most extreme voices get all the attention.
text_preceding: Democracy grinds to a halt without a willingness to compromise, or when even basic facts are contested, or when we listen only to those who agree with us.
text_following: And most of all, democracy breaks down when the average person feels their voice doesn't matter;

text_original: And most of all, democracy breaks down when the average person feels their voice doesn't matter;
text_preceding: Our public life withers when only the most extreme voices get all the attention.
text_following: that the system is rigged in favor of the rich or the powerful or some special interest.

text_original: that the system is rigged in favor of the rich or the powerful or some special interest.
text_preceding: And most of all, democracy breaks down when the average person feels their voice doesn't matter;
text_following: Too many Americans feel that way right now.

text_original: Too many Americans feel that way right now.
text_preceding: that the system is rigged in favor of the rich or the powerful or some special interest.
text_following: It's one of the few regrets of my presidency -- that the rancor and suspicion between the parties has gotten worse instead of better.

text_original: It's one of the few regrets of my presidency -- that the rancor and suspicion between the parties has gotten worse instead of better.
text_preceding: Too many Americans feel that way right now.
text_following: I have no doubt a president with the gifts of Lincoln or Roosevelt might have better bridged the divide, and I guarantee I'll keep trying to be better so long as I hold this office.

text_original: I have no doubt a president with the gifts of Lincoln or Roosevelt might have better bridged the divide, and I guarantee I'll keep trying to be better so long as I hold this office.
text_preceding: It's one of the few regrets of my presidency -- that the rancor and suspicion between the parties has gotten worse instead of better.
text_following: But, my fellow Americans, this cannot be my task -- or any President's -- alone.

text_original: But, my fellow Americans, this cannot be my task -- or any President's -- alone.
text_preceding: I have no doubt a president with the gifts of Lincoln or Roosevelt might have better bridged the divide, and I guarantee I'll keep trying to be better so long as I hold this office.
text_following: There are a whole lot of folks in this chamber, good people who would like to see more cooperation, would like to see a more elevated debate in Washington, but feel trapped by the imperatives of getting elected, by the noise coming out of your base.

text_original: There are a whole lot of folks in this chamber, good people who would like to see more cooperation, would like to see a more elevated debate in Washington, but feel trapped by the imperatives of getting elected, by the noise coming out of your base.
text_preceding: But, my fellow Americans, this cannot be my task -- or any President's -- alone.
text_following: It's the worst-kept secret in Washington.

text_original: It's the worst-kept secret in Washington.
text_preceding: There are a whole lot of folks in this chamber, good people who would like to see more cooperation, would like to see a more elevated debate in Washington, but feel trapped by the imperatives of getting elected, by the noise coming out of your base.
text_following: And a lot of you aren't enjoying being trapped in that kind of rancor.

text_original: And a lot of you aren't enjoying being trapped in that kind of rancor.
text_preceding: It's the worst-kept secret in Washington.
text_following: But that means if we want a better politics -- and I'm addressing the American people now -- if we want a better politics, it's not enough just to change a congressman or change a senator or even change a President.

text_original: But that means if we want a better politics -- and I'm addressing the American people now -- if we want a better politics, it's not enough just to change a congressman or change a senator or even change a President.
text_preceding: And a lot of you aren't enjoying being trapped in that kind of rancor.
text_following: We have to change the system to reflect our better selves.

text_original: We have to change the system to reflect our better selves.
text_preceding: But that means if we want a better politics -- and I'm addressing the American people now -- if we want a better politics, it's not enough just to change a congressman or change a senator or even change a President.
text_following: I think we've got to end the practice of drawing our congressional districts so that politicians can pick their voters, and not the other way around.

text_original: I think we've got to end the practice of drawing our congressional districts so that politicians can pick their voters, and not the other way around.
text_preceding: We have to change the system to reflect our better selves.
text_following: We have to reduce the influence of money in our politics, so that a handful of families or hidden interests can't bankroll our elections.

text_original: We have to reduce the influence of money in our politics, so that a handful of families or hidden interests can't bankroll our elections.
text_preceding: I think we've got to end the practice of drawing our congressional districts so that politicians can pick their voters, and not the other way around.
text_following: And if our existing approach to campaign finance reform can't pass muster in the courts, we need to work together to find a real solution -- because it's a problem.

text_original: And if our existing approach to campaign finance reform can't pass muster in the courts, we need to work together to find a real solution -- because it's a problem.
text_preceding: We have to reduce the influence of money in our politics, so that a handful of families or hidden interests can't bankroll our elections.
text_following: And most of you don't like raising money.

text_original: And most of you don't like raising money.
text_preceding: And if our existing approach to campaign finance reform can't pass muster in the courts, we need to work together to find a real solution -- because it's a problem.
text_following: We've got to make it easier to vote, not harder.

text_original: We've got to make it easier to vote, not harder.
text_preceding: And most of you don't like raising money.
text_following: We need to modernize it for the way we live now.

text_original: We need to modernize it for the way we live now.
text_preceding: We've got to make it easier to vote, not harder.
text_following: This is America: We want to make it easier for people to participate.

text_original: This is America: We want to make it easier for people to participate.
text_preceding: We need to modernize it for the way we live now.
text_following: And over the course of this year, I intend to travel the country to push for reforms that do just that.

text_preceding: This is America: We want to make it easier for people to participate.
text_following: But I can't do these things on my own.

text_preceding: And over the course of this year, I intend to travel the country to push for reforms that do just that.
text_following: Changes in our political process -- in not just who gets elected, but how they get elected -- that will only happen when the American people demand it.

text_original: Changes in our political process -- in not just who gets elected, but how they get elected -- that will only happen when the American people demand it.
text_preceding: But I can't do these things on my own.
text_following: That's what's meant by a government of, by, and for the people.

text_original: That's what's meant by a government of, by, and for the people.
text_preceding: Changes in our political process -- in not just who gets elected, but how they get elected -- that will only happen when the American people demand it.
text_following: It's a lot easier to be cynical;

text_original: It's a lot easier to be cynical;
text_preceding: That's what's meant by a government of, by, and for the people.
text_following: to accept that change is not possible, and politics is hopeless, and the problem is all the folks who are elected don't care, and to believe that our voices and actions don't matter.

text_preceding: But if we give up now, then we forsake a better future.

text_following: It won't deliver the economy we want.

text_original: It won't deliver the economy we want.

text_following: It will not produce the security we want.

text_original: It will not produce the security we want.
text_preceding: It won't deliver the economy we want.
text_following: But most of all, it contradicts everything that makes us the envy of the world.

text_original: But most of all, it contradicts everything that makes us the envy of the world.
text_preceding: It will not produce the security we want.
text_following: So, my fellow Americans, whatever you may believe, whether you prefer one party or no party, whether you supported my agenda or fought as hard as you could against it -- our collective futures depends on your willingness to uphold your duties as a citizen.

text_original: So, my fellow Americans, whatever you may believe, whether you prefer one party or no party, whether you supported my agenda or fought as hard as you could against it -- our collective futures depends on your willingness to uphold your duties as a citizen.
text_preceding: But most of all, it contradicts everything that makes us the envy of the world.
text_following: To stand up for others, especially the weak, especially the vulnerable, knowing that each of us is only here because somebody, somewhere, stood up for us.

text_original: To stand up for others, especially the weak, especially the vulnerable, knowing that each of us is only here because somebody, somewhere, stood up for us.
text_preceding: So, my fellow Americans, whatever you may believe, whether you prefer one party or no party, whether you supported my agenda or fought as hard as you could against it -- our collective futures depends on your willingness to uphold your duties as a citizen.
text_following: We need every American to stay active in our public life -- and not just during election time -- so that our public life reflects the goodness and the decency that I see in the American people every single day.

text_original: We need every American to stay active in our public life -- and not just during election time -- so that our public life reflects the goodness and the decency that I see in the American people every single day.
text_preceding: To stand up for others, especially the weak, especially the vulnerable, knowing that each of us is only here because somebody, somewhere, stood up for us.
text_following: Our brand of democracy is hard.

text_preceding: We need every American to stay active in our public life -- and not just during election time -- so that our public life reflects the goodness and the decency that I see in the American people every single day.
text_following: But I can promise that a little over a year from now, when I no longer hold this office, I will be right there with you as a citizen, inspired by those voices of fairness and vision, of grit and good humor and kindness that helped America travel so far.

text_original: But I can promise that a little over a year from now, when I no longer hold this office, I will be right there with you as a citizen, inspired by those voices of fairness and vision, of grit and good humor and kindness that helped America travel so far.

text_following: Voices that help us see ourselves not, first and foremost, as black or white, or Asian or Latino, not as gay or straight, immigrant or native born, not as Democrat or Republican, but as Americans first, bound by a common creed.

text_original: Voices that help us see ourselves not, first and foremost, as black or white, or Asian or Latino, not as gay or straight, immigrant or native born, not as Democrat or Republican, but as Americans first, bound by a common creed.
text_preceding: But I can promise that a little over a year from now, when I no longer hold this office, I will be right there with you as a citizen, inspired by those voices of fairness and vision, of grit and good humor and kindness that helped America travel so far.
text_following: Voices Dr. King believed would have the final word -- voices of unarmed truth and unconditional love.

text_original: Voices Dr. King believed would have the final word -- voices of unarmed truth and unconditional love.
text_preceding: Voices that help us see ourselves not, first and foremost, as black or white, or Asian or Latino, not as gay or straight, immigrant or native born, not as Democrat or Republican, but as Americans first, bound by a common creed.
text_following: And they're out there, those voices.

text_original: And they're out there, those voices.
text_preceding: Voices Dr. King believed would have the final word -- voices of unarmed truth and unconditional love.
text_following: They don't get a lot of attention;

text_original: They don't get a lot of attention;
text_preceding: And they're out there, those voices.
text_following: they don't seek a lot of fanfare;

text_original: they don't seek a lot of fanfare;
text_preceding: They don't get a lot of attention;
text_following: but they're busy doing the work this country needs doing.

text_original: but they're busy doing the work this country needs doing.
text_preceding: they don't seek a lot of fanfare;
text_following: I see them everywhere I travel in this incredible country of ours.

text_original: I see them everywhere I travel in this incredible country of ours.
text_preceding: but they're busy doing the work this country needs doing.
text_following: I see you, the American people.

text_original: I see you, the American people.
text_preceding: I see them everywhere I travel in this incredible country of ours.
text_following: And in your daily acts of citizenship, I see our future unfolding.

text_original: And in your daily acts of citizenship, I see our future unfolding.
text_preceding: I see you, the American people.
text_following: I see it in the worker on the assembly line who clocked extra shifts to keep his company open, and the boss who pays him higher wages instead of laying him off.

text_original: I see it in the worker on the assembly line who clocked extra shifts to keep his company open, and the boss who pays him higher wages instead of laying him off.
text_preceding: And in your daily acts of citizenship, I see our future unfolding.
text_following: I see it in the Dreamer who stays up late at night to finish her science project, and the teacher who comes in early, and maybe with some extra supplies that she bought because she knows that that young girl might someday cure a disease.

text_original: I see it in the Dreamer who stays up late at night to finish her science project, and the teacher who comes in early, and maybe with some extra supplies that she bought because she knows that that young girl might someday cure a disease.
text_preceding: I see it in the worker on the assembly line who clocked extra shifts to keep his company open, and the boss who pays him higher wages instead of laying him off.
text_following: I see it in the American who served his time, and bad mistakes as a child but now is dreaming of starting over -- and I see it in the business owner who gives him that second chance.

text_original: I see it in the American who served his time, and bad mistakes as a child but now is dreaming of starting over -- and I see it in the business owner who gives him that second chance.
text_preceding: I see it in the Dreamer who stays up late at night to finish her science project, and the teacher who comes in early, and maybe with some extra supplies that she bought because she knows that that young girl might someday cure a disease.
text_following: The protester determined to prove that justice matters -- and the young cop walking the beat, treating everybody with respect, doing the brave, quiet work of keeping us safe.
